This is one of my favorite places to eat in The City.   It's a tapas restaurant, so there is something available for everyone.  I would suggest 2-3 plates of food per person.  It comes to about $50 pp without drinks.The service is always fun, friendly and knowledgeable.I am sure you have heard of the French Onion Soup dumplings.  They are $17 now, but are worth every penny.  Even if you don't like French onion soup, order it, its that good.Other favorites:Goat cheese pirogies.  They are lightly fried, and have a tangy potato flavor.Meatballs.  I don't know how they do it, but they are light and almost fluffy.  Mini lobster roll.  The roll is a mini roll, and is very buttery.  The lobster salad is as good as any you will eat.  It's small, and is not made to share.  Order one for each member of your party that would like one.Enjoy!

The Stanton Social has some of the best tapas I've had. The plates are small but it allows you to pick at a few different options. The wait wasn't long and we were able to go upstairs for cocktails until our table was ready. The service was great. The only complaint I have is that the crowd here is usually a little bit scene-y which isn't really something the restaurant has much to do with. Better to come on a weekday.

Im definitely a fan of The Stanton. I've been here around 4-5 times and every time has been great service. I've been here for brunch and dinner/ happy hr. My favorite dish has to be the onion soup dumplings those are a must, their mac and cheese is also very delicious. This place is a bit pricey but it is worth the price. The birthday shot is also one of my favorite drinks, the cocktails are tasty and are not watered down so they are worth the price. This would be a nice place for a date or if you just want to catch up with a friend. Lights are dim giving it a classy,romantic feel.

Food was outstanding. Everything I ate was delicious. Loved the meatballs. Love the tuna tacos. Service for the most part was outstanding. The women that work here were really on top of it. The men, a little less so. Not sure why, not a judgement, just an observation. People seemed to really enjoy the cocktails. I didn't pick up the bill and we had a prix fixe, large party menu, so I have no idea what things cost. I would go back, and I'm a tough audience.

This place is horrendous. We had a reservation for 6 people at 845pm on a Saturday night and I made it on OpenTable a week in advance. The day of the reservation at around 3pm I found out one of my friends that was coming for dinner was going to be running late, since I knew this place was strict about only seating full parties I called them to let them know and see if it was alright. The lady on the phone was incredibly nice and said it will be absolutely no problem. I show up with 5 people at 845pm and they will not seat us. Shocking. The hostess said no one should have told me that over the phone and that she can't do anything for us. After this happen, I've now quickly noticed that there are numerous parties angrily awaiting their tables and continue to ask the hostess how much longer it will be. There are no tables available for anyone waiting. This was a bad sign and I should have left then. After 10-15 minutes, my final member of the party arrives and we approach the hostess stand to seat us. She said our table is not ready and does not know when it will be done. We proceed to wait another 30 minutes for our table and the hostess has not sat one party in the 45 minutes I had been standing there. I asked her a couple times for an update and she RUDELY kept saying "Sorry, I have no idea." How are you a hostess and a restaurant with numerous reservations and have no idea how to seat them? Finally, my hungry friends decide to ditch the place. I walk up the hostess stand for the last time asking what the wait time was looking at, and to get the same answer. I respond with that we will be going to dinner somewhere else, and to cancel my reservation. She looked at me like I was crazy, and said "Are you sure you want to do that?" It felt like she was threatening me that for some crazy reason I didn't want to wait over an hour for a reservation I made. Your restaurant isn't so great that we should all be lucky to be able to dine there.

I really wanted to give Stanton Social 5 stars because the food and the waitress where amazing!!!! However this is where the rub is. We made reservations on May 8th for 8:00pm on Mothers Day and arrived on time. We where told they needed a few minutes to prepare the table and to go upstairs and grab a drink. Over 45 minutes later we were textedletting us know our table was finally ready. When shown to our table right near the front door there where "6" empty tables. What good is a reservation if the times can't be meant within a reasonable timeframe????? If it wasn't for this I truly would have given Stanton Social 5+ stars.......We actually flew in from San Diego for a long weekend and were really looking forward to our night. We ate at Beauty and Essex in December and had nowhere near the wait. Food was also superb!!! We will give it another shot in December and I hope things have improved in the reservation seating department.John & Shirley Tillinghast
The food and drinks were mediocre. We made at reservation at 9. They didn't seat us until 9:30 and were pretty nonchalant and unapologetic about it.

Have you ever had just a couple tiny bites and then gotten a 400$ bill? That's kinda what eating at the Stanton social is like. If you are hungry and don't feel like spending hundreds, avoid this place. When you order eggs Benedict for $22, you don't expect to get literally two bites of egg. When you order chicken and waffles for $24, you don't expect to get 4 bites of chicken with a tiny dry waffle piece underneath. Overall very deceptive with the portions and prices. I came with a group of 8. We basically had appetizers for 400 dollars. Everyone left hungry. Worst of all, the first server had a serious attitude problem. He immediately was very short tempered, condescending and rude when we asked one question about one of the menu items. We had to go speak to the manager to get a different waitress. The second server we got was perfectly nice, but I don't want to have to complain just to get a server with common decency and manners. The ambiance is very nice- dark and chic. So if you're looking for an upscale meal and don't mind dropping some serious dough, you could consider coming here. The food was tasty, but nothing out of this world. Basic flavors and no creativity or culinary masterpieces here whatsoever. We got several dishes and all were tasty, but nothing special at all. Definitely food you could find at a thousand other places in NY for a fraction of the price and better service.

The French Onion Soup dumplings lived up to the hype.  But the potato & goat cheese pierogies were the best bite of food we had all night.  The tangy goat cheese perfectly complimented the creaminess of the potatoes, the sweetness of the caramelized onions made this dish something we will go back for time and time again.

4 STARS One of my favorite restaurant in the city. Located in a very hipster-y area so you get all walks of life, from your causal diners to the more opulent socialites. TL;DROverall (4 stars): A high end tapas restaurant with a beautiful interior. The food is absolutely tasty, but takes few risks choices on their menu. Good bar and great for a night out. Don't come hungry, it will hurt your wallet. This is more of a light snack and a drink or two -- type of place before you go out.FULL REVIEW:Service (1 star): I like the staff here, they are proper and attentive. I expected a little snotty behavior, this being a high end place, but it was not the case. The meals came fairly quick and the drinks were average.Menu (0.5): The menu was good. But as expansive as other tapas places and definitely not risky. It's a safe bet you'll know most things on here. I would put it as your normal restaurant-esque dishes but miniature as opposed to it being new creations. With that being said, the food is good. Great execution, lack of imagination.Pricing (0.5): High end usually means, high prices and... this is certainly the case here. Your dishes will range well over $15 each and the drinks (cocktails) range about the same. You would think the dishes would be a lot more creative for the price tag. Sadly not.Presentation/Atmosphere (1 star): It's a beautiful restaurant. The layout is modern and trendy with a high ceiling open space interior. There is a small, few tables, second floor but it's not as pretty as the main floor. The bar is small and wine selection is small and limited which isn't a dealer breaker but severely needs an upgrade. The ambiance creates a proper high end feel and staff's attire also resonants that message. Taste (1 star): Superb, albeit, no creativity. The plating is great and the overall clean and svelte approach helps to enjoy the simple dishes. Bill: $120 (20% gratuity - on my own discretion) on two individuals during dinner. About 4-5 plates and two drinks.Enjoy!

The Stanton Social has such an amazing feel to it. From the atmosphere to the service and of course the food, everything was very nice. I came her for an anniversary dinner and we made a 7pm reservation and were seated right away. We sat upstairs and the ambiance is very pleasant, I especially loved the stairs which is also a wine rack. We came here primarily because we wanted tapas and to try different dishes and people RAVED about the french onion soup dumplings. Food: We got Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos (3 tacos), French Onion Soup Dumplings (6 dumplings), Hand Pulled Chicken Arepas (3 arepas) and the Chicken N' Waffles (4 pieces). The server recommended that we get 4-6 dishes for two people. All four dishes were amazing and slightly different. The French Onion Soup Dumplings definitely lived up to the hype and I could definitely have an order to myself. The chicken arepas had to be my second favorite as they had so much flavor in such a tiny bite. The Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos had to be my next favorite, they were very good and the tuna tasted so fresh and flavorful. Lastly, the Chicken N' Waffles, although they are last on my list, this hardly means anything. The only criticism I would have is that there could've been more sauce. Overall I though the food was extremely delicious and tasty. The food is a little pricey and the servings are a bit uneven (there were 3 arepas and 3 tacos) which made it difficult which to split up between 2 people. Service: The waiter was very friendly and helpful. We asked for his suggestions and he had no issue telling us his opinions. The food did take quite a bit to come out but because it was so fresh and tasty, it didn't even matter. All the staff was friendly as well. Overall, I loved this restaurant. Is it a place I would come to all the time? definitely not mainly because with 2 people it is so easy to rack up a $100+ bill including drinks. But for special occasions or a treat here and there, it is perfect!

My rating is based on the service experience not so much the fool. I had been once before and really enjoyed it but this past Wednesday 5/10 our experience was pretty bad. Overall the food was good, we ate well, and had a good bottle of wine. The bill would have been $200 before tip. At the end of our meal one of our plates had a bug on it, we were eating up in the lounge and I alerted the bar tenders who quickly cleaned off the living bug at this time I told them to make sure to let our server know what had happened. Our server was Michelle who later on appeared to a be a manager. The bar tender came to our table and offered us dessert or some Rose, we declined because we were a little grossed out by the bug. The bartender then returned with our check which had 0 discount on it. I brought this to the bartenders attention to which he said,"I offered you a dessert or wine" so I asked for him to speak to his manager. He came back with a 10% discount approved by Michelle. I still did not think this was satisfactory (the bartender did apologize) and I asked to speak with Michelle. She did not apologize for what happened and ultimately offered us 40% off, again I wasn't overly satisfied by this but I was annoyed that we had to discuss this at least 3 times. I also had a Blackboard Eats coupon so ultimately the bill was discounted to about $85 w/o tip. I was incredibly disappointed that at the very least they didn't just offer to comp the food and I would have been happy to pay for the wine, but I'm also aware that most restaurants would comp the whole meal for something like this considering at the time I was calm and didn't make any kind of a scene. I'm also disappointed because like I said we had been before and had a really great experience.

Terrible service, Terrible food for the price and had HAIR in my tiny quesadillas!The server was very unfriendly, when I asked his opinion on $16 Quesadillas and his reply was just repeating the anatomy of Quesadillas.  I was asking for your dumb opinion not how quesadilla is made up of.   When the food came, it was cold and stale.  How do you manage a restaurant serving worse than mediocre quesadilla?  Honestly, I could have made a better quesadilla myself, and I don't cook much!  The size of these quesafuckingdillas was a JOKE! I mean, you get 4pcs of tiny...TINY quesadillas and it tasted SO bad! Could not even finish it, you know why?! Because there was a gross, long, curly hair in my stupid quesadilla!!! GROSSS!!  After a great night out, I wanted to finish my day with a nice meal, but The Stanton Social ruined everything for me.  Never going there again, and i do not recommend.  If you actually like this place, you need to reevaluate your palate.
After reading all the reviews we got a few different dishes. The one I hadn't seen mentioned was the goat cheese dumplings but they were AMAZING!

One of my favorite places in Manhattan. The scene is electric, the food is extremely innovative/delicious and you never know who you'll be sitting beside. There are a lot of must-try's at this restaurant. The potato & goat cheese pierogies and french onion soup dumplings surely lead the way. Additionally, the kobe beef burger sliders, wild mushroom ravioli, and hard shell tofu tacos are amazing. Be sure to try to the cocktails as well - plenty of great options. Keep in mind that even with reservations (which are hard to come by themselves), you'll likely have to wait once you arrive. Thankfully, there is bar upstairs that you can grab a drink at (and even eat) while you wait. Keep in mind that it is a younger crowd and if you're not up for loud music and large crowds, this may not be your place. Definitely recommend though for those looking for a scene and good food.

like the boss tweed gimlet cocktail! It's my first time try a cocktail with basil flavor, but it's really smooth and joyful. The beef Wellington, not large portion, but it taste so great I want to order one more. The steak got subtle smoky flavor and is very tender. The wrap is thin and crispy, the sound when you cut it into halves is really great.

Food: 3/5Ambiance: 4.5/5Service: 1/5Value: 3/5Note: I really downgraded my rating for this place because of the poor service. Came here for a birthday brunch with a group of 10. I picked this place bc it was one of the few that actually allowed group reservations without a prix fixe, which was much appreciated!! The restaurant is dimly lit and has a super fun going-out-y vibe even for brunch, and it reminded me like a toned down version of Beauty & Essex for those of you familiar with that. Overall the food was decent, but the portions were definitely small.. we had the Mac and cheese, huevos rancheros, fish tacos, fries, Oreo pancakes, cinnamon sticks, french onion soup dumplings, fries, and a few other things. Oreo pancakes and fish tacos were the highlights; everything else was good but nothing special. I was just incredibly disappointed by the service... our waitress was incredibly haughty and un-friendly, and when two dishes came out that we definitely did not order, she just seemed really disgruntled and angry with us when it was obviously not our fault the kitchen sent out wrong dishes. Also, we had some gluten-free members of the party who ordered specific dishes which NEVER CAME OUT! When we pointed this out to our waitress, she wasn't accommodating at all, didn't offer to send out the dish, and seemed to blame us. Also, brunch cocktails were $15, which was just so overpriced. Some of us wanted to do the bottomless 1.5 hours for $25 but that's only allowed if the whole table participates :( our drinks also came out SUPER slowly. I understand that a big party is tough to serve, but I was just really disappointed in the attitude along with the poor service.

I was excited to go to another Chris Santos restaurant but again I was not impressed. I tried brunch this time and shared some interesting plates with a friend. We started with some good drinks. I choose the Stanton Sunrise and my friend had a basic mimosa.  Both were enjoyed and we opted for the unlimited $25 deal, which was worth it. I was excited to taste the lobster roll, curious about the chicken and waffles and my friend wanted potato latkes, bacon and croque monsieur satays. Food was good but not wowing as anticipated. The noise level was horribly LOUD! I enjoyed friendly suggestions from our neighboring tables because the tables were uncomfortably close! If you are claustrophobic don't consider dining here. I won't return.

I had been prepared to give Stanton Social a 1 or 2 star review after me and my party had to wait an hour and 20min to be seated after our reservation time. HOWEVER, the manager gave us a free round of drinks for waiting, our food came quickly AND was so unbelievable good. I've been back now 3 times since originally eating at Stanton (and starting to write my original review) and the second time the service was again very slow, but STILL went back a third time.my advice, either be prepared to have a long dining experience (aka, don't be in a rush) OR go early on a weeknight when there isn't a lot of tables being filled. The food is really that good.

Visited Stanton Social during a Saturday night in the Lower East Side, our first on a night out bar hopping. Heard great things about the bar, so decided to visit. - Music: My favorite aspect about Stanton Social was their music. Track after track was great and well-mixed with hip-hop, 90s hits and more. This is the main reason I'd want to come back here!- Drinks: The drinks were good here, I mostly had the Moscow Mule (~$16) which was delicious and my friends had other mixed drinks that they said were good as well. - Atmosphere: The bar/ lounge area was much smaller than I expected, and with the table section blocked off for a party the place was tiny! Still had a nice laid back vibe to it where you can still have conversations with friends and the music isn't too overbearing or loud. Overall, had a fun time and glad that this was our first stop. It's fairly relaxed, small and has great music! I'd come back here if I was in the area but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
Music always good and Drinks always Strong! Hip hop/Top 40 on Saturday and Friday Nights!

We came for the bar upstairs.  If you are familiar with the bar scene in the LES, it is mostly crowded, young adult, college scene.  Stanton Social is if youre feeling a little classier and if you kind of want to hear what your group is talking about.  Def bougie but hey if youre 30 and not into beer pong, dirty floors and over the obnoxiously loud music, then come on down here.  No cover however drinks are typical for NYC prices but at least good quality.
We were probably a little too casual for this place. But, great food. Especially the Beef Wellington. The FIG cocktail was pretty spot on.

Wow insane recommend this place to a few friends.  Came here tonight with those friends-  two of them  has allergies and we discussed with waiter.  To make it easy we asked if they can make a plain burger.... waiter assured they can make a  burger plain...... and guess what it wasn't.........................   the number one allergen was in the burger.... don't care there are a thousands of places to eat in the city...... just be honest.....Restaurant people do have allergies and the reactions came be serious? BE HONEST WOULD RATE THUS PLACE A ZERO IF I COULD.

Hummm... So I was super hyped about going to this place! From all the reviews it sounded like a spot my husband and I would enjoy. Let me start by saying the music was on point the whole time! They played a lot of our jams. We were literally dancing at our table! Lol We were so ready to hit the dance floor. Being that my husband and I have a pretty hectic life with our jobs and 2 children, we were ready to take advantage of the night... The décor was nice. On the trendy side which I liked. The waitress was nice. Nothing out this world. Food took a while to come out. We ordered multiple tapas. My husband loved the short ribs, however I order the chicken and waffles dish. I guess I was expecting a crispy peace of chicken on nice fluffy waffle. Not exactly what I got... I got some grilled chicken on pieces of waffles. I guess it was healthier but not what I anticipated... lol Whatever... It was my husband's birthday so I didn't want to be b@#$... Lol At the end of dinner our waitress brought out a complimentary cupcake but I guess I was expecting a little more fuss. Many like everyone coming together singing happy birthday or something. She literally just placed the cup cake and walked away... Soooo it was still early and we were looking forward to dancing the night away. We proceeded to walk upstairs and they stated that they were closing in 20 minutes (1am)... Wait whattttttt??!! New York closing at 1am?!!! We're from Connecticut and even we stay open until 2am... I was beyond disappointed, but of course I didn't want my husband to notice... Needless to say we had a decent time, but I prefer to go to Beauty & Essex.

Absolutely terrible experience. We had a reservation for 8:45 and were told to wait upstairs in an overcrowded bar area for over an hour while our "table was being readied". When weren't called for over 40mins, we tried going downstairs to ask the lady at the reception desk about how much longer it would be but they had stationed an Extremely Hostile Bouncer who was threateningly rude to us. We asked him why we couldn't go in and talk with the receptionist, but he just maintained that we were not allowed in. To question our reservation! After 45mins! So screw you Stanton Social. You can continue to lose loyal patrons because you don't have your shit together and you have a bloody rude crew. When we left, we overheard several other patrons wondering allowed if they should leave too and most left afterwards. NEVER GOING BACK.

Great cocktails and decent service. Liked the atmosphere very much as well. The security guy/or manager.....not sure :) did an amazing job kept folding the napkins, checking in etc. he deserves a 5 star. If this would have been it would have been a 5 star review (especially based on the drinks) However, the food was over salted my girlfriend and I order two different main dishes and both were overly salty. When the waiter brought the beef Wellington to my girlfriend they didn't mention that the plate is extremely hot and she ended up burning her fingers while placing it on the table. Another point I didn't find great was that the man that looked like the cook had to slide the garbage can from the middle of the floor to the kitchen area....very odd and didn't seem very sanitary.

Had a large gathering last night here. Over priced, terrible service (in a large group and did not serve the right amount per person for burger), food cold.  I would only return for a high priced but good strawberry field drink.  P.s at the end of the meal after the group paid, I mentioned the temperature issue to the manager.  His response was oh you should of told me during the meal now what I am suppose to do about that.   Terrific service - not!
Completely full of ----staff.  From entrance to supposed manager, waited one hour, rcvd lame excuses . Horrible.  A complete disgusting experience.  Customers should never be treated this way.

I'm not big on writing reviews but I was so disappointed by what used to be one of my favorite NY restaurants. Besides being so over booked, over packed, and louder than any NY club.... the food was so subpar compared to what it used to be! The staff was a joke for a NY restaurant. The busboy spilled the carafe of water, they put on the table, all over our table and all over my father with out an apology, and when a female manager came to ask if we needed a dry cleaning voucher I was speechless. Accidents happen but what we needed was an apology. We just wanted to leave and by the time they sent over donuts "so we would leave on a sweet note" we were just done being there! honestly we had told them we needed to leave and that we didn't want dessert. It would have been nicer to say they comped one of our drinks (which we obviously had wanted). I sadly won't be back!

This review is for brunch after taking out-of-town friends here thrice upon their request.I first came to this place when I was young and jolly and thought it served the most delicious food ever. Sadly now I've gotten older and my tastebuds often demand things my wallet can't. Basically I've changed but the place has not - meaning it is still perfect for the "young 20's" to get together for a brunch but if you look around most guests are tourists. (When I first came here I was also just visiting new york..) Some dishes are definitely decadent and yummy (banana pancakes and french onion soup dumplings) but most dishes are just so-so (all tacos on the menu). When you order a side dish of bacon, you expect a mofo piece of thick yummy bacon, but they give you strips that you would make at home - know what I mean? The food always arrives a bit dry because it has been sitting out for a bit and they come up from the kitchen in the basement. Overall, this is not a place to come unless you have to.

This restaurant is pretty cozy & intimate...food is mostly tapas style & very tasty. The crab corndogs are AMAZING! A must! Drinks were really tasty as well. Wasn't a huge fan of their entrée plates. The branzino was ok a bit heavy on the seasoning & salt. Will definitely be back for drinks & apps only :)

Had my sisters bachelorette dinner here. All went very smoothly and the food was great. Highly recommend the chicken arepas, french onion dumplings, and ahi tuna tacos. They were very accommodating with the service and drinks were great too.

The food here was good, as were the drinks, but honestly it's very overpriced. We came here for brunch & the service was super slow & rude, despite the fact that they weren't all that busy. As time went on, it didn't seem like we were being taken care of very well & drinks were being brought out slower & slower. Our bill at the end was pretty high, even considering we were in the city, and it's not likely a place I'll return--the quality of food didn't outweigh the subpar service.

Well... I guess we'll do the pros first:* The food is tasty * Unlimited drinks come out rather quickly * The decor is pretty The end. Now for the juicy stuff (aka the cons): * The prices. What the f**k! Every single thing on the menu is overpriced. Cocktails average to about $15 each so obviously paying $25 for the unlimited feature makes more sense. The food ranged between about $14-$25ish for literally the smallest portions. Understandably, seafood is pricier than anything else, but the Lobster Benedict came with two little things of eggs for $22. The chicken taquitos were a few dollars less but came with like 4 bite size pieces... I'm still so confused by their pricing system. * The drinks. The bottomless drinks option for 1.5 hours was cute but the drinks themselves weren't that great. You're given a limited selection of drinks and like 75% of them were sh*t. The "bittersweet" mimosa was pretty much just bitter and we had to chug it just to get rid of it. The Bloody Mary was just awful; we had to send it back. The Bellini was decent (but I feel like anything would've tasted good after that damn Bloody Mary). The coffee cocktail was probably the best one and I really liked that they put actual coffee in it. * The service was neither here nor there. The hostess and our waitress were friendly for the most part. However going around our party of eight, she took everyone's order except for mine and was ready to start collecting the menus... so there's that. I was worried that it would've been a struggle to flag her down to refill our drinks before our 1.5 hours were up, but she was pretty good about it. The food took quite a while but taking into consideration how busy it was and how pretty our plates were, I wasn't mad about it. So I guess this is more of a 3.5 star review. But I rounded down because after spending so much on brunch, I can't afford to pay the extra half star. #sorryboutit

I haven't written a Yelp review in quite some time, but the subpar service, mediocre food, cramped seating area, and outrageous prices I experienced at the Stanton Social this afternoon prompted me to do so. Our server was unattentive - my friend had to flag her down every time he wanted a refill of his Bloody Mary (which wasn't very good, by the way) as part of the bottomless drink option he spent $25 on. She also charged him for each Bloody Mary individually at the end of the meal, and we had to wait 10 minutes for her to correct the bill at the end after we pointed it out, as she claimed she "didn't hear him ask for it." This was very well likely, as the decibel level in the restaurant was practically deafening for brunch, and the dimmed lighting and crowded floor didn't make the ambiance any better. Here's the setup: booths on both sides of a narrow room, with giant tables seating 5-10 people in the center of the room. This means that there were about two inches from the back of my chair and the booth behind me. Not ideal.Besides the uncomfortable arrangement and lack of lighting in the restaurant, the food was mediocre at best, and the dishes were extremely expensive. I understand that the Stanton Social is a tapas restaurant, but it is absolutely outrageous to charge $14 for an eggs Benedict that contains two soggy pieces of bread the size of a half-dollar and two tiny poached eggs on top, along with miniature rounds of Canadian bacon - seriously, it looked like dollhouse-sized food meant for Barbie and Ken. I can get a normal sized eggs Benedict at other nice brunch places in the city for $14. More importantly, my friend said the eggs Benedict was the worst she's ever had. (Also of note: they were unwilling to make ANY substitutions for Canadian bacon for my vegetarian friend.)The huevos rancheros were served in soft tacos and tasted fine, but I could've made them easily myself, and worst of all, there were only four tiny tacos in the $15 dish. Furthermore, all five people in my party ordered separate dishes, and it was crystal-clear to the waitress that we were ordering dishes separately and not to share, but three separate orders of huevos rancheros came out on two plates, with six tacos each skewered together. This means that the three of us who ordered the dish were forced to unassemble both dishes and create a third plate. This was annoying, especially since the tacos were served with sauce that was doled out in drizzle form right on the plate. The best part of brunch? The waitress did let three of my friends split the bill on their credit cards. Maybe she recognized that the outrageous bill would have been far too much for one of us to front by ourselves. I'm willing to deal with a lot if the food is delicious, but I can't justify spending big money on tiny portions, bad service, and an uncomfortable brunch environment.

By far the best modern twist to French onion soup. Flavor profile reminds me of the soup in Paris after a cold night strolling pass the Eiffel tower. Wow this dish is a must!!! I'm coming back for this during my next trip to NYC.

The food = awesome. The pastrami quesadillas were AMAZING. So many delicious tapas, we couldn't decide which to get! My only complaint was the waitress who attended to us. She almost seemed annoyed that we didn't chose what we wanted immediately after sitting down, and when we told her we had an online deal, she basically ignored us the rest of the meal. Would go back for the food, not for the service.

Came here with a few friends for dinner one night about a year ago. The plates were all really tasty and great for sharing to try a bunch of different things. The only plate we didn't like was the bolognese. We ended up sending it back as it felt bland compared to how flavorful our other plates were. Within 5 minutes of sending it back Chef Santos popped into a chair at our table to ask us how it was going. He was very personable and listened to our critic of the pasta. Overall great experience and looking forward to going back.
Wasn't sure what to expect. The staff are nice and the place is pretty swanky. I'd definitely come again.

The bottom line with this place is: the food is very tasty, beautifully presented, and the service is great.  However, I just can't swallow the price for the portion size.  To that end, I would almost eat something before coming here to make sure you are full enough by the end.    The bottom line is: don't come here expecting to be full in any way.  The end of the meal is somewhat anticlimactic without the arrival of an entree.  But, unlike dimsum or proper tapas, you really do want and need that entree.  You need to think of coming here as if you are buying tickets to a show and the show also comes with food (sort of a really extended amuse bouche).  That way, you'll really enjoy yourself rather than be sad at the end.

The Stanton Social is definitely a place to dine if you feeling bougie. The atmosphere makes you feel fancayyy and luxurious, but the food can be a miss at times. Came here with my parents and we ordered a few dishes ranging from their most popular options, to some items we thought sounded 'exciting' and 'new': The Charred Octopus Salad, Thai Style Salmon Ceviche, Rhode Island Lobster Roll, Charred Kobe Beef Burger, 'Beef and Broccoli,' and the much-raved French Onion Soup Dumplings. While this may sound like an insane amount of food, each dish is fairly small since they're tapas and meant to be shared. All the dishes were well executed, however, majority didn't have me raving. The Thai Style Salmon Ceviche was really unique with the slight sweetness from the coconut milk, and refreshing kick from the lemongrass. I'd recommend this dish if you're looking for something different than your typical spicy-salmon-on-top-of-fried-rice-balls option. The stand out were the French Onion Soup Dumplings. These babies are no hype--literally an explosion of comforting soup encased around a thin wrapper, served with a charred crouton on the toothpick and smothered in glorious melted cheese. Truly heaven. But the most memorable of all the dishes was the dessert. Specifically the Warm Doughnuts. These aren't just your run-of-the-mill Dunkin Donuts. They're perfectly fried and crispy on the outside, but incredibly fluffy on the inside. And I kid you not when I say you can eat like 5 of these and not feel weighed down--the lightest of all doughnuts I've ever eaten. They come served with 3 dipping sauces: caramel, chocolate, and berry. Divine. Would I come here again just for the doughnuts? You bet. So I'll be back, not just to satisfy my sweet tooth but to also try their several other tapas options. But perhaps only for a special occasion or when my parents are in town (so I don't gotta pay, know what I'm sayin'?).
Place is awesome. Went with a date. Recommend doing small plates to share. Very good cocktails and generally a fun vibe as well.

Had reservation for a Saturday night, still waited for close to an hour, checking in with the hostess was a hassle. Food was ok ordered 5 of their most popular small plates and they were just Ok. Onion soup dumplings was cold and cheese on top was hard so we didn't enjoy it, all in all I would not return, food was not worth all the hassle of getting there.

Had a reservation for brunch and was seated promptly. Food was pretty good, I especially liked the Oreo pancakes. We also ordered the French onion soup dumplings, egg bruschetta, and perogies. Everything was pretty buttery and felt fattening...so this isn't a place for you juicers.   Crowd was very basic Manhattan - People being there because they feel like this is the "it" spot.

I love Stanton Social! I came here for my birthday brunch with my best friend. We were actually a bit late considering we went for brunch around 2. So the restaurant was pretty empty, which worked out for us because we received undivided attention from the servers. We ended up ordering a couple of things to share - the taquitos and the social mac & cheese. Both were equally scrumptious. We also opted for the cocktails open bar and drank to our heart's content. I stuck to ordering the peach bellini & stanton sunrise and drank enough to give myself a sweet buzz. The restaurant surprised me with a cupcake since it was my birthday which was super sweet of them. My experience here was a good one and I'll definitely be back here again!

What's the big hype?You're better off staying home and having your entire family sit in your lap! This place is too small, and they literally sit you on top of the person next to you. You can barely breathe without having the person next to you move their table so you have enough to exhale. And the food wasn't good...at all.NOT A FAN, can you tell?

I was such a huge fan of this place that I actually came back a second time in one night. Yup.The first trip was for dinner with my fiancé and his parents. Everything was fantastic. Especially the french onion soup dumplings. I could have had an entire serving to myself. I also recommend the beef with broccoli, even though the sticky rice was a little heavy. Oh! And the pastrami reuben quesadillas were fantastic! The restaurant gets packed, so make sure you make a reservation. The reservations weren't too difficult to get either. ...especially after deciding to go back for late night snacks at 11pm. Note this, if you are a single straight man, you want to go to the third floor bar later on a Saturday night. I am not exaggerating when I tell you that the place was 99.9% women. These women were dressed up and ready to catch some men. If you're looking to meet someone, that is your place.
Terrible hostess food OK nothing special if you want a fun party place it's fine, but as a restaurant many better options

We came here with a gilt city deal for brunch, having been here many times for dinner (it's one of our favorite dinner spots in the city). Brunch was a very different experience. The cocktails were so sweet they were undrinkable. The service was slow, which was fine except they then told us we had gone over our time limit. The deal did not mention a time limit and simply said you were guaranteed five drinks with no caveats. Not to mention at this point we hadn't received the dessert we ordered as part of the deal. After arguing with the manager, we were given a fourth drink. Tip was already included which was disappointing after the service we received. I would never recommend this place for brunch.
Came here with a few friends for brunch. The Oreo pancakes are a must, as are the huevos rancheros! The portions are family style, perfect for sharing. Ambience was awesome.

Visited here with a few people. We shared a lot of apps which were delicious. Everything is really good so it's hard to recommend one thing. Drinks staff and ambience is fantastic. Highly recommend Stanton Social.

I went on a date here for brunch. This place had great food, and had some dishes that were for sharing, kind of like tapas. I would recommend the pirogies. So delicious. I would also recommend the potato latkes! These we're BOMB!  If you look for a solid Bloody Mary when you're brunching, I would not get one here. It's made with beet juice or something. It was just not the same. The place was pretty busy, so I would recommend making a reservation. All in all, good brunch spot!
French onion soup dumplings, potato and goat cheese pieorgies and Mac and cheese were amazing!! Perfect place for trying multiple plates with shareable sizes
Love the food here, love the interior. Very good dinner place for special occasions. Been here couple times, will come back !

Great ambience, the booths are very cozy and intimate. The staff are warm, friendly, very helpful, and they take their time explaining the menu. Let me start by saying, I wasn't impressed with the French onion soup dumplings. I don't find them to be fresh. However, everything else I had was amazing. How about crab cake corn dogs, say what? Yes, they taste as good as they sound. The potato and goat cheese pierogies were ridiculous (and I meant that in the best possible way). We finished the night with the warm donuts which were delicious. They're served with caramel, chocolate (dark), and berries dipping sauces.

Went on a Saturday night for my friend's birthday. It was just us two and we arrived about 5 minutes before our 10:30pm reservation time. The hostess told us it would be a few minutes and that we could sit upstairs at the bar for the time being. By 11 we still weren't seated so I went down to ask the hostess was the deal was...and was sat immediately. That was the only negative I had about the entire experience though.The ambiance was lively, pretty crowded and very cozy as far as dining rooms are concerned. Our server was helpful with the menu and attentive when we needed her. We had the pierogies, chicken and waffles, and french onion soup dumplings- all we out of this world, next level delicious. I ordered a few cocktails and a glass of Cremant and those were all tasty too. We finished with the birthday shots for dessert which were a bit lackluster- seemed like a vanilla shake with bourbon in it.Overall, food (and our server who was helpful) was the best part!

The food here is bursting with flavor. Every dish we ordered was exceptional. The Philly cheesesteak sliders, chicken taquito, arepa, chile shrimp and French onion soup dumplings  all amazing! This place has a very chill vibe.. good music and excellent service. I really enjoyed the fact that each dish came out one at a time.  That way your able to pace yourself and really enjoy the flavors of each dish. The reason I took a star off is because of the portion size. I've been to many tapas style dining restaurants and this restaurant by far has the smallest servings. They should be embarrassed to serve such a small portion like the arepas that were bite size with 3 servings ..

So I've loved coming to this restaurant for the longest time... until my last experience yesterday. So I'm sitting at the table and we've just ordered, when all of a sudden, I feel something crawling on my arm. As I look down, there is a huge COCKROACH  that has made its way up and is now sitting on my chest. Now I've seen cockroaches before, but this one didn't compare and was at least the size of my palm. I start freaking out (as one would if there's a cockroach on them) and finally it jumps off of me and starts running around the floor. Everyone within the vicinity is freaking out and it takes the wait staff a good 10 minutes to handle the situation as the cockroach is running about. Finally, a manager comes over and says that they have a "water bug" problem (ahahah yeah okay... that definitely wasn't a water bug....) and he offers to move us to the "VIP" section and comp our dinner. I mean, great, a free dinner, but that sure does not make up for the TRAUMA I endured as there was literally the biggest cockroach probably in existence (excuse the hyperbole) literally poached on top of my chest. Definitely won't come back until the health department does a little check up on this place. Cockroaches are one thing, but when one is SITTING ON YOUR CHEST, that's another story. Come here if you want PTSD....

My friends and I came to Stanton Social for a birthday brunch and we were extremely disappointed in the service and overall experience. Service started off good at the hostess stand but then went down hill. We did the bottomless brunch for an hour and a half and the time it took to get each set of drinks was incredibly long. We started ordering rounds of drinks half way into drinks because we knew it would be at least 20 minutes before they actually came. The food was fine, but not as great as expected for the price. Also note, it is encouraged to do family style instead of people ordering their own entree. Portions for the dishes varied - some  were a good size for sharing and some were not at all. I also asked for a birthday cake shot that everyone posts and they did not have these for brunch - so I asked for a different kind of shot and the bartender didn't know how to make it so then they gave my friend a shot of champagne and charged us $17 for that. Not impressed with my overall experience.
Food was great again. The hostess was awesome as I made a mistake on my reservation and she accommodated us.

This place has seen better days. I used to come here when the restaurant first opened, and it was the place to be. Tonight I walked in and the sign outside advertised a Gilt special. That's one step above a Groupon. The menu is eh (has it changed since 2005?), and the sharing concept is no longer unique. I had the chicken (over cooked), the octopus salad (not much octopus) and the salmon, which was uninspiring. I was similarly uninspired to drink any more than two cocktails, so for that at least I am thankful. The staff seemed to be going through the motions; the interior is getting a bit shabby. My sense is that Stanton Social is on its way out. It's unlikely I will eat here again.

So we got a reservation through our Amex concierge service which was wonderful. The atmosphere was so elegant hip and relaxing - the food was equally wonderful with every bite. But let's talk about our waitress and her side kick Mr. Clean- BIG NO VOTE OF CONFIDENCE. She seemed to think we were there to be served at her pleasure , MIA Most of the time , 30 mins to get a drink easily , so I thought she must be in training or got the job by other means. I go talk to the hosts as  I have invited my 4 guest to dine there, and explain nicely that our waitress seems to need a little help and could he please have her bring a bottle of champagne to our table  to celebrate one of my guest's recent promotions.  Next I thing I know she shows up at the table and says in front of my guest - "So someone wanted to order Champagne"- i'm then thinking are you kidding me, go back to working at Buffalo Wild Wings !!! I quietly pull her aside and explain which was received with a blank stare. Then when I ask to order some wine with  our food Mr. Clean show up and says and I quote " So now you want to have a real conversation ?"   So my take on this lovely establishment is .... so many fab places with fab food and staff in NYC - JUST SKIP THIS PLACE
Great food and atmosphere. This place is a family sharing tapas style menu. The Oreo pancakes and the huevos rancheros were the most tasty.

I will start by saying the food was delicious. We had a group of 5 people, and ordered two rounds of food (it's tapas style) and it was more than enough for everyone. And the drinks were also delicious.However, the wait staff was off. Our waitress took 45 mins to come over to get our order and by that point we flagged her down. Then when someone tried to surprise me at the table with champagne to celebrate, the waitress came over and completely ruined it despite the fact my friend had told her it was a surprise. She was nice, but not very attentive and definitely not high caliber. The ruined surprise wouldn't have been awful if she had been attentive or dynamic waitress, but this combined with her blasé attitude was too much. I expected more from the restaurant. That all being said the food nearly made me forget how ridiculous our waitress was.

I would have never thought I would be full off of tapas. I was mistaken! Every plate was delicious and beautifully plated. Pace yourself on these tapas, don't order all of your items at once. Order, eat slow, savor, enjoy and order more. This venue is small and narrow but has a hip, eclectic vibe. I highly recommend making a reservation and sit at a booth to enjoy people watching, there are beautiful patrons. The "dress blues" is a delicious cocktail that is heavy on blueberry jam. The staff seem to collectively push certain dishes like the pirogies, and I'll admit they were good. Great for birthdays or girls night out.
Tapas food. Not enough food for brunch. 1.5 hour all you can drink limit but drinks took forever to get to the table because "bar was backed up."

Trendy, intimate, and chill---that's the vibe I get at  Stanton Social. This place is perfect for brunch, date night, friendly gatherings, or for a late night of snacking/drinking.I can't really comment on their brunch menu but I can comment on their dinner menu. Honestly, I think this place is best when you go with a few other people. Since they serve a variety of small plates. It gives you a chance to try several different things. ONE OF EVERYTHING PLEASE! Stanton Social doesn't come cheap like other places in LES. This place is popular for their tapas and I guess the trendy atmosphere. Don't expect to leave entirely stuffed and satisfied unless you're willing to spend the $$$.Can't wait to try their French onion soup dumplings!
Overrated. Expensive. Sweet dishes were overly sweet. French onion soup dumplings tasted overdone. Perogis are better at my local Costco.

I wanted to come here for brunch but came for dinner instead. The food was nothing special, just ok. Menu items are tapas style and meant to be shared. We ordered 3 tapas- french onion soup dumplings, fish tacos and potato and goat cheese pierogies. We also ordered 2 drinks. I liked the ambience and the decor but for the quality/amount of food I thought the $90 bill was pretty high. I wouldn't come back for dinner, might give it another try for brunch.

Lots of style but lacks in substance.  Would not return.The place looks nice and super trendy.  Its like a cross between a nice restaurant and a night club.  They were blasting music.  It was so loud that the waiter couldnt hear what I was trying to order.  I could hear my girlfriend across the table from me.  Its a tapas place, the servings are small and the food is expensive.  You are definitely not getting any value for your money.  The lobster roll is the size of a shot glass and prices at $11.  While very good (it was the best item we ordered) and very fresh it definitely wasnt worth $11.  We also ordered the cucumber fries (good), beef & broccoli (good), french onion soup dumplings (smelled awful but tasted better than it smelled), fish taco (good), and steak frites (very very salty).For food this place rates a 3. Half the orders we good the other half were horrible.  Deducting 1 point for the loud music.  If the waiter cant hear the customers orders then you need to turn the music down.  Deducting another point because this place looks clean in the dark but is DIRTY.  I made the mistake of putting my hand down on the seat and could feel the crumbs that were left on it.  And there was a lot of it.Would not come back here.

Went here with a couple friends during Restaurant Week 2017.  A very..very busy place. Despite reservations, we still had to wait a bit - but they have a texting system, so we just wanted to a bar around the corner, so not a major issue.  We were promptly seated once getting the table-ready text, and here's the run down:Apps:Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies - Boom. I may be obsessed with goat cheese, but even if you aren't...these are goddamn tasty. Not ordering these when here is a sin. 4 pieces...you should probably get at least 2-3 orders. MinimumCobb Salad Bites - pretty substantial for a salad dish, pretty good!Crispy Hard Shell Fish Tacos - lovely, the creamy avocado and spicy mango salsa really made this app special. Mains:Chicken n Waffles - really really delicious take on the dish with corn pudding and balsamic maple syrup. This was my pick...and I'd do it again 1000 times.Torchio Bolognese - I tried some of a friends - delightful, deep flavor, just yum.Desserts:Warm Doughnuts - Like the pierogies, these win the round.  Chocolate, caramel, and berry dipping sauces...which are great, but the doughnuts could be happily consumed with a side of bark.Guinness Toffee Cake - quite nice, particularly with the Bailey's ice cream!Orea cake pops - your standard cake pop, which is not necessarily a bad thing (they are generally quite good), but nothing too out of the ordinary.Drink - The Hunt. Do it.Good service (once seated), great food. Win.

I was mentally writing my 1-star review while waiting for our table, as I'd made a reservation for my birthday dinner but had to wait an hour. Upon checking in five minutes early, the hostess informed us that they were running 15 minutes late and they would text me when our table was ready - we went upstairs to the bar to wait. 45 minutes later, no text, and came downstairs to investigate - pretty sure the hostess simply forgot but she didn't even apologize. Instead she said that they were getting our table ready (at this point it was 9:30 PM on a Monday, and tables were emptying anyway). I was FUMING and hungry. They must've noticed because two dishes came on the house, which was a nice gesture. The first dish was unremarkable, but the second was a crispy shell fish taco-type dish that had some delicious raw fish. My partner and I ordered the restaurant week menu, plus the french onion soup dumplings, and all combined it was a TON of food. We left perfectly satisfied, somewhat forgetting the beginning of our evening, as a result of our great waitress, good seats (we got to sit in a circular booth for just the two of us), and decent food. Not a huge fan of the french onion soup dumplings or ravioli, but my partner seemed to enjoy his food. I loved the Oreo cake pops and the birthday cupcake though! But overall, the main reason this review ended up being 4 stars is the great waitress we had - thanks for making an otherwise almost-mediocre birthday dinner special!

Really nice place and good food. We ordered:Starters: POTATO & GOAT CHEESE PIEROGIES, CRIPSY HARD CHELL FISH TACOS, CRISPY BARRIO-STYLE CHICKEN TAQUITOS The potato and goat cheese was the most delicious Entree: 'CHICKEN N' WAFFLES were so good! The desert was ok, but not to die for. We ordered donuts and toffee cake Great service!

Waited an hour to be seated after making reservations 2 weeks prior. The tables for two are crammed one on top of the other. Food was great but I wouldn't come back, you can get a way better experience somewhere else.

I was extremely underwhelmed with my experience here. 8:15 reservation and 9:15 we were seated. All with false hopes of "tables opening up really soon." Guess what? Tables were open, but just because I'm not a celebrity I guess that I means I need to wait. Honestly, you could go to a 5-star michelin restaurant and not have to wait this long. When we were finally seated we were brought upstairs to the 3rd floor, which by the way...there were PLENTY of open tables around us. But due to the loud noise, lounge/club atmosphere to the left of us we couldn't hear our waitress at all. So we were moved downstairs where my friend was pressed up all the way against our table and could barely eat. When we finally got our food at 10:15 it was good, but seriously not worth all the hassle we went through to get. Save your time/money/energy and go somewhere else that will treats you like a valued customer.

Definitely love staton social! Always come here when the Clinton street bakery's wait was too long tho... But the food is really good! Love the tapas brunch idea, so that I can try many things! And they always able to duplicate the plates depending on the party's number.My favorites are1) Oreo pancakesIt's super fluffy and have a great amount of ores in it.2) French soup dumplingYeah, everyone loves it, and it tastes much better than the picture!3) CroqueA very nice small bites place, with a good amount of cheese and ham4) HurvosA good portion that's good for the whole table to share. It's full of favors!5) Fish tacoHas a very good balance of sour!Things that personally don't like that much1) chicken and waffleThe present of it is very pretty. But personally I'm not a big fan of friend chicken breast. It's too dry for me.2) Slides burgerThe beef was really dry last time. And it's pretty mediocre comparing with other dishes. Besides, it's too filling so that I can't try other things....I remember staton social had very good rock shrimp tempura before. Maybe 2 years ago? Definitely THE favorite dish. It was taken off the menu, but it is really good! Hope some day it will come back!

Just be forewarned that even if you make a reservation, you will wait. I should've seen this earlier through the reviews. I was pretty hangry, but putting aside my bitterness this place has delicious food. So I'll give it the rating it deserves. So two must do's: 1) Make a reservation, and 2) Make the reservation for a time thirty minutes before you actually want to eat. Then grab a drink upstairs at the bar and chill in the dim and loud ambiance.Atmosphere: Restaurant Week, Winter 2017. My birthday always falls during these weeks so I use it as an excuse to treat myself to a nice but still relatively affordable meal. Made reservations for a Monday night at 7:30. Get there on time, am told they're backed up and it'll be 15 minutes. Go upstairs to hang out in the bar, come back down 15 minutes later. Still waiting...and waiting. I made an agreement with my boyfriend that if they don't seat us within 45 minutes of our scheduled reservation, we're dipping and indulging in pancakes at Clinton Street. 43 minutes later...we have our booth. You almost lost us, Stanton Social (Clinton street, I'm coming back for you soon). The place is dim, packed, loud and tiny. But the lighting and the decor is awesome. Food: Here's where this place makes up for my hangriness. It's all tapas style sharing. Our restaurant week choices were as follows: Potato and goat cheese pierogis: probably my favorite food out of all the ones I ate that night. The goat cheese was light and creamy, the creme sauce was an added delight, and the damn caramelized onions provided a sweet overlay on top of the pierogis. Just really, freaking, delicious. Fish tacos: three mini hard shell tacos, filled to the brim with fish and other fixings. Had a delightful citrusy and mango-ish kick to it. Chicken and waffles: That balsamic spiked maple syrup though ugh, it needed to be drizzled all over that is. I also wish the chicken could be a little crispier and fried, but the waffles were yummy and soft in the inside and crisp on the outside.Torchio Bolognese: pasta is pretty dense and heavy. If you like lamb, you'll love this. A little too lamby for my taste though. But that ricotta salata and mint was a delicious touch to the dish.Warm doughnuts: the donuts are standard and fluffy/warm sugar doughnuts. What makes up for it are the three sauces that complement the dish: chocolate, caramel, raspberry. The raspberry by far was my favorite, as it was rich in flavor and tart. The chocolate was really dense and strong in cocoa and the caramel was standard but albeit delicious. Guinness toffee cake: my word, I had a moment the first time i bit into this. The cake in itself is so moist, has a crunch around the edges, and was perfectly complemented by the cold ice cream. Bits of toffee explode your taste buds and the Guinness sauce on the side is addicting. It was so good I didn't even realize I spilled some on my shirt. I'm an embarrassment. They also gave us complimentary falafel crostinis which were tiny and tasted like fresh hummus on a cracker. And they also gave us a decently sized portion of salmon ceviche (on four Asian noodle soup spoons). The salmon ceviche was filled with fresh salmon and a lot of ginger. It was dope. Payed about 54 per person in total. A decent price for the amount of yummy and creative food provided. Restaurant week gives me life! In any other event I think each dish ranges from $17-30 so we def saved some cashé.Service: despite the long wait, the service is friendly, quick, and accommodating. I like it here, just fix your time management, please!

So everybody has mentioned the French onion soup dumplings and you know why? Because they are really that good. They are playful, tasty, and pop with deliciousness. Shared a nice meal with my lady here and we thoroughly enjoyed the space and food. Prior to eating in the main dining room we had a couple of cocktails at the bar upstairs which felt like your own private oasis. Can't wait to come again.

What a great experience we had!!! LOVED the uniqueness of all of the dishes and I highly recommend the potato and goat cheese peirogies, the French onion soup, the meatballs and the mushroom ravioli. The chicken and waffles were dry and not good but we loved everything else. We were there as a party of 9 and they made the orders suit our size which was great. The birthday cake shots were a very fun touch. The service was good too!!
Decided to explore the NYC atmosphereEating tapas portions , enjoyed every bite of what we ordered went on Thursday night had to make reservations a week before  Must order the onion soap dumplings
Love this place, came here for my birthday one year and everything we tasted was SO GOOD. Will definitely be going back.

Went here for restaurant week. The food was amazing. They're tapas, so smaller portions, so it's good to go with a group and try a bit of everything. The french onion soup dumplings were wonderful, definitely something you've got to try if you go here. We also had the pierogies and tuna poke wontons and cobb salad bites. All very good and with everything together, it was plenty for the 3 of us. They've also got some great cocktails to try since the restaurant turns into the lounge. The music was great, the service was also good, everything came with good timing in between. We overall had a good time and would definitely go back again.

I finally went to Staton yesterday after having it on my list for years. I had done a little homework and looked at pics/reviews to decide what would be the best choices and I am happy to say we thoroughly enjoyed every dish we had:-Potato and Cheese Pierogies: very good. Loved the truffle creme fraiche on the side!-French Onion Soup dumplings (of course): savory and rich. Def recommend to share (might be too salty if you eat a whole serving by yourself)-"Phiilly cheesesteak": only brings one but it had a good amount of meat which was well-flavored.-Baby Back Ribs: very good, literally falling off the bone. Good  flavor and a amount of meat. -Chicken N waffles: I was a little skeptical about trying this because of mixed reviews and fact that the chicken being breast was not fried but it was very good!-Spiced Sesame Salmon- a good amount of salmon and well cooked. The spiralized vegetables were in a  nice fresh citrus & ginger sauce.The ambience was elegant and sexy- makes for a nice date night. It is a little pricey but there was no dish we did not enjoy which is hard to say about a restaurant. I would definitely recommend.

I've been trying to go to Stanton Social for years and I finally made it.  I had the French Soup Dumplings, Pierogies, Social Mac & Cheese, Bacon, Frites, & Warm Doughnuts.  Good: Bacon & Warm Doughnuts.  Okay: Social Mac & Cheese. Meh: Frites.  No Comment: French Onion Dumplings & Goat Cheese Pierogies.  I found out that I don't like the taste of goat cheese.  That's no fault of theirs.  As far as the dumplings go, I don't know if I don't like French Onion soup or the dumplings aren't that great.  It's not a place that I would go back to.  I don't mind paying a lot of money for food if it's fantastic.  It just wasn't that great, in my opinion.

great food, quiet restaurant and awesome service. we ordered the following:potato & goat cheese pierogiesnori spiced tuna poke wontonfrench onion soup dumplingscobb salad biteswarm doughnutsdrinks included brooklyn lager and lost in polanco. will definitely be back.

I've been here a few times, and love the lively atmosphere and the food. I've never had a bad meal here (I highly recommend the French Onion Soup Dumplings) and it's certainly a great place to come with a group of friends or on a date (it can get loud though, just as an FYI). It's a bit pricey and portions are small, so be prepared to shell out some money. Overall, if you are looking for a fun place to have dinner, look no further than this place.
My favorite spot... always good food & ambiance Kobe beef sliders !!! French onion soup dumplings !!! lobster roll sliders !!! And the doughnuts are life

For a special occasion I would not recommend this place. STRIKE ONEWe received several calls asking us not to be late or they will cancel our reservation but then after arriving promptly with our party of 10 was it took over 30 minutes to be seated. STRIKE TWOWe ordered the brunch cocktail open bar for $25 for unlimited cocktails and had to BEG for refills. We probably got 3 drinks in the 90 minute period. STRIKE THREEWe had friends fly out from all over the country to celebrate our friends birthday and we're told at the end of our brunch that there would be charged a $5 cake cutting fee. I've heard of $2 cake fees but $5! And no advance warning!! We called weeks in advance and we're told we could bring a cake but not once was the cake cutting feeTHE FOURTH STRIKE (if that was a thing)Staff was cold (even by LES standards) just mean and not service oriented in the slightest. What a wonderful day that was ruined by this restaurant.
We had a great meal here. There was a bit of a mishap at our table but the manager and the waitstaff were very gracious about it. We really appreciated it. We'll be back.

Overrated...The place is a lot less cute and smaller than in the pictures. Came for brunch and food was really average, not bad just average and kinda greasy. The server was a little grumpy as well. Keep in mind you will need to order at least 3 different things from the menu per person since they are super tiny. I'm saying this and I'm a girl that eats little. The biggest disappointment was the french onion soup -  6 tiny pieces of bad american cheese with butter and onions. We spent $200 for two and it was just barely enough. There are better food, ambience and service in the city for this price.

Really enjoyed brunch here - would definitely come back/ recommend to others for brunchFood: I think most people dine tapas style here, split French onion soup dumplings (they are famous for these, good flavor but not a must have for 17 dollars I believe) chorizo Mac and cheese, breakfast bruschetta, Philly cheesesteak sliders - would definitely recommend the last 3; they off a 1.5 hour unlimited drink special where there are more offerings that just a Bloody Mary and mimosa (spiked Vietnamese coffee, bitter Bellini), food was very tasty and satisfying although I do think the price point was a little high- price for the unlimited alcohol was reasonableService: waitress was very attentive (a little too scantily clad for brunch time) but she did mess up a couple of our drinks - not too mad as the place was swampedAmbience: bustling- a little too bustling if you wanted to squeeze to the bathroom, they do have a bar upstairs ( I didn't check it out) and a coat check to free up some space

Although the beer selection is great, the staff and crowd are way too douchey for my tastes, but boy has the LES changed.  I've never eaten here because the two times I went there were no tables available - so it gets very busy.

In attempts to go to Katz Deli, my boyfriend and I came across this gem. We have since been back multiple times. I can't even begin to explain how mouthwateringly delicious every dish is. I'm usually not a fan of tapas type dishes. But, since every dish is so darn good and I can never make up my mind, I am glad I get to try a variety each time. I would recommend each person ordering 3 dishes. Since we've been back with I've been able to taste a little bit of pretty much everything. My personal favorite is the Oreo Cookie Pancakes. If you're having trouble picking off their unique verity of dishes, the staff are quick to recommend their favorite. Some of our favorites are:Oreo Cookie PancakesCaramelized Banana PancakesWarm Doughnut With Fudge SauceFrench Onion Soup Dumplings Potato & Goat Cheese PierogiesPhilly Cheese steakChicken N' WafflesSocial Mac & CheeseAlong with YUMMY food, the ambiance was great. Its small, so definitely call ahead if you have a large group. Sitting in the center tables, you will feel very squished.Overall, The Stanton Social is a great place to go.

Stanton social is an easy 5 out of 5 stars...like a Chopped Episode taste, presentation and creativity are 100% on point!It's expensive so be prepared to shell out some cash money. Me and my husband shared the following 6 dishes:In order of our favorites (top to bottom)-Potato & Goat Cheese Perigees  -French Onion Soup Dumplings -Mushroom Ravioli -Mini Gyros -Chicken and Waffles (only thing we didn't love)To end the meal we got the warm doughnuts with chocolate, caramel and raspberry dipping sauce. It was crazy good. If you go on a Saturday be prepared to feel like you're in a club with loud music blasting, waits for your reservation and feeling of exclusivity....but go on a cold Sunday night and it will be much less noisy and busy. Its a different experience depending when you go.Huge huge fan of Stanton Social.

Went here on a limb because our hotel was near. Shared bruschetta and banana pancakes. Let me tell you.. These pancakes were like sex in my mouth kinda good. And everything was small portion sharing size. Loved it.

This was a strange experience. The ambiance is nice and it's a busy yet cozy place that draws a large crowd. The menu looked awesome. Pretty much everything on the menu sounded fantastic. Some of the items we got truly were outstanding. The French onion soup dumplings and the perogies were out of this world. The service was odd. The actual server seemed only semi-present. His communication skills were poor, he couldn't care less about giving suggestions, had limited knowledge about the wine menu, and tried pouring beer into my friend's water glass twice. The guys bringing the food out and clearing the tables seemed better-equipped to be waiters. The beer menu was awful. Barely better than what you'd find at a baseball game with nothing on tap. My biggest issue by far with this place was the price relative to the serving size. They have this little speech about plates being "meant for sharing". Ok fine, I can share as much as the next guy, BUT please give us enough to share. Thanks for adding the third normal sized meatball to our two meatballs for $8 extra. That's right, $24 for 3 small mediocre meatballs. The "sliders" is ONE slider for $9 and is TINY. Seriously?  We could have eaten three orders of the dumplings. If you want some tasty food that leaves you starving after spending $75 per person, you've found your place.
The food was so savory.  Everything on the menu is a winner you can not go wrong with anything on the menu!  I definitely recommend this place

My friend and I have tried Chris Santos' other restaurants so we were eager to try this one. I must say, this is our new favorite! The tapas styled menu allows you to try and share several different items. The mac and cheese and chicken and waffles had to be the highlights of the night. The chicken taquitos were delicious as well. In short, if you're looking for place on the LES with great vibes and with even better food and drinks, check out The Stanton Social!

I would never eat here again. I had a open table gift certificate and there are only a hand full of restaurants to choose from and it seemed like it would be a fun atmosphere. The arepa was ok but the mac and cheese and crab cakes were inedible. We also had the ravoli and kobe sliders, both had so much sauce that I wondered what they were trying to hide. The $16 cocktail I ordered was not good at all . The birthday cake shots have a good flavor but a strange consistency so we couldn't finish them. The one star is for the twinkie, that I would recommend.

Came here for a business dinner and left completely full and happy. We basically ordered a prix fixe dinner, so we just got to sit back and relax while the food kept coming in. I can't even remember half of the food I ate, but the highlight of the night had to be the kobe beef slider. The french onion soup dumplings were also a favorite of mine and an interesting concept in general, but I just kept going back to those juicy sliders. Wasn't a big fan of the chicken and waffles, but the potato and goat cheese pierogies that were served before them were great. Finishing off with the warm donuts hit the spot, but I definitely didn't save room for those. Overall the experience was great and the wine they had in their collection was excellent.

ritz cracker sized appetizers that end up being like $5 per ritz cracker sized serving.spent basically $100 on 2 cocktails and a tiny snack.everything was too salty, maybe to encourage more alcohol consumption?didn't stay for dinner.  decided to get $9 grilled cheese sandwich a block away!

It's been awhile since I've been so utterly aghast and disappointed in a dining experience. I've had Stanton Social bookmarked for a couple of years, and I was thrilled that I was finally going to get to experience it with friends. Unfortunately, nearly $200 later, we all left there unimpressed and hungry. First of all, the restaurant itself is beautiful. It's dark and chic, and has the perfect playful ambiance for an evening out. It has three levels to the space, with a 2nd bar on the 3rd level. Stunning layout.When we first arrived I had to use the restroom, so I began to approach an employee. Seemingly knowing what I was going to ask him, he pointed upwards as if to signify that the restroom was upstairs on one of the other levels. So, I made my way upstairs and still could not locate the restroom on my own. I then approached one of the employees near the upper bar area and asked for assistance in finding the restroom. Without saying a word, he pointed towards a corner of the room. I guess Stanton Social employees are too good to be bothered with basic customer service interactions.To start, we ordered the following:Hand Pulled Chicken Arepas ($15) - These were tasty, but the portion size was outrageously unacceptable! The total circumference of each "arepa" was less than the size of a half dollar piece. Moreover, these were NOT traditional arepas; rather, they were more like a deconstructed version. Basically, each one of these cylindrical bites cost $5. Pastrami Reuben Quesadilla ($16) - Again, these had great flavor, but the portion was shameful. French Onion Soup Dumplings ($17) - These were very good. Served piping hot, as soon as you bite into them you get an explosion of French onion soup in your mouth. Albeit very tasty, they are still woefully overpriced.Our friends ordered the Veggie Burger which had to be sent back because the flavor was offensive to everyone at the table. They also ordered the Lobster Roll and Goat Cheese Pierogies ($14). Again, portions were small.I realize Stanton Social is tapas style, but when your table orders 6-7 plates, drops $200, and everyone leaves starving something is dreadfully wrong.

Over rated and over priced.  If you like to eat go somewhere else, if you like to taste this may be a good place for you.  There are a lot of restaurants in NY and this isn't one I'll go to a second time - once is enough for me.  Disappointed

If you have any semblance of an adult appetite, don't come here. I came here for a celebratory brunch expecting to you know, eat. It was essentially finger foods. I'm talking TINY. My fiancé who doesn't eat pork wasn't given a substitution for one of the items we were served, but was still charged the same price. 2 glasses of champagne per person, if you want the unlimited it's an extra 25 on top of the supposed 45 per person for the party we were a part of. We ended up spending 140 for two people, and went down the block for 99 cent pizza after as we were still starving. I love food and don't mind spending on it, but for these prices you would expect to actually get....full maybe? Save your time and money and go elsewhere. I have brunched at several places for the same if not lower prices and left stuffed and drunk. You will not get that experience here.

We arrived to this location for my friend's birthday. He hosted his birthday brunch at this location. The ambiance and vibe is really cool on a Sunday. They dj played really good music. Because it was a party of 14 we had a pre fix menu. The menu consisted of very smal bites (i.e. small tacos, philly cheesesteaks, donuts,and potatoes. The serving size was very small and only enough for one per person. Because the serving size is so small i highly advise that you eat before attending any brunch at this place (especially if it's a pre fix menu).Overall the service was okay and food was decent.

Our reservation was at 8:30 but our table wasn't ready until 9:20. Small portions and extremely overpriced. Food was mediocre considering how much it's priced at. Found a splinter in my Kobe Beef Burger that came from the bamboo stick that was pierced through it.
Haven't starting eat yet but the women who checks us in is having a super super bad attitude, have NO IDEA what happened with them, service DEFINITELY need improve!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food was good, super small portions and way overpriced. Expect one or two bites max to anything on the menu between four people AND we paid extra just so there would be enough for four. Best bang for your buck, the cucumber fries, the dip is great and you get more of it. Its like $12 bucks and its not even one cucumber. Two tiny meatballs, $16... I'm serious. Drinks were great and fairly priced! I highly recommend the Notorious F.I.G.Probably wouldn't go back, this was a one and done. We ordered about 8 tapas and left super hungry and with a hefty bill.

I understand restaurants, especially in the LES can be busy on a Saturday night. But what's the point of making a reservation when you're expected to wait an hour AFTER the reservation time? If anything, be upfront about it. For 30 minutes, we were told our table was being prepared. Then 30 minutes later, the hostess told us the people at our table were paying, or was it that the table was still being prepared? Even the hostesses seemed confused and forgot to communicate with each other. Couldn't even get their stories straight! We get it. It's busy.
