But please do not patronize your customers and it won't hurt to be honest from the beginning..My group really wanted to make this night special for our birthday girl, so we made the best of it. I don't know if the strategy is to make everyone starve before they sit, but we thoroughly enjoyed the food. It was fun and delicious. Thank goodness...

So accommodating with all food allergies - amazing service.  The food was SO good.  We did the sit down brunch with 2.5 hr drinks and about 15 people.  Service was on top of drinks (and they were strong), so definitely worth it! We will definitely come back!!  Ask for Abe - he was the best!

Celebrated my birthday here and it was lovely! If you are with a big group I suggest getting your own tapas as they were certainly true to the small size. We were seated upstairs in a private space right next to a small bar. The music I noticed gets louder as the night goes on but we didn't mind that at all.

The Wait: We were a small group of 4 with a reservation for 8:45 pm. We were there by 8:40 pm. Stanton Social (SS) informed us that they were running a few minutes late and suggested we go upstairs and get a drink. Sure! No problem. We went upstairs, ordered some cocktails and waited at the bar. No news from the folks downstairs. We went downstairs at 9:15 and asked about the table. SS told us that the table assigned to us just paid their bill, so it will be a couple of minutes for the table to clear. No problem. We wait downstairs this time, standing at the entrance area. We see other folks being seated, we ask again about our table. Oh! Our table just ordered dessert, so another 15-20 mins. Wait... what? At this point, we get a little upset and tell them we've been waiting for an hour for our table. 3 minutes later, we are magically given a table.The moral of the story is that we shouldn't have been polite. The Dinner Wait: Our waiter introduces us to the tapas concept and recommends 8-10 dishes for the 4 of us. We were starving by then, so picked out 7 things from the menu immediately and were ready to order. The waiter asks us to hold on and disappears. 10 minutes later, she comes back for our order. This became a theme for the rest of the evening. Everything involves a wait and every plate has tiny portions. The first plate arrived about half an hour later. We were ravenous and devoured the tiny tacos in two seconds. Then we have another 10-15 minutes wait. The next plate arrived and we devoured it in two seconds and so on. The Food: The food itself was average. The only spectacular thing on the menu was the hard shell vegan tacos. Everything else was underwhelming. 1. Hard shell vegan Tacos: Really fantastic and the only worthwhile dish we had all evening. It was a burst of flavor and texture. Sadly, only 3 in a plate, so one person didn't get to try it. 2. Vegan Sliders:  Each plate comes with one tiny slider - so we ordered a couple. These were inedible - my cousin actually spat it out because it had raw tamarind in it. She started coughing because it was incredibly dry. 3. Pierogies: Average. Tiny. 4. Wild mushroom & goat cheese ravioli: Again, 3 on the plate, so one person couldn't eat it. This was decent. Had some flavor but was a bit too chewy for my taste. 4. Roasted tomato pizette: This was the only decent sized dish, was not bad. The crust tasted a bit burnt but on the whole edible. 5. Shrimp lolipops with popcorn: The shrimp was a tad cold but not bad. The popcorn was literally just some popcorn in the glass with some cayenne pepper on it. Not even salt. I don't remember the other dishes we had. Overall, we're not likely to return. The ambiance is upscale and the service is not bad.  My advice is to eat something substantial elsewhere prior to going or plan to eat something substantial elsewhere after the dinner. The dinner itself is not going to sustain you.

Very delicious and savory. All tapas are amazing. Came here a few years ago and finally decided to do this review. It's more a bar and tapas atmosphere. Great for a small group and awesome drinks. Good for after work social as well as brunch. Def come again soon!

The food here is very OK, but the service here is absolutely AWFUL. We came here last night with a group of 15 people and we were squeezed in a small table in the corner of the restaurant. Despite making reservations weeks in advanced and having a prefixed menu, it took us an hour to actually get our first dish. The dishes came out in 30-40 minute intervals which there was absolutely no reason for considering everyone had one bite sized portion that was finished within seconds.. You can imagine most of our night was sitting around waiting for food. Have friendly conversation? Forget about it! The music choice was good and just the right volume-- if we were at a club event-- not for a pleasant dinner. At one point, you just get tired of screaming over the table to speak to each other. We had to constantly tag our waitress down for drinks the entire night since food was no where to be found. The steak finnalllly decided to arrive about 2 hours later. I was taken back by the mouthful of salt I got with my piece of semi-cold steak (which I guess makes up for the lack of salt on the rims of my margaritas).What we had originally planned to be a 2 hour dinner, turned out to be 3 hours. Most of us couldn't wait that long and had to leave to go home without finishing our entire menu. On our way out, we had to grab out own coats, which were coat checked and sectioned off from the public. We had to climb over the rope and find our own jackets.

Came back with a group of 16 people with a pre fix menu. We were seated at a cramped table under an open staircase where people were walking (all we could picture was the dirt off people's shoes falling on our table). We were seated at 7 and didn't get our first appetizer until 8:15. Service was terrible with the exception of drink service being okay. The music was too loud to carry a conversation. Most of the food was okay but certainly nothing over the top and a lot of it came out cold. They did give us a nominal discount but that didn't replace the fact that dinner took us almost 3 1/2 hours which certainly killed our atmosphere and most people had to leave before we even got dessert (which was served to us in a bag to go - how nice).

came here once on off hours. Ok food.  Made reservations (cc: Seinfeld) and every time had to wait 30 minutes before hearing '10 more minutes'.  I had three clients with me three different times, respectively, who all got tired of waiting and it was a bad look  - and everytime came to blue ribbon sushi around the block, where they More than took care of me and savedWant to get embarrassed?  come here.Want to impress someone and close a deal - go somewhere else with reliable table turnover and an understanding of their guests.

Hip-ish spot, that seated us earlier than our reservation. TY!  Cool vibe inside with great music playlist. Food was small plates only, but oh so good. We ordered 9 plates for four of us, and we still had room for desert.

It's been ten years since we came to Stanton Social and it's exactly the same as we remember in a good way. Except better service! Our waiter brought us at least three dishes from the chef, and everything we ate was amazing. And dessert on the house! We came with our two boys because we thought they'd get a kick out of the sharing menu. We will definitely be back. Great LES option.  Thanks Chris Santos and staff!
Good place to eat and hang out with a group of friends. Great music and decor. Food was really good just wish it wasn't such small meals. I know that's the point but you continuously want more.
Went with a group of 9 for my husband's birthday. Food was delicious, everyone loved it and service was great!!! Would highly recommend.
Rudest most horrible staff ever.   Restaurant was was empty and they refused to seat an incomplete party.  Wouldn't give me a reason other than that it was policy

Food was good but not amazing. Unfortunately the music was too loud and there was a group of what looked like frat pledges next to us. If really loud music is your thing during dinner, check it out. If not, just go for drinks.

Our group of 11 was celebrating a Bachlorette Party and we had the best time!  The food was fantastic, more than we could even eat!  The drinks and service was fantastic.We are already talking about coming back after the holiday season with our husbands!

I've come here multiple times and always enjoyed the food and ambience. This is the first time I'm here when I reserved a table for 11 pm for four and unfortunately had one person in our party who could not make it till 11:20 as his flight was delayed. In spite of requesting  the host multiple times that we would start ordering and not have the table wait they refused to seat us. In fact the first host who spoke to me tried to look past me and pretended I wasn't standing in front of him. It really doesn't make sense to refuse a table at 11 pm for dinner in spite of having a reservation. The only place in New York I've seen this happen that they wouldn't seat an entire party just for one person.
Slow service, but the French onion dumplings are one of the best things I've ever tasted. Good place for a group as the dishes are served tapas style. Very fun atmosphere too.

Was so excited to try this place after doing some research on it, and was even more so after I looked at the menu and thought to myself "I could eat 20 things on here!" Service was fine, nothing to complain about, nor write home about. My girlfriend and I shared the following dishes:- "Corn Dog" Crab Cakes - Was so excited by this concept, expected a very crispy crab cake. What we received was a mushy crab cake on a stick that was almost completely devoid of any flavor.- French Onion Soup Dumplings - This was by far the best dish we tried. It was incredibly flavorful, but bordered on being too pungent. All things considered, it was a good-not-great, creative dish.- Chicken & Waffles - I don't even know why I ordered this considering I'm usually underwhelmed by chicken & waffles. These were arguably the worst I've encountered after trying probably 8-10 different varieties in restaurants ranging from soul-food spots in Harlem, to very upscale eateries. The waffles were plain mushy, not really sweet or savory and the chicken was grilled instead of fried, like I was hoping for and expected. - Baby Back Ribs - I have never once in my life sent back a dish to the kitchen. Not once in hundreds and hundreds, if not thousands of restaurants. This changed at The Stanton Social. These were simply inedible. I sat there and thought to myself "how can somebody try this dish and decide it was a good idea to put on the menu?" It's a shame because the ribs themselves looked beautiful, incredibly meaty and falling off the bone.- Ice Cream Sundae - How do you screw up an ice cream sundae? It was more or less fine, but the vanilla ice cream had zero flavor. None. Non-existent. It was like plain, unflavored ice cream. Kind of bizarre. Well, there it goes. I'm definitely not a foodie or even a hard person to please when it comes to food. 99% of the time I don't review, but I felt compelled to this time and I just hope someone reads it.

Amazing delicious place, atmosphere is really good the music is just perfect, I love the tartare, I love the French onion soup, Music was amazing. I was there for a birthday party but I thing it's a real good place to go on a nice date.
Amazing for Sunday brunch. Good cocktails and great food. You have to try the Ruben quesadilla and the pizza.

My favorite restaurant in all of New York City. Beauty and Essex and Vandal, their other restaurants are also awesome but I like Stanton Social better because it's a little more casual and easier to deal with. The others are more of a spectacle, great if you have guests from out of town you want to impress Stanton Social is best for when you want a fancy night out without pushing past the wanna be real houswives of wherever on their big night out.

The food was OK at best.  It was so overpriced I could not believe it.  I don't mind paying for good food as long as it is good.  There were 7 of us the bill came to over $300 and we all left hungry and unsatisfied.    It was so overcrowded that people were bumping into each other all night.  We had to keep moving our seats ( we were forces to squish ourselves up against the table) so people can get buy.  Maybe round tables in the middle of the restaurant are not a good idea. We picked that restaurant for he French onion soup dumplings  and they were a huge disappointment.

1985 called and they want their food recipes back. This place is not somewhere you go if you want good to average food. I don't mind the concept but at least make sure the food tastes good or have evolved and justify the prices.  I haven't been here in like 10 years and wish it had been longer as in never again.

The host girl is very rude telling the customer they can only eat here for two hours. Though the seating was tight but the hpst still decideds to put us on a very tight table with open seats left elsewhere. Pur waitress was nice, but there was hair in the food, seriously paying over $400 dollars at this spot is a joke how it turned out. Will not go back for sure.

This is a very good option for bunch on the lower east side. It was easy to get a reservation for 12:30 on a Saturday as late as 11pm the night before. One of the aspects of Stanton Social that makes it unique is its tapas-like approach to brunch.We shared four dishes - the cinnamon roll sticks, the caramelized banana pancakes, the french onion soup dumplings, and the smoked tomato pizzetta.The only one of these dishes that wasn't excellent was the cinnamon roll sticks, and this mainly stemmed from the fact that we had different expectations as to what this dish would be. We thought they would have a consistency more similar to cinnamon rolls when in fact they are more flaky and crunchy. They weren't bad in their own right, just slightly disappointing.Otherwise, the food was very delicious. The French Onion Soup Dumplings in particular were amazing, and we devoured the pizzetta. The service was also quick and very friendly, and the ambiance was pleasant. They did have a slight problem with clean glasses for tap water, but they were very nice about it. We would definitely come back again, if only to try out some of the other small-plate options that they offer. For a group of 2, 4 small plates are more than enough for one brunch.

This is the kind of place I like- you can make dinner reservations and it's got a lounge feel. Drinks were yummy, food was delicious. Maybe not BLOW MY MIND but really good. Great place for a big group of friends looking to eat and drink. Classy but not snobby.

3.5 stars. Maybe my expectations were too high for Stanton Social. The number of reviews, the incessant hype, the seemingly creative menu...I thought we were in for a treat. As it turns out--and this is the moral of many, many stories--looking pretty on the outside is not enough. If execution falls flat, the buildup all seems pretty silly. All in all, Stanton Social is a fun venue with tons of energy with solid cocktails but overpriced, underwhelming food. Reminded me of Beauty & Essex (in vibe, presentation) but significantly inferior. Came here at 8:15pm on a Friday night. As expected, the place was loud and bustling. The decor here is gorgeous--glamorous and creative, beautiful lighting fixtures, sleek design overall. This is definitely a good spot (in theory) for a girl's night out or a big group dinner. Would definitely recommend making a reservation beforehand, especially if you're a large party. This place is busy 24/7.Stanton Social boasts a pretty intriguing cocktail menu--I actually found the drink execution to be much better, as a whole, than that of the food. To kick off the night, I opted for the Sage Advice (Botanist gin, mango, shredded sage, lemon), which I'd definitely recommend as a starter drink. Though it's listed under the "Savory" heading, it's actually quite sweet. Heavy on the mango, but I have zero issues with that. Huge mango fan and don't see it enough in mixed drinks. Be careful though--though you can't really taste the gin here, I assure you, it exists. My second drink won the night though (both in taste and in name)--the Notorious F.I.G. (Bulleit bourbon, fig, pear-cinnamon syrup, fresh lemon). Now here's something that's worth the hype. My bf typically doesn't like whiskey and even he agreed that this drink was a winner. Cobb Salad Bites: shaved brussels sprouts, bacon, blue cheese, quail egg, avocado (B+/A-)These were *almost* fantastic. Something was just a smidge off with the flavor and I still can't really place it. Still, these were fun, inventive and a great first dish of the night. The creamy avocado on the inside held all of the other goodness together and not surprisingly, paired wonderfully with the bacon. That combo isn't really a stretch, though (the ingredients of a Cobb Salad aren't exactly a secret). I'm not a huge blue cheese fan, so that might've been the issue for me. Overall, these were Willy Wonka-esque and definitely woke the palette up. Nori-Spiced Tuna Poke Wonton: cilantro, avocado, crushed wasabi peas (A-)One of our better dishes of the night, and very reminiscent of my meal and Beauty & Essex a number of months ago. Three wontons (WHY MUST THESE PLACES ALL SERVE THEIR APPS IN TRIOS?? The Cobb Salad Bites also came as a group of three.) topped with bountiful avocado (think your dish needs more but coming to a standstill on how to make it better? Put an avo on it!) and those yummy wasabi peas. The poke craze has made it to New York and we're all going crazy for it. You're dining as a duo, someone's gotta take the high road and concede the third wonton. French Onion Soup Dumplings: B-These are apparently the "signature" at Stanton Social. I've never been a fan of French onion soup, but our waiter raved and raved about these babies so we gave into the pressure. We needed one more dish. Unfortunately, these were collectively the least favorite dish of the night. It's entirely possible that this just isn't a food that I like. Simple as that. It's perturbing to me given my love for just about every food out there, but ya can't have it all, I guess. Just can't get behind these. Maryland Crab Cake Corndog: AWe seemed to be confronting a visual theme of general brown-ness across presentations. These were cute/creative/actually really tasty, but at this point we were tiring of breaded-this and battered-that. Just a small gripe. The flavors were fantastic, though. I will never tire of crab cakes/literally any dish featuring crab, and these didn't disappoint. Again, we were only served three! At least these are a bit easier to split (relatively). House-Brined "Pastrami Reuben" Quesadilla: swiss cheese, sauerkraut, mustard aioli (A-)Pastrami reubens carry a lot of nostalgia for me. Cold cuts with the Jewish fam every Sunday was a big tradition in my house growing up. Though I enjoyed the flavor profile of the dish (pretty hard not to if you like reubens), these felt a bit too dainty for me. Reubens are supposed to be falling apart at the seams with pastrami and these were a bit too weak for my taste. But when you're looking for this type of style (light, easily shareable), these are a great take on the reuben that don't require as much commitment as a Katz's sandwich does. Our total for the night was something like $140. Considering the quantity and the qualify of the food we received, that's simply too much. I get that a person comes here for the experience more than anything, but I was still disappointed. At least the service was great?

Very bad service from the very moment we walked in. There was a pregnant lady in our party but they refused to seat us since we were one person short. There were people blocking the passage way but they refused to tell them to clear the way. However, when we asked if it was okay to be seated, she told us to get out of the way without regard to the pregnant individual in our party, whilst allowing the Caucasian party to block the passageway and doorway. I understand that some rules and decorum must be kept, but the delivery could be more considerate and less rude. This experience left a bitter taste in our mouths, which hindered our ability to optimally enjoy the meal.

I loved the tapas-style brunch at The Stanton Social. I always have trouble deciding between sweet and savory at brunch, so I enjoyed getting to taste a little bit of everything. All of the dishes were delicious, but the warm doughnut with chocolate sauce and the breakfast tacos were definite standouts.The cocktails were strong, delicious, and plentiful. The service was another major highlight. The servers and host were all very warm, friendly, and attentive. They made the meal especially enjoyable. I'll happily be revisiting Stanton's Brunch in the near future!

Came here for brunch on Sunday and sat upstairs. The food was delicious and it was tapas style so I would recommend coming with a group of friends and sharing everything. it was a good crowd and boozy drinks were flowing as well. It has a loungey, trendy vibe and the atmosphere is fun. Would come back!
Very good quality food presentation and ambience. Definitely worth a visit! I shall return

Three stars for the food, which was delicious through and through, and the service, which met our expectations. I'm hesitant to blame servers for bad experiences (unless the server is outright rude) because I worked in the industry and know that much of what happens in restaurants is beyond the servers' control.The menu explains that the dishes are designed "for sharing among friends" and "are brought to the table steadily and continuously throughout the meal." We ordered 4 dishes for 2 of us, but since my sister is a vegetarian we only picked one with meat. We got the meat dish and a small bruschetta plate first - both delicious, but my sister wasn't eating the meat dish, so she only had a piece or two of bruschetta while waiting for the rest of the food. An hour after we ordered we were still waiting on the rest of the food.  At first we were hesitant to ask about it because of the menu disclaimer, but at a certain point there was nothing "steady" or "continuous" about the meal. We finally asked the server about the other food, he apologized and told us it was coming. A few minutes later a different server brought us a complimentary plate of potato and goat cheese dumplings and apologized for the delay and thanked us for being so patient - but this was confusing because one of the two dishes we were waiting on was just a side of fries, which I can't imagine is a more complicated dish to make than dumplings. It was also frustrating because while the dumplings were tasty, we didn't order them, and had to resist eating them lest we fill up before the rest of our food came. The food finally came about 10 minutes later and was delicious, as all of the food had been, but we had to wrap it up because we were basically full from the dumplings, and also had planned to do things other than just eat brunch that day and it was getting late. Seems like they are having problems with management or kitchen organization, the table next to us was having a similar experience (and even tried to cancel the food they were waiting for because they were also full from the dumplings). Good food, but no food is good enough to be worth the wait.

I've been here three or four times and this place is hands down one of the best brunch spots I've attended in NYC. High quality staff, from the friendly doorman to the servers who are constantly on top of things. As a vegan, I find it difficult to find brunch places that will easily cater to my dietary needs. I came here with a vegetarian friend (and a meat eater) all at the same table and the servers quickly -and without complaint-   let us know that they could prepare vegan and vegetarian dishes for us. Everything was absolutely delicious and so filling, and they kept the boozy drinks flowing. Great atmosphere. Top notch staff. Highly recommend.

Ordered 2 dishes and a latte, waited for 30+ minutes, no sign of food, not even the latte. Asked a waitress and she said it's going to be here in a few minutes. Waited another 15min and still nothing. Our neighbors came before us and they are still waiting as well, so we took a hint and left.Their 2-person tables are so close together you have to one into the next to make a crack for a person to get through. If you can't serve that many people, don't try to squeeze them in!

WORSE SERVICE IN MY LIFE! I HAVE NEVER BEEN TREATED LIKE THIS IN MY LIFE. At the end of a nice night @StantonSocial, instead of being asked to pay and finish my drink, the bathroom security person along the doorman just pushed me and said, please leave. I said, what is this about? why are you pushing me? The bathroom security guy said no, please leave. Then, the doorman came to help him. They came out of no where, I was talking to my friend who is getting married and we were talking about places to have the wedding. This happened at closing a couple of hours ago, Saturday, October 22nd. I took a video that i will be more than happy to share with management. DON'T VISIT THIS PLACE!!!

The service & attitude of the hosts (like in many other places) are just awful. They let you wait, with no explanation as for how long? Why? When?, even when you have a reservation. The food isn't great at all & below the standard of Chefs restaurants. And of course, it's overpriced. When they give you the final bill they say "no more than 4 credit cards"... huh? I wouldn't recommend this place, unless you're in a mood of spending some big bucks on (very) small appetizers

We loved our dinner at Stanton Social Club. Friends suggested that we make early dinner reservations because the restaurant gets loud, which we did. The restaurant serves family style small plates, which we loved.  We ordered their signature French Onion Soup Dumplings, Spicy Mac & Cheese, Chicken Taquitos and the Spiced Sesame Salmon.  The chicken taquitos were served first and were excellent. In fact, he wished we had ordered a second one.  Next, the mac & cheese arrived. It was baked in the oven with Panko bread crumbs, which added a nice crunch, but I was disappointed with how mild cayenne was. Heck - I put more cayenne in my scrambled eggs at home.  I asked the waiter for heat and he brought a dish of hot sauce which I added. The hot sauce definitely helped add heat to the mac & cheese.  The French Onion Soup Dumplings are an inventive small plate and they're covered in melted parmesan. However, I found the dumplings a little too sweet for my taste, as the melted parmesan didn't add enough salt to counter the sweet onion inside the dumplings. I added hot sauce to a dumpling, which helped, but was too strong for the dumpling. We both liked the spiced sesame salmon very much.We had a great waiter and enjoyed both the food and wine very much. We had really nice meal at Stanton Social Club.

I do not recommend this place for parties more then 5. The food is super expensive, all food is tapas. Came here with a party of 10 and the amount of the bill was super expensive and i probably only had 7 bits of food LOL. The Maitre D doesn't seem like she knew what she was doing when it came to reservations. Service was great

Came here for a social brunch with bottle service - advertised as 7 courses but more like 7 small bites (think hors d'ouevres size). Highlights were definitely the latkes (yummy, although not really latkes - the Gentile next to me made some sort of comment about them being "really good latkes" and I almost strangled her), the tiny reuben panini things, and the doughnuts. Courses I could have skipped were the egg "taco" things (basically hard-to-eat breakfast burritos) and the flatbread (fine, but nothing special). The food was pretty decent, but the service was SO slow and unexceptional. We were there for a full three hours. Now, I've had 2.5-3 hour meals before at some restaurants, but for some reason because of how small the portion sizes were at The Stanton Social, we finished our bites in about 10 seconds and then had a LOT of sitting around time waiting. Didn't really like the vibe for brunch. There was a DJ upstairs playing pretty loud music, which was kinda bizarre to have in the background while a table of girls sat and chatted. I DID like the whole "social" concept, though, in that I liked the tiny, shareable bites with ample drinks and kinda a communal-casual feel to the tables. I just think The Stanton Social can't figure out if it wants to be a unique tapas joint, a club, or an upscale brunch place.The food was good, but I won't return.

The food was good (I loved the soft egg tacos). The drinks we're OK( I've def had better).... The atmosphere was nice , the place is very cleaned the best part to me was the DJ!! lol I went for Brunch this past sunday we were seated upstairs and I enjoyed his mixes from arrival up til departure! They're a little pricey but not too bad. The staff was also very pleasant :)

OVER PRICED. Back waiters were amazing but the Servers were lazy and uninformed/uninformative! Based ofd of the giant meal we ordered, not a whole lot of food, and the autograt was HIGH! They did no work for the tip. The food was tapas and some of it was good, and cool, slightly innovative with the Dumplings... BUT Ive had better tapas and cocktails for much less.

Extremely disappointed. We were taking out friends who were visiting from out of town. Had a 10pm reservation, at 1045pm were told our table was still not ready despite there being one in open sight. We ended up leaving and going elsewhere. Manager did apologize and gave us complimentary drinks however still a bad experience.Reservation system needs work

We got here earlier. Our dinner reservation was at 10:30pm. We drunk something while we were waiting. After being saying "5 min more, 5 min more "for at least 20 min we sat down at 11:00 pm. By far the worst service I had in NYC in all my time in the city. Rude, unprofessional servers and specially the hostess ; glasses were dirty and the only one thing that you can do in a restaurant which is to talk to the manager was un useful. She juts smiled to us as if we were kids and left. No solution, no apologizes. My worst experience in NYC by far . Came here is the best way to ruin a Saturday night.

It's an expensive restaurant. Now that we got that out of the way, I can tell you the brunch and the dinner are both to die for. Awesome place for out of town guests. Share tons of things. Portions aren't huge so it can be frustratingly "new york" but if you come in with expectations properly set you will have an unmatched dining experience.
love coming here to eat every time I visit NYC!!  French onion soup dumplings and the strawberry fields cocktail are amazing.  Staff is always friendly and prompt!  Must eat here!

I would not suggest a late reservation. Like many popular restaurants this place over books. Unlike other hotspots the staff was not friendly or accommodating. We booked the reservation at 10pm and were told they were running 20 minutes behind. After an hour and following up twice we still did not have a table. About 90 Minutes in they finally offered a table too small upstairs to wait at until a larger table opened. At this point we walked out. I have been in this situation at trendy NYC restaurants a few times before (Catch, Beauty and Essex, Miss Lily's ect) and we have always been offered a free round of drinks once it hit an hour wait over the reservation time. The staff has been apologetic. Not at Stanton Social. As you can imagine in a popular area like LES we walked out to lines everywhere. This really put a damper on the night and I felt awful for the birthday girl. Next weekend, we'll be going else where to celebrate her birthday to make up for a night ruined by Stanton Social.

Holy balls! This place was bad ass! Chic space with wonderful service and delicious tapas-style food.  My friend and I ordered four tapas each because we didn't want to share. We were both so happy with our selections.  The tuna crudo was life changing, the meatballs/manicotti were perfection,  and the perogies were so yummy. My least favorite was the short rib beef with sticky rice. There was a spice in it that I didn't like too much.  My Polanco drinks were great too! My friend ordered and loved the chicken taquitos, the fish tacos and the quesadilla. Her least favorite was also the short rib beef dish. She also really enjoyed her Sailmaker drinks.  Our server was very friendly.  After dinner we went up to the lounge to enjoy more drinks. The place was popping! I felt underdressed with jeans and a plaid shirt.  The crowd was very fabulous and the music was on point! Definitely returning soon and dressing up!

930pm reservation organized a month ago and reconfirmed on the day. Show up at 915pm and they say 20 minutes late due to a backlog... 1 hour later we get a table upstairs in the area that's almost like a nightclub..Extremely disappointed. We were taking out a friend who was visiting for 2 nights from Sydney. Could barely hear anyone talk due to the level of the music.... Asked to be moved and 45 minutes later we were given a table on the second floor. Manager did apologize and gave us complimentary drinks however still a bad experience.Food is amazing but the reservation system needs work.

Drink prices were outrageous (even for NYC), and our server was rude. She kept moving us around and hassling us and creating drama and making us feel unwelcome. Bottles ranged from 300-1200 dollars! No thanks.

Way back when in my mid 20's I had a sizeable bday bash here...thought the service and food were excellent. Though I may have been heavily intoxicated then...possibly under some influence of some non prescription substances or two as well...but I digress. Ambiance is still as beautiful as always. Staff is also pretty to look at as well as the presentation of their dishes. But it ends there really. On the surface this place has it going on. But dig deep and the results are just as mediocre as some of the diners in the area. Ordered off their brunch menu. Doughnut dough hadn't been proofed long enough so although the exterior was nice and golden brown the interior was raw and gummy. The oreo pancakes were just Ok, the cream layers was reminiscent of an oreo but the rest was not and our oreo crumble on top tasted stale. The French onion soup dumplings were ok, nothing to really write home about and the chicken and waffles were the star of the meal but wished the waffle was a bit crispier. Our server apparently was "too busy", though there were plenty of open tables, so someone else took our order and then they all kept disappearing. We had to chase them down for water, chase them down for our check then chase them again to take our payment and process all the while when the restaurant wasn't busy. Odd.Great place for a party, for drinks, even some of the food items but service needs major help.

Came here for Saturday brunch expecting to have a great time but instead we got.... my drink came in a dirty cup with lipstick on the rim. The food and drinks took forever. The food and drinks were good though overall. The kicker was when we asked for the dessert menu and received a nasty response from our waiter Matthew. His response made us all cringe and we settled on just asking for the check to do dessert at a place with better service. Not sure what his problem is or what makes him talk to patrons like that but its not ok.
Absolutely amazing tapas.  We ordered about 15 different items and one was better than the next.   So so good.  :)

This is one of those places that thinks it's cool to be rude to customers and judge them upon entering, decide that they're not really cool enough to be here, but let them in reluctantly so they will spend lots of money on very little food. When I entered I was judged by the 2 hostesses and then some of the waitstaff.The food itself tasted pretty good, but for the price everything is so, so small. The vibe and crowd = meatpacking trying to be lower east side and the reverse at the same time. Oh and it's very, very loud. Like I can only hear people directly to my left and right loud (not the person across). If this all sounds like fun to you, then you should definitely come here. And oh, we probably wouldn't get along.

I have been wanting to try this place out for such a long time. Great service. The waitress was very helpful in informing us which dishes to double up on so all of the party would have a share. She also suggested how many tapas to order that would satiate the group. The food came out surprisingly quick. Everything was delicious. I would love to come here again.

Came in between brunch and dinner shift, fifteen minutes out from the dinner menu kicking in. Me and my girlfriend decide to stick around and wait for the dinner menu. In the meantime we had the french onion dumplings and a glass of red. Nice wine selection, we went the cheapo route and weren't disappointed. The french onion dumplings honestly looked better than they were. Still happy with the insta pics ;)For the main we both split a couple dishes, the chicken and the short ribs. We were happy with both. Both were presented beautifully.Service was fantastic. I wish I got the servers name. He was tall and the light fixture kept getting in his way and we had a good laugh about that. Anyway, I recommend, especially early dinner when its nice and chill. We loved our booth seating
We had birthday drinks for my BFF. The ambiance is nice and it's a cool place. We did the beer and wine happy hour which makes drinks half the price.

I didn't know what to expect other than pricey items  by the 4 $ signs Google and Zagat suggested. I will say the food was good. If you are looking to sit down and enjoy a delicious filling meal this isn't the place for you unless you purchase many small plates. My drink was good and everything we tried- caramelized banana pancakes, fish tacos and infamous dumpling French onion soup- very tasty. The ambiance was nice. We waited quite a while for our food considering there was only a small crowd of patrons. However, our waiter was nice which is always important to me.

I had heard a lot of good things about Stanton Social but I was slightly underwhelmed by my dining experience. We had the French onion soup dumplings, the chicken and waffles, and the pierogies. The pierogies were definitely the best thing we ordered especially the dipping sauce. The chicken and waffles was not very good, the chicken had a thick layer of skin and one piece had a bone in it. The soup dumplings were underwhelming. The basil gimlet was really good, the green tea cocktail was okay. The grapefruit cocktail was way too sweet. The donuts for dessert were good but had too much sugar on the outside.
Water was dirtyClose qtrsNo personal spaceFood was just okWe had the dumplings and mac n cheese

I booked a business dinner for a larger party.  The set up was very smooth.  They have a sales staff which seems to work well as a team.  We opted for a prix fixe menu.  I was concerned that, as a tapas restaurant, there would not be enough food.  Ha!  I was wrong.  The following were amazing...potato and goat cheese pierogies, French opinion soup dumplings (extraordinary- served in an escargot plate), Kobe beef burgers (larger than sliders), and donuts (light and airy and served with three dipping sauces).  Very good were the tacquitos and scallops.  Honestly, I could not eat everything and missed being able to review more.  The wine list was adequate but limited in selections.  The service was very good.  I would highly recommend and will be back.  Side note, Mr. Purple is right up the street and a great place for cocktails beforehand.

We went with friends and ordered 8 appetizer dishes to share. All 8 were excellent. The servings were small but incredibly tasty. The wedge salad was a winner; the hard shell fish tacos were outstanding. The sliders were great too, and well sized. We ordered lobster and Kobe beef sliders both were excellent. We skipped the cocktail menu, even though the drinks looked intriguing and creative. We would definitely go back and order double wedge salads, double fish tacos and double sliders, either lobster or beef. Wonderful ambiance and super hip, dynamic neighborhood. After dinner we walked around the corner to Laboratorio Di Gelato for ice cream. Great way to finish the evening.

Second time coming to this restaurant. The first time was for brunch and the food was amazing. Tonight I came for dinner and it was absolutely awful. First of all, everyone's dish came out and then unfortunately, they gave me the wrong order. I didn't mind at first, until it took 25 minutes for them to bring out the correct dish. The 9 other people at the table were polite and waited for my dish, while theirs got cold- very unpleasant start. The waiter was very rude and didn't even apologize for the mistake. The food finally came out and it was just awful. The tuna was mixed with a watermelon base and it just didn't not mix well with the sauce. I then ordered a cobb salad recommended by the manager. Again was not appetizing, but was hungry and couldn't wait any longer. And after all the shenanigans, the waiter left the tuna dish I returned on the bill! Just not recommendable customer service and I really hope no one else has an experience like this when spending so so much money.

Expensive and just ok food. We took a friend here for her pre-wedding celebration and we ordered a bunch of items. And everything was just ok and some even didn't taste very good. We tried the octopus salad, salmon, ribs, chicken and waffle, fried green beans and everything was just all right. The chicken and waffle was actually event bad..just very dry and bland.. The french onion soup dumplings was probably the best tapas from the night. It was served in this ceramic dish and topped with cheese. Pretty flavorful. Service and the ambiance was great. Overall, definitely a letdown given the how expensive and all the buzz this place gets

I must say I was so completely disappointed with this restaurant. I heard and read so many rave reviews, that I was totally confused with how bad our food was. I really wanted this to be an amazing experience, but what we got instead was a mediocre yet really expensive dinner. We ordered the chicken taquitos (ok) the spicy salmon (ok-) the scallops (almost ok) and the green beans (not ok at all). The green beans were as dry as rhe Sahara Desert in summer, and were tasteless to boot. For dessert we ordered the strawberry short cake that was plain awful. I wish  I ordered the doughnuts that everyone is raving about, but we clearly made the wrong choice...a really sad choice. I hope for The Stanton Social that they just had an off day. Maybe the Labor Day weekend got to them....because if this is what they normally serve, then the emperor has no clothes!

Hello All- So I came to The Staton Social with already confirmed reservations on what I assumed would be a busy Saturday night. Showed up 10 minutes before the start of my reservation and immediately checked in with the hostess, notifying her of my party's arrival. It seemed to be booming in the downstairs dining area so I would have been pleasantly surprised if our table was ready. Sadly, I was not pleasantly surprised, which was not a big deal (again we ensured we came early for this reason). The hosted notified us that the party currently dining in our assigned seating was on their dessert course therefore we would have a short wait. She stated she would send me a text message once our table was ready and directed us to the upstairs lounge area where we took our pre- dinner thirst. Upon arriving upstairs, the bartender (bearded gentleman) was extremely pleasant and accommodating. I was told the cocktail he made was flawless as well. Kudos to you sir! The cocktail waitresses seemed very attentive upstairs as well. After waiting 20 minutes beyond our confirmed reservation time, I chatted with the staff upstairs about possibly bringing our reservation upstairs but was informed that there was a private party scheduled. The DJ had just arrived and it's seemed like upstairs was going to be the place to be. Fortunately the same music is played in both areas. After waiting 30 minutes, I went back to the hostess to inquire as to our table. She then told me to hang tight because we were about to be seated. I wish she informed me of this via text message as promised but was relived nonetheless.As we walked to our table, there were groups of birthdays, celebrations and other beautiful people dining just because. I felt at home. Our waiter came to our table shortly after being seated and was great. Explained the menu very well and was very patience with my group. His name escapes me. To Share- -Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies- Great dish to share. Came with about 5 pierogie bites with a goat cheese spread. Very good share item.-French Onion Soup Dumplings- I wasn't overly impressed with this item. I know it is a favorite but seemed to be a bit salty. I tend to be particular with my salt/sugar intake so that my have attributed. =/-Chicken Arepa- Probably my favorite share item. Perfect size for each of us.-Quesadilla- Was okay. There was an obvious difference from normal quesadilla with its size but the flavor was also good.We ordered 4 share items between the 3 of us and it seemed to be enough. They came out in two's in great time. With how busy it was, the kitchen was on fire! Thank you for your attention.For Myself-The Herbed Fries- pretty good side order but I've def had better fries for less.The Glazed Ribs- Probably the black sheep of the group or items ordered. Was not to fond of the sauce but the meat slide off the bone which was great.Overall positive experience due to our server, the bartender upstairs and the quality and speed up most of the food. I know it can be tough accommodating all arrivals with a busy night on the books but I think this place could benefit from regular check in's with patrons on the queue list informing them of the status of their table. I would have appreciated to know my table was almost ready 30 minutes after my reservation instead of having to check in with the hostess. I plan on returning.

The food itself was good. The chicken/waffles were a miss, but the food really was overall very good. We loved the donuts, huevos rancheros tacos, and several other dishes. (except the Bloody Mary... they were weird/terrible)The experience was just so dampened by the service. It was a group of 10 for my 40th birthday. There with me were my parents and closest friends. The waiter, Matthew, was so atrociously bad and rude that I was embarrassed. It was a really special occasion. I was excited about my 40th birthday brunch, and honestly, Matthew had us all uncomfortable. He didn't even greet us in a friendly way. The whole time he was sour he had to be there. He might have even asked if it was our first time there or celebrating anything. I might have even been okay with that if he were efficient. You gotta be lovely or efficient, but if neither, a problem we have. Several in my group have been in the service industry. Besides being a large group, which naturally means wanting more overall, we weren't at all difficult. The place was busy. We get it. It would have made it easier to have seated us upstairs vs. in the way of everyone on the downstairs floor. We get that's not Matthew's fault. It certainly is on him that he didn't even come to the table for a full 15 minutes, though. He also then took another 20 to bring coffees. We had 11:30 reservations, which is when they open. We were on-time. How were other tables getting food before anyone at our table even got their coffee? And knowing we had to make reservations through their "events team", I was surprised a Manager never stopped by the table. Had that happened, maybe this could have been resolved. I'm not the type to demand a Manager, so there wasn't a natural opportunity to get things running better. I get being busy. I even get honestly simply not being very good at the job or making mistakes. My issue is that Matthew acted burdened by having to do his job. I got the $25 deal for unlimited select drinks within 90 minutes. First round took about 20 minutes. When he brought it I asked if that's when the clock was starting. That hardly seemed like an unreasonable question given the 90 minute limit. Instead of apologizing for it being late or just politely telling me that of course he'll start it from when I actually receive my first drink, Matthew went on for literally nearly a minute about how they are very busy, and are doing the best they can, and we'll have to be patient. Dude! I wasn't rude in how I asked. No need for the lecture. And never did he make it the least bit about me. It was about him and how he was busy.I took care of the tab and did tip about 22% because while Matthew didn't the least bit deserve it, I didn't want to be a jerk and also did want to make sure that the lovely young woman helping him would get something nice from us. It's rare I take to Yelp, but I've called the Stanton Social a few times and no one saw fit to call me back. My advice: good for a casual meal | the service is too unpredictable for a special event

The food was great and the drinks were a little too sweet. Our server was excellent but what really kicked it was the 90s hip hop. A steady stream of biggy and Ja rule kept us in the place longer than we wanted to be. Order the little tuna tacos-especially good and the wedge salad. Skip the cocktails if you're not into sweets and get a drink made. Recommended for an up town vibe in a downtown area.

What can I say about The Stanton social, Simply amazing from the host to the service.... Even the bathroom was nice. I was here for the first time on Wednesday, From the moment we sat down the service was excellent. Our service (Igor) I think was his name was amazing. He made a few suggestion for us,we started with the watermelon cooler a nice strong refreshing drink. I love the soup that they give before your meal. We started off with the octopus salad and shrimp cocktail. That salad was so good and the cocktail was just right. We then had the french onion dumplings and the chicken and waffles. I've never had french onion before but those dumplings amazing and the chicken and waffle was delicious as well.Even though it was decent size portion we we're stuffed,We didn't even get to try dessert.The ambience, service and the food was amazing. I know where I'm having my birthday dinner.

Definitely will come back!Yes, pretty expensive, but the foods are so damn good! I forgot all the dishes names, but everything we got was really delicious! Onion soup is a must! I saw that dish on almost every table. I was initially doubtful mostly because of the weird smell, but I understood immediately after a bite why everyone recommends it. We sat at the first floor round table booths, and it was pretty tight to fit five people. And our server wasn't super attentive, other than that I highly recommend!

Walked in on a whim earlier this summer after being dazzled by the thousands of Yelp reviews and I'm glad I did. I'll admit I had pretty low expectations; you just never know what to expect when a restaurant is known foremost as a ~place to be seen.~ But the food actually lived up to the hype!We ordered the pierogies, mac and cheese, beef wellington, pea-crusted salmon, and several cocktails.The pierogies were incredible -- this may have been the most memorable dish for me. I loved how the pesto and warm onions combined to create a crazy complex bite. The Mac and cheese was awesome too, and I'd 100% order that beef Wellington again. I have no idea how they managed to make the meat so tender without sacrificing the texture of the dough. Ugh, so good. The pea-crusted salmon was tasty, nothing to write home about.I enjoyed how each dish was divided into shareable mini portions. And for all that food, the bill was shockingly doable (heaven bless the East Village!) The service was OK. The wait staff was clearly overwhelmed but they did their best. Cocktails especially took a long time. In sum, if you're looking for a place to *wow* your trendy, young friends, Stanton Social is a great pick.

The food almost made up for our poor service at the bar upstairs. Despite standing directly in front of the bartender with her making drinks directly in front of us, it took her 7 minutes to acknowledge us. Never even a "be right there" or "just a sec." She even managed to not make eye contact with us while taking orders at the surround tables. For someone who has waited tables, I know how it is to need help or have too many tables at one time...but at least acknowledge that you see me. The hostess also seemed confused and took aWhile to seat is after checking in for our reservation.Our waitress was accommodating and nice but the fact that we were ignored for a full 7 minutes left a bitter taste in my mouth and I will not likely give them my business nor my company's business.

I struggle with tapas/small plates concept perhaps because I am greedy or because I am cheap, but the notion that I get one bite of something delicious that for which I just paid an entree price leaves me feeling unsatisfied and grumpy. So I went into the Stanton Social skeptical. The only reason I took the plunge is because I've enjoyed Beauty & Essex. Also, Stanton Social's menu options jump off the page at you as scrumptious. They had me at french onion soup dumplings. In the end I took the leap of faith. My husband and I choose the french onion soup dumplings, the beef and broccoli, the chicken arepas, the social mac and cheese, and the pierogies. The beef and broccoli and the dumplings were by far my favorite!! The beef and broccoli was tremendous. I almost took an elbow to my husband to get the last bite. In the end, I am glad we dined as just a couple. We were full and satisfied for about $60. A group of four may have ended in hurt feelings.

I went here for a friends birthday and the hostess was really rude. She told us we had to be out by 8:45 pm when our reservation was at 7 pm. The food is good but the portions are incredibly small. They try to rush you out and give you a set time that you can stay at the table for. I won't be coming back here again.

Food was amazing! We did as the menu suggested and shared all our plates. We got the Mac and cheese, tuna wontons, quesadillas, taquitos and chicken and waffles. All delicious. My favorites were the quesadilla and wontons. Service was great and the atmosphere was very trendy. Will def be going back.

Used to a fun, USED to be trendy but like all trendy restaurant, this too has reached its expiration date.  My personal enjoyment of the food has somewhat diminished, the service was okay but the hostesses are still B list actress wanna be's with an unrealistic sense of self importance.  The crowd is now Real Housewives watching types... watching from Jersey, that is, who seem to delight in being talked down to "I once was a background person in such and such movie". In fact, think they shot an epi there which tells you they need the advertisement.

Great for groups in LES!I went to The Stanton Social for restaurant week with my sisters and niece. We had an early reservation at 7:00, because they were booked until 10:00pm. Atmosphere-Dressy casual, group seating, 3 levels with a busy kitchen and 2 bathrooms. The vibe is very trendy and the people who come here want to be seen and heard. Expect noisy conversations and lots of laughter. All good of course!Service-Our hostess was super quick and helpful with our order. This is a tapas place so we wondered how much we should order. She was very helpful. Note: while our waitress was super nice to us, I saw her obviously making fun of some guests at another table. I thought that was a bit rude!Food-Perogies are a definite must. Tasty and delicious!Fish tacos are alright, but not stand out.Chicken and waffles were cute but the corn emulsion was a tad too sweet for me. Mac and cheese- I didn't like it! Too grainy! But my sister loved it! Pizzetta was delicious, I mean it's pizza!Doughnuts yummy and warm.Birthday shot- it was so cute and delicious too!Tip: Book in advance! Don't come before 7:00pm.

This review is based on my Restaurant Week experience, but I feel like it can apply to the overall experience of the place. Stanton Social does not live up to the hype it's gotten here.I'm honestly shocked that this place has such good reviews. It has a fun atmosphere with upbeat music, but the food was inconsistent, underwhelming and overpriced.I came here with two other people, so we were able to try almost everything on the restaurant week menu.For appetizers, we ordered the coconut curry samosas, nori spiced tuna poke wonton, and crispy barrio-style chicken taquitos. The coconut curry samosas were subpar, with an overpowering curry flavor and absolutely no hint of coconut. We enjoyed the nori spiced tuna poke wonton. It was light and refreshing. The taquitos were easily forgettable.For main course, we ordered the 'mexican street corn' ravioli, mango-jagermeister glazed baby back ribs, and wasabi pea custed salmon. The ravioli pieces probably only had three kernels in each piece. I felt like I was just eating dough. It was also pretty tasteless. The baby back ribs were actually pretty good. The meat fell off the bones and was very tender. The salmon was very disappointing. It lacked flavor, was not slightly crispy on the outside, and was just really bland overall. It was lukewarm when we got it, and there was way too much pesto.For dessert, we got all three. Lemon meringue twinkie, warm doughnuts, and chocolate peanut butter cake pops. All three was just okay. The doughnuts came with three different dipping sauces. The cake pops were too heavy and sticky.We also ordered the french onion soup dumplings per our waitress' recommendation because she said it's their most popular item. They were pretty disappointing. I love the smell of french onion soup, but this dish did not have the typical smell. It was actually kind of pungent. The only good thing about this dish was the cheese on top. Everything else was pretty tasteless.I think the whole restaurant week experience was severely thrown off because of all the different mixtures of cuisines. Eating the ribs after the salmon confused our taste palette, certain dishes were excellent while others really lacked in flavor. I feel like if Stanton Social focused on one type of cuisine, their dishes would be way better.

I almost want to give this one star because the service was so awful, but the food redeemed this spot. I heard about this restaurant after seeing the Head Chef on Chopped. I was excited to see this as an option for Restaurant Week and my girlfriends and I were really looking forward to our meal here. The service rendered this meal unenjoyable and rubbed us all the wrong way from start to finish. Definitely not what we expected from a $$$$ restaurant. The whole place had a flippant club vibe of 'we don't really care if you're here'1. The waitress told my friend and I 2 different things about what was on the happy hour menu (Only west coast oysters, not the east coast). If she was new, she could have mentioned this beforehand. She also thought that we needed to close out at the bar before moving to our meal - which was rectified by the hostess.2. The hostesses were uppity and not friendly. Our bad not explaining that we were going to be short one person for dinner, so we started later. She was absolutely unapologetic about having to kick us out at 8:15. (Original reservation for 6:30, we told her we were all ready at 6:50, no one came to check on us in between)3. Following up on this... 1) our check arrived while we were eating dessert; 2) a busboy was wiping the table while we were paying the bill and got crumbs on my friends lap in his hurried sweeping motions.4. The waiter wasn't knowledgeable, wasn't aware of the ingredients for the pesto. And frankly being Asian - I am a little offended by an item named 'asian pesto' because it has fish sauce in it. I will end on a good note, the food was good, definitely above average though the service made it less memorable. I recommend the poke tacos, samosas, and "Asian" salmon. My friends also raved about the donuts with their caramel, strawberry and chocolate sauces.

I think this place is way overhyped. I recently had my birthday brunch here and was slightly disappointed by the way the food tasted and the fact that some $15 dishes only had like 3-4 pieces. I wish they had the option to add a piece if the group of people is 5 just so that everyone at the table can at least taste what they are paying for. The waiter told us that the most favored dish was the french onion soup dumplings. We ordered this and no one liked it. It had an odd smell and taste to it and there was no soup in the dumplings... The chicken and waffles was very average and I've definitely had better in the city. We thought the mac and cheese and the breakfast bruchetta were decent, but nothing spectacular. The only redeeming quality of this place is that the service is pretty good and the waiters are helpful. None of us would return as there are for sure more delicious places in the city that are of similar pricing.

Great restaurant - been twice now for restaurant week and you just can't go wrong. The ambiance is great and the food is so delicious. You have to get the french onion soup dumplings. The chicken taquitos, perogis, and samosas are all killer. I'm a sucker for anything birthday cake and they happen to have a birthday cake shot which is great. The warm donuts for dessert are the way to go.
Trendy New York spot....good for groupsLove sharing the tapasFoodMeatballs...yummyCeviche...refreshing and good with a kick to itGrilled octopus salad, fresh ingredients and octopus tasted fresh

1st night in NYC I ate here. It's a tiny little spot that as packed with shiny, happy people. We were elbow to elbow with the table next to us. My company didn't care and we ended up chatting and sharing appetizers. No joke. It was a great way to start our trip and was yummy too!

I absolutely adore this place! The ambiance is magnificent and the drinks were delicious, especially for a date.  We ordered the Sage Advice and the Grapefruit Herringbone to begin our night. I'm a huge fan of tapas, which was one of the main reasons why I suggested this place to my manfriend. Together we ordered, the french onion soup dumplings ( known for), Mexican street corn raviolis, fish tacos (2 orders because they were amazing!) and chicken arepas. Honestly, everything was  cooked perfectly and I was pleased with the amazing service. Although some may believe this restaurant is on the pricey side, I think its completely worth it because you are paying for quality.

If you have $40 per person to blow, this isn't the worst place to do it. That said, the plates are small, and it is nothing mind blowing. My favorites plates were the tuna poke, the French soup dumplings, and the chicken and waffles. The doughnuts are also a must-try for dessert, but again, nothing extraordinary. The silver lining of the night was stopping at the Meatball Shop to grab a few meatballs to satisfy what was left of my hunger.

Held engagement party and birthday dinner on the 2nd floor lounge area. The place was gorgeous, the staff was friendly, the music was a bit dry (but it was between 6:30-8:30pm) picking up late. Because of the lounge space we were offered 7 small plate menu options, that kept rolling out. It took sometime for the food to start coming out, but once it did my guests got filled up quickly. The food was really good, however at the last minute many of my guests shared they were vegetarians ... Something The Stanton Social wasn't prepared to handle as our menu was preselected by me. The place was terrific, however for the money spent I would like to have a better 'comped' gift to the birthday girl & fiancé, she got a cupcake. I could've purchased a cake, but it would have been an additional charge... And I was going to bring my own, but that would've still been another charge. With all that behind the scenes stuff said, my guests had a great time, it was special, I have good memories and would recommend it.
Absolutely delicious. Perfectly presented & prepared. The arepas are some of the best I've had. Pricey but, 100% worth it. Perfect date spot. Super friendly staff.

Decent food, bad service. They made a mistake with our reservation and then blamed us even though we had the correct confirmation. When I explained to them that they were wrong, they insisted someone called. Nobody called. Then they responded by "wait just a minute and I'll call you when your table is ready." They kept us waiting for over 30 minutes. The food is not worth the rude people. At all. I'm not going there again.

Came in for a company dinner on a Thursday night with reservations. Very nice atmosphere inside. We were seated in the middle table near the back. There is a decent amount of foot traffic around us and would have preferred a quiet area.We ordered around 10 items. Everything came out in perfect size portions. Everyone was able to get a serving from each item and not get too filled up. My personal favorites were:French Onion Soup Dumpling: I was really surprised by these. The inside was actually soupy and had all the flavors of a french onion soup. Potato Pierogies: Very flavorful and especially excellent with the creme fraicheNori Spiced Tuna Wonton: Pretty much like tuna tacos. Fried wontons with raw tuna inside it.Lamb Osso Buco Arancini: Melt in your mouth lamb.All in all, all the items were unique and great tasting. Some hit better than other but I enjoyed the meal in general. It was a fun way to try a bit of everything and enjoy company with each other.

Brunch with friends but to be honest it was disappointing. The food quality was just normal but the portion was so small that you will need to order lots of plates. The waiter 'suggested' the way you should eat which actually made us uncomfortable. They say their food is for sharing but every plate actually is smaller than a normal plate in other brunch places. Considering the taste, portion and service overall, I am afraid I would not recommend this place.

Three of us went on a Friday night without reservations at 8pm and they quickly and kindly took care of us the very best they could without a wait. I was impressed because I kinda went with the attitude of you never know? Atmosphere on point. Service outstanding. Staff knowledgable and kind. Music was perfect. Food and drink was better than my highest expectations. The French onion soup dumplings and the octopus salad is a must. I can't wait to go back honestly!
Brunch was excellent! Definitely get the $25 drinks for 1.5 hours. They are strong and tasty. The food overall was fantastic.

We had the Stanton Essentials (prix fixe menu from Sun through weds for $38pp) which I'm surprised nobody has commented on here. I don't remember everything we've eaten but we had the pierogis and the donuts which were amazing. Everything we had was super delicious and I was really impressed especially for the price! Will be back if I'm back in NY!

Beef wellington: after obsessing over this after watching chef Ramsay all day. I decided to try this for the first time at the Stanton, the beef could have been leaner and less "chewy", however the puff pastry was on point. And the sauce was the perfect complement to it. Onion dumplings: I do not see the hype out it, they have better things on their menu. Lamb gyros: lamb was perfectly cooked. pita could have been a bit more crunchier. Con: the waiter brought in the check when our glasses were full and the dessert intact.

I went to the Stanton Social with two friends for brunch on my birthday. Wonderful ambiance, friendly service and delicious tapas. I would definitely recommend ordering several dishes, due to the fact that the tapas are small in portion size. We ordered the following: Caramelized Banana Pancakes - The pancakes were smaller than I expected, but the smoky flavor of the buttery syrup truly made the dish special. I would have preferred more caramelized bananas. Goat Cheese Pierogies - These were absolutely delicious. The goat cheese was perfectly tart, and they were paired with an onion/garlic cream. French Onion Soup Dumplings - These were a must try. The dumplings were nice and hot, bursting with sweet onion flavor and covered in melted cheese. Fish Tacos - The battered fish was perfectly seasoned, topped with a refreshing cabbage slaw. However, instead of placing a tiny dab of aioli on the side, perhaps a sauce to finish the fish tacos would add that needed flavor. Warm Doughnuts w/ Fudge sauce - Soft, fried pillows of doughnuts with cinnamon sugar and bittersweet chocolate was a perfect finish to a lovely brunch. Overall, the Stanton Social was a lovely restaurant with great dishes to share. However, if you dislike tiny portions, this is not the place for you.

Always a great repeat. Ideal to go with even numbers given the portioning so every one can experience a little of everything. French onion soup dumplings are a standout. Creative and absolutely delicious.

Had the most amazing experience here last Saturday. Food, service, drinks = excellent. Great ambiance overall.  2 negatives: tables are super close to each other and we had 2 very loud and annoying women next to us. Second, there was only 1 bathroom, which is odd for the restaurant's size.

Came in on Friday night around 8:30 pm without a reservation. Was told to go upstairs to try getting a seat at the bar or lounge. We saw 2 people leaving so quickly grabbed those bar seats. Ordered the fish tacos (pretty yummy, came with 3 on a skewer), the perogies (4 in between caramelized onions - super yum), and the french onion soup dumplings (yum but very heavy/cheesy).Loved our bartender (Lindsey?) who made my husband the FIG cocktail - smooth and delicious and a nice size.Would recommend and return for the unique food and great bartender! Definitely gets crowded though.

Trying to be cool and desperately failing. Waited an hour for a table WITH a reservation. Just because you make people wait doesn't make your restaurant any better. The reception girl with blue lipstick is too try hard, she belongs at the Star Trek convention

I came here for a lunch with a friend last week. Food was decent but overpriced with a limited portion size. I would've given the overall experience a 4/5 if a tip nearly three times the tip I gave wasn't charged on my credit card. My original tip was about 20%, so it's super disheartening to have them try to charge me more than the tip of me and my friend combined. Anyways, I was able to get a portion of my tip back after calling the place and informing them of the erroneous charge, but it really isn't the kind of experience anyone wants to endure.

You know...it's such a disappointment that I have to write this review. I dined there in March and the reason for my review NOW, three months later, is because I still haven't heard back from management about my experience. I emailed someone named Michelle to explain but since they disregarded me via email and in person, I felt a review was necessary. My cousin came into town to celebrate a mini bachelorette weekend with me before getting married. She wanted to have a really fun night out in the city and so she made reservations at Stanton Social for a Friday evening at 9pm. Of course, as most places in NYC are, it was jam packed! Understandable. We were sent to the top bar and checked in every 20 minutes to see how long til we could sit. The hostess was incredibly rude each time we checked. Now, I know it's annoying to her that people check in on a table time but also, that is her job. At one point she told another customer and myself to "calm down, it's NYC and you should know we're packed" when we got upset after an hour of waiting and she said there was still 7 tables waiting to pay and leave. Astonishing. Anyway, we were finally told we could sit after an hour and 25 minutes. With very full drinks in hand, the person who sat us didn't bring them to the table, didn't offer a round of drinks, didn't apologize for the ridiculous wait, etc. I was not looking for anything free at all, I understand how the industry works, but Stanton Social didn't care in the least that they made us wait so long with a reservation and didn't bother to try to rectify any situation. What makes it ALL WORSE, is that I tried to email in to explain my experience before having to tell the world with a review and never received a response. The food was delicious. It's a shame because I'll NEVER be back and have made sure all my friends as well know about the crap experience we had. I understand wait times, but show some respect to your customers. Not everyone cares about the scene at your restaurant - you should care about people coming back time and again and you've lost me as a customer for life.

We had a reservation of four people for 9:15pm, arrived on time, weren't seated until 10pm. This alone is enough to ruin someone's night to be honest. Service was good, waitress was nice and attentive but she made a mistake with the desert order (gave us the wrong options of daily sorbets available, and then brought the wrong one to the table). The food was quite good. If this review was based on food alone I would give it 4/5. We had French onion soup dumplings, sliders, fish tacos, and Cobb salad - everything was quite good. However, living in NYC, I have high expectations and there is a ton of competition, so 3/5 it is.

My boyfriend and I came here for the first time on Friday, and it lived up to all of our expectations! It was smaller than we thought and busy when we got there for our 8pm reservation. We were seated quickly, but it was very loud and hard to hear each other across the table at first, which was annoying. But once we started drinking and eating we were too consumed with our meal to care. This place is a must if you're in NYC!Drinks: First, I had the Grapefruit Herringbone which was delicious. Pretty sweet but also strong, which I liked. For my second drink I had the Strawberry Fields, which was also really good. There were crushed strawberries at the bottom which at first seemed weird, but were a good addition and very fresh to enjoy with the drink. This drink was sweeter than the first one. My boyfriend had whiskey on the rocks.Food: Everything on the menu is small plates and meant to be shared, so we shared 5 items and then dessert. Tuna poke wontons: very much a SMALL plate. There were three very miniature tuna tacos (like the size of my thumb), but they were really good. The crushed wasabi peas on top was more of a paste, and was not hot like straight wasabi. Oysters: came with a few sauces. They were fresh and very tasty, nothing different than any other good oyster out there. Kobe beef slider and crab cake slider: They were each a good size and well cooked. The kobe beef was my favorite, and my boyfriend loved the crab cake. They both had either aioli or another sauce on it, which went well with each. They both came with a few chips that were also a good side addition.Lamb gyros: These were good, but not great. The tzaziki was really good on top, and there was nothing wrong with these, just not our favorite. These were also pretty miniature, comes with three of them.Beef and broccoli: This was short rib on a sticky rice cake with pureed broccoli. The sticky rice was really good, and the short rib was fine, but nothing special compared to other items. I would skip this one next time. The broccoli was also fine.  Dessert: Do not skip dessert here. It is 100% worth it. We got two birthday cake milkshake shots that had whiskey with birthday cake ice cream in them. We felt like we had to try them at $4 each, because I love birthday cake flavored anything. Although I would expect a different type of alcohol other than whiskey to be in them, they were pretty good. They whiskey aftertaste was a little much for me mixed with birthday cake flavor, but they were pretty good for a shot sized treat. We also had the warm doughnuts that come with chocolate, caramel and berry dipping sauce. These might have been the best doughnut bites I've ever had. They were covered in sugar and warm and doughy on the inside. I loved the chocolate and caramel sauces but didn't care for the berry, but my boyfriend liked it. These were seriously to die for and you have to get them if you come here. SO good, and a good size portion too, I think there was 6 of them.

"Maitre d" unbelievably rude. Will never return here after her attitude. We came in without a reservation (stupid) but were told we could be seated in a hour plus. So we left our phone number and left to get a drink. Hour plus later called told us they didn't have our name, apologized, said they did and they could seat us. We came back and maitre d said she didn't know what we were talking about, etc, etc. Very unimpressed, if you can't seat without an advance reservation, fine, just say it.

My friend and I came here on a Thursday night. A very popular place it seems. There is a doorman checking IDs for anyone wishing to enter the upstairs bar/semi lounge area.The ambiance is low lighting, but still with an open friendly atmosphere. The whole back wall is a huge wine rack, which I thought was a nice, unique touch.The waitress was kind enough to explain how the menu works, mainly appetizers to share, though it is rather small appetizers, so I would suggest at least 2, probably 3 per a group of 2.We ordered the French Onion Soup Dumplings that everyone seemed so keen about. Neither my friend, nor I was much impressed with them. The way they were displayed in the bowl was cute and different, but the taste just wasn't there. It had the remnants of a french onion soup taste, but with a lack of luster.The potato & goat cheese pierogies were of another world! So much flavor, and the truffle creme served on the side as the "dipping sauce" was divine! They could probably open a little shop right next to it and make a killing off the sales. DELICIOUS! We were tempted to just scoop it up and eat it (seriously that good).Red snapper tacos were okay. They were 3 mini tacos, about 2 bites with a piece of lightly fried fish inside. I don't think they were worth the $14 price tag.Side note: be forewarned, the sliders are tricky the way they are worded - it is only ONE slider that comes per order. So if you order a "kobe beef burger slider" - it is just one slider.

The later it gets, the louder this restaurant gets. Great food and drink, but don't come here with friends if you want to have a conversation. You'll need to exit before 8pm because it gets packed and super loud, not just conversations but the music.

Came here for brunch last week with Wyman. We ordered the polenta and the chicken and waffles. Both were so good!!! Even the brunch is served like tapas, so I would recommend ordering more dishes.
