I was content after sharing two, but could definitely go for more food. Out of the two dishes we had, my favorite was the chicken and waffles. They served it with this magical sauce - the perfect combination of savory and sweet. After reading the other reviews, I'm questioning whether or not I should come back for dinner. If you haven't been here before, I'd definitely recommend trying the brunch first!

seemed to be the popular pick for 18 year old birthday celebrations with tiaras -- most of the food though was great and i would certainly come backPotato & Goat Cheese Pierogies- 5 (truffle crème fraîche mmmm)French Onion Soup Dumplings - 5Red Snapper Tacos - 5 'Pastrami Reuben' Quesadilla - 4.5Rigatoni - 3 (not worth it, flavorless)

To be perfectly clear, my 3-star rating is based on the price and portion size of the food.Visited yesterday for brunch around 1:30p and the place was virtually empty. Our server was prompt and attentive, but mentioned that the plates were "meant to be shared".This naturally led us to believe that the portions would be of sharing-size?We decided on the Red Snapper Tacos and Chicken & Waffles. Both dishes were VERY flavorful, but extremely pricey ($15 and $21 respectively) which is ok and expected for NYC/LES- BUT the portions were tiny :(And that is were i gotta draw the line. Also ordered 2 Bellini's bringing the total bill to about $73.Tasty and creative....but not worth the money, unfortunately :/

Ehhhhhhhh..bleh. A la carte? Even more eh. Food is bite sized, like not even appetizer-sized. The snapper tacos were great and also the mushroom ravioli was deeeeelish. They served us a "complimentary tomato soup shot" that was cold and gross. Super crammed in there and loud. Whatever. Lol definitely won't be back.

Painfully Nasty Service. The service is so mean that it takes away from the taste. We arrive on time, two of our party is late for our 6 p.m. reservation, the entire restaurant is dead as tomb, and they will not seat us. We stand at the small hostess stand asking why not, and are told flatly, "That is our policy." No invites us to wait at the gorgeous bar/lounge area upstairs. We eventually find it, have drinks, and are presently someone else's bill. We get our bill but our credit card was forgotten. During dinner, one surly server spills the beer on one of our party, does not apologize, takes one of our napkins to clean it up, and purposefully clanks and makes noise removing the plate of beer. Mind you, the server spilt the beer. A new napkin is never brought. After all this, who cares what the food tastes like? Yeah, it was cute, clever tapas. Very sweet veggie burger slider. Overly sweet coconut curry samosas. Scalding hot French Onion Soup dumplings. No oreo pancakes on the menu. Frankly, there are 3 categories that need to be up to par in a restaurant: Food, Service, and Decor. Decor is the only category that can be overlooked. The decor was nice. Never again.

Went here for dinner with a party of five. The room was so small, so dark and very loud. Loud enough for the waiter not to hear your order. The bathroom was so tiny and smelled. We finally ordered and she said everything on the menu is like family style. We got our food and it was tiny as hell. Not very nasty. The restaurant was very busy and service SUCKED. The drinks were OK but very expensive.

Went here with a group of girlfriends and I do not see what the big deal is. We were seated at a table in the middle of the restaurant that was so close to everyone else I could have reached over and eaten off of their plates! This also caused the place to be very loud. We ordered several plates of many of their "well known" small plates- the French Onion Dumplings, Poke Wonton, Meatballs, Lamb Gyros, Sesame String Beans, Chicken and Waffles and none of them stood out to me as being particularly flavorful or "special". I dont know if it used to be better and has now become just another NYC hip restaurant to be seen at but I was disappointed.

Stanton Social is probably one of the five or so remaining 1000+-review spots in NYC I've yet to visit, and it took a BlackBoardEats deal for us to stop in early on a Friday evening to a completely empty restaurant. Gazpachos to start weren't announced, and were unevenly filled, and they took away one of our two sets of silverware and didn't really acknowledge the oversight when we asked for the second. The 30% off helped with the bill for what wasn't much food, as did the Citi extra perk of one complimentary specialty cocktail per person (the Off the Cuff was strong but lacking character). Their widely-renowned french onion soup dumplings were a bit of a letdown; we definitely preferred the goat cheese pierogies. The red snapper tacos were messy and not great. Service was very attentive (not hard when only one table is populated) after the initial mishaps, though the lights atop the table are placed awkwardly, requiring them to manuever around them to make eye contact.

Ah-may-zing! Been here a couple of times and I'm never disappointed. The food is sooooo good and the staff is very friendly. The mac n cheese is so good you'll want it everyday and the mini lamb gyros are THE BOMB! The pierogies are delicious. Everything is delicious!

Lovely place for a not too crowded brunch. And they take reservation!It was even better when I heard that they share the same owner of Beauty&Essex cuz I also happen to love that restaurant as well.It is tapas but they are def more filling than the traditional ones. We had the Oreo pancakes (which was absolutely amazing), chicken & waffle (mind you that the chicken is grilled not fried), and the huevos rancheros which is more like cheesy tacos. Servers are attentive which is another plus. Will come back for happy hours or dinner!

We had a reservation at 9:00 pm and was not seated until 10:00 pm. This was after an hour of the waiting and the hostess asking my friend for her reservation name at least 5 times with a rather artificial smile. While the food was good ultimately, waiting for a table for an hour when you have a set reservation is just bad management and would not lead to a recommendation or return visit. I have lived in NYC for nearly 20 years and rudeness is never necessary or acceptable.

So happy to finally have visited this place. The standouts are beef wellington, ravioli, wasabi pea salmon, octopus salad (though tad too salty). Our waiter did a great job of recommending plates and portions for us. I love sharing plates- it was 5 of us and we ordered 10 different tapas. So we probably tried almost half the menu. Highly recommend!

This place is simply amazing for brunch ! To start off, the drinks were very well executed.. Strong, refreshing, and STRONG. Love. Now for the food... So my favorite part of this experience was that everything here is served tapas style, which meant we could try many dishes in one visit. The French onion soup dumplings is what they're known for, so by default you must try. Unique dish and equally delicious. My personal favorite dish here are the goat cheese perogies. So creamy and rich, with a superb dipping sauce, definitely worth the calories. In addition, we tried the red snapper tacos, lamb gyros (amazing), and Oreo pancakes- all great picks! Can't wait to return to try the dinner menu.

Overhyped, overpriced, and unmemorable.Was taken here for a date. My date read good things about this restaurant thru other sources beyond yelp which inclined her to take me here. Since I stopped Yelping as frequently as I used to and venturing out to the newest restaurants and only spending my money on tried and true disappointingly I find myself here today with my experience.We ordered the french onion soup dumplings as an appetizer. Great starter dish. It all went downhill when I decided to order the social mac and cheese. Should I mention I am a HUGGGE mac and cheese lover. This happened to be the WORST mac and cheese I've ever had hands down. I couldn't help but to stare blankly at how awful it was and sent it back. I should have known better but I am a good sport and decided to try again so I ordered the red snapper tacos.  I mentioned to the waiter before my decision that I was looking for something fulling. He did not suggest otherwise. Minutes later the plate comes out and I am baffled at the appearance of three miniature tacos that couldn't dare feed the appetite of a toddler yet alone an adult.Long short ended up down the street at yet another restaurant to fix all of the wrong that happened here. I left unimpressed and I won't be going back.
Been here twice.The atmosphere is loud and trendy.Have not had a dish that we didn't like. Come here with some friends and try everything. Drinks are good and service is great

Great spot for Tapas.  Seating could be a little better, especially when making reservations but the food made up for that.  For myself and significant other, we were told to probably order 5 different things off the menu, however, four really stood out for us since we don't eat fish and we were pleasantly full.  The pizza is delicious! We also ordered, the taquitos which were ok but not outstanding, the edamame had a great miso glaze, and the kobe beef slider is amazing. The Philly cheese steak was good but personally i didn't love the truffle mayo sauce. For desert - the chocolate peanut butter cake pops are on point. Would definitely recommend this place.

Great trendy restaurant. I loved the food. Everything was delicious. For dessert my niece and I had the pistachio ice cream and the birds nest. It was amazing! They do need to step it up with the drinks. I thought their drinks were watered down.
My favorite dinner spot in NYC. Small plates to share. A great place for a date. They have amazing dishes and really good drinks. Make sure you have the French onion soup dumplings and the donuts.
Never disappointed with this place and a great go to spot. Wish some of the tables had more room from others as well as the size of them.  A little small when your ordering multi dishes

I thought the Stanton Social was one of these restaurants that was well past its prime. Wrong. This was a great call for a team dinner. Food rundown: - Arepas: I don't like Arepas. These need a different name. Freakishly good unique arepas - Pierogies: I'm not a big fan of Pierogies. These were great - Put these on your short list: Lamb Gyros, Red Snapper Tacos, Crispy Brussels Sprouts - Pass on the following: Meatballs (slightly above average), Sour Dumplings (meh), Mac & Cheese, Hanger Steak - Dessert - worth saving room for dessert

Perfect place for a date night. Very intimate and romantic. It is loud though! Tip: make a reservation! We did and we still had to wait 20 minutes. It was a Thursday night and packed!!!! We had the French onion dumplings. Like everyone on Yelp has said, it is amazing! The mac n cheese is really good too. The sliders are AMAZING but pricy. I mean, $9 for ONE slider. We got drinks as well. All cocktails for $15. They were delicious but not worth $15. They should of been a little more boozier for that price. Either way, I'm glad we went. It was a really fun experience.

Went there Saturday, May14th, 2016- Fancy atmosphere, pretty people, good drinks - food was unremarkable. They play up their food with fancy sounding terms like wonton onion soup and seal bass tacos, but the onion soup(wrapped in wonton skins) was overly salty and the fact that it's wrapped in wonton skins does nothing to the taste or flavor. Kind of gimmicky. The fish tacos was made with minced fish meat and not wholesome chunks of fish.

Went for a birthday dinner with 2 friends. Atmosphere was awesome, so much energy and great music. Drinks were solid and creative, although we're talking the usual NYC prices. Food was great as well. Our favorite were the goat cheese pierogies and kobe beef sliders. Finished up with the famous birthday cake shots. Overall a fun and impressive meal.This place should get at least 4 stars but the wait time definitely brings down their rating. Our group made reservations for 9:15pm. Place was packed when we walked in (as expected on a Sat night and we were willing to wait our turn) but we weren't seated until almost 10:15.  I thought the purpose of making reservations was to cut back on wait time... Sure, the upstairs bar is a nice option to grab a drink and wait for your table, but with standing room only and people on top of one another, this is only enjoyable for so long. Really takes away from the good thing they have going.

I give this restaurant a very SOLID 3 stars. I was with a group of girls for a quick weekend NYC trip and we had reservations for a Saturday at 9:30. We arrived right on time and still HD to wait around 20 minutes to be seated. We waited upstairs at the bar until our table was ready. The drinks were expensive as expect but very good. There was one citrus one served with fresh basil my friend had and it was probably one of the best drinks I've ever had. I had a Seer Sucker with Jerry Sailors in it. It was kind of like an Old Fashioned, not nearly as good as the basil drink though.On to the food.This restaurant reminded me of 'The Girl and The Goat" in Chicago. The food is meant to be ordered at once for everyone to share. Maybe if I had ordered the menu I would of liked it more as I would of personally picked all I knew I would like most.We had the Perogis and Goat cheese (amazing, best food I had there), Ther chicken and waffles (mediocre, not fried chicken, grilled chicken a little overcooked), macaroni and cheese,  which was good had a little kick to it, Edimame( which was great), red snapper tacos ( ok but not a lot of of flavor, too many things other than the fish chopped up in it), and unfortunately I could not think of the last thing we had, must not have been memorable.The service of course was perfect, very attentive and nice.All in all I'm glad we went. I probably won't go back to the City and search this place out again.

Food - very good, loved everything we had. Service - waitress was a sweetheart and on top of her gameHostess - worse we've had in the city.  Lied to us, gave our table away twiceManagement - didnt care 7:15 pm reservation ended up 8 pm.  Will go back bc we love the vibe and food but service was terrible (waitress excluded)
They overbooked and made people wait for a least one and half hours. The food is not even impressive. Very disappointing and a very poor experience.

My wife and I were in New York and were tired from travel.  We need sometime fast to eat but we did not want fast food.  We were lucky enough to stumble on The Stanton Social.  After looking at the menu we realized it was perfect.  Small plate and great drinks.  We shared several small plates and had 2 couple dirty martinis each.  Even though we thought we wanted something fast we discovery we were there over 2 hours just relaxed and grazing.The servers were great and we were not rushed out even though the place was filling up and for the later dinner crowd.  We recommend to for a casual dinner or a more formal dinner.

WOW. This meal was amazing. What I really like about this place is the tapas styled meals. I came here on Tuesday night for a business dinner and we ordered around 7 dishes along with a few drinks. While we were searching through the menu for what to order, our waitress brought out some free potato soup samples for us to try out, which was very nice of them and made us even more excited to try out the rest of their dishes. What entrees I recommend based off what we ordered - Wok Charred Edamame (spicy edamame), French Onion Soup Dumplings, Wild Mushroom & Spinach Ravioli, Social Sliders - Philly Cheesesteak (AWESOME). I also had ordered myself an "Off the Cuff" cocktail, which contains Hennesey and tastes sweet. Desserts entrees - Warm Doughnuts, Movie Theatre Sundae and Birthday cake milkshake shots. ALL amazing, my personal favorite was the Movie Theatre Sundae, almost ate that whole thing by myself haha. The Birthday Cake Milkshake shots were nice and tasty and made a great dessert for my sister's birthday. Definitely will be returning! Thank you Stanton Social!
Great food and great vibe! The Social Tea is on the stronger side. Bartender was great.  Made me a custom margarita off the menu. Sliders are better choice than chicken and waffles.

The location in my opinion is not ideal, but I'd probably still go back here because the food is outstanding. You'll need about 8-10 options for a party of 5 if you're doing the brunch, but all of the ones we had were excellent. Pricing was fairly reasonable as well. Our bill came out to under $300 and that included three cocktails and dessert. The caramelized pancakes and the pirogies are as good as advertised. I could eat an entire plate by myself, but unfortunately I had to share. Service is pretty solid as well, we never had to wait too long for our server even though it was pretty busy when we arrived. The interior is very nice and has an upscale feel to it, but the place is very cramped. You kind of have to snake your way through the tables and even the seating itself feels tight if you're in the booths, but the food more than makes up for it. Probably not the best place for a big group, though 4-5 people is doable.

So I headed the warnings from other Yelpers that they don't seat you at the time of your reservation and send you to the upstairs lounge first for drinks and knew beforehand that the wait could be anywhere from a half hour to an hour before we were seated. I think it's great as long as you make your reservation earlier than the time you actually want to eat. I enjoyed the opportunity to experience both spaces. The lounge upstairs is charming and a great place to start off the night with drinks. The downstairs seating area is a different vibe (little more noisy) but also nice decor. The only thing that was a minus was that there was only one bathroom downstairs- a single private unisex bathroom, so the wait is long. The food was good. I loved the chicken arepas, which I almost did not order because I didn't think they sounded exciting enough and boy, was I wrong. They were delicious and ended up being my favorite thing. The scallops are also very good. My guest and I were not a fans of the goat cheese pierogies but I think it's one of those love-hate items. We also had some sort of tuna tartar taco starter that was also quite delicious.
I only went upstairs to the bar area. The place is very nice. The drinks are strong. The Bartenders were great and checkup regularly.

The food was glorious and amazing. If you can just overlook the horrible, ego centered wait staff and hostess. Their rudeness was an affront and I hope that they get the same level of customer service that they dish out. Besides that the French onion dumplings are the thing that foodie dreams are made of. And folks, I've been to exclusive events in the past, this wasn't about that, it was outright rudeness. How disappointing because my understanding is that the owner Chris is on the Food Network and I'm a huge fan.
This place is good for a lot of appetizers. Clean, great atmosphere. Food is expensive and in very little portions. I don't drink so can't help you with that but I'm sure those are pricey too.
what an amazing experience!  The ambience is beautiful and the food was spectacular!  The service was perfect as well.  Total package!!

We went here for brunch and were generally very happy about the place. The best part was the tapas style servings to be shared which allows you to try a lot of different things. The downside is that the portion sizes are so small that you need to order atleast 8 things between 4 people, making it a tad bit more expensive than a typical brunch. Everything we ordered was delicious and my favorites here were the Oreo pancakes, chicken taquitos and the crab cake sliders.  The cocktails were great and I would definitely recommend the Vietnamese coffee.The ambience is great and we had no complaints with the service. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for great food with no budgetary constraints.

So this place was way too hip for my parents, but I have to go back sometime because it was great. Good was good (tuna tacos!), and it didn't come out too expensive for the number of dishes and drinks we got. Also, they say it's all small plates, but they're pretty decent portion sizes, which is nice. We had 7 dishes between 4 people and had too much food.Also everyone at this restaurant was objectively beautiful.

I decided to come here due to the great Yelp reviews on the French Onion Soup Dumplings.  It seemed everyone was raving about them.  Our waiter recommended ordering 5 to 6 "tapas" to share for dinner.  As someone that frequents Spanish tapas bars, I trusted his judgment.  This proved to be a very daunting task, as the 'Chicken n' Waffles' alone could have been my whole meal (and trust, I can eat).Here is what we ordered (and how I graded):--- 'Chicken n' Waffles' - C+... The flavor was lacking in this dish, but it was creative--- Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies - A... I hate goat cheese, but YUM--- French Onion Soup Dumplings - B+... My friend loved them; I thought they were pretty good--- House Brined 'Pastrami Reuben' - C... No wow factor, but not a terrible choice--- Old School Meatballs - B... I was honestly so full when these came, but they tasted fineI wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but this place is charming and the menu is enticing.

Stanton Social has very typical goods and bads. Goods: solid tapas plates, decent cocktail choices. Bads: too noisy, almost impossible to make conversations, mediocre service.Good*1: Basically if you read Yelp carefully and step-by-step follow suggestions, you would not end up with wrong dishes. French onion soup dumpling, red snapper taco, scallop risotto were musts. Believe they spent lots of time recreating traditional western dishes and adding new elements into it. Good*2: many fruity drinks that were suitable for girls - my friend and I loved our strawberry/grapefruit cocktails.Bad*1: oh my. I think about 90% time when I was trying to communicate, I had to shout really hard to make sure that my friend could hear me. Very unorganized. Bad*2: no one came to us during our dinner and checked on our food and stuff, really felt like we were being left alone.To be honest I don't really care about service, so long as food itself could justify its fame. In this case, I took away one star from the originally five-star rating, for everything that I did not quite enjoy.

The food was alright but nothing special especially for the portions and price. Fun to check off the list but never going back. Multiple groups around us were squeezed into tables and constantly had waiters bumping into dinners. If it was a roadside diner that would have been ok but not for the price you are paying there - aka $16 for a slider that is 2 bites.

This is one of my favorite places!They make sharing food with the people you're with so much easier.Lots of great "tapas" and they even accommodate for the amount of people you're with, so if you order something that only comes with 4 pieces, they will let you order 5 pieces instead, amazing!My favorite thing to share are the FRENCH ONION SOUP DUMPLINGS....they come in the cutest little dumpling ceramic dish with a nice thick layer of cheese crusted on top of the dumplings.  Don't let them take that dish away without peeling off and eating all the cheese crusted on the ceramic, you might need to fight over the pieces of dangling, crusted cheese like I did the last time I was there, haha.Other great items: Pastrami Reuben Quesadilla, Mini Lamb Gyro, Chicken and Waffles.But guys, the last time I went, the group wanted to each get their own thing so I begrudgingly obliged and ordered SARAH'S BIG SEXY BURGER and my mind was blown away.One of THE BEST burgers I've had ever.  The meat was cooked perfectly medium, perfectly pink in the middle with the most delicious bacon jam.  and this comes with a DOUBLE PATTY, but it's really thin so it wasn't too meaty.I can NOT wait to come back for the burger!

The food here is SO good no complaints and the dessert is really good I recommend the birds nest and the pistachio gelato. The drinks are ok nothing amazing. The staff is attentive and helpful. It is a very tight place but once your seated it's comfortable. I would come back

This review is for their BRUNCH service only: suuuuper lame! I have enjoyed many lovely evenings here - the food and vibe; but brunch was d-bag city. There are so, so many options in NYC, so why would anyone pick the one with the worst booze situation and mediocre food? I mean, I had a birthday obligation, but if you're reading this and still decide to go...that's on you. Prep for weak drinks, apathetic servers (can't really blame them tho) and flavorless food. Woof!

Went there for Sunday brunch. The food was good and I get somehow the no substitution thing ... but when I ask for olive oil on the side (because I don't like blue cheese dressing) for the only salad on the menu and the waiter says "no", that's taking it a step too far I think ... especially when there is no other "green" dish available. Limited brunch menu + pretentious cuisine = never go back ... #sorryIamnotsorry

Came here on my birthday and maybe my expectations were just too high based on all of these fab reviews. The food was okay. It wasn't bad, but for the price, it could have skipped the "microwaved"feel. The waitress was very nice, until her shift ended. The other waiter we had maybe came by twice to see if we needed anything and that's it. The staff was polite but nothing to make you feel special or attended to. The dessert : sucked. We had the "Bird's Nest." It tasted like store-bought whipped cream and not even the good one. The food was presented nicely but it's nothing special. We had chicken and waffles and the chicken had no flavor whatsoever. The only good thing here are the drinks. If you're here for drinks, they were on point. Food: avoid.

The service is terrible... Sat at the bar for a good 10 minutes before even getting the bar tenders attentions. Then at dinner the waitress was good but then her shift ended and the waiter that replaced her was awful. The food is TERRIBLE! Comes out 2 minutes after you order... Like that's not okay. Never coming here again.

It was so incredibly delicious! One of things I didn't realize until getting there was that it is actually a Tapas Bar and therefore all of dishes are essentially the size of an appetizer (3/4 pieces per "entree"), and every dish costs from $10-$50. This place is not cheap, but it was definitely delicious. Everything that we ordered was perfectly made. We ordered about 6/7 dishes to share amongst 3 people and dessert. Our bill came out to be about $180 with tip for 3 people (no drinks).Come here, but make sure you're aware of what this experience is going to be like so you aren't disappointed.

I've been to the lounge upstairs for drinks a few times over the years but had dinner in the restaurant for the first time this week. I wish the lounge and restaurant could have separate ratings.I would give the lounge 4 stars as a great place to have drinks and a night out. Great ambiance and decor, good cocktails. Had some food as snacks but nothing memorable.For dinner in the restaurant, I give 3 stars. Friends wanted to try the famed French onion soup dumplings. I never heard of them from anyone or anywhere until my friend said it a week ago. Not knowing anything about them, the only expectation I had was from it's name. My friend who tried it first immediately said "overrated" and I have to agree. When the dish was brought to the table, the runner warned us that it was very hot and suggested that we wait a few moments before digging in. We maybe gave it a minute. Because the dish has "soup dumpling" in its name, I thought of Asian soup dumplings and was anticipating a similar experience. However, we were sadly disappointed that there was no soup to drink inside the dumpling or drip down our chins. The filling was a bunch of soft caramelized onions and no liquid soup. Just calling them French onion dumplings (omit "soup") or caramelized onion dumplings would be more appropriate. The generous melted cheese topping mimics French onion soup, but the flavor of the filling was just okay. The dumpling skin also had a slightly plasticky texture.Our waiter suggested 6-7 plates for 3 people to share. The dishes were served 2 at a time and we did end up feeling full with the last dishes. The rest of the dishes were seasoned well, some with okay flavors, and others that were a little better. But nothing stood out where I'd suggest the restaurant for dinner.Chicken Taquitos - the menu should say taquito (singular) because it was one taquito cut up into 4 bite size pieces. The chicken didn't stand out and it's an okay dish.Charred Octopus - this was one of the better dishes. Well seasoned, tender octopus, and some nice spicy heat from the harissa.Beef Wellington - this is a larger or main dish. Size is what I'd expect for beef Wellington and rich with fois gras. It was tasty and the filet mignon was tender. We ordered medium temperature but the beef was cooked to medium rare.Chicken & waffles - small piece of chicken on one small waffle. Tasty but would have liked the waffle to be crispier. Also well seasonedSocial Mac & Cheese - menu says Italian sausage but the sausage used tasted more like a chorizo to me. Not bad just a bolder flavor than expected.

Food is a 10, amazing, small dishes that make everybody happy.  Price was clearly high but still excellent.  The only problem is they cleared our plates away before we were finished, and had the next table stand over us until we left.  When we complained that they took wine and food away their response was, "we are busy."  No manager available.  I will go back for the food, and at the same time be more aggressive when they try to take food away.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and it was great.We got seated literally 7 on.the.dot. which was great. We ordered:Chicken and wafflesOystersMac and CheeseMeatballsChicken arepasEverything was great except for the mac, that was just okay.drinks were AMAZING. Our waitress was attentive and nice as well. The food was pricey and plates were very small (tapa plates).However, I was very disappointed later on that night. My boyfriend and I had decided to come back at about 12am for drinks because they were that good! We went up to the bar and it was PACKED nowhere to sit in the lounge area and nowhere to stand by the bar. However, we saw that there were numerous tables empty upstairs and nobody waiting for them. We went downstairs to the hostesses and asked if we could be seated for drinks, they said no because we weren't eating (mind you, they remembered us from earlier). My issue was, if nobody had reserved them, and there were 7 empty tables... and we were going to be giving you our money anyways... why wouldn't we be seated? I thought that was ridiculous and thats why my rating is only 4 stars and not 5.
Super cute and hipster lounge on the LES. The chicken and waffles were my favorite dish. Cocktails were pretty good too. Make sure you make a reservation!
Amazing drinks! Cool atmosphere, yummy food. Vegetarian options: cali veggie burger, pizza, fries (all good) Good service

Good food and friendly service. We went as a group of 6, had some drinks at the bar upstairs for a bit before we got seated once our party was complete. The food was great for sharing. We each ordered something different so we could try it all. Delicious food and good price. Nice hangout spot with your friends if you'd like a chill, hip and relaxing place.
The portions are tiny here but the food is pretty good can't complain. I like the ambience of the second floor bar area its pretty nice.

YES! YES! YES! Went here for a Sunday birthday brunch, luckily it was a pre-fixe menu and we got to sample alot of the food. But first things first, ambience is GREAT, the place looks different in daylight as opposed to nighttime. Get the champagne instead of the mimosa for brunch. The food is worth the hype.A must visit if you're ever in LES.

The food was absolutely incredible.  We had the potato and goat cheese pierogies, French onion soup dumplings, hand pulled chicken arepas, braised short rib, philly cheesesteak slider, with a couple of repeats.  Everything was incredible.  You have to try the pierogies and the French onion soup dumplings, I'm still thinking about them!Service on the other hand... not so great.  Getting water appeared to be a tremendous hassle.  I can't even count the amount of times we asked to have our glasses refilled.  Wouldn't an empty glass be the first thing the wait staff notices?  We were seated at the same time as a couple of the people around us.  Each table received a small starter, compliments of the chef.  We never received one.  Not sure why...Also, I made reservations a month and a half in advance.  I called Stanton Social a couple of times to tell them that the reservation is to celebrate a milestone birthday and was very special.  I was told Stanton does a special dessert for birthdays and they will annotate that on the reservation.  The day before, I called again to confirm that the birthday celebration was annotated.  Anyhow, we show up, have our meal and nothing happens.  No "happy birthday", no birthday dessert, absolutely nothing.  The dessert doesn't bother me much, it's the principle of it.  I'm not sure what more I could have done to confirm that Stanton Social would do something special.  If I would have known, I would have made other plans for dessert.  We did see another table receiving a birthday dessert..Completely disappointed by the service.  For the amount we paid for food/drinks, you would think the service would be a bit better.

Let's clarify - I've been waiting to come here since I saw this spot on the Food Network at age 17.Then for my birthday, many years later, here I am.I'm going to say it: the french onion soup dumplings are hype. They are definitely more dumpling that soup which is disappointing and threw off the flavor. All of the other bites range from above average to delicious but you won't be missing out if you pass on the dumplings. The best thing here, hands down, is the goat cheese pierogie. My friend and I could not believe how incredibly flavorful and well done they were. You HAVE to try it.The vibes are really what Stanton Social are known for. It's a trendy place with a good place list. The crowd is younger and it's fun to kick it with your friends in this very New York, LES spot. The service varies depending on the night. But that Notorious FIG - one of the best cocktails that I've had in Manhattan. I recommend stopping in to try it. Also, the birthday cake shots are wonderful. If you're looking for a good date spot (reserve ahead first!), Stanton Social is an option. Probably not a first date though - the wait for a table might be too long for the awkwardness.

Did not eat here, but went upstairs to the small lounge for drinks. Drinks were delicious! Loved the unique drink choices on the menu. Sat at the bar, very cool vibe, dark lighting, intimate seating. The bartender seemed angry/annoyed and was pretty short with us, not rude, just didn't seem in the mood, so we ordered quickly...was a Saturday night and seemed pretty busy, so maybe that was the reason. Would go back because the drinks were that good, and would love to try the restaurant (downstairs).
Nice ambiance. Loud. French soup dumplings were meh. The cocktails are also good but not out of this world.  You basically pay for the ambiance.

We finally made to this place after hearing about the name for so long. There's three of us and we ordered 7 small tapas. Each one come out pretty nice. The French onion here is what everyone orders here. We really loved it. I also like the pizza and meatball tapas. Trendy and hip. Great for social, small group or date.

The food here is pretty good. I do, however, take issue with how expensive the cocktails ($15 each) and dishes are. I understand that the price point is expected for Manhattan, but paying about $20 for each small plate to be shared with at max 2 people is a bit much. All and all, I enjoyed everything I sampled (Kobe beef slider, rigatoni bolognese, butternut squash ravioli,herb dusted fries, and mushrooms). My Strawberry Fields cocktail was just ok, very small. The place was super crowded on a Saturday night, and the tables are jam-packed close together.  I had to shout over the loud music to have a conversation with the person I went there with. I would not recommend this place for an intimate date, but it's definitely worth checking out for food.... if you're feeling overly pretentious  and don't mind spending a lot of money for a few bites of grub. Do not go on a weekend night without a reservation as the wait time could well be 90+ minutes.

Beautiful space with two floors, intimate enough for a romantic date but also maintains a lounge atmosphere. Food and cocktails are expensive but REALLY good and special occasion-worthy. "Notorious F.I.G." cocktail was delicious and made with actual fig, would also recommend the ahi tuna dumplings if you're a fan of sashimi. The salmon entree was a little overcooked for "medium-rare," but the wasabi/pesto crunchy sauce really made up for it. No problems at all with service.If you are deeply uncomfortable with the upscale/trendy direction that the LES has gone over the past decade or so, stay far, far away.

Glad to see a celebrity-chef-owned restaurant focused on quality and service. So many of them wind up being a disappointment. Thank you Chris Santos for our amazing experience at your restaurant! Every single item we ordered, from the French onion soup dumplings to the movie theater sundae was impeccable. My husband was shocked - he had never had food like this and didn't even know restaurant food could be so delicious. You honestly can't go wrong here. Everything on the menu is perfect. I always try to visit Stanton Social when I am in NYC for that very reason!

Definitely one of the coziest, classiest places to get small plates on the LES. I've previously tried the potato & goat cheese pierogies (incredible) and tonight I had the meatballs, which were more delicious than anything I've ever had at The Meatball Shop, sorry guys. The cocktail list is definitely inventive and the drinks are strong. There's a party every Monday night on the super secret third floor. Oh yeah, and all the hosts are super friendly and attractive. This place is a great example of New York nightlife- come on a weekday for a chill evening out, or come on a Friday to ride the weekend rush with a bunch of happy people.

We were a group of 7-8 people. When we first got there, our table was not ready. The food is good. It is good to experience this place once or twice. The best is to go with a group of 4 people, so the group can split things evenly (including the bill). The dishes are small; they are tapas style. The best dish is the meatballs; these are a must. The mac & cheese and sliders are good. Upstairs is nice to lounge and have drinks.

I've been to Stanton Social twice, and both times (spaced a full year apart) their treatment of their customers was abysmal.First time: We had a 6 pm reservation on a Saturday.  Four out of five girls arrived on time, and the fifth was stuck on a disabled train.  (Not much you can do about that.)  The dining room was 90% empty but they refused to seat us and forced us to give up our reservation. We went to the lounge and had drinks and small plates.  Food was fine, drinks were fine, but they should've just seated us and let us order without our fifth person (as we said we'd do). Not a great experience, but I figured that maybe they were just sticklers for reservation times.  Oh, how wrong I was...The second time I went, we had a reservation for 6 at 9:30 pm on a Saturday.  Remembering last time, we arrived at 9:10 to be safe and went upstairs for drinks in the lounge.  Once we got up to the lounge, it was so packed you truly could not move - let alone get to the bar.  Moreover, everyone around us was in large groups, saying they were still waiting for reservations from 8:30 and earlier.  We probably should've left then, but we were overly optimistic and stayed to wait for our table.  9:30 rolled around and we checked in again - no table.  We checked in at 10 - no table.  We checked in at 10:30, *a full hour after our reservation,* and still no table.  At that point, we left and tried to figure out where to eat on a Saturday in the LES at 10:30 pm, with a large party.  (Hint:  this is hard.)  Finally, at 11 pm, we got a text from Stanton Social that our table was ready.  At that point, it was NINETY MINUTES after our reservation time.  Ninety minutes!  That's an insane delay, especially without any apology or courteousness or even - gasp - comped drinks from the bar.  Obviously, we did not go back for the food.Anyway, those are my two experiences here.  First-world frustrations for sure, but I'd wholeheartedly advise you to spend your money elsewhere.  This place is miserable.

Beautiful decor as we walked in through the dining room, up the stairs to the back corner table under the stairs. I guess someone has to sit there but unfortunately we were the ones! 20 min to get drinks delivered and the coveted French onion dumplings were great until my daughter pulled a hair out as she took a bite. We didn't report it as our younger guests said they would be embarrassed by the confrontation. The rest of our meal was good but for a couple hundred dollars, I've had some really memorable meals and this was not one.

This place is good - it's very hip, trendy and very LES. The female servers wear black dresses with a stanton social tag on the back, I think it's a uniform.I came here with two friends during RW Winter and we decided to do that dinner menu.We got seated at a booth and it's pretty cozy.For apps, we had cobb salad bites, mini tacos and empanadas. They were all very good for sharing among the three of us. For entrees, two of us has ribs and the other had a burger.The ribs were OK - they weren't bad, but I've definitely had better ones at other restaurants and I think the Stanton Social does a decent job on hyping up the dish, but it was just alright. The burger looked alright - I don't know if I would have wanted to spend so much money on a burger here though - I feel like there wasn't any other allure for the burger other than it's "big and sexy" name (and it wasn't even that big tbh, lol).The desserts were alright - the chocolate dessert definitely tasted better than all the other options we had.Would I come back? Maybe - I mean the ambience is very nice and it's a very young and hip crowd, but if I wanted mediocre food in a nice atmosphere I think the city has a ton of those already.

This. Place. is so good.  Definitely a stop if you are visiting and planning a night out in the LES.  My two friends and I had a 9:45 reservation, were not seated until about 10 but the food was beyond good.  Get the brussel sprouts if you have the chance.  Have not been able to find some this good since.

3.5 stars overall. Very nice lounge-type of environment, but I can't say I'd recommend it for dinner. I wish this place was self-advertising as tapas/small plates because their "big sexy" burger was more of a small, unattractive sandwich. Don't get me wrong, I was here for my youngest cousin's 21st birthday and we  (me and all my cousins) were there to surprise her and make sure she had a great night- mission accomplished! Drinks weren't bad, but everything was overpriced and I wouldn't return here for the food. I would come back to pregame a night out in a comfortable, classy environment.Also, it's fine to only serve sliders, but they were distinctly, differently named and yet the same size as my "big sexy" thang. Drinks were strong, mac and cheese looked scrumptious, but I didn't try it. I did try one cousin's samosas, which were interesting, but everything here is tiny and the tables don't really allow room for your plates AND your drinks. That's troubling in a place like this. Nice spot, underwhelming food, fun atmosphere for a nice time out with your friends. The movie theater sundae is amazing, and I'd probably pay $14 for it again, but I can just make my own- with a better kind of brownie- at home.

Conversations from the second floor:"Do I look like I'm Bridge and tunnel?""No."Me , **smiling** "really?" "No." **pauses*   "You look Midwestern. You look like you're from Wisconsin."Me: "oh...." smile fading.4.5 stars...I really liked this place!  A dark, apparently 3 story slightly unassuming LES building houses this restaurant/bar that is owned by a chef of "Chopped" fame (I can't tell you more about that because I spend my money at places like this, and thus, no cable.). There was a darkish more formal dining room on the first floor. We asked about the bar and were directed to a long staircase through a door to the left to ascend to the second story bar - apparently there's a third floor too? (My Milwaukee brethren will take note this place reminded me of a darker Eve back when it first opened and served food.) Upstairs, we found a bar, more seating and a sunken loungy area where we were able to luckily snag one of the brown leather coaches that offered table service for food and drinks. There were small larger groups (many ladies and some dudes) celebrating/birthdays and whatever else even early in the evening (7-8ish).Drinks - I ordered something called "The Social Tea" & it was just perfect. I tried a friends jalapeño margarita and it was pretty good. Other fun names: The Notorious F.I.G., Dead Presidents, Sage advice.They also had (it looked like) bottle service.Food: its mainly tapas but it looked like they had a few bigger dishes. Ordered:Cobb salad bites:  don't question the how-just order. So good.Arepas: (sp)not my fav but OKFrench onion soup dumplings: (same as Cobb bites above)Taquitos:pretty goodMeatballs with manicotti: very cheesy, very soft, very very goodIt felt more "loungy" than "cluby" but it was sort of early. I thought our service was really good. We had a tiny table so they appropriately staggered courses so everything fit. This is obviously probably not a regular hangout -it was pricey.  But I would definitely return. Most likely by plane first - & then bridge and tunnel.

Love this place, the French onion soup dumplings were awesome and the banana pancakes were some of the best I've ever had. My boyfriend got some coffee martini drink that I can't remember the name of, but it was insanely good

The atmosphere was upbeat, music enjoyable,  staff pleasant and food was interesting.  The sauce on the red snapper tacos was slamming,  the octopus salad is a must have and the Notorious F.I.G. drink was delicious.  Definitely looking to come back.

I've been waiting to come here for a while so i am glad it finally worked out!!The place is beautiful, but intimate. There's a bar upstairs with a little lounge as well while the restaurant dining is downstairs. The decor is really neat, and the dim lighting adds to the ambience. My three friends and I reserved this place for 9:15 and we were seated right away! They gave us a free little appetizer which was nice. I've been to their sister restaurant Beauty and Essex so I was able to see a little bit of the similarities. Their French onion soup dumplings were good, but not as delicious as we hoped they would be. Be careful they are hot! LOVED THE RAVIOLI!!! Our favorite for sure and the individual flavors were ah-Mazing. The fluke was good but not memorable. Definitely fresh though! The veggie sliders I think were one of the best I have ever had- I think my friend and I enjoyed it more than we would with meat!!! I really want to know what's inside their veggie patty because it really was something. YUMMMM!!!The Kobe slider was very delicious too! My friend definitely enjoyed it and ate it all up in a matter of minutes! The side chips were a great pair with the sliders and added a great kick! The Greek custard was the PERFECT ENDING. Light and sweet but not over bearing. They look like little bird nests!! Haha so cute and the presentations were well done :)Servers were all very kind and attentive. I say definitely go there at least once!

Glad we tried.....but would not go back. Found it loud, dimly lit, overcrowded and over priced. Too bad because we read a lot of good reviews on Stanton Social (which I am really surprised by) but they certainly did not live up to them for our group.Our reservation was for 7 PM, but when we got there on time, the table wasn't ready. That's not too uncommon so we waited patiently for our table. The hostess directed us to the bar upstairs until our table was ready. The bar upstairs was extremely loud, crowded, and HOT. I was dying - I would have rather waited outside in the rain, but thankfully our table was ready in 30 minutes. We went back downstairs to the main area excited to be seated and away from the crowded bar. The hostess proceeded to take us to the back of the restaurant, up 3 more flights of stairs - where we admire the beautiful décor of the restaurant from above, but to our surprise.... we just ended up back in the bar area. Just why? Disappointed cannot even begin to describe what I was feeling. The atmosphere upstairs was a bit unpleasant for a good dining experience. It was too dark, even to see the menu, and too loud to have a conversation. We literally had to use the light from our iphones in order to read anything off the menu. The server recommended 2 -3 tapas per person and we found the food to be inconsistent. A few of the small plates were great - including the Red Snapper Tacos ($11) and Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies ($10), but the others were less than stellar. Their signature dish of French Onion Soup Dumplings ($14) ended up being cold, heavy and lumpy - we didn't see what was so "signature" about this dish was. The Rigatoni Bolognese ($18) was a complete miss as well - it was completely bland and had a strange mint taste to it. Wasn't a fan. Overall, portions were tiny and food was way too expensive for what it's worth. I didn't find the dishes to be good enough for the cost and didn't enjoy being crammed in an extremely loud and dark room.
Came here for lunch on a early Saturday afternoon the food was delicious and the server Allison was very patient because we didn't know what we wanted to eat... Overall we had a great time

So delicious! This is a tapas style restaurant and great for large groups. Great music, great drinks, great food. Highly recommend all the dishes we ordered. We came with a reservation.We ordered:-french onion soup dumplings-red snapper tacos-hand pulled chicken arepas-beef wellington-mac and cheeseDessert-doughnuts-smores molten cake

Sat us quickly on a Wednesday night. Beef Wellington was super fab, french onion soup dumplings were not thaaaat amazing, gimlet was on point, and surprisingly loved the beef sliders!Atmosphere was romantically dim, but also perfect for getting blackout.

I went here for dinner with my mom and her friends. It was a good dinner, I really liked the atmosphere of this place. It is on the smaller side and they manage to pack a lot of tables into the space but it still felt intimate and we enjoyed the dining experience.I did not give it 5 stars because of time we waited to sit down. We had 5:30 reservations, we got there on time, two other tables were already seated with many open tables. No one was in line waiting a head of us and we still stood waiting for 10 minutes as a line began to form behind us. It seemed they were trying to create some type of door scene / crowd before starting the night which was unreasonable with all the empty tables and servers standing around waiting for them to seat people.

Very busy place and just a warning- even if you have reservations it will take awhile to be seated. We have 745 reservations and didn't end up getting seated till 8:30. It wouldn't have been so bad had the hostess been nice and apologetic, but we got a lot of attitude and mean looks from her. Also my sister left her card with the payment sleeve at the upstairs bar and the bartender was rude about looking for her card and we had to get a manager to find it and give it back to her. But the food was good-expensive and small plates but great variety and our whole group enjoyed the food. Our drinks were also great and our waiter was very nice. In a nutshell- expect to wait and some rude staff encounters at this place but the food and drinks are good.

Been 3 times and always great food and atmosphere. Would recommend everyone to get the french onion soup dumplings. Always had a reservation and feel that they have been fully booked everytime I went (so glad I did).

I'm a guy who likes to eat and I don't mind spending money if the food is good. I must say, I just didn't enjoy the food, completely overrated and it isn't a place is go back to. The place was very beautiful though and the service was good but the serving was tiny and was overpriced.

The interior decor is great and it's an excellent date place to impress your date. However, the food is not really impressive. The french onion balls are alright, but the fish tacos seemed a bit mushy on the inside and the other items were not that great. The banana pancakes were alright. Nothing really special on the menu. If you want a truly excellent culinary experience along with the atmosphere, try beauty and essex nearby. It is even nicer inside and the food is the best in the city. I think this place is great but not exceptional and definitely not up to the hype. However I did crave those french onion wontons later that day and may return for those alone

I came here for my 21st birthday dinner and the tapas were great! My favorite was either the tuna poke wontons, or the goat cheese perogies. The strawberry fields drink was a bit strong for me, but my sisters really enjoyed their drinks. The dessert could have been better-- my favorite was probably the birthday cake milkshake shots and least favorite was definitely the cookie dough Twinkies (avoid!!!). I wasn't such a fan of my waitress who did not really give much of a celebration as she brought out my birthday cupcake and Candle--was definitely expecting more, though I guess it depends on who the waiter/waitress is.Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would like to come back for brunch, hopefully with a better waitres

The food and drinks were great to me, my date did not enjoy all of things we ordered. The restaurant was crowded and loud. Our first waiter only really came over two or three times, second waitress was much more attentive (forgot her name). It was my first time coming here, I was a little bummed he didn't enjoy himself as much I did being it was his birthday.  I'd come back ONLY FOR THE FOOD! We had the pulpo salad(our fave), French onion soup dumplings, Reuben quesadillas, scallops with mushroom and peas risotto and the donuts for dessert.

I've been coming here for years and I always have a great time. I love, love, love the food. Small plates is my favorite style - I love getting to try lots of different dishes - and nothing here disappoints. And they have plenty of vegetarian choices to satisfy me. The cocktails are delish and the music is great. It's a perennial favorite.
Been to a few bday dinners here. It'd a great group atmosphere, and the food is great. I sampled pretty much everything and have no bad things to say.

I went here on a date, and I really enjoyed the ambiance. We did a boozy brunch and ordered the banana pancakes, the chilaquiles, and a fennel salad. I also ordered the spicy margarita which was fantastic. The food was good, but nothing really stood out to me besides the pancakes. They were amazing! I would love to come back and get something from their lunch or dinner menus though. Absolutely everything on the menu sounded great! I just don't think we chose the right things. Our server was very attentive, though the food did take a while to come out. Will definitely be back though!

I'm sorry I don't get the hype. My Girlfriend and I went to the Stanton Social for brunch, and based on the reviews we were expecting an awesome experience. Dont get us wrong, our food was tasty. We loved the oreo pancakes, and the eggs Benedict, but $15+ per plate is ridiculous. I've had cookies bigger than their "pancakes".  Also, $15 for a well drink, GTFO ! Insane ! Typical NYC robbery.

Came here for the restaurant week menu. It's a tapas restaurant, so I expected to have dinner and then go get a burger because I wouldn't be full. At one point I asked my husband to help me out with my entree because I was so full. I highly recommend the ribs. I've never had ribs I wanted to cry over, but now I have. It's a beautiful restaurant that is perfect for a date and if you want awesome oysters for $1, I recommend you hit the bar upstairs for Happy Hour (5-8). Can't wait to come back. Those ribs......ahhh. One funny thing though. Waiter said to NOT order the twinkie for dessert. It's dry and he doesn't even know why it's on the menu. So why is it still there? Didn't have it so I can't give a real opinion.

This place is lit.  For what it's worth, we were seated 45 minutes after our reservation time at what essentially was a large coffee table for 8 bros, and I'm still giving this place 5 stars.  It's a bit overpriced, but the food is stellar, the decor is on point, the music is perpetually on 100, and the clientele is attractive.  Will go back again.

Stanton Social people it ROCKS!!! I was there tonight for dinner with my wife and each and every dish we ordered fulfilled our expectations and more. We had the Red Snapper tacos, Rueben quesadillas, French onion dumplings, Perogies, 1/2 shell oysters, Kobe sliders, Chicken and waffles. We will be visiting again in the near future.

I ate at Stanton last year and loved it, the busy environment was a plus. Good food and good buzz. I went back last night, which seemed a lot less busy, but the experience was not that good. We had a reservation at 10.45, didn't get the table until 11.25. We were asked to wait at the bar, no problem, it was not busy but we were given a very small seat when most spaces were empty. We asked for some food whilst waiting, but the waiter did not give us cutlery or napkins, more so because the seat we were given had not enough space to accomodate food drink & 2 people all at the same time. The food was not as enjoyable as last time. Something changed or just a case of second time unlucky. Too many nice restaurants and bars around, not sure I want waste another evening....

I'm giving this place 5 stars because it truly deserves it. We had a 9:30 reservation on a Saturday night. My fiancé picked this place because of some recommendations from friends and we were absolutely elated to try something new for our first NYC Valentine's Day.  When we got there, the hostess told us that we'd have to wait longer due to a private party that just wouldn't leave. The wait was SO worth it. Our server was amazing, the hostess was phenomenal, the food was incredible. Because it is tapas style, we ordered the pierogies, French onion soup dumplings, chicken and waffles, Mac and cheese with sausage, Cobb salad bites, Thai chili Brussels sprouts, two sliders (crab cake and Philly cheesesteak), and finished with the movie theater sundae...holy wow was it amazing. Every single thing we got was phenomenal. The quality was so impressive, we left in a food coma that we are still experiencing this morning. TLDR: The wait was long, the staff is great, the food is the best.

Intimate atmosphere. Cute decor. There's a bar area with a lounge area/couches next to it. The opposite area has tables and chairs for food, but we weren't allowed to sit there if we weren't having dinner.I liked the music - a mix of 90s/2000s hip hop that's easy to dance to (although there's no dance floor). Drinks were ok. I got the strawberry field, which was slightly sweet but tolerable. My friend got some cranberry drink which was nearly not palatable, which makes me conclude that the drinks are hit or miss.Decent option if you're in the area, but not something I'd recommend trekking out to LES for, if you don't live close.

I've been dying to go here for the longest and finally made the trek from midtown. It was so worth it!!! We had a reservation and were seated as soon as our whole party arrived. Our waitress was super helpful as none of us have been here before so she gave great suggestions on what and how to order. We ordered 7 different tapas style meals and they came out at perfect times. Not everything came out at once and there was just the right amount of time in between. Everything was delicious. We even ordered dessert and it was amazing. Try the movie theater sundae and birthday cake milkshake shots. And the prices were reasonable... We were super surprised when we got the bill.... In a good way. This place is a must try and we will definitely be back!!!

I wanted to love Stanton Social and debated with myself about giving it four stars but at last I really can not.We had a reservation and checked in with the hostess 15 minutes early.  The waiting area was jammed packed and the hostess suggested we go to the bar. My boyfriend ordered the notorious FIG and even though I don't like bourbon, I thought this drink was very well made.  We ended up being seated an hour after our original reservation time.  Needless to say a few of us were very hungry.If you're reading this and you haven't gone yet do not believe what the waitress recommends. We were a party of 7 and she suggested we order 8 dishes as they are meant to be shared.  If she had recommend 16 - 18 dishes this would have been more appropriate.  Our table ended ordering 14 dishes and most of us left feeling hungry. Portions are small and really meant to be shared between 2 - 3 people at most.  The tacos were amazing and had great favor.  If you have a little bit of a sweet tooth the donuts are a must try. I also tried the perogis and samosas, not my favorite flavor profiles but def above average.The atmosphere after you're able to squeeze passed the crowded awkward entrance is gorgeous.  However the chaos on the coat check and general mass of people by the door as well as the door opening into the dining area/ hitting you if you and the door opener are not paying attention was weird.I loved the idea and ambitions of SS but I hoped for a better experience.

Stanton Social was a pleasant dining experience. I went there on a double date during restaurant week to take advantage of their menu. My gf and I arrived early so we headed up to the bar to have a couple drinks while we waited. My gf ordered the Notorious F I G and liked it enough to order a second one when we went down to the restaurant. The lobby is extremely small and was cramping all the people waiting for tables. The awkward doors and hallways there don't make the situation any better. We got seated on the second floor right near the edge so we could look down and see the entire restaurant. Originally, we were planning to do Restaurant Week orders, but changed our minds when most of us said that we were not hungry. One person ordered the poke tacos, the ribs, and the smores cake off the RW menu, but the rest of us ordered a la carte. The tacos were tiny, but delicious (not sure if they are worth the price though). The ribs were a bigger portion than I thought (5 or 6 large pieces) and were cooked perfectly, meat falling right off the bone. The French Onion Soup Dumplings sound and look better than they taste - I meant, they were fine, but I was expecting more.  I ordered the skirt steak which was cooked at a nice medium rare. Again, nothing special here and it felt a tad bit bland. My gf had the scallops and was good, but not memorable. We ended the night with the Birthday Cake Ice Cream shots which, again, theme-of-the-night, were good but not worth the tag. Overall Stanton Social is solid, but not a place that I'm in love with.

If you're looking for a classy night of drinks & tapas, this place should definitely top your list. I came here for a friend's birthday party with a group of about 10. A few people went with the restaurant week prix fixe menu (about $40) and the rest of us shared about 7-8 tapas plates. The restaurant is extremely accommodating to the size of your party and will suggest sizes/portions so that everyone can have a bite of everything. Must-order: French onion soup dumplings & chicken and waffles Complaints: the drinks weren't stellar (I ordered the Strawberry Fields cocktail) and it took quite a while for us to be seated (over 30 mins), even tho we had reservations.

This is a trendy spot. The bar/lounge area on the second floor is cozy and romantic. Everything we ordered was good. My favs were the pastrami quesadillas and French onion soup dumplings.They serve small plates, fun for sharing. I DO think the small plates with small portions are a bit overpriced. We all had a great time though and the staff were all friendly and attentive.
Really good food and great music.. Though I didn't love the service and I decided don't leave tip, a lady approach us and ask us why? I just think it wasn't the right approach...
One of my favorite restaurants in all of Manhattan. Great scene, fun menu, and overall great experience. Definitely highly recommended!

I don't know why I don't frequent this place more often but every time I do come here I'm reminded of how delicious everything is.The restaurant is swanky and perfect for large groups or intimate dinners.  The crowd is a bit younger, but that's ok - the food is worth it.  It's also quite the scene, always bustling at all hours of the night.  The portions are small, and tapa style so make sure you order quite a few things for sharing.  The best part is everything comes out piecemeal and so fast! Our go-to's are the French onion soup dumplings, potato and goat cheese pierogies, and social Mac n cheese.

Been hearing about The Stanton Social for a few years from various friends. I also really like their "sister" restaurant Beauty and Essex. On a weekday evening my friend and I arrived for a early dinner reservation.CONS: Ambience: Understanding that Manhattan real estate is at a premium but they really do squeeze too many patron in one area. We were less than 6 inches away from the other patrons. Between the music & being so close to the other tables, I could barely hear the waitress & had to almost yell to my friend across the table. If you have a party size larger than 2 you might luck out and get a booth. PRO: Service was well paced & professional. My cocktail was yummy & strong. Mixed Bag: Foods was hit or miss: The ribs & chicken (from the chicken-n-waffles) were both dry. Desserts (donuts & tiramisu) were delicious. French onion soup dumplings ARE amazing. Samosas were heavy on the coconut(?) much to sweet not savory enough. Menu is extensive so I may give it another shot but there are definitely better options in Manhattan.

Came here a little while back. This place has definitely worked for its reviews. Very quaint location down in lower east side. It was a cute litte restaurant with very kind servers and a beautiful ambiance. The food was alright. I wasn't too excited about the food. It seemed a little overwhelming. The French Onion Dumplins were kind of disappointing to be perfectly honest. The food was good, but it wasn't amazingly interesting for me. All in all I enjoyed it and it was great, and I would recommend it, but I wouldn't go back.

My mind would have never dreamed up to fill a dumpling with French Onion soup and cover it in a crispy shell of Gruyere, but this is one of many reasons why I crush Chris Santos' cuisine so hard. On a bleak and rainy Wednesday evening I sought comfort from the wind and lack of umbrella etiquette in those very dumplings. Waiting at the bar upstairs, I ordered the Hemingway - a gin based drink that tasted like perfume with a refreshing after glow of grapefruit. I seriously would have made out with strangers just to share the experience with them. The table gods were kind and after a few minutes of sipping upstairs we were led to a booth on the lower level with plenty of space to order to our hearts delight, which we OBVIOUSLY did! Dumplings aside, the mac and cheese with spicy sausage was more comfort in a small tureen, as were the charred octopus salad with bits of feta and the crispy chicken taquitos. Another round of Hemingways and intense "girl talk" led us to order the final comfort food of the evening, the Warm Doughnuts with three kinds of dipping sauces. I was tipsy and dopamined out of my mind when suddenly a birthday cupcake appeared with a single lit candle. Oh, Chris, you shouldn't have!!! Two bites in and I knew this wasn't a Chris Santos creation; however a girl can dream!!!! That's exactly what my ass did all the way back to Brooklyn.

Stanton social has been on my brunch wish list for a very long time. Tried it for brunch with a couple of friends and it didn't disappoint. Unlike a lot of other establishments, they seated me as soon as I checked in even though my party was a few minutes late and they were packed. Props to them for that.Everyone had a lot to drink the other night so coffee was the only drink ordered. We started off having the granola, which was surprisingly really creamy and delicious, it was called berry granola, it had just strawberries but the home made granola more than made up for the lack of berry variety. We had the red snapper tacos, which weren't my favorite honestly. The breakfast bruschetta was probably my favorite dish at brunch, perfectly scrambled with yummy Asiago and the crunch that the toast gives made it fantastic. We also tried the veggie slider and the pizetta, they were both very tasty. 5 dishes for 3 people was more than we could handle. So unfortunately we didn't try desserts.The service was great from start to finish. Without drinks our total I think was about 60$, really reasonable. Loved the ambience as well, and it wasn't too noisy. Can't wait to go back and try more on their menu.

​The Stanton club was amazing!  I called a day before for a reservation on a Saturday night and thought it would be impossible.  The young lady I spoke to was very polite and the process took 2 minutes.  I got a call Saturday morning to confirm and were in there in time for dinner at 6pm.  The place looks spectacular; I love the décor and vibe of the place.  The hostess seated us immediately upon arrival which sometimes doesn't work in trendy restaurants even with a reservation.  We took 2 flights up and sat next to the bar.  We had a young man with dark hair as a waiter but I don't know his name, he was very good! He interacted with us and made personal recommendations, he was a pleasure.  We had the red snapper tacos, empanadas, mac and cheese, perogies, beef and broccoli, French onion balls (those were just ok) and the Steak inside the puff pastry and everything was delish!  I love the concept of the restaurant that everything comes out when ready and the table shares, definitely good for groups.  For dessert we ordered the greek dessert and the donuts w the dipping sauce... though these weren't bad, I wasn't exactly wowed as with the dinner.  I don't eat chocolate otherwise I would've had the Sundae with popcorn which looked great every time it passed by me, which was a lot... it seems to be the popular item.  I would def recommend this restaurant but more for a special occasion or special group night, it's pricy.  It was two of us and the bill was $200+.  But it was definitely worth it.  I think I've been to all the Chopped judges' restaurants and this one is leading the pack! Thumbs up Chris Santos.

Great place for a catch up with friends, but i suggest only go with like 3-4 people because more than 5 you will be cramped up! This place is small plates and we order everything from the RW menu and overall from appetizers to dessert was good. But i wasn't comfy eating in a booth where i am squished among my friends. they make you sit in a small booth with like 6-7 people, with jackets and your purses it was impossible. Honestly this place lost its stars because of the ridic charge fee they have... whyyyyyyyyy i really dont understand why restaurants charge people cutting fees per person when they are bringing in their own cake and still ordering from your damn menu.... whatever fee is fine, $5 per person almost cost just as much as the cake. so yeah just really upset about the fee and the comfort-ness. :X

I wanted pancakes and we walked all the way to get them as our subway route was cancelled.The pancakes were divine!!! We got a few sharing options: banana pancakes, fish tacos, Oreo cookie pancakes, Kobe beef burgers, mac & cheese and boy we were stuffed.Tried the lemonade which was very nice and refreshing with Sunday brunch. The restaurant was very busy, we went upstairs for a drink and the music was cool, bar was busy. I would definitely recommend Sunday brunch @ Stanton Social.

Great place! I'm a big fan of Chris Santos and his other restaurant Beauty & Essex. I was looking for a place in the LES to celebrate the B/F's bday. They were able to accommodate me on short notice. Every time I had to change the party size, Amanda was super sweet and helpful. They were even able to make separate meals for one of my guests who was gluten free. Everything was set up and ready when we got there. We had a cool table right in the middle of the restaurant. My guests all raved about the delicious food! We had a pre-fix, family style menu which included:Potato & Goat Cheese PierogiesHand Pulled Chicken ArepasRed Snapper TacosFennel & Watercress SaladWasabi Pea Crusted SalmonCrispy Brussel SproutsPrime Grilled Hanger SteakHerb Dusted House Cut FritesWarm DoughnutsReverse Chip Cookies. I was adamant about having to leave the restaurant by a certain time so we can move on to a show nearby and the staff was able to make that happen without feeling rushed. Would highly recommend Stanton Social for a party or just for dinner with a date or friends!!

Super accommodating with my support dog and everything I put in my mouth was absolutely delicious. Been wanting to try this place for so long, but after I found out Chris Santos was the owner, I HAD to come. It's kinda expensive because everything is tapas, but it is so worth it. Staff was super friendly also! Def coming back when I'm feeling like treating myself or a special occasion.

Wish i could rate this 10 stats! Great spot with great food and ambiance!  Upstairs lounge and bar area had killer music by DJ Dojah.  It gets crowded so reservations are recommended !  A must place to visit if you're in the Lower Eastside.

You get what you pay for.This is probably one of the swankiest spots on the LES. The servers recommend that each person order 3 tapas each (to share, or not) for a full meal. Each tapa runs around $15. So dinner for 2 would be like $90 without drinks, desserts, etc. It adds up fast! That being said, I had a great time dining there and loved the creative menu! The French Onion Soup Dumplings are very popular and inventive, but I would not say it was the best thing I tried there. The stand outs to me were the potato and goat cheese pierogies, coconut curry samosas, and the pastrami reuben quesadilla.  There are many other things I want to try but simply did not have the stomach capacity to handle :DA lot of the desserts looked really interesting, but I only had room for the birthday cake milkshake shots that have a little bourbon in them. It definitely does NOT have to be your birthday to enjoy those -- they were stronger than I expected!I definitely want to come back some time when I want to impress someone or feel like I'm in the "treat yo'self" mindset. Make your reservation ahead of time on their website to avoid waiting!

This place was recommended to us by friends for our weekend getaway to NYC. It was so insanely loud (which I get is the scene) but the tables were so close together you could barely walk through. We couldn't hear ourselves talk over the larger groups right next to us. Not what we were expecting. Drinks were tasty but the food was just ok. Pretty standard fare but I think we were expecting more well executed flavours. All in all a cool place to grab drinks and a bite but don't expect gourmet goodness.

The food was adorable and absolutely delicious! I can't wait to come back to NY just to return. The French onion dumplings, the red snapper tacos, the sexy burger, the chicken arepas... I couldn't get enough!! The crowd was great & Dj Dojah was amazing!!!

Simply put amazing!!! Every dish we tried was fantastic. We went in a big group and tried everything on the menu and nothing disappointed! The arepas were the best but everything was great. The ambiance and service were on point. Most importantly the dj played great music. Great night out! Must try

Hands down worth every star allowed. Nothing on the menu that we ordered could have been any better. Simply an amazing experience. And to add to the great food, the music was on point along with the service! I will definitely return next time I'm in NYC.

I was finally able to make it here for restaurant week after a long time of waiting for a good excuse to check it out. I was disappointed when I first arrived and they had pushed our reservation back by about a half hour as they were very behind on reservations. They directed us to their upstairs bar which was very crowded and took 20 minutes to get the bartender's attention for a menu. I was debating just leaving but I am so glad I waited!!For the meal, my boyfriend and I were tempted to go with the regular menu but ended up sticking with the restaurant week menu.Appetizers: tuna poke wontons and the barrio chicken taquitos. Both were very good, we ended up liking the tuna better because of the differing textures although both were deliciousEntrees: wasabi pea crusted salmon with soba noodles and the braised ribs. Between these two I would say both were great choices but the ribs won out for me, they were so flavorful and fell right off the bone. Although the salmon was very good too, nice crust and spice from the wasabi.Dessert: smores brownie and warm doughnuts. The warms doughnuts were SO good! Still hot and came with awesome dipping sauces.I am so glad we stayed! It was absolutely worth the wait, will be back again soon!

Came here for my birthday with some friends and we ordered 6 tapas to share. The restaurant looked beautiful inside with the lighting and chandeliers. We started with drinks and and all of them tasted good. I can't remember the names but mine had figs in it and it was a nice balance of alcohol and sweetness. However the food was a bit disappointing. The only standout dishes were the scallop with risotto and steak with fries. But the fries were really salty. We had the beef Wellington but the puff pastry was soggy and it was mixed with a weird flavor that was not appealing. The other dishes were only mediocre. They tasted fine but not memorable or worth mentioning.

This place gets crowded fast so make sure you make a reservation and have the entire party to seat. The lights are dim, the mood is set, the staff are knowledgeable, and the tapas is outstanding.
