From the Wonton Tuna and French Onion Soup Dumplings for appetizers, the Octopus salad, the Mac And Cheese (big enough for more than one person) and to the dessert of Movie theatre Sundae and birthday cake shooters- the place holds the bar to why there's always a wait even on a Thursday. The word to describe the food; delicious!!!

Loved this restaurant ! It is a little over priced and smaller portions but the food is well worth it. Their drinks are the best! My favorite thing on the menu were the scallops and the grilled calamari salad.

We planned on going for the Restaurant Week prix fixe, but wound up ordering off the regular menu. The food is excellent. But as a "small plates" restaurant, the dishes are...well, small. You'll definitely need several, which means the price of the meal creeps up quickly.Our biggest complaint was that the tables are REALLY close together. As in, chairs touching back-to-back, and about 8 inches between tables along the walls. I honestly don't know how the wait staff navigates the dining room. If you go, go in a party of 3. As I looked around, they seated trios in roomy booths on one side of the room. Everyone else was packed in.

We wanted an excuse to try out a swanky LES spot for Restaurant Week, so we chose The Stanton Social. Only thing is, after looking at the rest of the menu, we didn't even end up taking advantage of the price fix special. Not quite enough for 4 stars, though.This is not your typical restaurant, considering the dishes are designed to share and continue to come out throughout your experience here. We skipped out on the $15.00 cocktails and opted to share the following:1. French onion soup dumplings - The'yre known for this, but I honestly thought they would be better. The flavor was really good, but too dry and not really what I expected.2. Tuna Poke Wontons - More like tuna tacos. If you like tuna rolls and wasabi peas, you need to try this dish!3. Chicken and Waffles - Really good mix of flavors, but very small portion for what we thought would be a larger plate. 4. Burger (not the sliders) - Kind of underwhelming. The bun wasn't toasted, and the burger lacked flavor besides the bacon jam spread. For $19.00, you would expect more of a specialty gourmet burger. The fries that came with it, though, were amazing - super crunchy and perfectly seasoned.The chef also offered us a complimentary bite at the beginning of our meal that was delicious - the lentil puree was so, so good.While the portion and quality of certain dishes were less than I expected, the atmosphere of this space is warm, trendy and tasteful. The service was also what you would expect of upscale dining. Be choosy of what you're ordering/how much you're ordering here and you should be good to go (the couple next to us kept raving about the salmon, p.s.!)

Some of the best food I've ever eaten, in a high energy environment. Two of us ordered 4 different small plates, and left unable to finish it all. The flavors were amazing! My faves: French onion soup dumplings and mini lamb gyros. I will definitely go again!

Beautiful environment and delicious food! I absolutely love the shareable style of the restaurant. I would not recommend the chicken waffle. Don't expect the typical southern friend chicken waffle, this was a modern healthy style which dish that just didn't work for me. Other dishes were simply excellent! :) My favorite? Oreo pancakes or huevos rancheros!

Maybe it's because I've become somewhat diet- and budget-conscious lately, paying $35+ for two small tapas that don't exactly fill you up just doesn't sound like a very good deal. It's also difficult to find something exactly healthy on the brunch menu for a vegetarian. The potato and goat cheese pierogies are delicious, but also very heavy. The black truffle creme fraiche was a nice touch, though. Many have also raved about the French onion soup dumplings and they look like they're drenched in cheese. The burgers are mini-sized but command the price of that of a regular one.I haven't tried the sweet options on the menu yet, but they look amazing. I also like the ambiance of the place, including the high ceiling, the cozy booths, and stylish chandeliers. I would be back for drinks or a small bite, but probably not a meal.

I went with my friend about a year ago and never got around to reviewing it. It has a trendy ambiance and friendly service. I love that the menu is eclectic, we had red snapper tacos, korean short rib tacos, salmon with soba noodles, and pierogies (DEF GET THIS). We don't drink alcohol but they were really accommodating with making us awesome mocktails! one star knocked off because it's super pricey for the portion size but it's made up for through quality!

First impressions did not go down too well. We arrived at 11:20AM in the blizzard. When we got to the door a member of staff was closing the shutters. We asked if they were open to which he replied yes at 11:30. On any other day I would t be too bothered but to leave us outside for 10 minutes in the blizzard was shocking and at first left me confused and then very annoyed at what had just happened as we stood at the window looking on at the staff basically just waiting for it to hit 11:30 while we froze outside.My apologies to the host who felt the brunt of my dissatisfaction.Once seated our waitress and food was good. We had the Oreo pancakes, French onion dumpling, Mac and cheese and frites. They suggest 6 dishes for 2 but we struggled with the 4.The pancakes were great, man and cheese not so much. The French onion dumplings was not what I was expecting but the taste was good. Be warned there is no soup per say. The soup is inside the dumplings. In all, would I return? Probably not, the guy who left us waiting outside for the clock to strike 11:30AM really left a sour taste in our mouths.

I'm a huge fan of the small plates, because who doesn't wanna try multiple items on the menu in one sitting?! I had 10 o'clock reservations on a Friday night and our group of 3 had to wait a little bit even though we got there a bit early. We headed upstairs for a drink and slipped into a spot at the bar rather quickly. The atmosphere was upbeat and roaring. I ordered the Sage Advice (gin, mango, sage, lime), which I was a fan of. It was a stiff drink but had the right amount of sweetness. My cousins had the Blood-Orange Jalapeno Marg and Ruby Jack. Both were fans. Once we were seated, our waiter came to introduce himself and since it was our first time, he advised us that typically a group of our size shares about 6 plates. We thought that was a lot so we started out with 4, then ended up ordering 1 more for good measure: French Onion Soup Dumplings, which are a must, Chicken & Waffles, Cast Iron Shrimp, Timmy's Stuffed Bell Peppers + Social Mac and Cheese French Onion Soup Dumplings: I was expecting these to come out soupier, for lack of a better word, and hotter. My cheese pull was all off! You could tell it had been sitting there for a couple minutes before it got to our table. Nonetheless, it was delicious. My taste buds were pretty happy. Chicken N Waffles: Good, but nothing to rave about. When I imagine a dish like this, I see fried chicken and this was grilled so I wasn't enthralled. There was too much similarity in textures. Cast Iron Shrimp: Looking back this was probably my favorite of the night. Jumbo shrimp sitting on a crispy cake of paella. Great flavors here!Timmy's Stuffed Bell Peppers: I don't even remember so that says enough about thatSocial Mac & Cheese: I'm not sure what it is about mac & cheese, but I haven't had one that says "wow, that is amazing" and this one is no different. The addition of sausage and peppers added a good quick but still didn't exactly tickle my fancy. I think the "social" in the name gives clear a indication as to what this place is all about. It's more of a lounge where you can get a couple drinks and share a few plates with a group of friends or even for a date. The music gives a really good vibe (I was loving the 90s throwbacks), and overall I had a great time. Is this a "foodie" spot, I don't think so. I would definitely come back to try a couple other plates but my focus would definitely be to have some drinks and chill.
hung out upstairs recently and was really into the tunes and crowd. so into it in fact that i have yet to leave. i hope they dont start charging me rent!!!

Super cute brunch spot with great concept. All the dishes are in tiny, to-share portions, and we shared 8 dishes between 2 people. The Kobe beef burgers and Oreo pancakes are SO good, though the French onion soup dumplings were a bit of a let down :(

The Stanton Social's vibe is great. They play awesome music (note: it's club level loud). The layout is cozy but comfortable. We ordered the :French onion soup dumplingsRed snapper tacosButternut squash ravioliMini lamb gyros Crispy Brussels sprouts I would probably skip the last two, gyros were ok and Brussel sprouts were over salted. The other three dishes were amazing.Best part about the meal? Dessert. Popcorn ice cream is now my favorite flavor of ice cream. Definitely get the sundae and the smores dessert.
French onion soup dumplings! Satisfyingly rich, sweet, warm, indulgent, cheesy goodness on a toothpick. Need I say more? Snapper tacos were meh. Wouldn't order them again.

Place is trendy and pretty nice as soon as you enter. We were impressed and couldn't wait to be seated. Wait was around 30 minutes for brunch on a Sunday morning- not bad at all. We decided to wait upstairs in the lounge area and were immediately looked after. It was 5 of us there 4 of which ordered bloody Mary's. I was expecting it to he a great cocktail since you know, paid $15 for each drink but it was bland! Nothing special, spicy, tangy like it's supposed to be! Drink was just a mixture of alcohol and tomato juice that.is.it!! Anyways, we head downstairs to be seated in a lounge and ordered 5-6 dishes just to try. We had pancakes that arrived faster than anything else and they were just ok! I'd go as far as saying IHOP carry better ones! Their french onion dumpling soup, seemed to be the most popular dish based on reviews, was the best thing we ordered but it was nothing I'd specifically go there for. The chicken and waffles and the quesadilla were nothing of note as well. Service was good and the place is a chic venue to go out and have a girls night there if you don't care for the food. The prices were way too high. Maybe that's the price you pay for an upscale restaurant in NYC? But I'd like them to deliver the taste as well if I'm paying that much!

We went for brunch. Oreo cookie pancakes, poached eggs with smoked bacon polenta, French toast bread pudding and French onion soup dumplings are delicious!! However, chicken and waffles were very disappointing...dry, grilled and bland chicken over a soggy waffle. At 21 dollars this is extremely over priced! Nice ambiance overall.

Dynamite. They bring you small plates to share and it is well paced. The waitress Laura was awesome and made great suggestions what to order . We had the lamb gyros, french onion soup dumplings, goat cheese pierogis and the Kobe beef slider. The butternut squash ravioli was sweet and served last like a dessert. Will definitely be back

I love this place.  Drinks are totally awesome and inventive.  I always head straight upstairs and sit at the bar to imbibe and eat.  I have to admit I seem to order the same two things because they are so darn good: the pierogies and the onion soup dumplings.  Oh man, both are beyond memorable with the most exquisite combination of tastes.  Love the loungey vibe upstairs too on either side of the bar.  Perfect for a clandestine tryst.

Great French onion soup dumplings, red snapper tacos, Kobe beef sliders, edamame, and tomato pizza!! Was a bit disappointed in the taste of the Mac and cheese. It was spicy.. Since when is mac and cheese made with goat cheese? Other than that the ambiance is great and the service is quick and waiter was very helpful and nice. Do recommend. Great for dates and groups.

If you're a fan of Beauty & Essex, you will probably like The Stanton Social. The menus are similar -- fun, creative small plates in a nice environment. It's not as big or as glitzy as B&E, but great if you want something a little more casual, but still hip and trendy. I think you could come here with small or large groups. The food and drinks were excellent.

Great trendy spot in LES for a night out with friends or for date night. On the weekends they play loud music at night and gets you in the mood for a night out. I've been here a few times now, with friends and with the husband. Every time I've left with the same content feeling.It's a tapas restaurant so everything is meant to be shared so that you can try as many dishes as possible. Some of the must tries are the fish tacos, the sliders, French onion dumplings, and the truffle fries! The sliders are a bit expensive though for what they are. Overall if you come on a weekend you will require a reservation. The staff offers great recommendations and you definitely can't leave without trying the dessert. Try the warm doughnuts and the movie theater sundae. Next time I come here I want to come for their brunch. Have heard great things about that as well.

Love this place! Great food, trendy, fun atmosphere. Definitely coming back! It's very busy on weekends so make a reservation if you plan to go during that time. While you wait, you can hang out at the bar upstairs. Great music & good crowd.

3.5 stars. I love Beauty and Essex (5 stars!) so I was really excited to come here, but was a bit disappointed. We had a reservation but had to wait 30 mins - which we didn't mind too much as it was 9pm on a Saturday and we got a nice drink in the (very crowded) bar upstairs. The cocktails were good and strong as you would expect. The atmosphere was great. But I felt the food let it down a bit... Granted, some things were incredible - the french onion soup dumplings are just as amazing as everyone says they are, so flavourful and tasty. We also loved the chicken arepas and the brussel sprouts side was the best I've ever tasted. However we actually found the meatballs inedible - the cheese tasted really not nice (I hate to say it but my husband and I both independently thought it tasted of vomit). The ribs were fine - not amazing, we didn't finish them. We had the donuts and twinkies for dessert - donuts were good (just plain balls with dipping sauce so hard to go wrong) but the twinkies were just a bit strange and bland. They were meant to be cookie dough but just tasted sugary and creamy. We had a nice enough evening but I would choose Beauty and Essex every time. My husband wants to give it another chance so I'm sure we'll be back at some point but not for a while (and I'll be approaching with caution!)...
great food, average service and a long ass wait to get seated. they took an hour to seat a party of three even though we had a reservation. honestly, ridiculous.

Made a reservation a week in advance for an early time (6:45pm) and was given the worst table in the place. Right next to the door and everyone standing waiting for a table. We asked twice to change tables and we were told it would be another hour wait. The hostess was not at all apologetic.The food is good but the entire experience was ruined by the seating. Didn't even get a feel for the restaurant sitting here.

Came to the Stanton social for my birthday. The bar upstairs is beautiful but the bar tenders are straight up jerks. I thought most bar tenders are supposed to be charming, isn't that how you get tips? Anyways, the drinks were very nice. I had the watermelon strawberry margarita, strong enough to knock your socks off but not too strong to block the flavor of the fruits. The waitress was very patient as we were a big group of people and we were seated right away. If you are worried that you are a big group and you will have to order multiple dishes of each, never fear they are very accommodating. Since we were such a big group we requested their be at least two bites of every tapas for each person. The ambience was romantic yet busy but also perfect for socializing. Its very swanky and it kind of reminds you of a place that the cast of sex & the city would have a couple of drinks chatting away about some escapade they had. Now onto the food! The main event for us had to be between the potato pierogies and the infamous french onion soup dumplings. We basically ordered everything that was on the menu and literally everything they put before us was pure HEAVEN. It was the perfect balance of flavors and all in one perfect bite. I recommend getting the beef wellington as well, take it from someone that is not too keen on the red meats...this was outstanding. There was also a complementary gazpacho which usually I'm not too excited about but it was also very well executed. I plan on coming back despite the price on the bill (YIKES, talk about expensive) but I am not complaining because it was the perfect locale for my birthday.

Ordered the must try French onion soup dumplings - a true surprise in its texture and creativity. The soup is inside the dumpling! I had initially thought the dumplings were soaked in soup. It is definitely delicious for cheese lovers. Not so much if you don't like onions thought. Philly cheesesteak sliders - mini versions of cheesesteak, the sauce was amazing. I would get this again. Goat cheese peroiges - good consistency but too much unions on topChicken quesadillas - chicken was too dryOverall I would give it 4 stars for its beautiful ambience, perfect spot for a first date where you can converse but also be in a crowd. Great for girls night out or brunch! Fun atmosphere and friendly staff. One waiter even taught us how to get the dumpling out of the bowl! Also they gave us a free apple appetizer before our meal even started. I was stuffed by the end! Also - the birthday cake shots are a must try!

More like 2 1/2 stars. The decor is very trendy, the crowd is mixed, even some families with kids here. The service was ok. The food was pretty good, however very pretentiously small portions, which l'm not a fan of especially with prices such as those. The waitress (who was sweet, but we at times had to get her attention) suggested we get at least 5 apps b/c they were very small portions. We ordered 6. My favorite were the "Pulled Chicken Arepas" in fact, l ordered another! The Veggie burger needed salt baaaaadly, of course l was looking around for salt. Anyway at the end of our meal, we ordered cappuccinos & l was looking forward to the "S'mores Molten Cake" since l love s'mores! Well it was a let down, completely dry! I'm a HUGE dessert fan so l was disappointed to end on a "sucky note". With the word "molten" in it, you'd expect something to ooze out of it, NOTHING came out, l think some smoke came out as l cut into it with my fork b/c it was so dry..lol ok not really but it really was so bad l didn't even finish it. Whaaa?! ME not finish dessert?! Yup, unheard of but true. Oh and where was the marshmellow part of that s'mores dessert?? Anyway, the Cappuccino wasn't even great. It tasted burnt. How can you screw that up?? The people right next to our table seemed either know Chris Santos (co-owner & chef) or know of him, from overhearing their convo. They turned to us & asked if we've been to "Beauty & Essex" (another Santos restaurant). We haven't but were thinking of trying it sometime. Anyway they saw me unenthusiastically eating the cake & said "you're not into that dessert are you?" I responded "Sadly, no, it's disappointingly dry & there's nothing great about it" ..then she said "the desserts here are horrible, ya gotta go to 'beauty & essex', they have better desserts". We shall see, l have high standards with desserts especially.So we proceeded to the lounge area. We ordered our drinks, we were meeting a couple more people there. My 2nd drink l took 2 sips; still a full glass. l got up to walk over to greet a friend, had to be less than 5 seconds..sit back down, drink was gone. I asked what happened to my drink the female bartender took it. Why?? I wasn't finished nor was it empty! What's funny is l've read other reviews about drinks being taken away prematurely. What's up with that, Stanton Social??! So l told her l wasn't finished with it, she made another but it was sloppy. That female bartender tonight, sucked, smh.
Darn great vibe in this joint. Laid back lighting and seating with some cool remix music going. Tried a few menu items all of which were good. Great price on clams. Personable server.

I recently visited the Stantion Social with a couple of my friends. A very chic upscale restaurant with a Tapas style menu which is meant to be shared and funky cocktail menu if you want to explore that.We were all vegetarians and we still had a decent list to choose from. Some of our favorites were:- The Mac and cheese without the meat- Coconut curry Samosa- potato and goat cheese periogiosWe also had the Bloody Mary and Ruby Jack cocktails.The place has the ambience of a speakeasy bar and a fabulous place to go with a medium to a large group!

Really great atmosphere, super fun for a small group of friends. Very classy and the food is amazing! We loved everything we ordered, I particularly liked the beef and broccoli tapas. Desserts are fun too.

I went to Stanton social for my birthday with 8 girlfriends of mine this past Saturday and had an amazing time.  The music is so awesome while we were dining, there was a dj who came on at 9pm. Although there was a wedding party on the third level, once they left, one of the workers told us we would be able to go upstairs to the lounge to dance which is awesome!Favorite items were the pirogies, rigatoni, and French onion dumplings. Perfect place to go on a date, girls night or restaurant night. Only for foodies though!Can't wait to go baxk
Good place for a late night dinner, sliders all the way! Drinks are good and the crowd is entertaining.

I'd like to give this place 3 1/2 stars. The place is trendy, loud and dark. We ordered many plates:Poke wontons-- awesome fresh and crispy. More like tacos than wontons. Pirogies---yummy. The sautéed onions and truffle creme fresh were fantastic additions.  French soup dumplings. Blah. Didn't love. I found them to be hard like old bread. Octopus salad--tender but not memorable. Brussels sprouts--good, balsamic reduction a tad bit over cooked. Scallops over risotto  perfectly cooked scallops but gritty!!! the risotto was gummy. Shrimp over paella awful!! The paella was either burned or they used the smoking mechanism and left it in far too long. I felt like I licked a fire log. Molten s'more cake-- there was no molten. It was over cooked. Pumpkin pot de creme-- perfect balance of pumpkin and creme.

The tapas were great and the atmosphere was nice. However, I gave it a four stars because they did not seat us for 30 minutes even though we had a reservation. We almost left - but thankfully they called my name just in time.

Awful, 1 hour wait time despite 2 week early reservation. We were told that others were still finishing dinner and we would have to wait or done elsewhere. Completely unacceptable and disrespectful.But tasty food though....

Top notch service, even for really large groups.  We were a group of 14 women and reserved our table ahead of time in the upstairs lounge area for a friends birthday.  Everything made it an incredible experience, even making the reservation itself. We went back and forth on the number of people at our table and Amanda did a great job managing the changes. Our server was incredibly sweet and timely and was able to handle us ordering more food and drinks throughout the meal. The food and drinks were out of this world (we kept reordering meatballs and sliders, to die for). They kept checking back in to ensure that everything was up to par. Highly suggest this venue for events!

I came here once for brunch and it was really nice. It was calm but there was still music. Food was very good and it was sunny inside thanks to the ceiling windows.I also came on a late Saturday night during SantaCon and it was REALLY good considering the shitshow the neighborhood was outside and at other bars. It was a really chill and trendy crowd the DJ was REALLY good. Played hiphop & all the good new stuff (if you're in to hot97 power105.1 and edm type of person)

Items to try: Chicken Arepas. Really nice smoky flavor. Pierogis - Solid and nice with the caramelized onions. Let downs - French onion soup dumplings. These were odd. Didn't care for the texture or the overall approach on toothpicks. Samosas - these taste like all that is inside is coconut shreds. Not good. Dessert - Pretzel/brownie/popcorn sundae was ok. The donuts were really nice and fun.

Love this place! I had been wanting to try this place for a while and we came here on a Friday night to grab dinner and drinks with some friends. We literally couldn't find the place because its a hole in the wall and therefore we got there a few minutes late so we didn't have a table (even though we had a reservation) so they told us to go upstairs to the bar and grab some drinks, which we did. The drinks were sooo good. Our wait was only about 15 mins and we were then told to come downstairs where we were seated. Luckily I had dressed up extra nice, the place is pretty trendy and everyone is dressed on point. Service was great and we got a bunch of appetizers and drinks. Fav drinks included the swashbuckler and the blood orange jalapeno margarita, they were really great! I loved that there were so many yummy things to share (and great veg options!!) and we got the edamame, curry coconut samosas, potato and goat cheese pierogies, veggie sliders, mac n cheese and a bunch of other things all which I highly recommend. The location is also close to many clubs/bars/lounges if you want to go there afterwards. I highly recommend this place for a date night and its perfect for a girls night out. Do make reservations though as it gets pretty packed.

This place was amazing! At first I wasn't sure what to think about the small plates, but I soon realized that small plates pack big, delicious flavors. The atmosphere is beautiful and very relaxed. The waitstaff is very attentive and friendly and was sure to ask about food allerigies at our table. Overall, I love this restaurant and would love to visit again, especially for the "dessert donuts." I could have licked the plate of dipping sauces!! Definitely one of my favorites in the city!
Extremely good food,  left very full and food drunk.Just make sure not to let you server over sell you, they say 5 or 6 meals for 2 people is ideal but that's insane unless you're a strong man.

I really really like this place. I've never been to a Tapas restaurant and now I realize I love the idea of sharing plates because you get to try a variety of tastes. Atmosphere: Very hip, casual, and classy. You ask how all three... Well, I'm not entirely sure but I'll try to make sense of it. The decor is appealing paired with dim lighting making it intimate and you add the R&B classics you have all three! Drinks: They have a large cocktail menu which is on the pricey side averaging around $15 a cocktail. I got the Jalapeno Margarita which didn't impress me. Going around the table no one was entirely impressed with their drinks. Maybe wine and beer is the move because of the price.Service: Great. Don't need anymore detail than that. Food: OH MY GOD. Mini plates of mouth watering goodness. MWG...I'm going to coin that. Anyways, we probably got 50% of the menu as we were a big group.Highly Recommend - Mac & Cheese - French Onion Soup Dumplings: Melts in your mouth- Cocunut Curry Samosa: Perfect with the dipping sauce - Red Snapper Fish Tacos- Potato Pierogies: I don't remember why I liked these so much but they were great- Oysters: Any because I love oysters - Doughnuts: Can't mess donuts up for dessert Good but not great- Ravioli: It had a very sweet taste to it. Maybe best for the end of the meal. It was good but I was surprised by the sweet taste.- Chicken & Waffles: Chicken isn't friend...enuf said.- Smores Cake - Little too dark chocolately for my liking. I bet most people would like this though. Overall, I think this is perfect for groups or a date. If you like family style sharing this is a must try. The food is amazing and the vibe it gives off is great.

Another favorite restaurant that I have frequent. I love the food and the ambiance in this spot. I have been here for dinner and brunch. Chef, Chris Santos is definitely a foodie since the food is very creative and good!!

So this place is a great find.   It's small, but food is great the cocktails are amazing.  Had the gimlet with spices and it was good but the Strawberry Fields was perfect.  It had a hint of sweet and a perfect blend of alcohol and "Etc".   Salmon Benedict were perfectly fresh and delicious (seasonal). Tacos appetizer was also very authentic and tastes.  Desserts are all delightful

The Stanton Social embodies a risqué environment, which makes it perfect for dates! ;) My first visit was with my girlfriend on a early Friday evening. The tapas were so savory and full of flavor! I made a second visit the following week with my boyfriend on a Saturday evening to show him the goods.On both visits, service was on point and the servers were very attentive and informative. Also, mini complimentary cups of daily soups. 4-6 tapas are recommend for a party of 2. *not including dessert* :PThe tapas all come out together to be shared as family style.  The look of our faces were like kids in a candy store. Very excited to stuff our faces!! We kept our cool though. Food game:~ French onion soup dumplings {2.5/5} - This was the first item our server recommended (during both visits) their most popular well known tapa. Also seems to be a favorite of all the fellow foodies here, however this dish did not really "wow" my gf & I. The dumplings were way too overpowering in flavor and too cheesy for my liking. ~ Coconut curry samosa {4/5} - A very fantastic savory blend of both curry and coconut stuffed in a puffy pastry. The curry was very rich in flavor with hints of lingering coconut, heavenly. Love the yogurt sauce! ~ Red snapper fish tacos {5/5} - I fell in love at this point! Very fresh and delicious, I love the blend of creamy avocados and spicy mango slaw! The red snapper was very well seasoned. All slammed into a mini crispy taco shell. ~ Potato & goat cheese pierogies {3.5} - I liked it, but didn't love it. Fluffy truffle truffle crème fraiche on the side. ~ Mexican street corn ravioli {5/5} - I really loved this dish! This is such an awesome fusion of Mexican street food meets pasta. Excellent pairing. ~ Pastrami Reuben Quesadilla {4/5} - House brined pastrami, rich in flavor. ~ Korean short rib tacos {0/5} - This was a MAJOR disappointment for 3 mini tacos and a very heavy price tag attached. The short ribs were not marinated Korean style at all.. They were SOOOOOO SALTY. My boyfriend and I were not impressed with this dish. PLEASE STAY AWAY. The upstairs seating area seems like a nice lounging area for a midsize dinner party, will be perfect for a birthday dinner.

One of my new favorites. Amazingly unique dishes, designed to be shared tapas-style (e.g., Reuben pastrami quesadillas, French onion soup dumplings, movie theatre Sunday featuring popcorn-flavored ice cream) at shockingly reasonable prices. Incredibly attentive service did not disappoint- after waiting over 30 minutes to be seated after the time of our reservation, we were offered a complimentary starter and a dessert for our patience. My one complaint is the cramped space and the volume in the restaurant, but these are small prices to pay for a trendy LES locale. Will return soon.

This place is great! If you are a (old scho) hip hop fan you could just come for the music!! They gave my boyfriend and I a cozy table that could probably fit 4-5 people but it was great. The dining room is lit sexy and the people who work there are beautifulThe only downfall was waiting for our cocktails. Our food came out before drinks which prohibited us to have a second and third round. I'll be back.
Great food, good ambience, great service. Drinks were good too and relatively easier to reserve on weekends.

What do you think of when you think about the East Village and the Lower East Side? Me, I think about CBGBs and Kim's Video (RIP), and all the crazy times I've had running around Tompkins Square Park. But hey, I'm an old fart. Things have changed. Punk is dead. So are video stores.The East Village is still alive though and has lots of great places to visit. One in particular has been around since 2005, and my girlfriend and our Alphabet City friend had a chance to check it out recently.The Stanton Social is a sexy restaurant and lounge run by one of New York's hottest teams of restaurant creators, Celebrity Chef/Owner Chris Santos (also owner of Beauty & Essex), TAO and LAVO owner Richard Wolf, and Peter Kane of Happy Ending.Chef Santos' trend setting multi-ethnic share plate menu is designed to offer guests a chance to experience multiple dishes and flavors throughout their meal. And that's exactly what we did.We started out however with a few designer cocktails. The Watermelon-Strawberry Margarita was sweet and flavorful and the Social Tea (Ketel One Citroen, Gunpowder green tea, & orange-honey marmalade) was nice as well, but the real winner was the Basil-Lime Gimlet. So good that I had two of them! We followed the drinks by ordering just about everything on the menu. The Nori Spiced Tuna Poke Wonton was exceptional, with cilantro, avocado, and crushed wasabi peas to give it some bite. The Red Snapper Tacos were snappin', with creamy avocado and spicy mango.I also liked the mini Lamb Gyros and Maryland Style Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, but our hands-down favorite were the Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies. Although I ain't Polish, I know my way around a Pierogi, and these were the best damn ones I've ever tasted. Worth the trip downtown just for this alone, we truly enjoyed everything we tried, including the Chicken n'Waffles.More drinks were in order so I tried the Strawberry Fields (Grey Goose Citron, muddled fresh strawberries, lemon syrup, fresh lemon, & a Riesling floater), and my girlfriend took the Blood Orange-Jalapeño Margarita, a Jalapeño-infused Maestro Dobel with blood orange juice, fresh lime and Cointreau. As usual, she picked the winner, as her drink rocked!To finish our feast we ended with some sweets. Their Key Lime 'Twinkie' was interesting and different, but I wasn't a big fan. However, their Movie Theater Sundae was, well, words can't describe it, other than to say yum, Yum, YUM!! It is a brownie, along with peanut butter pretzels, popcorn ice cream, and brown butter caramel. Need I say more?Last but not least we had their signature Warm Doughnuts, which came with three delicious dipping sauces. Better than any Dunkin' D I've ever had.Next time you wanna go out in the East Village you should Definitely check out The Stanton. It's well worth it. Ask for Ashley to be your server, because she's awesome!

Forgot I had been here before until after I had left. Technically most everything here is pricey. But besides the drinks being just good, everything else was great. Sampling all sorts of different plates - each tasting as good as I could hope. Coming back would be nice.The atmosphere of the place is real nice too.

Well done, Chris Santos! I love this place - Santos is truly a master of mini plates and serves up the best bourbon cocktail I've ever had. Yes - and I don't say that lightly. One of the only places where I actually finish my cocktail because it's delicious and its bourbon based. Mmm. My husband and I are both avid fans and this is definitely a 'regular' spot on our list of local reliables.

Everything we ordered was a sucess. The ambiance is nice, trendy and stylish. The cocktails were a bit too strong for my taste but no complaints. It was my first time trying foie gras, and I enjoyed it very much.

From the complementary appetizer to the Movie Tavern Popcorn, loved every bite!  The social atmosphere and then decor just sealed the deal for me. Not sure the rest of my NYC foodie trip will live up to the bar they set. My teens loved every bite of their unconventional meals.

Ordered: Oreo pancakes, Eggs benedict, Potato and goat cheese pierogies, Ricotta fritters, and French onion soup dumplingsPros--The Oreo pancakes were fluffy and its syrup made the pancakes melt in your mouth. It had the perfect amount of sweetness from the Oreo cream and Oreo cookie crumbles. The ricotta fritters were creamy and came with a great raspberry cranberry sauce. These would be the only two items I would reorder.Cons--The pierogies were okay. The goat cheese flavor wasn't apparent which was needed to lighten up and balance the potato. They were also oddly garlicky. The French onion soup dumplings squirted out the soup which wasn't expected or visually appealing. The dumplings' flavors needed to be simpler as well. The flavors were too overpowering and the dish was in need of an ingredient (like sour cream) to lighten it.

This review is for their very bad service! Didn't even get a chance to taste their food because their service was so bad. It was my husband's birthday celebration and we had reserved a table for this occasion. We got delayed and called the restaurant beforehand to inform them that we were running late - could be 15-20 mins late. The person who answered our call said that they wont hold the table for more than 15mins but will seat us when we arrive as soon as possible. A normal person would assume this would be in less than an hour of arrival. However, when we arrived, the hostess told us that they wont seat us until 10:45. Our reservation was for 6.45 and we reached there at 7.05-7.10. Does that remotely make sense? When you have a reservation and call in to inform them of the delay, isn't is good service to hold the table for the party? Even if you don't hold the table, could you not inform of a 3 hour waiting time so that we don't bother coming if we are late? I had already informed the place that we were celebrating a birthday and this kind of service is completely unacceptable because it ruined the celebration. Never coming to this place again.

Cocktails ok, not worth $15 each.Started on a high note with the breakfast bruschetta.  Eggs were perfectly cooked - so fluffy and flavorful with tomato over toast.  French onion soup dumplings - creative twist to one of my favorite soup.  Served on an escargot dish.  Eat it when it's hot.  Very filling.Chicken waffle - wish the waffle was crispy and the chicken needs to be fried.  Caramel banana pancakes - good pancakes but very little banana.
Favorite restaurant! Food is delicious, the vibe is amazing! Love how the menu is constantly changing and upgrading. Bar atmosphere is amazing.

I had a really great time at the Stanton Social. The staff was very friendly and efficient, and the food was very good. It's a great place to come with a group of friends or younger members of your family. Everything I had was delicious and inventive, and there are TONS of vegetarian options.

We had a reservation and came to celebrate a special birthday, which we had noted. Our party of 4 was taken to the top floor where we were squished into a table which would have been more suitable for 2.  The atmosphere and food are very trendy.  The menu has a wide variety of 'small plates' and I'd put the emphasis on SMALL.  The portions are much smaller than most tapas/small plate dishes I've seen.  Most were delicious. The edamame, brussel sprouts, and onion soup dumplings were awesome. The fish tacos were disappointing. Unfortunately our 'dining experience' was brought down by some of the worst service I've ever had. Our waiter could not have been ruder, and the service staff were just as bad. The waiter had a huge attitude, which from the moment we sat down suggested his job was to get us in and out as fast as possible. He was annoyed when we did not want to order all our dishes at once, but first order drinks and appetizers. He never even came back to ask for another round of drinks. The service staff literally reached in front of us and removed our plates and silverware before we were even done. It was my daughter's birthday and they had brought her a  cupcake, and they took it away before she had even tasted it!  We were made to feel very unwelcome.

I've been visiting Stanton Social for a few years now, and it was always pretty good.  It's a trendy place to eat, but after my last experience, I've realized it pales in comparison to what is used to be when they first opened.  I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner and we both left very disappointed with the meal.  I don't think I'll be back - there are definitely better places in the city.

I started to think I may have needed to seek professional help with a possible food addiction after finding myself day dreaming about my next trip to the Stanton Social.  Then I thought about it and realized - Ehhhh NOPE, they just have a great thing going & all restaurants should strive to duplicate their recipe for success! I've been here on 3 separate occasions and each time it has been exceptional! Food: Stanton Social is a tapas bar with a menu that reflects a tour of multiple mouthwatering flavors.  It was a must for me to order new items after my first visit.  Tuna Poke Wantons, Red Snapper Tacos, Chicken Taquitos, Old School Meatballs, Kobe Beef Burger, Mac & Cheese and last but never least, Chicken & Waffles.  These are some items I can hands-down testify to their culinary perfection.  Every dish was beautifully plated and with the taste to match.  I really can say that I thoroughly enjoyed every dish.  Of course everyone has different preferences but for this place if I had to absolutely pick must-haves, they would be: the chicken & waffles (magic without the syrup), the tuna poke wantons & the old school meatballs.Drinks:  The menu has an array of specialty cocktails.  All are mixed with top shelf alcohol and certainly justify the price.  My go-to is the Strawberry Fields.  It has just enough sweetness to mask the alcohol taste and yet strong enough to supply you with a nice buzz.  I've also had the Dead Presidente and the Grapefruit Hemingway; both great.Dessert:  To be honest, I know I've seen a few desserts on the menu but my ONLY interest have been the Warm Doughnuts! They are paired with three dipping sauces, chocolate, a berry & caramel. Total life changer after indulging in their dulcet taste.   A girlfriend of mine and I often reminisce - all that needs to be said is "Dem Doughnuts" they're orgasmic. Service:  Expect to receive nothing less than excellent service! The waiters are very attentive, well dressed and give great recommendations.This place is definitely beyond a 5 star rating & will spoil you with a first class dining experience!

I'm really bummed out about the customer service we received here. Trendy spot, very crowded but attractive, and a rather unfortunate smell, but that seems to be truffle oil or something from one of their popular dishes. There was a second floor which seemed to be a bit more spacious.  We were stuck in city traffic and were 15 minutes late to our reservation but did have one person already there at the restaurant to let the staff know. When the rest of our party entered, we were greeted by the hostess telling us that we had to leave by 9:00. Speaking to the manager didn't help either. We were never told that we could have a cutoff time when making our reservation and that really put us off. It's poor form and poor customer service in any case. Regardless, we got to our table and enjoyed a variety of really delicious small plates. I recommend the pierogies as well as the meatballs with manicotti. Everyone else at my table loved the sliders (I didn't try them). After we finished our food, our server came over TO REMIND US that we had to clear our table by 9:00. That really sucked and took away from our enjoyment. We also couldn't help but notice quite a few empty tables which wasn't helping the case. An expensive evening especially considering they are small plates, so I wouldn't really recommend it for a large party. I would return based on how much I enjoyed the food, but only with a group of 2-3 people total so we could get one of their booths which appear to be at less risk of getting hit by others. ...and I definitely won't be even a minute late if I return.
Overall great experience. Food, atmosphere and concept all well done.  Been here for brunch, dinner, drinks. I enjoyed every visit. Great vibe, cool place.

I'm trying to think of all the things a few friends and I shared our first night in NYC... We tried SO many things!!But THE MOST memorable thing we had there, hands down, were the seared scallops. Oh. My. Scallops. They were cooked PERFECTLY. And the risotto underneath, honestly, man I could order that endlessly!I remember liking the cast iron shrimp.. The crab cakes were of course divine. The short rib tacos were tasty but not memorable. I think what lost that last star might've been for the fact that our waiter said that their French onion soup dumplings were what they were known for, and I was slightly disappointed that they tasted slightly old and not that great??I would definitely go back and try more!

Came in for dinner with a group to celebrate a few birthdays.The space is vey chic and well appointed with seating, lounge areas and bars weaving through three floors. We started in the upstairs lunge facing Stanton Street and enjoyed a cocktail. I had the Ruby Jack which was Jack Daniels, pomegranate juice, lemon simple syrup and peach bitters. The drink was quite good and was served in a coupe glass which gave it a nice touch. We ended up doing all small plates after they sent out a curried chickpea amuse bouche. We opted for the oysters, which were served with a delicious mignonette, French onion soup dumplings (which are the signature dish), dry rubbed ribs, cast iron shrimp, Caesar salad flatbread and the potato-goat cheese pierogies. All the dishes were very good with the dumplings and the pierogies being big hits and which we ended up reordering since we enjoyed them so much.The table ordered several desserts (S'mores, donuts and 'twinkies') but not being much of a dessert person I opted for the birthday shot which was Makers Mark and ice cream.Service was great and since I didn't pay I couldn't tell you if the prices were reasonable but I would certainly return and try more of the menu options base on this experience.

One of my favorite brunch spots in the city! Live music, tapas brunch and great breakfast booze... What more could you want! A great option for large parties because all plates are meant to be shared. A great idea to be able to try all kinds of plates! Highly, highly recommend this spot for brunch and the Oreo pancakes and potato latkes in specific. Won't be disappointed!
If you want a Goose dirty martini that tastes like butter and vanilla extract for your special 28th birthday you should definitely come here to give almost twenty dollars to land o lakes

This place blast their music. You literally have to scream to get a conversation going. I came here for my sisters birthday. We were a party of 7 and had reservation. Once we got to the restaurant we were seated right away (which was a huge plus).  We had this round table right in front of the entrance. The table was extremely small for 7 people. We were pretty much stuffed onto a table. There wasn't much chair room. I had to move my chair about 10 times for people to past by behind me. Onto the food. I wouldn't say it was bad but it wasn't great either. It was not worth the amount of money I paid. Our table ordered French onion dumplings, tuna wanton, quesadilla, Mac and cheese, Caprice pizza, lamb gyro, chicken and waffle. I believe that was it. The french onion dumpling came out extremely cold. Couldnt event take it off the plate because the cheese got all dried up.... The bill came out to 400$. We all left a bit hungry. I wouldn't recommend this for a big group. Maybe a date night with a friend or two. Not worth the hype.
We had a few dishes, personally I think their cheese steak is out of this world, the Mac n cheese is perfect. If you are thinking of desserts, you have to try the Movie Theater Sundae, it's crazy.

Came here for my birthday with seven people. The seating area was super tight.  Restaurant music was super loud.  We ordered the the french onion dumplings, tuna wanton, quesadilla, Mac and cheese, Caprece pizza, lamb gyro, chicken and waffle. The french onion dumpling were cold.  It was so difficult to separate the cheese apart.  It didn't taste as good as I thought it would be.  The lamb gyro had this funky tasty.  And the mac and cheese tasted like any typical Mac and cheese.  Nothing special.  The chicken was dry and the waffle wasnt even that great.

Brunch here is basically eating a bunch of ok appetizers for meal prices. I must say their oreo pancakes were delicious, and service was quick, but if you are hungry and have a healthy appetite like my boyfriend, this is not the place to go. I wouldn't come back.

The Stanton Social for brunch is *much* different from Stanton Social in the dinner or late evenings.  Whereas, dinner/late evenings is more of a deafening "scene", the brunch is just your average and surprisingly quiet brunch.  This is not a party brunch with girls in dresses and leering guys hitting this place up before they go out, but just locals catching up for brunch.  Like you could take your parents here for brunch.  That otherwise rowdy second floor is empty on the weekends.  That said, the dinner is better than the brunch.  The ambience, food and crowd is just much better in the evenings.I still regret not having gotten the oreo pancakes.  I had the chance and I missed it even if I only was going to take one damn bite, I still should have ordered it.  Instead, true to my boring brunch tastes, I had the Eggs Benedict and the Latka pancakes with sour cream.  My friend ordered the breakfast burritos.  Now given what we had ordered, I thought they would be entrees.  But like dinner, even these usually entree-like brunch entrees came tapas style (like on long horizontal plates and several in mini-style).  Everything was good, but uneventful.  I think I ate almost everything myself as my friend does not eat much when we go out I noticed.  Service was a bit rushed and I couldn't understand why.  The "are you finished with that?"  "Here is your check."  "Can I take this check now?"  "Is there anything else you ladies need?"  It hadn't even been crowded when we left.  They were polite, just it seemed trained to get people out asap.  They managed to get us out after 1.5 hours.  I should have endlessly ordered cups of tea and coffee after the meal just to drive them insane.  Don't rush me at brunch.

Fabulous! French onion dumplings are the most delicious things you will put in your mouth! The Mac and cheese was just okay, chicken and waffles were the bomb.com, fun samplers for everyone to try!  Great for a date or groups.

Been here 3 times now, and the food has not disappointed me once. The best thing to me on the menu are the kobe beef sliders! Yes, they are the most juiciest and tastiest I've ever had! The drinks are amazing! The other must-haves are the coconut curry samosas and potato and goat cheese pierogies. I had to try their chicken and waffles, and it was melt in your mouth good. Of course, to wash them all down, my friends and I ordered the Basil-lime gimlet, made to perfection. The only thing that was kind of disappointing was the fact that after a certain time, you and your friends are yelling at each other, because the overhead music starts to get louder and louder. So, its a good thing we're full and happy with our drinks at that point, that it was time for us to save our larynx, pay the bill and go somewhere else for a good cup of coffee, dessert and actual conversation. So, if you don't mind the clubby music at around 10pm and making faces at your friends saying "what??", then stay. But definitely come for the food and the drinks!
Amazing atmosphere. Packed on a Tuesday night. Perfect for datenightFrench onion soup dumplings are a must. Make a reservation if you'd like to be seated quickly!

FBdfdsDJHBsdfdgHSBGHSFSBFhbdhfbdshfbdsfvghfhsbfsv!!! OMG IT'S THAT GOOD.I remember coming to Stanton Social when I was literally 17 years old. I know I don't look 100 years old, but I'm a lot older than 17. This place is like an ancient gold-mine for Manhattan standards. I have some really fond memories here as this place was such a huge "scene" to go to over the years. I've been here for literally any type of event that you could think of.Ambiance: Trendy. Great music (all were Kygo remixes). I like to go to these trendy type places a few times in a short span of time as I know how these type of restaurants can be hit or miss sometimes. I went to Stanton Social as I was getting my hair done near the restaurant and it popped up on Yelp as being close by. We opted for the tasting menu which they offer on some days (can't remember which days but I assume weekdays?)Tasting menu:+++ Crispy Barrio-Style Chicken Taquitos with roasted guajillo sauce, avocado, creme - I was confused by the description as to exactly what this dish is but it's basically these balls filled with chicken, sauce that's a bit spicy, and avocado (drizzled with some creme). These are gherbfhjsbfbfhjbhbsdd good! So so so so so tasty. One of the best things on the menu, for sure.+++ Chicken and waffles - I don't think I've ever had grilled chicken with waffles. I've only had the fried stuff which makes me feel like I'm going to have a heart attack shortly after. I believe that Stanton Social used to offer this dish fried but times are changing my friends! They offer chicken and waffles with brick GRILLED chicken. They don't overdo it on the sauce (maple syrup with a hint of balsamic) and this dish is absolute perfection. If you plan on having this dish,BEPREPARED.You will literally come back two more times within the same week to eat this heavenly dish again (true story, happened to me). I literally ate at Stanton Social three times in one week because I was so obsessed with this dish (and I'm going there this week again). I just can't get enough of it!!!! Someone please help me! Is there a chicken and waffles Stanton Social rehab?+++ Warm donuts with various dipping sauces - Self explanatory. If you need me to explain how good this dish is, please stop reading Yelp reviews.+++ Lobster roll - Amazing. Usually lobster rolls are drenched with tartar sauce and/or mayo. Yuck. Who wants anything drenched in sauce? Not me. This is a perfect blend of lobster and sauce. It's seriously delish! + Red snapper tacos - I've tried these before and thought they were meh. I've had some pretty awesome tacos in the same style before and I just didn't feel like this was a really strong dish on the menu. It's not that these aren't good, it's just that they aren't the best thing on the menu.Service:Hit or miss. I came here the first two times and the service was great. On the third time it was absolutely terrible. My only suggestion would be for them to just get their service together a bit more.All & all, a solid place. Definitely also a place that I would recommend to people visiting from out of town. While it's not specifically a tourist infested place, it's a great place for locals as well as tourists to go.

I love the ambience of this place! I went here for my birthday and we made reservations but we were late. We were still seated very fast.  It's like the reservations weren't needed. I ordered the French Onion Soup Dumplings, They were good but I was disappointed that they didn't have any meat. Still pretty good though. I also ordered the Beef Wellington. AMAZING! Best Beef Wellington I've ever had and the complementary gazpacho was great. The waitress even gave me a free cupcake for my birthday!

The food is fantastic - without a doubt!  The gluten-free menu is equally as delicious with a wide variety of choices.  The ambiance is terrific  if you are looking for a fun, upscale chic NY restaurant.  The only caveat is that you must, must be there on time in order to keep your reservation.  If you have a large party, every member of the party must be there or they will not seat you.  This can be a challenge on a Saturday night. I was visiting from the West  coast for a special celebration that could have gone awry, but the manager, Luis, worked magic to ultimately get us seated, provide us with complimentary appetizers as we waited and then checked in with me throughout the evening to make sure the dinner was fabulous.  And, it was!  Thank you so very much.

Went here last year on a surprise birthday dinner party organized by my then girlfriend (now wife) . Amazing food and ambience! Perfect for larger groups and special occasions. Food was delicious overall, especially the French Onion Soup dumplings and the mini lamb gyros. The waitress was very helpful in suggesting what to order and was attentive and friendly throughout dinner. Prices are a bit on the higher side but you definitely get what you pay for.

Came here on a sunday with a reservation.  It was probably not needed.  They have an upstairs which is lounge seating and a downstairs which was a little more formal seating.  We ordered many dishes since it was tapas style.  The most memorable were the social mac and cheese, stanton social beef wellington, wasabi pea crusted salmon, and potato and goat cheese pierogies.  The mac and cheese was tasty and flavorful.  Not too overly cheesy.  The beef wellington was great.  The pastry that it is wrapped in went incredible well with the steak inside and just melts in your mouth.  The salmon dish was kind of a surprise.  I expected it to tasty fishy and a little weird with the wasabi but it turned out pretty good.  Didn't really have a strong taste of wasabi and the soba noodle were good.  The pierogies were pretty good and placed on a unique looking dish.  Overall this is a nice tapas restaurant.  The quality of food id good and service was great.  Just a little pricey and maybe a little over hyped.

Jonathan and Patrick are the best. I proposed to my girlfriend last Friday. I planned with them beforehand. They were very discreet. Everything went smoothly.  The food and service is over the top.   Thank you guys!!!!!!
Food was just ok. had orea pancake, the french onion soup dumplings, and the veggie slider. too expensive. only thing i would go back for is the french onion soup dumplings.

This place very stick for reservation. Please make sure everyone there on time. One of my group of eight could not make it on time. We have to wait until that person come even though I told them to order for the other person. This place really different to other restaurant in the area. Good place to hang out and experience variety of small plates. I tried 80% of the menus. Love everything. Cocktail here is very good too. Will be back for more cocktail and the less of menus.

Came with a friend from out of town, and my 9 year old granddaughter.  Service was terrific; food was so-so.  Everything except the hamachi tartare was way too salty!  And I'm a person who loves salt.  Granddaughter ordered Kobe slider and ribs.  Ribs were too dry and salty for her to eat -- so got second slider. All in all, a very good time -- but take the salt away from that man

Went here recently for a bachelorette party.  We were upstairs in the lounge and the atmosphere was great.  It was pricey, but the cost included drinks and food for 3 hours. All of the food they brought us was it of this world-my favorite were the Kobe beef sliders and the tuna wontons.  Drinks included signature cocktails.  Highly recommend for a bachelorette party or fancy night out.

I am NOT a big fan of much of anything in NYC, but Stanton Social is one of the delightful exceptions to that which I must point out.  Our group of 5 ordered 10 plates, and in the interest of brevity without sacrificing accuracy, they were 10-for-10.  Not ONE plate was a disappointment, all were delicious, and presented one, two,or three at a time in a very nice progression.  I don't remember all, but I'll name what I can: pierogi, cobb salad bites, red snapper tacos, kobe beef sliders, wasabi poke tuna, beef wellington, french onion soup dumplings, some kind of ravioli.  (OK, got 8, not bad.)  Great atmosphere, friendly attentive service, delicious imaginative food.  They are so good that I absolutely cannot fault them for how expensive their prices are (they are pretty pricey, at least by my middle-class NJ guy standards).  You really do get what you pay for here, so expensive is not bad when it's a good value.  I will be back.

The French onion dumplings. I can't put into words the party in your mouth. Oh and the tacos and the meat balls. Everything here is worth trying. I can't wait to have an excuse to go back to NYC and eat the entire menu all over again. And did I mention the Mac and cheese?!?!

The bad--- Made a 9:30pm reservation for a special event. We were greeted by a rude waitress that told us that it will be a "little while" until our table was ready. She did not offer an apology and seemed annoyed when we asked about how long it would be. The restaurant was super crowded and super noisy, so we decided to wait outside until our table was ready. Fast forward ONE long hour...we were seated at 10:30 even though we made a reservation!! That's not a restaurant that values our business and is totally unacceptable. I would've rather they told us that they couldn't seat us at 9:30. We expressed our dissatisfaction to the hostess who got the manager. The manager offered a quick apology and two complimentary dishes. I appreciated the gesture HOWEVER it took at least another 10 minutes for them to bring out the plates and utensils to eat what he had brought out AFTER we had to mention it. The attention to the customer was just not there.The good--- some of the dishes are truly delicious- Perogis, snapper tacos, Mac and cheese.The bottom line is I would probably not come back unless I wanted to wait a few hours for pretty good but not amazing food.
Great $5 happy hour wine special.  We had french onion, doughnuts, and kobe sliders. The food was amazing and service was excellent by the bar.

Arrived with a group slightly late for our rez and they seated us quickly anyway, so we were off to a good start. With a group of 4, we decided to each pick 2 things to share. Make sure that you ask about getting the right amount of pieces for the whole group to try. There are certain plates that are served with only 3 or 2, but your server can request more servings from the kitchen. Since it was a birthday celebration, one of our group let the server know and voila! We were given cupcakes with candles. It went well with the round of birthday shots we ordered. So delicious you barely knew there was alcohol. Speaking of, the drinks were amazing! I favored the Hemingway, but my friends tried just about everything so we got to taste test the menu. If you're the kind of person that thinks everything sounds amazing, this is your place. Come with a group and you can practically try everything! DO NOT MISS THE FRENCH ONION SOUP DUMPLINGS
Best tapas ever! Brunch is the way to go... Amazing cocktails.Theyre chocolate chip pancakes were awesome.A bit pricey, but what do u expect for a NYC brunch? :)

IM REALLY UPSET!!!!! I drove an hour and a half for their chicken and waffles, only to hear they changed them! And they weren't good at all. Why fix something that's not broken?!?! The old chicken and waffles should were by far the best dish I have ever tasted. EVER. They were fried (as chicken and waffles should be) and just so scrumptious. Now they're grilled or baked. Grilled chicken and waffles. Is this real life? Am I living in the twilight zone? Please, for the sake of humanity , bring back the old chicken and waffles. But I had to give them 5 stars because everything else was delish and service was great. We had goat cheese pierogies, onion soup dumplings, Mac and cheese & sliders. Please go the food is great, just don't order the chicken and waffles because you it will ruin the rest of your night.
Nice place with good music. Loved the seafood platter and the French onions dumplings. The cheesecake pops are delicious !!
I came here back in 2012 for the first time and have been here a couple of times since. I revisited again recently and it doesn't seem to be as good as before. Not sure why.

Went here for my birthday and had an amazing time. The ambiance is awesome and the crowd is great! My girlfriends and I had a blast! They have a great wine selection. The food was soooo good, everything was so delicious! You definitely have to try the onion soup dumplings. They also had birthday cake shots which were yummy! Thank you for making my birthday awesome!
Food was amazing! The philly steak and cheese and Ruben quesadilla were phenomenal. I would highly recommend this place for brunch.

Popular lower east side spot, have gone off and on for years. Food is clever but unpretentious update on American comfort foods. The French onion soup dumplings were a revelation when I first had them, still always order them when I'm here. The chicken and waffles, cut into smaller sections, also really good.good for dates and apparently girls night out - always a table of young women celebrating something. Place can get really loud (the celebrating young women contributing to this!) and sometimes the staff seems to think it is still the trendy new place everyone is talking about. Overall service is good, but weird waits even when you have a reservation can happen. I don't think this is rudeness, but crushes of people coming at once and overwhelming the staff. I prefer the vibe downstairs to upstairs.

Trying all the hits (red snapper taco, kobe slider, dumplings), I wasn't as impressed with everyone else. For my taste, the dumplings were not that flavorful.  The standout for my brunch was the breakfast bruschetta.Also note, drinks for brunch are on the pricey end - $15.

Great food! Good for more than 2 ppl since everything is small plates, its great to order a lot of items from the menu to share. We came for brunch on sunday, they weren't that busy but our service wasn't great. They charge $9 for strawberry lemonade.. No refills. I'm still questioning that, but whatever. The food makes up for it. I wod definitely come back. The oreo pancakes changed my life :) definitely a must order! The meatballs were still red in the middle.. I didn't eat any but ppl in our group did and they are alive still lol. The meatballs came with 2, small meatballs. Philly cheese steaks were good but the truffle was a little too much. Lobster rolls were tiny and just okay. Probably 4 inches worth.

Don't be surprised if despite having booked a table weeks in advance, your party's wait time is 40minutes plus. And if you think the hostess will care, or even attempt to apologize for this, think again. That would be way too much to ask in terms of customer service from this fine establishment... If you don't mind that kind of an introduction to your night, the food is great.

Went there for brunch with a big group. The place is really pretty and sophisticated but Our table was pretty small for 9 people. The service was not that great, not very attentive. The food is meant to be tapas style, the serving size is really small the prices are about $10-15 per dish. Since we had a big group I tried a lot of dishes: fritters, Oreo pancakes, bacon, French onion dumpling, meatballs, pierogis, lobster roll. Don't even order the lobster roll, it's literally two bites and it wasn't that great. The best dish was the meatballs. It was done perfectly. All the other food were ok. Brunch cocktails were $15 and I had the pomegranate Bellini which was good. Overall not impressed .

this place really is very very good. the restaurant is really nice and trendy inside with low lighting and cool decor. the food is excellent. primarily everything is tapas style so you order a bunch of small plates (they recommend two per person) and then everything is shared. i highly recommend the goat cheese perogies, chicken and waffles, and the corn raviolis. everything here that i've tried is very good. the drinks are also tasty and inventive but they will set you back $15 bucks for their signature cocktails.  all in all a wonderful place but you will pay a good amount as the small plates range from $10-$20 each
Good food and drinks. But kept our group of 7 waiting 30 minutes past our reservation time, without an apology. A drink for the bachelorette would have gone far.

Bday dinner 2015...  Never been here but everybody and their momma have told me this place is off the chain...  Great service, cool atmosphere, delicious food.  Now I get what all the hype is about.  Stanton Social just entered my top 10 for NYC dining.It's a tapas style restaurant.  Multiple small plates of food just keep coming and coming.  Fish tacos, empanadas, potato pierogis, Mac and cheese, ribs, chicken and waffles, etc, etc...  The combination of all that might sound a little overboard but its not.  Remember, small plates.  All very delicioso.  To finish the meal off, we had the warm donut holes, comes with 3 different dipping sauces (chocolate, caramel and strawberry jam).  So good...  Uuggghh...  Great BDay Dinner.

went for Saturday brunch. Unfortunately, they don't have a brunch drink special and the Bloody Mary left little to be desired. The food, however, was absolutely delicious. The decor is beautiful and it's got a nice vibe to it.

Vibe reminded me of a dinner at Tao in Vegas. Danceable music in the background, dimly lit & great service! Food was delicious! Even better was it was a short walk from the Ludlow Hotel I was staying at.

omg, went for dinner and drinks on a saturday night and the food/drinks were ridiculously good- service was also very good, given how busy and packed it was.  even got our table at the reservation time (which honestly doesn't always happen w/ pretty popular places)... just leaving out 1 star because it's almost too popular-- there is no way you could have a normal conversation.  it is so loud you are shouting/screaming the entire time, and even then couldn't hear 50% of the conversation haha... i would not go back at busier times (guessing weekend nights) because of this, but definitely would go back maybe after work on a weeknight or for brunch.

Cute, cute place and idea for Brunch! I went here last weekend and I was pleasantly surprised by the tapas style for breakfast items. My favorite was the chocolate chip pancakes. They were soooo good. And the perfect size and amount of pancakes too. The fritters with raspberry sauce was tasty too.I have no complaints at all for this place. The waiter was a cutie and he was very pleasant. I learned that they have Restaurant Week all the time. 3 courses for $38. I will definitely be back to try more items on their menu.

My husband, brother and I went there for dinner last Friday.  We were sat right away in this beautifully decorated restaurant. We ordered 9 small plates and each were as delicious as the next, great find!

I seriously cannot wait to come back here again! I went with a group of friends, and our party was easily accommodated. Our wait was a little long considering we had a reservation, but the rest of the service was prompt. The restaurant itself is nice and spacious, though very loud. Our group had a tough time hearing each other (we were at a round booth).We ordered a bunch of plates to share, as is the style at places like this. Every single thing I ate here was absolutely delicious! I was particularly fond of the Philly cheesesteak slider (the goat cheese and beef are magnificent, truly), the potato/goat cheese pierogies, the french onion soup dumplings (be careful, extremely hot!), and the taquitos. However, you can't go wrong ordering anything on their menu... seriously, everything was delicious! The ingredients were fresh and perfectly cooked. It's the first time I've been to a restaurant and liked everything I've tried. The cocktails weren't too bad either, though not my preference. The only thing I regret was not saving enough room for dessert!

The French Onion Soup Dumplings were amazing! The chicken and waffle was also fantastic-chicken and waffles tend to be a bit bland but this was full of flavor and came with a spicy butter which went very well with the dish. The Oreo pancakes sounded and looked delicious, but were so sweet they just tasted like pure powdered sugar. It reminded me of an extremely sweet doughnut rather than pancakes. I know these are supposed to be sweet but this was so overwhelming you could barely taste the Oreos. Good idea, but not good.Great service. Only other complaint would be that it was so cramped it was difficult to get around. There were just way too many chairs everywhere.The portions are supposed to be smaller for sharing. My sister and I shared 2 dishes and were full. I imagine someone with a larger appetite may want to order more. The suggestion was 4-6 dishes for 2 people. I can't imagine trying to tackle 4.

Came here for a birthday dinner with 6 people - perfect experience, got exactly what we were hoping for - We had reservations - we were seated right away on time- Restaurant is huge and beautiful. Great place to bring people to looking for classy but fun/nightime vibe. - Really really good vegetarian options - we loved everything we tried - the pierogies, spinach samosas, veggie burger sliders, mac & cheese, and pizetta. The pierogies were our favorite.- Amazing cocktails - strong and well made - Had a bar upstairs if you wanted to hang around- Will be back to try their brunch

We came here to have a wonderful brunch, everything is designed to be shared. The chilaquiles are to die for! Try the sweet'n'sour mimosa! Music is just at the exact volume level, and ambiance is just perfect!

I brought my friend here for his birthday and he loved it. The food was delicious. On Mondays it's fun to go for a drink upstairs...although I witnessed a fight once which seemed uncharacteristic of the restaurant.

Made reservations here on a Saturday night for 9:45pm. They sat us right away in a cute little circular booth on the first floor. The ambience was great and trendy. Loved the decor, music, and atmosphere in general. As for the food, it was nothing special. Ordered the infamous french onion soup dumplings. It seemed to be a ball of grilled onions topped with melted cheese. However by the time I ate them at the table the cheese had hardened and was no longer the melty goodness I suspect it should have been. Also ordered the korean short rib tacos (3 to an order) and they were just so-so. Lastly tried the scallops on a bed of risotto which was good but not great. The drink I ordered was mango puree with gin. It was pretty strong which was good but the mango was so thick I could barely drink it. Overall the small plates are okay. I would return for the atmosphere and just get a different drink.

I went with a friend of mine, he said it's pretty trendy. To his word it was trendy but was absolutely too loud. Food was ok. Cocktails were hopeless .It's a cool place to go for a drink or go to just socialize . I wouldn't go there to eat .

Came here last night for my birthday dinner with my fiancé. We hit up the happy hour upstairs first (until 8) before we went downstairs to sit. It's half off wines and they're 14$ each so it's totally worth it to go up and get a drink before dinner. Dinner was ammmmazzzzingggg! I'm still thinking about how delicious everything was. We had Korean tacos, the Pizzette with mozzarella and arugula, the big sexy burger, and rigatoni bolognese with ricotta and mint. Our server suggested getting 5-6 items but with these four we were so full we didn't have any room for dessert (although it looked delicious!) The ambiance is very dim and chic. Totally great for a date night or any celebratory dinner!I would absolutely come back here!

Delicious place for small plates and specialty mixed cocktails. It is a very lively spot to go with friends or with a date and it also has a very intimate vibe. They play a good mix of music and there are two floors to this place. Reservations must be made bc it's in the village and is always busy.

Great ambiance and interior decorThe food was OK. To be honest I thought the portions were extremely small for the prices being charged. Ordered the short rib tacos that were not great at all. The french onion dumplings weren't anything special and the scallops was ehhhh. Another overpriced joint in NYC.

After hearing such great things about this place aka seeing numerous Instagrams of the french onion soup dumpings on my feed, I decided to make reservations for 2 on a Thursday night. As expected for NYC Restaurant Week, it was packed and we were asked to "hang out for a little bit by the bar until our table was ready". Well that hour long "hang out" turned out to be very hangry groups of people around us comparing reservation times. I don't think it was the wait that people minded or at least I can speak for myself. It's the fact that two very persistent girls next to us got seated before the couple that had been waiting for over an hour. I just felt like our reservation was pointless since the hostess was doing her own thing. It seems to be a common occurrence according to nymag.com. I was happy to be seated on the third level since it's less crowded up there. At this point we were so hungry we ordered a bunch of plates to share but the hand pulled chicken arepas (a little spicy) and the warm donuts with the 3 dipping sauces (the caramel one was my fav) were the only ones worth raving about. I mean the vibe is great so I would recommend checking it out with a friend or two one of these days but no rush...literally.

Great restaurant! Small plates and tapas..Service was excellent and their burger was out of this world(we took the waiter's word for it)! Our waiter was awesome! We also went with Mac and Cheese and pierogies! Yummy!! I cannot forget to mention we had the popcorn caramel brownie sundae and it was divine!! (All my fav things in one Sundae!) Along with two birthday shots since it was my bday. They also brought out a cupcake with a candle for me!  I love when they do that! (I did mention it was my bday in the comments on my opentable reservation) check my blog out at: craftytaramarie.wordpres…craftytaramarie.wordpres…

The vibe is great, and the staff were very helpful. We began with the amazing cocktails, I recommend the notorious f.i.g and the blood orange spicy margarita. Then our server told us to get five plates and while that doesn't sound like a lot trust me it absolutely is holy cow I'm writing this review the morning after and I am still stuffffffed. We started with the lamb gyros which were excellent, they have an awesome beet-feta purée that now j wish every kebab place had. The periogies with goat cheese and crime fraiche were also fantastic and I noticed had the largest portion.
