Well the French onion soup dumplings was a large portion too, and delicious, and super hot so be careful. For dessert we got the birthday cake shots, birthday cake batter with makers mark, um BOMB. Wow so amazing. And they aren't shy about alcohol either. It's very reminiscent of the shots you get at beauty and essex. Then we got the movie theater sundae. Oh. My. God. It was fantastic! It would be my favorite Sunday of all time if they lost the brownie. Or at least had made a better batch, because ours was so terribly dry and we were content with the caramel sauce, the amazingly delicate and delicious popcorn flavored ice cream, and the chocolate covered pretzels. Chocolate covered pretzels have a way of getting soggy in ice cream but there's were still very crunchy! I highly recommend this place, just be prepared to eat!!

This restaurant is great, what I don't recommend is the chicken waffles, cuz it just tastes fucking weird. But you should get any burger, and the onion soup thingys and the pasta bolognese is nice.But all in all, great atmosphere, and Good food.

Came here on a Monday evening for a date night with the boyfriend because we saw it was listed for NYC Restaurant week and because for years I've wanted to visit this place. Once we got to Stanton Social we opted out of Restaurant Week and chose to eat from the regular menu because in the end you weren't saving much (Which is what Restaurant Week is supposed to be for, upscale restaurants that regular Joe's/Jane's can't afford).   Anyways, Stanton Social is an upscale restaurant where Chef/Part-Owner Chris Santos created tapas style diverse unique small plates, case in point one, one of the appetizers we got was the French Onion Soup Dumplings and O-M-G it was AMAZING. I'm already obsessed with French Onion soup and having the taste of a soup in a dumpling it just took it to whole new level. Another favorite of mine was the Mexican Street Corn Ravioli, tasted just like the Mexican corn and I wanted more. So sad that for three pieces of raviolis it cost $18. We both got the Strawberry Fields, tasted same as the ones I made when I bartended at the bars of JetBlue at JFK Airport. Overall I loved this place, the food was amazing but it's best to just come for a big occasion not just a regular night.

If you want a fancy high end vibrant new york scene doesnt get much better than Stanton Social.  Its been easily one of the best resturants in the city and til today my favorite. Dont kid yourself it is pricey for a regular joe but for a anniversary or big celebration very good option.  My favorite drink is their Strawberry Fields.  One of their signature dishes is the French Onion Soup, i was a little disapointed with their lobster roll this time around i think they replaced sum lobster with pickles which i wasnt a fan of but still very good.  They always tweek their menu so you can have something new everytime, this time i had the Ravioli which was amazing.  I tried going for resturant week deal but it really isnt worth it for what your gonna pay they just force things on menu you may not have so keep that in mind

I worked with the Stanton Social for two big group dinners this year, and both of them went swimmingly. They sent over a limited menu for me to choose four courses, but the options were all great and included some of their popular items such as French onion soup dumplings and their delicious sliders. The staff for the most part was very easy to get a hold of and responsive. And I like that they're able to add fun touches, like a personalized menu printed to welcome your group. These little things really make these kinds of dinners feel special. Once there, the service was hit or miss. The first time, we were seated in the mezzanine and seated right away. The service was spectacular. The second time, as with the first, they said they couldn't guarantee our group the mezzanine but that they'd try their best. We didn't get that preferred area this time, and we were told to wait upstairs in their weirdly bright bar upstairs (at least it was at about 7pm). Food, always a hit. It's a bunch of really fun, creative dishes that get people excited. Honestly there really wasn't a miss in either of the meals. Favorites included the aforementioned dumplings and kobe beef sliders, and people loved the warm doughnuts and inside out chocolate chip cookies for dessert. What really really impressed me was that they created unique options both times for the vegans in our group. Not many places will do that, but they were happy to accommodate. The cocktails are also really fun, though pretty pricey. As for the ambiance, there's a reason why this has been a NYC go-to for so many years. It's a fun, energetic scene and though it's lively it's still possible to hear each other in conversation. The decor is dark and sexy, but the servers are still chipper and unpretentious. It's not an easy feat to make a large group dinner go smoothly not once but twice, so for that bravo!

My second time there, this time with my dear friend Nykeisha. We both had the same thing from the restaurant week special: tuna tartare and then ribs. We shared the donuts and cheesecake pops for dessert. We needed to add the fries to our order, there should have been a carb or veggie already included with the ribs. Food was great, meat slid right off ribs and mixed well with cole slaw but service was not great. Kind of pretentious. I knew they wanted the table but they asked us three times if our check was ready and the waiter grabbed my last two fries without asking if I was done. #wewerehungry

Some of the food options were good. The waitress was really nice but overall this place is not for me . The food portions was way too small. Left there feeling hungry . Didn't care for the Mac & cheese and the movie sundae . The ravioli was good as well as the philly slider although small . Good date spot if your looking to mostly talk and enjoy the scenery of the restaurant because it is designed beautifully.

This place is really cool-- dined here on a Thursday--minus the nearly hour wait with an reso...thankfully the bartenders make some mean ass drinks:)!!The French onion dumplings are TO DIE FOR...(I'm still tasting it-- wishing my date ordered 2-lol)Ordered from the NYC restaurant week menu -- Tuna taco(I think) was yummy Main dish --the salmon something was FLAT-barely touched itThe dessert Popsicle was super cool a pleasant surprise!!I must say I was a bit envious of my date's order,That Mac n Cheese would have made you slap ur "southern mama" it's so darn good ( he didn't finish it, so I  took that home) Was very full for a tapas place A Must return place (but arrive early to check in early for a long worthwhile wait)

I came to New York with my son and the Stanton social was highly recommended. When I arrived I was blown away by the incredible lively vibe and beautiful restaurant. We had drinks upstairs the bar which was bustling with people and the drinks were amazing. Every dish we ordered was incredible a little small but incredible especially the Korean pork barbecue tacos and arguably the best fish I've ever eaten the French onion dumplings. I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a exciting atmosphere great drinks and beautiful people

Our anniversary dinner was Monday 8/3 & we had a gilt city voucher to use so my husband made reservations & mentioned that I am gluten allergic. The hostess added a note to chef so he's prepared. Also we arrived my husband notified the server LJ. She's fantastic & provided us with the best service & beyond our expectations. The chef was very accommodating to my gluten allergy & changed the gilt city menu so I had more food options. The food was amazing & we loved everything. The artichoke appetizer, tuna tartar, chicken store tacos. Then we had pizzetta, gazpacho soup, edamame. Then for dinner we had ribs, salmon, chicken with waffles for my husband, & roasted Brussel sprouts with kale. Dessert my husband had beignets with dipping sauces & I had the arnolder Palmer sorbet & apple sorbet.

The waiter gave us a complimentary gazpacho soup but took it away before my dinner mate even had his first taste :/. It's tapas style here, so waitress recommended 5-6 dishes to share between 2 people and seemed disappointed/annoyed when we only ordered 3 savory dishes plus dessert to share and I was stuffed (and even took some home)! Sounds like a ploy to make you spend $$$.  Anyway, Mac and Cheese was really good as were the red snapper tacos. Chicken of the chicken and waffles dish was meh...chicken needed more crunch, waffles were just right.

OMG, Amazing (the food part)! Came here for my bday dinner, I've never been here but based on friends' recommendations and yelp reviews - I made the right decision! Due to the size of our party, we had to pick from their pre-fixe menu, which had most of their signature dishes and generous portions - $64 per person and we were completely stuffed!!!The Kobe Beef sliders, Lamb Gyros, Chicken and Waffles, Fried Dough, Potato and Goat Cheese stuffed Pierogies, and Reverse Chip Cookies were absolutely divine! BTW, I even took the left over reverse chip cookies home - I could eat them ALL DAY :) The French Onion soup dumplings were good, but maybe my expectations were set too high from reading the reviews or the fact that I am just not a big fan of French Onion Soup or maybe both, it was just OK to me. Though, I loved the cheese crust and pretty much ate all the leftover cheese! The scallops were my least favorite, in fact, most of us did NOT like them at all! I'm not a picky eater by any means, but they were SO FISHY - yuck! Aside from that, all the other dishes were awesome (even the fries and kale chip - YUM!).The staff was nice, but I did feel like we were treated a bit like a production line (could be because we're a large group and they already know our orders). it was just collect empty plates, gather the leftovers onto one plate to make room, and bring the next round of food. I don't think anyone came around to ask how our food was, if we needed anything (besides drinks), or our experience... Would given them 5 stars if they did. I would still come back, so it's still a happy story after all :)

We opted to skip the Restaurant Week tasting menu and instead got a bunch of plates recommended by the waitress:* Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies* French Onion Soup Dumplings* Hand Pulled Chicken Arepas* Kobe Beef Burger Slider* Grilled Cheddar & Jalapeño Bacon SliderThe food was very rich and heavy. Cheese, cream, bacon, etc. The only dish that wasn't overly heavy was the arepas. Maybe since we weren't drinking we didn't love the heaviness of the food. It was good but really the flavors were nothing new or particularly interesting to me. My favorite dish was the arepas and then probably the pierogies but neither blew my socks off. The soup dumplings, which were topped with a lot of melted cheese just didn't do it for me. It tasted exactly like french onion soup... inside a dumpling.No problem getting a reservation for two at 6:15pm on a Monday.

I was looking forward to this place looks great.Reservations were made for 10 pm Sat eve ,arrived not ready handed beeper you can go upstairs to the bar which we didn't really want but ok .Hour later shabby service too packed too noisy .

Will have to come back to try the food.Came here because piano's was too crowded. The DJ and the drinks are great. DJ really knows how to set the mood with good music, bringing it back to the 90s and mixing it up with some stuff that is out there.Strawberry fields cocktail was sweet and tart.

The food was really good. The portions are small so you may need to order a few items. The scenery at the restaurant  was nice. The staff and host was very friendly. Drinks and signature cocktails were really good and interesting  fun flavors and ingredients.

My boyfriend and I had a great experience eating here. All of our food was excellent and the service was great. We unfortunately had a hair in our food, but the kitchen took back the food immediately, the manger came over and apologize, they removed it from our bill and they brought out complementary dessert - GREAT service! I would recommend coming here.
The red snapper tacos were some of the best goddamn tacos I've ever had. However, the rest of the food was mediocre at best. French onion soup dumplings were pretty disappointing.

Ive been to this restaurant numerous times for brunch and dinner.  Food is awesome, ambience and decor is awesome.  Extremely trendy.  Definitely order the french onion dumplings.  They come out hot, so be careful.  They serve them for every meal, so make sure not to miss out. And if going for dinner, make sure to dress up.  It is definitely one of "those places."  It's so fun for a date night, or just a girls dinner.  DJ will start playing at around 10/11pm, so you can definitely make it a night.

Great place. Yesterday was my second time dining here and the experience once again did not disappoint. The ambiance in this restaurant is superb, very lounge like environment with the excitement of the lower east  side packed into two floors. For our meal my friend and I ordered the Mini Lamb Gyros, Mac n Cheese, Pastrami Quesadilla and of course the French onion dumplings. If you are looking for a great atmosphere with superb food, look no more you have found it. The only reason why I gave this review 4 stars instead of 5 was due to our waitress who kept trying to give us the boot after we finished our dessert. Besides that I would definitely come back.

The bloom is off the rose. Have been a long time promoter of Stanton Social but it is no loner GREAT. Peter & Chris, I suggest that you get back in the kitchen. Timing of food was way off. Soup dumplings were served in round 3 of it 4 rounds and were not "hot and gooey".....cold and yucky!

I had been here three years ago for the soup dumplings. I like the vibe here with the live dj and the location, but the prices are outrageous to get food that is essentially "party poppers". I think the dumplings get way too much hype, the tacos were too small. Pros: good service, good mac n cheese, good cobb salad bites, but its just too expensive for what they are offering

The food was amazing, but the service was awful. I have been here before and loved the experience. But this Friday I showed up to celebrate my sisters birthday (she was visiting from out of town) and the service was awful. We had Raylene as our server and it was impossible to get any attention. We waited for a solid 20 mins for her to return the bottle we bought for the table. On top of that, the waitresses were extremely rude and unprofessional. Don't think I will be bringing out of towners to visit here again.

One word that describes this place is unfriendly. Came here with a wedding party and asked to be seated in the mezzanine. As a note, reservations were done ahead of time and the party size was given. Fast forward to being seated. We are against the wine cramped. In order for a person to move we would have to separate tables and make it uncomfortable. We asked the manger as we sat down to see if we can take the 8 top table next to us in order to free up more room. Plausible in my mind but not in his. He then proceeded to explain to me that he could not based on the layout. Don't believe this excuse. I get he wants to maximize his table space but he wants to do it at the cost of sacrificing a diners comfort. Writing this while sitting down and the 8 top table next to us has only 2 people sitting down on it. First time being here and last time as well. Will never recommend to friends.

The food here is spectacular, just wish I was not sent to the bar area upstairs to wait for the rest of my party to arrive or they would get 5 stars for food and service. It is inconvenient to wait upstairs, if you need to look out for your guest, like what if they walk in, don't see you, then decide to leave? Ok so the red snapper tacos, chicken arepas, and the goat/potato pierogies were soooooo......gooooood......I almost melted from the delight, not to mention the perfectly crafted amuse bouche of tomato gazpacho! Then came the Cesar salad pizzette was so yummy, then the mac n' cheese, ribs, and chicken and waffles, hmm...hmm...greaaattt...! To finish we had the donuts (so hot and fluffy) with 3 dipping sauces, everything was just too tasty, I felt like I never wanted to leave, you must get the Gilt city voucher, totally worth it and my strawberry fields cocktail with fresh strawberries was the icing on the cake!
To die for, be sure to order goat cheese pierogies and spicy edamame. Cool hip atmosphere for drinks and apps.

This place is SO over rated, over priced, food was mediocre, not worth it at all. Will never go back. I'm disappointed  that I even listened to the hype and decided to go. So many other better restaurants in the city.

Food is decent...brunch is prob the best meal here but the hostesses need a SERIOUS attitude adjustment. They're wanna bes who would probably be happier if perhaps they actually ate some food once in a while. Have a few drinks before you get here bc anyone sober will be seriously pissed off at the attitude the hostesses seem to dole out even when the place is not very busy.

Great food, but be ready for an incredibly rude door hostess.  Our reservation was for 10pm, but we weren't seated until 10:45pm, even though there were a number of tables open.  I understand restaurants make most of their money on alcohol from the bar, but after one drink we were ready to eat, and didn't appreciate the hostess forcing us into another drink and lying to us about the table availability.  All in all, the Stanton needs a more professional door person.

Came here on Saturday as a group of 4 with a reservation. We were seated right away in a nice circular booth on the first floor. The place is decorated very modern supper club, and has a cool vibe inside. Our server was friendly and gave us some great suggestions for dishes. He suggested 8-10 small plates would be enough to feed our group (most plates come with 3-4 pieces). We ordered two of his suggestions: French Onion Dumplings and Potato and Goat Cheese Perogies. As well as:Littlenecks on the half shellRed snapper tacosCast iron shrimpCrab cakesHamachi tartareGrilled Caprese pizzaMini lamb gyrosI personally don't eat meat, just seafood, so some items I didn't try, however, everything I did eat was delicious. My personal favorite were the snapper tacos, and my fiancé's vote goes to the pierogies. The only dish I wasn't crazy about was the pizza. Not bad, just wouldn't order it again with all of these other amazing dishes on the menu. We all left full and happy and with a fistful of Stanton Social matches that are up for grabs on the way out. Not a bad night. I highly recommend this place for groups (leave the picky eaters at home), but I think it'd be a great place to come just as a duo with a hefty appetite.
user_loc: Marina del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

text: I loved this place, so let me explain the loss of one star- the dining hall was full, so we were seated upstairs where a full menu was available.  The lights were really too dim to properly enjoy the beautiful food we were served.  Also, several of the things we ordered were too heavily dressed, or really too small for the price.  That said, we thuroughly enjoyed our meal.  Here's how it went down:The Swashbuckler- quite pleasing, the honey-lavender syrup a great add.Cranberry Flower- very good, a little disappointed not to have actual pieces of cranberry from the compote in the drink.Fried baby artichokes-  the "olive dip" on top was wayy to heavily applied.  After the first little aritchoke was consumed, we learned to wipe off the excess dip and it was great.Hamachi Tartare- great, just great.  Every bit was gone by the time the waitress brought our next dish.Hand-pulled Chicken Aerpas- this was good, but again they added a sauce that was just too heavy for the tapas-style dish.Lobster Roll- the lobster and bread were great, but yet again, the mayo was too much.Kobe Beef Sliders- fantastic.  A great end to the meal, it included two very small sliders, but with such a decadently showcases piece of beef, it was enough.

This place was hip and really crowded, luckily, we had reservations. Unfortunately, I didn't really enjoy the time or food here. I felt the food was way too expensive (same goes with the drinks) and the quality didn't quite warrant the price tag.It better be a special event if you're coming here for some rather pricey dining.

Sometimes it is hard to differentiate between four or five stars for a restaurant. But the Stanton Social was a hard five stars. The food was beautifully crafted making each bite heavenly! We went there for a friends  birthday and it was amazing and delightful. They say you should choose around seven dishes because there small but we had 8!  We ordered the quesadillas, arepas, onion soup dumplings, ravioli, Bolognese, red snapper tacos, chicken and waffles, (potatoes things i don't remember). To give you a run down of what to get, get the onion soup dumplings, the potato and goat cheese dish we had And the chicken and waffles are an absolute must!!! They were so good there was a battle at the table. The red snapper tacos were cute yet tasted a little too fishy for our taste buds. The quesadillas, arepas and Bolognese were great as well. In terms of service I couldn't have asked for anything better. Serving five girls can be difficult especially when it's my group of friends. They were always checking in on us and because it was my friends birthday thy gave us on the house birthday shots that consisted of whisky and cream. It tasted like heaven in my mouth. We didn't even taste the whisky and thought we were drinking a milkshake. All in all this place is a must and half!!!! Whether it's friends, family, distant cousins, take them here and enjoy the trendy, hip vibe with great food. We even went here on a Monday and it was still busy!
Based on brunch.Order the oreo pancakes!- very good! Lobster Benedict was ok.

Come here for a double date night this past week, after visiting with family over a year ago. It was as good as I remembered, and I died when I saw a vodka gimlet on the drink menu. We had a blast and ordered a variety of food - the pierogies & french onion dumplings are definitely THE BEST.

Definitely not a place that will fill you up if you are super hungry! I found out it was a tapas style place after we all (8 people) recieved our invididual orders and realized how tiny and unfilling the food was! But the atmosphere was amazing and I will be going back for their late night dance parties.

We ordered about 5 dishes of which about 2 were anything to rave about. The pierogi and samosas were the best dishes. The stuffed bell pepper lacked flavor.  The service was very good and our waitress attentive.The donut desserts were apparently very popular but the taste didn't match the hype. All in all, average food.

The food was absolutely outstanding. My girlfriend and I ordered the perogies, mac and cheese, French onion soup dumplings, a mini lobster roll, and an assortment of cocktails. Each dish well deserved five stars, most notably the French onion soup dumplings! The wait staff was very attentive and knowledgeable, deserving of five stars as well. The only negative remark I have is that we were sitting very close to the two couples on either side of us, almost as if we were all at the same table. This didn't bother us and in fact it was interesting for us to observe other couples. This restaurant is a must try, date spot or small party. Atmosphere, food, staff, and drinks are all superb.

How can you think about food when all you want to do is dance the minute you walk in the door? The food is phenomenal!!! They started us off with complimentary shots of Gazpacho which was delicious. We had the Brocolli Beef (our favorite), French Onion Dumplings, chicken & waffles, lobster roll and the Philly cheesesteak. The Blood orange margarita was also great. The music, Hip Hop, was loud and a good variety. I danced in my seat at dinner then went upstairs to the lounge to continue the dancing and drinking. Very fun place!!

Simply amazing. From the minute we sat down the service was excellent and more important the food was so unique and different. We were four people and ordered 6 dishes. The must try are for sure the French onion soup dumpling ( I am still dreaming about it) and the potato and goat cheese pierogies!we also ordered the poke wonton, delicious and chicken taquitos! It was plenty of food for the four of us and we enjoyed every bite! The vibe of the place is great for a night out and the food is delicious.
it was fun.it was delicious.it was expensive.it wasnt filling.it didnt matter.
The French Onion Soup Dumplings are unique and are the best item on the menu (one of my favorite appetizers ever). It's a pretty trendy restaurant, and the wine was good.
We ate, and ate, and ate until we couldn't eat anymore. Service was great;  drinks were on point. The only downside was the crowd. I highly recommend making reservations.

I had the great pleasure of dining at this establishment, and I must admit,  I thought I was still going to be hungry, But no I wasn't The food was delicious every bite was flavorful and delicious. The preparation and presentation were on point and the staff were exceptional. The staff was quick and very attentive even as they were so busy. I really enjoyed my dining experience there. The short rib tacos and the French onion dumpling was amazing  try em, you'll be glad u did.
Came here for Tapas brunch with a group of friends. Lots of interesting and fun dishes! Everything we ordered was delicious.

Extremely overrated. When they say small plates they mean small. We ordered a fair amount of items and still left hungry. And the items we ordered were sub par. And there was a lag between dishes so we sat there for a while inbetween food items. I just didnt like the experience

It's not the best meal I've ever had, but the place was hopping, the service was excellent and the food was solid. There's def a cool, trendy vibe here and it feels like you're eating in a club, a fancy one though, not that teen club from '99-ish (lol). I would tell you how good the food was, but by seeing what we ordered below, you can tell it was good. With such decadent and rich items, it HAS to be good..French Onion Soup Dumplings, Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies (caramelized onions, truffle creme fraiche), 'Philly Cheesesteak' sliders (truffle & goat cheese fondue), Fried 'Chicken n' Waffles' (maple cheddar waffle, Louisiana hot sauce butter), Korean Short Rib Tacos (kimchi, gochujang aioli), House Brined 'Pastrami Reuben'Quesadilla (swiss cheese, sauerkraut, mustard aioli).... See what I mean? Deadly. Full Disclosure: The dessert (Warm Doughnuts with caramel, chocolate & berry dipping sauces) was good enough to earn me the nickname Dumpster Drew, bc I ate everyones leftovers. True story. Overall, I might bot spend every meal here, but when dining with a group, it's a fantastic option, provided you're in the mood to get heavy with the eats. Enjoy!

Very cute concept sharing 6 or more apps.. My boyfriend and i really enjoyed it here! Food is good i wish i loved their famous french onion soup dumplings more but they were ok... Otherwise its a cute place with very tasty food!

I came here with friends for a friends birthday and was certainly not disappointed.  The goat cheese and potato pierogies were absolutely delicious!  We ordered the french onion dumplings which is what they were known for; they were good too but they should consider promoting the pierogies more.  We also got the caprese pizza, edamame, mac & cheese and chicken and waffles- I enjoyed it all.  The restaurant also has a very chill, LES ambiance.  Good music, dim lights and a cool bar area upstairs- definitely going to eat up there next time. Drinks were good too and so was the service!

My husband and I went here for one last date night before my daughter is born later this week and we become parents to two small children with no life hah! Stanton Social is a truly awesome place- great atmosphere - trendy and really yummy food. Yes it's expensive but I would think most people know that going in- it's just one of those places. It's all tapas / share plates style. For two people you need at least 4-5 things and would still have room for dessert. We got fried artichokes, red snapper tacos and meatballs with ricotta all of which were superb - absolutely delicious. We got a little pushed into ordering the French onion soup dumplings - even though I stated I didn't really like French onion soup- but the server kind of wouldn't let it go so we ordered them. No surprise if you don't love French onion soup these won't be your favorite. We finished with skirt steak and chimichuri which was very good but not as amazing as the first three dishes. I have to say the French fries were weird. May sound strange to complain about French fries but they just were not good. They tasted almost like yuca or some other vegetable and were cooked to a weird gummy consistency. That was really the only thing that wasn't delicious. For dessert we finished with lime sorbet- so yummy and tart and donuts. An almost perfect meal- with 2 glasses of wine and a mock tail it ran us 150. I would definitely return again but for the prices would have to be an occasion of some kind or for a customer/work entertainment.

Was here for a family style birthday dinner. Great ambiance, excellent food. Second floor has a very crowded bar. Recommend french onion dumpling soup, lobster tacos and red snapper tacos, mac and cheese, and chicken taquitos.

My friends and I came here to eat. We were very disappointed for many reasons. One was the size of the appetizers. For the price of 3 tuna tacos we could have gone to Taco Bell and fed an entire city block and our selves. Second the atmosphere does not match the food at all. It appears to be a Asian restaurant that serves American bar food.Service was good but not good enough to overcome the small portions and low quality food.

One of my favorite tapas-styled restaurant in the lower east side. The place is trendy with a nightclub kind of atmosphere (especially after 7pm). There are two levels to the restaurant. Downstairs feels more like a traditional dining room, whereas the second level features a dining area with a bar. They offer an expansive and eclectic tapas menu, accompanied by a nice cocktail list. Try the gruyere-topped French onion soup dumplings, kobe-beef sliders, goat cheese pierogies, kobe-philly, ribs, and chicken & waffles. Don't forget to save room for the s'mores creme brûlée!!

Very quiet for a mid week dinner and would absolutely recommend the soup dumplings and pierogies. We also had the snapper tacos (okay but teeny tiny) and the corn ravioli which was just okay.  Be prepared to be on top of your neighbor!!
Love the french onion dumplings, potato and goat cheese peirogi, crabcake corn dogs, and I hate myself for this because I can't remember the desserts I had but I do know that they were AMAZING lol

Hello French onion dumplings!  I am not even a huge fan of french onion soup, but these were amazing.  Came here for dinner with a few of my girlfriends and shared about 10 small plates.  We were impressed by almost all of them and left satisfied  Although the service was good, our waitress could have been a little bit friendlier, but no biggie.  Definitely recommend,

Amazing and unique handcrafted cocktails, perfected and creative small plates. Of course, one of our favorites were the French onion soup dumplings per all of the recommendations that we got from friends to try them. The desserts were awesome, I love how the chef experiments!  We had an amazing time here during our "Girls take NYC" weekend trip and I can't wait to go back!

The place is cool for a first date or similar and the music is cool, however, if you like really good food, this isn't the place. It's a trap with music and cool people but not of food. The food was average and lower.
My #1 most favorite place to eat in the city. Have been here around 6-7 times and it's always incredible.

Went here with a group of coworkers last night for the first time and I am very impressed. The server was very friendly and atmosphere was very upscale. Great drinks-Try the strawberry fields on the drink specials menu. Pirogis are to die for, impeccable. Also got free samples of gazpacho soup which was very creamy and seasoned nice. Server made sure to ask if we have any dietary restrictions right off the bat (I'm vegetarian so this was a plus for me). Lots of vegetarian items, including crispy fries and veggie burger sliders made with avocado. Food is served in very small portions, designed so as more keeps being brought out throughout the meal. Three of my friends got the chicken and waffles (good portion size-took leftovers home). They also brought out  complimentary potato ravioli drizzled with caramelized onion and creamy dip. Desserts are EXQUISITE. We had a sundae with caramel and popcorn, doughnuts with three dipping sauces (caramel, chocolate, dark chocolate), and these key lime pie filled Twinkies. We also were lucky enough to get a kitchen tour-the entire team works so hard cohesively.This restaurant is owned by Chef Chris Santos from Food Network's "Chopped," and let me tell you it lives up to its hype. The prices are high, but the food is to die for.

"You gotta go upstairs and check it out, and let me know what you think" That's the running instructions a friend of mine was giving her guests for her birthday party. So you climb the wooden steps and Wow! Somebody went through a lot of trouble to create swank in the middle of a street that is so not swank. Well, not yet anyway. But you know where the LES is heading now that the Village has moved to Brooklyn. I kid. Yeah, the downstairs is nice as well. But you feel like you're in Midtown upstairs here without that Midtown mania. And odd thought. It was a bright afternoon, so I'm standing there as two women become three, so I'm invisible. And I'm appreciating the lighting. Above the skylight someone placed a bunch of reeds in a way that makes you look up and think of a field. It's that kind of detail that is in the decor and cuisine.The food is just awesome. Just "awesome". Yeah we had the dumplings covered in cheese. I had the octopus appetizer, delicious. As well as the little lamb gyro. The other five orders looked amazing as well, but I unfortunately didn't bring my appetite. I'll know better next time. Lots of "Yums" and "Try theses" around the table. You know a place is fantastic when the conversation is magnificent. It's like awesome food heightens the Gathering. Cheers to your next coming together.

Definitely one of my new spots in New York. Small plates, all done with style!Came here with a party of about 8 for brunch, which made things slightly complicated in terms of ordering. They recommend about 1-2 plates per person at the table, and so we ended up ordering a good number of dishes with the concern that we may not have enough food or may have too much food. However, the waitresses were all very helpful in recommending the best food options for our table.What's awesome is that I got to try so many of the dishes here because of the small plates dining style.-Goat Cheese Pierogies: My favorite of the brunch. So creamy and indulgent with the stuffed cheese, and the dough tasted fresh.-Vegetarian Sliders: I always hate that I never get to have sliders usually (I don't eat beef) so when I saw this on the menu I was beyond excited. It lived up to the hype! Avocado, veggies...-Granola: Tasty, but nothing to rave about. A good healthy option to add into the mix.-Oreo Cookie Pancakes: a MUST order. Deliciously fluffy. -French Onion Soup Dumplings: looked AMAZING when it came to our table, and I dove right in. Taste did not meet expectations, but was still tasty nonetheless!I came to celebrate my birthday with my sister, and at the end of the meal they brought out two mini cupcakes with candles for us to celebrate with. Cute gesture!The place is trendy, and the small plates style ends up creating a slightly more expensive brunch experience that I think you would have anticipated. However, the food quality is very very good and the ambiance helps create a memorable time at the table. Highly recommend.

I've lived in the city for more than 3 years now and this is absolutely my favorite restaurant in NYC! I've been here many times and every time is just as good as the last. I have been here on random nights during the week and also on the weekends. On the weekends its much more energetic and lively. I think we came for like a 10 o'clock dinner reservation, which is not late by NYC standards.The food is EXCELLENT. By far, my new favorite dish on the menu is the chicken and waffles!!! YUM YUM YUM! Throughout my trips here, the dishes I have tried are: Wok Charred Edamame, French Onion Soup Dumplings, Red Snapper Tacos, Cheesesteak Sliders, Beef Sliders, Old School Meatballs, and a few others.*Chix & Waffles, Wok Charred Edamame, and French onion soup dumplings are a MUST!! And as for desserts.... Warm Doughnuts & Movie Theater Sundae are my two go-to desserts there. They are both phenomenal!!!!
Been here twice and its always on point! the chicken and waffles were dankk and their red snapper tacos are to die for. A fun casual place to get great food.

The food was good but I do think it's overhyped. Because it is tapas after all, the portions are very small but is quite delicious. I highly recommend the red snapper tacos and the French onion soup dumplings(unless you don't like salty foods). My favorite part of my experience here was drinking the strawberry fields cocktail (YOU MUST TRY!!) and their old fashioned donuts were to DIE for. I personally think it is very overpriced for the portion/ food quality although the atmospheres pretty classy and easy going. 4 stars for the drinks, dessert, service and atmosphere (not for the food). *** ALSO, that Asian server by the lounge upstairs is absolutely rude. My bf and I came upstairs to sit by the bar (without reservation) and she was NOT willing to help us. Stood around for a while waiting to get seated or some kind of help even after having eye contact with the lounge server. She wasn't doing much and still chose to ignore us. I asked her if there were any seats for us and she answered back by cutting me short in a bitchy manner. Being a waitress myself, I was super turned off and annoyed that we left. There are nicer ways to go about "sorry there are no available seats by the bar". Clearly, she shouldn't be dealing with any sort of customer service. Not going to take off a star because the waitress who served us was very attentive and friendly on our 2nd time coming back (with reservation). Either way, it's unfortunate for such a nice NYC restaurant to have a bitchy lounge server.

Typical fatty-food. The thing that sets this place apart is the fact that Chris Santos is behind it and the food is a step above what you'd prepare for your friends (and a bit smaller portioned too). It's not unreasonably expensive and I'd seriously recommend the pizza, as it actually came out on a large dish and could satiate everyone at the table. Skip the fish tacos, the shell is very, very heavy and greasy. The Social Tea is an incredible cocktail, and for fifteen dollars you won't find a much larger drink in the city. This place has it going on in terms of music and ambiance too, and the waiter was sweet.

I love The Stanton Social!  I was actually on the fence about trying this place during my visit to NYC, but I'm really happy I did.  I decided to make reservations the morning of the day I decided to go and I was able to make a reservation for 2 at 6:30 pm on a Saturday night.  I was running late so I called them to let them know, and they were very accommodating.  Once I arrived, we were seated right away and the service was excellent throughout the entire meal.Food:Hand Pulled Chicken Arepas - This is pulled chicken and jalapeno on top of flatbread.  These are served bite-sized and packed with flavor.  These were great.French Onion Soup Dumplings - This is the house specialty; melted cheese over a french onion dumpling, each topped off with a single crouton.  2 thumbs up.Fried Chicken and Waffles - This is your typical chicken and waffles, served with a chipotle butter on the side.  Each waffle is lightly drizzled with the perfect amount of syrup to not be overpowering.  Nicely done.Pan Seared Scallops - served over Acorn Squash Risotto.  Scallops were perfectly cooked.  Another very good dish!Sliders - We ordered one Kobe Beef slider, and one Philly Cheesesteak slider; both had great flavor.Donuts with Dipping Sauce - House made sugar donuts served with various dippy sauces (Chocolate, Caramel, Berry). Donuts were light and fluffy and the sauces were great.  I particularly liked the Caramel one.  Great way to end the meal.I would definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner and I will be back!

I'm not gonna lie - I was starstruck at The Stanton Social. It's only the second restaurant EVER that I've visited IN MY LIFE that is owned by a Food Network celebrity chef (I went to the awesome Jose Garces restaurant Garces Trading Company a few times).  Unfortunately, Chris Santos was not the chef of the night when the ladies and I ate dinner there, but that didn't deter me from totally loving the experience and food!!! It was nice enough that our server went to the kitchen to ask where Chris Santos was! But anyway, I don't know why I don't remember all of the tapas dishes we had (there were at least 5 dinner plates!), but I do remember the most delicious ones - French onion soup dumplings, fried 'chicken n'waffles', and Social Mac&Cheese. The ladies will agree that these three dishes were so enjoyable to eat, without a doubt! However, it was the DESSERT plates that transported me to paradise. We all shared the warm doughnuts and the movie theatre sundaes. Ahhhh, where have these doughnuts been all my life?!?! And the movie theater sundae was scrumptious and dangerous! If anything, go for dessert at The Stanton Social. The atmosphere is lively, and the staircase with bottles and bottles of wine on the shelves is the perfect backdrop to your next photo (just be mindful of the traffic, at least on a Saturday night!). Thank you, Stanton Social!

The food was fantastic.  We made reservations a full month ahead since we are big fans of Chris Santos on Chopped.  Unfortunately that garnered us a table upstairs by the bar.  It was incredibly loud.  The music was loud, the atmosphere was loud.  The food was great.  It's small plates and they encouraged us to order six items for our table of three.  That worked out about right.  The scallops were our favorite.  The beef and broccoli was our least fav, but still good.  We watched one of the hostesses text and Facebook the whole time we were there.  Lame while all the other staff worked very hard.
Ok--It's official--Chris Santos is a mysogynist--watch Chopped--look at this bast*(&^ revel in giving women poor reviews.

food is always tasty and creative.  3.5 stars considering the 'tude, service and prices.  rounding up because I like it better than beauty and essex and i'm about to round down on that review ;)  and because im a sucker for tapas.  the french onion soup dumplings are the truth. chicky n waffles too.

The Basil Lime Gimlet is my very favorite cocktail!  We have never had a disappointing dish at the Stanton Social - just thinking about the French Onion Soup Dumplings makes my mouth water.  Service top notch.

My Family went here for our Daughter's Birthday. The place was packed to the gills, we were seated at a semicircular booth, all 5 of us and we were pretty much squished in, although we are family and didn't complain.  We all ordered specialty drinks at $15.00 each.  You couldn't find the alcohol in these drinks and they weren't especially good.  We ordered 8 dishes at the advice of the server.  We had the french onion soup dumplings, samosa, pierogi, pastrami reuben, etc.  All I can say is What the Hell happened to this place and to Chef Chris Santos.  The food was greasy and either cloyingly sweet or salty.  It almost tasted like frozen food from Costco that was warmed up and sweet or salty sauce was poured on.  The Restaurant was packed and it was unbearably hot in there.  So hot that some of us started feeling queasy and light headed.  My Daughter had to wait outside while we were finishing or should I say not finishing desert.  We had asked the Server to bring a cupcake with a candle out, instead all the deserts came out.  10 minutes later I asked what happened and was told oh its on the bar it'll be out soon.  We cancelled it, I complained to the Manager, to absolutely no satisfaction what so ever and we spend over $400 for the 5 of us.  When I went to Chris Santos's website I saw that he had contact info for his agent, my advice Mr. Santos, Care more about the quality of your Restaurants and Food and worry less about publicity.  A great concept, beautiful space, horrible food, uncomfortable booth, hot as hell!!  Go across the street to Sombrero for a taco and a frozen mojito, you will save a ton of money and leave feeling very happy!!!!

The worst meal I have ever had. The food is smothered in salt and cheese, absolutely zero flavor. We ordered the grilled octopus crostini... The octopus was chopped up finely and very rubbery, it didn't taste fresh. The Mexican ravioli tasted like garbage, I almost spit it out. The restaurant was so hot it became unbearable and I had to leave mid dessert to get fresh air. The place was packed with underage girls drinking, which isn't too big a deal considering the cocktails had zero booze in them anyway. Two margaritas...zero buzz. Big mistake, maybe if they put more alcohol in their drinks I would have been fooled into liking the food. Avoid this place.. it's not hip, the food sucks, and the prices are out of control. I will NEVER return.

One of the best meals of our lives has been at Stanton Social.The brickpressed chicken and cheddar waffles = one of the greatest dishes ever. The spicy butter/sauce that comes with it is insanely good.The menu has changed each time we've gone but the philly [goat]cheesesteak is up there as probably the best take on the classic I've ever eaten. Then there was the shrimp tempura. Outrageously good.The Mini Croque Monsieurs. Fantastic.The mini cinnamon rolls are very good but the fresh donuts and unique take on smores are indescribably good.

Fun place and good food. I would honestly say a few things though (the place is a bit crowded due to how tables are crammed in together, the service can be hit or miss, and do not order the "French soup balls").

I made reservations for my bf birthday. He absolutely loved it. We were sat upstairs and the place is beautifully decorated. I found this place because I watch the Food Network a lot and I wanted to try the Chopped judge's, Chris Santos restaurant. Omg was it great. Very dimly lit and very romantic ambiance. The food is served tapas style. Perfect for a night out with friends or significant other. Sharing is caring. We ordered the cobb salad bites, cider steamed mussels, grilled octopus, baked spanokopita, and crispy barrio-style chicken taquitos. All were delicious. Omg. At the end of dinner, the waitress brought a delicious cupcake with a candle to celebrate my bf's birthday. It was a nice touch. The fellow patrons were congratulating him and he loved the night. We also ordered more desserts, a birthday shot and movie theatre sundae. They were so yummy and delicious. The whole experience was great, so great that I recommended it to my friends.

The Stanton Social has great cocktails. I got the basil-lime gimlet and it was refreshing. The swashbuckler was also good. Each cocktail is $14, which in my opinion is pretty average pricing. In some places, I've seen them go for $15-18 if not higher.The food here is also awesome. It's tapas style, so my date and I just ordered a bunch of things that we wanted to try. The coconut curry samosa is flavourful and delicious -- I recommend. The red snapper tacos tasted really fresh -- recommend. The Korean short rib tacos weren't that great and didn't really have any of the traditional Korean flavours that one would find in the meat. They literally just put gochujang (Korean red pepper paste) on top and, consequently, called it Korean. The kimchi that was used didn't even taste like Korean kimchi so I don't know what they were doing with that -- I do not recommend.The ambience/decor of the restaurant makes it seem pretty fancy, but it's not as stuffy and bourgeois as it comes off as. The tables are a bit small and the space is tight so you might be getting quite cosy with the your next-door diners.

Wow, this place is at the top of our "go to list" for an enjoyable dining experience.  From the edgy atmosphere and music that help you arrive at the perfect energy and attention level throughout the meal, to the very well trained and attentive staff, to the fun and tasty food, this place is awesome! It's great for date night or entertaining, especially out of town family and friends because it's a nice change from the "ordinary", balancing personal interaction with an upbeat atmosphere.  You never really have the desire to leave for a place to have more fun. You can stay right there at Stanton Social, listen to great music and sample a wide variety of perfectly prepared food items that will satisfy your need for almost anything, from a gourmet styled street taco to a delicious Kobe beef burger.Price?  That's a choice we make when we decide what it is we are looking for when we go out. In my opinion it's not too pricey and the total experience is worth a lot more than they charge, that's for sure.  It's more than worth every penny.  Highly recommended.  Thanks Stanton Social!
Great food, great service . Do not come with friends with a limited palette , you will be sorry! Have the French onion soup dumplings for sure!

Overrated. Food was pretty good but they add fees depending on how many people are there and don't tell you. So you can order a $16 plate of food to share and then they add $8 and don't tell you unless you ask. And they gave us attitude when we didn't want to order everything at once. They told us for 4 people we would want to order 8-10 dishes. We ended up ordering 5 and that was plenty and we all left full.

Hmmm the food is good but be aware of the prices!! The food is served tapas style so you will probably want at least 5 dishes to share amongst 2 people. The prices per plate are in the teens so it can get quite expensive especially if you're also getting drinks (aka I got 1 drink with a friend and ended up paying $60 for brunch *yikes*)Anyway, price aside the place has great food and an innovative take on brunch. Here is what we ordered:- french onion soup dumplings (not really a soup dumpling like the chinese style but nonetheless delish)-  potato and goat cheese pierogies- red snapper tacos- wedge saladand dessert!My fave was the potato and goat cheese pierogies but I have to say I am biased because I love anything that has goat cheese.

Food was delicious! The Pastrami Reuben Quesadilla was BANGING. My sister and I could have easily eaten 4 or 5 orders of that alone. (French onion soup dumplings were tasty but overrated.)We sat on the third floor which def. made the experience more pleasurable as it wasn't as crowded as the ground floor. Only complaint is that the dinner felt a little rushed; the food was not delivered "steady and continuous" as the menu promised.
Love this place- especially for visitors to the city. It is a very trendy / romantic tapas restaurant. Also really like that you can make reservations.

Mmm Stanton Social, how I loved you in 2010. Your tapas twist on classic American faves (hello french onion soup dumplings) spoke directly to my belly in more ways than one. And coming back in 2015, I couldn't wait to see how you've evolved in mind-blowing ways. But for whatever reason, you just didn't speak to me in the same ways. The chicken and waffles, my once favorite dish, was still fun and tasty, but just didn't hit the mark. The salad was over dressed. And the soup dumplings, okay fine, who am I kidding? The soup dumplings were incredible. But now for some real talk: super disappointing cocktails. I could see that the menu was all fruit-based, but I assumed that going off menu and ordering a manhattan wouldn't yield the cheek-achingly sweet cocktails that I tasted around the table. Unfortunately it wasn't the case. Next time I'll stick with wine.And that's the thing: there will definitely be a next time. Even with the above, I still love, love, love this restaurant and will heartily recommend it. It's just a bummer when the current experience doesn't meet the glorious, drool-inducing memory that I've held so tight.

I come here as it is a great place to share dishes. Love the French onion dumplings and angus beef sliders! Delish!! The crab cakes were a little fishy but otherwise we enjoyed our meal. The only negative is we had to find our waiter in several occasions to order more drinks. My advice is to be seated downstairs as you the upstairs is really small and the servers are a bit slow. Oh, you must get the donuts with all the dipping sauces!! Worth every calorie:)

Visited The Stanton Social for brunch for the first time today. The ambiance was great and the food delicious. I also enjoyed the coffee and the personality of our server. Unfortunately, they do not accommodate food allergies well (ie: pretty rigid about not substituting or leaving off ingredients) and our server failed to mention that there was a participle allergen in one of the dishes we ended up ordering. He was concerned, however... Despite this, we enjoyed our experience overall. The Oreo pancakes are ridiculously delicious--better than birthday cake.

While I love the food here, the service has gone to the birds.  I had an 8 pm reservation, I walked in at 755.  I was asked to wait at the bar upstairs.  As usual just enough time to order drinks in martini glasses.  Just as we got our drinks the pager vibrated, we walked with our drinks downstairs, spilling all the while.  We went back to the hostess who then walked us back upstairs to be seated there.  Seriously bad policy guys, making us walk up to walk down, just to walk back up again.   I felt like I worked there, except I don't.  The seating was extremely tight upstairs and I had to ask several times to cool it down.  Lastly the menu specifically states that if you order all sharing plates they will trickle out so you have time to enjoy each.  All five plates came at once, I complained and received an apology.  The table was over crowded with plates and awkward.  Apologies don't solve problems.  Great food.Horrible service.

Had a reservation was told wait would be 30 minutes. Host was very snooty to say the least. We ended up having an excellent dinner in the lounge. Our waitress was outstanding, food was excellent as well. I would give 5 starts if it wasn't for the host.

Totally. Blown. Away. Stanton Social has long been on my "must try" list pretty much since it opened and I finally had the opportunity to try it out the other night with my colleagues.As is common for large groups like ours, there was a special menu in place for our dinner. The waitress immediately came over to me and noted that the chef was making me vegan courses that would be arriving at the same time as everyone else's. I have heard from friends that the chef here is not only extremely accommodating to vegans, but actually thrives on the challenge. This is important because there is a difference between merely accommodating a dietary restriction (often begrudgingly) and celebrating one (ie, strive on making specialty dishes that are just as awesome as other dishes on the menu). So...  five stars for you, Stanton Social! Dish after dish of *creative* vegan small plates exceeded even my loftiest expectations! Not a single boring butternut squash soup (rather, a curried coconut amuse bouche), nor pedestrian grilled pepper and mushroom to be had, friends! Instead, there was a scrumptious small beet burger, three tiny incredible street tacos stuffed with decadent rice/protein (tofu, I think?) & veggies, an OMG-this-is-crazy-amazing vegan quesadilla (if I had to venture a guess, Chao cheese is involved) and a wasabi-encrusted tofu steak. The tofu steak was my least favorite, mainly because I thought the tofu should have been of the firm/pressed variety (improves the texture and taste) and I'm not the biggest fan of wasabi. But I appreciated it regardless! They even served me dessert, which was also unexpected (and appreciated). I was glad to be privy to a trio of very light sorbets (a sour grapefruit, sweet blueberry and my favorite, a refreshing peach mixed with vanilla - don't quote me on that, but it has another flavor besides peach).Decor is right up my alley, with its restrained 1920s posh dark appeal (next time I hope to sit in one of those gorgeous semi-circular booths). Secrets should be shared here, however it is extremely loud (ah, NYC acoustics).
You will have no spaceBUT french onion soup dumplingswill make you forgive

This place is amazing, i keep coming back for more. I haven't tried everything on the menu yet but i do plan to. Everything is superb. If you go definitely try the french onion soup dumplings and the short rib tacos!

We've been riding this train for some time now and every time we go back we have another amazing time.A few tips...(1) I would go with at least 4 people so you're able to try lots of options since all the dishes are served to share (2) you need to make an evening of this place because they are not fast which can make the night extremely enjoyable, but only if you've factored this into your plans.That being said, when you walk in they'll send you to the upstairs bar which is serenaded by some pretty danceable jams, enhanced by a strong cocktail menu. Once your table is ready your buzzer will ring and the feast begins. I recommend the French onion soup dumplings, the kale salad, the pulled pork tacos, and the Ruben. If you're ready for dessert after the first few rounds, the dunkable powered donuts are on pointe.What does one wear to the Stanton Social? Anything trendy, but dress to impress.

Came here for a birthday brunch and was very impressed! The restaurant style is small plates, so they recommend ordering 1-2 small plates per person and sharing at the table. The thing I liked most was that if you have a party bigger than lets say 4-5, which is what some of the portion sizes are for things like pancakes, they can easily accommodate and give you __ more pieces. No hassle / issues of deciding between ordering one FULL more order or not.Things I LOVED: +Goat cheese pierogies- i've never had pierogies but these were a great first time. So delicious, cheesy and rich. +Egg bruschetta - wow how is this not a thing? The bruschetta bread was crispy on the outside but warm and soft on the inside, and topped with an abundance of eggs, onions and herbs. Delicious! +Vegetarian Slider - I think it was a beet burger topped with avocado, tomatoes and the works. So unique and tasty, wish I didn't share my other half...Overall, definitely a great brunch spot. A little pricey, but that's what you get I think for hitting up a hot spot. Tips:+Call ahead to make a reservation! +Go to El Rey across the street before/after for delicious coffee and ambiance.
Small bites for an entree price. Don't understand the concept and it should be changed.

Hands down one of my all time favorites in NYC. Stanton Social is a must for every New Yorker! The waiters are pretty well in tuned to how much food your group will need. For small plates I highly recommend the pierogies and French onion soup dumplings. If you pick two dishes those are the two to eat. The fried chicken and waffles are also one of my favorites - that hot sauce butter is like the perfect combination of butter and franks. So delicious. We've also tried the tacos - both the red snapper and short rib are worth trying. Atmosphere is fun but no matter your reservation time you'll probably always wait a bit. Not a problem though - there's a fun bar upstairs. Try the Social Tea - yummy. And you must finish off with the warm doughnuts or you just must hate desserts. Enjoy!!
Awesome vibes, trendy, delicious cocktails. Food is tapas style - great for sharing. Would definitely go back for the drinks. Ask the waiter which tapas he recommends.

One of the best brunches I have ever had! It was recommended by my sister and it did not disappoint. We ordered the french onion dumplings, chicken and waffles and red snapper tacos, which were all equally delicious! My friends ordered egg dishes & I ordered the creamy bacon polenta, which was the most amazing polenta I have ever had! The staff was friendly & explained the menu well. The decor was beautiful & I expect to return in the near future!

Went with a friend for dinner at around 7:00 on a Friday. It was definitely busy and appeared to be a popular weekend spot for us "youths". The space is very modern and hip; definitely a bit tight but I always feel that's a good sign (and hey, it's New York, tight is how we do).Our server was very friendly and attentive (and tall!) despite it being so busy. My friend ordered a couple of margaritas and I ordered off the cocktail menu - the Sage Advice ($14). It was a gin cocktail with mango - very unusual but very tasty! I think I had three...The food was very good as well. I am a vegetarian and there was a good assortment of things I could order; some places you go to have at most two or three uninteresting things on the menu, but there was a really nice variety here that I appreciated. Our server recommended 5 dishes for the two of us to share, so we ordered: the edamame, the pierogies, the street corn ravioli and some haricot verts. Only four dishes and that was plenty for us! The edamame were really nice and charred, something you can't get just anywhere. The pierogies were wonderful, not too heavy, and the ravioli was very tasty but maybe a little too sweet (also only three for $17, seemed a bit of a stretch). We did not order dessert, but there were some good looking treats.For an LES hotspot I was not at all disappointed. As an NYC restaurant it was about what I expected for pricing of menu items and drinks, and the noise level, although loud, was fine. The second floor is also a really great lounge space and looked like a lot of fun. I would definitely go back with friends for some snacks before a night out!

The menu has a great selection. We ordered the mussels and they were a little grainy which means they should have been washed more to get out the sand. The salmon was my favorite dish of the three. If you like basil, get the basil-lime gimlet.I'll definitely go back to try other dishes.

After hearing so much about The Stanton Social the last few years and seeing Chris Santos on Chopped more times that I probably need, I finally decided to give it a try and came here for Restaurant Week Winter 2015. Once I walked in for dinner, my immediate first impressions were that it was very dark and loud! Throughout dinner I had to yell to my tablemate who was only across a small table. In addition, it was quite cramped between tables. They definitely could've done without a few of the tables, but unfortunately the restaurant suffers from "squeeze as many customers in" syndrome. The service was excellent though.As for what we ordered:Red Snapper Tacos - creamy avocado, spicy mango- Fresh, crunchy and filled to the brim with stuffingCrispy Barrio-Style Chicken Taquitos - roasted guajillo sauce, avocado, crema - It was served in little bite sizes. I probably could've devoured 100 of these!Fried 'Chicken n' Waffles' - maple cheddar waffle, Louisiana hot sauce butter- Definitely not your standard chicken and waffles. It sort of looked like 3 chicken fingers served on a few small waffles. I wasn't a huge fan of it, but it wasn't half bad either.'Big Sexy' Burger - dry aged prime rib eye patties, caramelized onions, fancy sauce, herb dusted frites- The burger was juicy and huge! I loved the "fancy" sauce on it as it added some additional flavor.Warm Doughnuts - caramel, chocolate & berry dipping sauces- Of the 2 desserts, I absolutely preferred this one. It was very simple and who doesn't love warm doughnuts accompanied by dipping sauces?S'mores Panna Cotta - house made graham cracker, chocolate ganache- Definitely a downer! The Panna Cotta was way too sweet and very difficult to mix together.Overall, the Stanton Social was a letdown. I had high expectations considering the buzz it gets, but the food just didn't have the creativity or flavor I expected from a popular NY establishment.

The food was amazing - the hostesses were HORRIBLE! We went here for a birthday dinner - and even told the hostesses it was a birthday dinner.  We were running fifteen minutes late and called to tell them this and they were pretty rude about it even though we had a reservation (that we made a month in advance).  When we got there they sat us in the front of the restaurant by the door that made us freezing every time someone opened the door.  We asked if we could move to a different table since it was a special occasion and they said the one we had was the only one available.  Their entire attitude was uncalled for, especially since we made it clear this was a special occasion.  It really spoiled the evening.
The seared scallops taste so delicious it's above and beyond my expectations. Highly recommended!!!

Overpriced and underwhelming. My girlfriend and I came here with a couple friends to try it out for the first time. We had heard so much about them that we couldn't wait to try them out. Sadly though this journey would end in disappointment. I'll start with the positives. AMAZING DESSERT, without a doubt one of the best donuts and syrup plates I've had before,  totally light donut with a good sweetness and perfect for dipping in the chocolate, caramel and raspberry sauces. The French Onion Soup Dumplings were great as well,  while not personally a fan everyone else at the table loved them. The Tuna Poke (sp?) was delicious as well but lacked any hint of spice or wasabi, and you really had to use the lime to add some flavor. While great samples from the meal they don't tell the whole story. The bad side of our meal really shows the downfalls of this place. This place is WAY overpriced for the size of the portions, I understand this place is a tapa location but there's a difference between tapas and sample size which is what they served half our meal as, this was especially true of the taquitoes which I felt was nearly a crime for what they dare served for that price. The other big issue was the lack of flavor, I understand people have different tastes but to just make everything bland pleases no one, almost everything was just lacking in any spice or defining flavors. While the concept is amazing for many of the menu items and the presentation was nice  it couldn't make up for being overpriced and lacking in flavor. Overall this place is completely underwhelming, you read the menu items and have such high hopes all to leave disappointed.

Came here for lunch. Food was mediocre. Cheesesteak was underwhelming. Soup dumplings were just meh. The gyros were pretty decent. Cocktails were solid. Crap beer menu. Didn't do the trick for the price.
Amazing food and great cocktails! Best veggie slider ever ! Real great experience and their Sunday brunch is really one of the best!

I'm sorry to say I ate here a fews days ago and I was very disappointed. I ordered Corn ravoli , octopus, ,   Beef Wellington , scallops and pierogies.  My corn ravoli where cold not room temp, The octopus tasted over done and had to much vinager on them.  Scallops was dry so over cook , and the Beef Wellington I ask for mid rare I got raw!!  #ChrisSantos you've been #Chopped I know your a busy man but get back in that Kichten I used to come to #TheStantonSocial when you a had the raw bar. And I'm a big fan of #BeautyandEssex  #keepcooking #Foodie1st #ChefStanStrong

This is the place to be for happy hour. Given the name, Stanton Social, you can safely assume their food is designed to allow you to be more communicatively engaged with your party. I recommend making reservations because the place does get packed and when you arrive to make sure everyone in your party is already here otherwise they will not seat you. Their dishes are tapas style, basically finger foods meant for sharing. They recommend 6 - 7 dishes for parties of 3 but we decided to go for four instead and boy are we glad we did. I was stuffed like I just had a Thanksgiving meal. French onion soup dumplings, red snapper tacos, Crispy Barrio-Style Chicken Taquitos and Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies. While we waited for the food, we were given complimentary shots of carrot and ginger soup with crème fraîche. It was super yummy, I'd rather have it served without the crème fraîche. I liked this over the usual bread that restaurants give people prior to their food arriving. As for the tapas, my favorite was the french onion soup dumplings. Props to them for the creativity, but eat carefully because it's broiling hot. It was kind of hard to scoop out without breaking the soup. My least favorites were the taquitos and the red snapper tacos. The tacos are good but red snapper wasn't really my kind of fish. All the dishes were rich in flavor but some were not my cup of tea. For dessert, we did shots of Spicy Mezcal Hot Chocolate and Birthday Cake Milkshake and movie popcorn sundae. The shots were absolutely delicious!! Both were great but if I had to choose I'd say the spicy mezcal hot chocolate was better. I didn't really taste much alcohol in it but in the birthday cake milkshake you can taste some of the rum. The presentation was adorable. As for the movie popcorn sundae, it seriously tastes like movie popcorn. The caramel pieces and peanuts brings me back to the theaters, perfectly executed. I noticed the crowd was mostly female but for you male foodies out there, don't be discouraged! You can totally come here for a boys night out or something.

Tucked on the same block where my weed guy lived in the 90s, I had a flashback coming here for brunch. Sometimes, remembering what once was can really kill a moment; there's something so strange about dining in the lower east side, looking up and the people around you look like Hoboken. Eating here was like a bad Hollywood movie where the hero (played by your boy) realizes he was here before...before he acquired his secret powers, before the midwest of Amerika moved in and priced the OGs out and before weed could be smoked in wax form. That means one of two things: I'm old and... I'm really fucking old. The basil gimlet is perfecto... how's that for a transition. I would have stabbed my own damn self, if those words came out of my mouth while chill'n here in the 90s, but that's the truth, Ruth. The Bloody Mary was on point (ask for extra spice, cuz it's nice), the "French Onion" soup dumplings were OK, but the name is misleading in the sense that when you bite into it, theres a lack of actual soup (oh, and the dumplings were crazy thick and chewy). Still, it has cheese on it, so it's not a total waste. The lob'stah Benedict was good and the same could be said for the lamb tacos. I'd skip the wedge salad, because who the hell eats white lettuce anymore other then basic bitches, your female friends from Dallas (same thing) and your parents? They serve tapas style and everything was meant to be shared. It got packed later then earlier. This is a second or third option joint. Eat on the third floor if you can, because the first floor is just a zoo.The bathrooms on the third floor are dope. There's something to be said about windows at waist level cracked open while the wind from the alley cools the boys off and you're getting rid of some excess bloat. Brilliant. Service: professional, friendly and on point. $140 tab for dos during brunch was a tad steep considering we just rolled out of bed and wanted to grab something. Dear Jerome, you use YELP to talk shit about a lot of stuff, next time, you might want to actually read a review before saying, "ok" you douche. Or, you should take your sunglasses off and look at your surroundings and realize that this isn't Bereket. Or, never blindly follow a girl who says, " Oh my gawd, the food here is soooo goooood". Be prepared for an expensive brunch and a small wait. If you aren't feeling nice by your second drank, don't order another round, because these drinks were strong and $18 for a weak ass drink is dumbtard. The food choices overall are fusion...shocker. Asian, latin, Mediterranean, Kardashian, and douche' all hook up on the menu. It's not mind-blowing like when you first discovered wax, but it's mos def better then the dirt weed I used to smoke around here back in the 90's. I'd come back again, but only if my first two options were too long of a wait...which is exactly how we ended up here.

Stanton Social is a pretty cool spot. The music is pretty on point and the people working there are friendly and helpful. Not sure if they still do this because I have yet to go there in 2015, thus far but when I was going, they had special open bar nights, every Monday, that included passed hors d'oeuvres as well! That was always really cool.Honestly it would have been a 5 from me but the last time I went by, a guy that labelled himself as the manager was standing outside and told me that I couldn't go in because it was at capacity and said I couldn't go in unless I purchased a bottle.Me: I have to buy a bottle, to get to the open bar.Manager: YesAnd I was definitely wearing dress clothes that night, so that wasn't an issue. I won't give them a 2 based off of a single terrible night but that was rough :/

When this restaurant tells you they are classy they mean it.  That means you cannot haul in 40 balloons for your friends birthday because they will make you check it with the coats and hats....Sign, they were so beautiful bright and happy but they clash with the decor and Stanton Social will not have that.So yeah, make sure you blend in with the yuppies that come here.  Wear all black and don't even think about frivolity and fun.Ok, my total embarrassment aside, we hardly saw our server and when our food was finished they began to wipe down our table while we were sitting there!  WHAT!!!  I have never had that happen to me!  They were turning over our table for the next group while we were still sitting there. I won't be back, probably to their relief, Im the rabble with balloons that should be at a Chucky Cheese.
Everything was amazing. Atmosphere is great and so was the service. Little disappointed they were out of chicken and waffles, lobster AND oysters but everything else made up for it!

This place is fantastic -- great food, service, and ambiance and very filling. Everything you should definitely share and try as much as possible... everything I had was something I'd order again! The standouts were definitely the French Onion Soup Dumplings (actuallyy incredible albeit v heavy) Mac & Cheese, red snapper tacos, and butternut squash ravioli. Drinks also fantastic, probably one of the better old fashioneds i've had in the city.

have dined at Stanton Social various times and decided to try their Saturday Brunch for a change. It most definitely did not dissappoint. Had the oreo cookie pancakes and they were amazing. Also ordered the banana pancakes that were delicious, the French toast sticks and doughnuts. Our waitress was very helpful and attentive, and we had a great time. All in all, our brunch was a decadent food fest that we look forward to repeating.

Awesome special occasion restaurant. Went for my sisters birthday and we loved it! Really cool shared small plates. Some of our favorites were the French onion soup dumplings and the Perogies with goat cheese! It's a really fun atmosphere with great drinks and music. We also loved the donuts for dessert!

Overall good experience Ambiance = 5 Service = 4Food = 4 just a bit too pricey for my liking, but the taste was still pretty goodA bit too trendy for me. i would probably go back if i didn't have to pay.

Came here for drink and a quick bite. We had the Mac n Cheese(which was good) , mussel(good also) and pizza(not too great pretty average).It is small plates/tapa to share. Of course i has the strawberry fields drink which was good also. I was not too fond of the staff as they made it a big deal that i was having drink first and having dinner once my friend arrived, that seem to difficult for them understand this concept, but whatever.  You should make a reservation if your planned to come on a sat or sun.
Had an okay experience here. Server was very nice and the food was okay, but I wasn't really as impressed as I thought I would be by reading these reviews
Fantastic food and cocktails. Try the Notorious F.I.G. Cocktail. Tapas style American cuisine with a flare. Must go but make a reservation.

2000th review, yay! Boyfriend and I went to The Stanton Social for our five year anniversary. The restaurant was very crowded (as expected) and our table practically touched our neighbor's table. We ordered the following dishes, and we thought everything was really delicious. The only problem was that each dish contained some kind of cheese, and we got full really quickly. My favorite dish was the French Onion Soup Dumplings, and the mac & cheese is pretty high on my list too. As for the cocktails, I liked The Swatchbuckler more than Notorious F.I.G. The honey lavender syrup is delicious.Rhode Island Lobster Roll Philly Cheesesteak slider Social Mac & CheeseRed Snapper TacosPotato & Goat Cheese PierogiesFrench Onion Soup DumplingsNotorious F.I.G.The Swashbuckler

Unfortunately, my 2nd time here was not as stellar as my first. Pros:* One of the few NYC restaurants that take reservations for weekend brunch! They call you the day before to confirm* A winning dish to add to my previous review: French Toast Sticks $10 (nutella, vanilla crème fraiche, strawberries)- lightly buttery toasted goodness on the outside and soft and eggy on the inside. Cons:* I don't see why people rave about the French Onion Soup Dumplings, as they were pretty mediocre: the dumplings were chewy and there was no soup inside * Because The Stanton Social is so jam packed the noise level gets so high that I end up having to shout at times to carry a conversation (especially when seated in the semi-private mezzanine area) and the staff is spread very thin...so service was very slow (but friendly nonetheless). * There's only one bathroom on the first floor so it became gross and messy. During my entire time there the toilet paper was never replaced. If you find yourself waiting for the bathroom with 2 patrons before you, run to the 3rd floor- chances are it's empty and it's really pretty up there!* The Stanton Social is on the pricey side (a small but addicting slider goes for $8/each!) where total per person for a standard number of filling appetizers (with no cocktails) was $40 including tax and tip.
