Celebrated my friends bday here last night. The atmosphere energetic and vibrant. The music was a great! It's like they knew which songs we loved and decided to play them just for us. The food- so we had the periogies, French onion soup dumplings, mimi lamb gyros and the red snapper tacos. I must say in terms of flavor- everything was amazing. The only draw back was the portion size. Yes- Stanton Social prides itself on small plates and sharing rather that individual appetizers/entree but at least give me enough on the plate so I don't have to stop at McDonalds on my way home because I was still hungry!!! (Yes it really happened). There were, on average, 4 pieces of each selection on the plate. I was able to hold the morsel of food with two fingers because it was that small. No utensils needed. The prices weren't too bad but you can easily spend a lot more because there isn't enough food on the plate. I will definitely come back because I want to try other things on the menu but will only come with my sister who likes to go out but doesn't like to eat. The service was pretty good too. The waitress brought my friend a bday cupcake which was really nice of her.

Food 3.5-4Service 3.5-4Ambience 4.5-5Decor 4.5-5The live jazz band greets you when you enter. You can coat check and get checked in with the hostess, and then be seated under the beautiful lighting and decor of the restaurant. It ended up being a romantic brunch w my gf. The ambiance made me think I was getting dinner at a fancy tapa restaurant.Other than the face my waiter took a while to fill my coffee, I was pleased with the service. I forgot to get the dumpling but, I made sure I ordered the French toast sticks because my friend who was telling me to come here was raving about these sticks. She actually said she got it for the appetizer and dessert in the same seating. These were definitely good. They were very sweet to start my morning though, so I would actually get them for dessert the next time I come.The spicy lobster benedict were great. You'll be enjoying the chunks of soft lobster if you get this. The arugula salad placed in between the two English muffins freshens your palate (I wish it had less dressing). We also ordered the red snapper tacos. You get3 small tacos-about 4 bites-that are well packed with the inner ingredients of avocado and mango sauce. These were good but I would want to try something else next time. The Bloody Mary my friend got looked like some grapefruit-cranberry juice but said it was delicious. The food is very good, but did not blow my mind. But the Stanton Social is definitely a place to have a good time with anyone. If you're looking for a good vibe you should come. If you're hunting for a new brunch spot with mind-blowing food, maybe you shouldn't. I wouldn't go out of my way to come again but I still know I will be back for the beautiful decor and good fancy tapa style brunch. I want to get dinner or just drinks in the near future.

ive been a couple times now -- most recently for RW.the apps are awesome, the french onion dumplings really are that good -- even if you're not a huge french onion soup fan (i'm not)the ambience is great, good wine selection. the cocktails are fun.the main courses were alright, would def order the small plates only instead.desserts are pretty decent.
This place is over prices for subpar food. At one point I thought it was cat food on a cracker. Drinks are way over priced.  I do not recommend to go at all.

I don't know about the food yet, but this water is on point. 5/5.Update 3:50 PM. Just received a text from my friend, "Yo I'll meet you guys at the bar. This is one of the best bathrooms for taking a shit ever. Top 5 for sure.." Nothing else to say.

I was so looking forward to going here during restaurant week.  The menu looked great and had lots of options.Sorry to say the experience did not meet my expectations.  The appetizers were good.  Goat cheese pierogies and mini tacos.But the entrees were another story.  The chicken and waffles were maybe 2 stars.  The waffles are very dry and the chicken was like the frozen ones you get in the freezer section. Burger was ok.But the most disappointing was the service. As soon as we got our desserts the waitress put down the check and said no rush.  Two minutes later she asked if we looked at check and did not ask us if we wanted anything else ... Ah maybe coffee? Or more wine?  We paid the check and left.  I will not be going back there again.

Wankville. Food is good but you certainly pay for it. The drinks are over priced, making it an expensive experience. If you don't care about how much it costs - it's fine.Also, how on earth can you not have a veggie main option for restaurant week ? That's just rude!
Love love this place.  Never disappoints.  A little pricey when you order half the brunch menu.  But enjoyed everything.

Loved it! I was lucky enough to sit in the lofted space overlooking the main dining room (which seemed incredibly cramped) and enjoyed a wonderful meal in less crowded quarters. Our tasting menu included a series of creative, shareable plates that I'm still dreaming about. From French onion soup dumplings and savory goat cheese & potato pierogies to chicken and waffles with hot sauce butter, every dish was a standout. On the dessert side, the highlight was a spicy Mezcal hot chocolate shot. Overall, a total treat!

I absolutely love this restaurant, but I only go here for special occasions and never without a reservation. They are known for their French onion soup dumplings, as they should be, but everything else on their menu is delicious as well. The last time I came here I had an Amazon Local brunch deal, which had a separate menu but was still just as good and you were not treated any differently for having the deal (some places do that, amazingly!). They also had a really great string quartet playing -- awesome mood music!

This rating is solely related to the restaurant week menu. Would have loved to try the restaurant but my fellow foodie & dining companion is a vegetarian & there is absolutely nothing for her to eat from the menu. Most places have at least one vegetarian option in each course so I was both surprised & profoundly disappointed that this one does not.

Tried Stanton Social for the first time last night for Restaurant Week with my boyfriend. The Restaurant Week menu was incredible, all of the best pieces from the regular menu. We each got the 1 app, 1 entree, and 1 dessert for $38, and then we each got a drink (about $13 each, I got a glass of wine and he got a cocktail), and then we got one more app for the table. The food was excellent. There's so much detail put into every single dish, and even every piece of decor.The service was good, but the only reason I didn't give 5 stars. The coat check woman, the hostess, and the waiter were all great. However, there were 2 bus boys there who were VERY quick about cleaning up empty plates, pouring water, etc. However, they took my almost full dish of Penne Bolognese (I was already pretty full from the appetizers and wanted to save room for dessert ;)) and when he asked if he could wrap it for me, I said "yes, please" and then never saw the dish again. :( Really loved the dish and was hoping I would be able to have the leftovers. It also felt like a waste of money.

I've been coming to Stanton Social for a few years now. I go once or twice a year for special occasions. They have an interesting drink and food menu. On paper. Over my times coming here, the more things I've branched out and tried, the less enticing the dishes become. The lobster roll is good, but you can walk 3 blocks to two different places and get a bigger and better one, for a fraction of the price. The French onion soup dumplings and the red snapper tacos are a staple here for sure. Everything else ordered was below average and the mussels and the ribs were sent back as neither was served warm or correctly. Which brings me to the value. I know it's trendy, and I know it's shared plates. But the price for what you get is honestly quite insane. Two of us split a bill for six people and I would've expected to pay what I paid for everyone. We all left hungry and unsatisfied and got a quick bite of food nearby (and it was better). Once you take away the fact that it's cool and there are (wannabe) models all around you acing like they are eating lots of food because they ordered two small entrees, this place will leave you feeling pretty empty. Both in the wallet and stomach.

I love the atmosphere here...its elegant and chic...the people are nice but sometimes you get the bitchy ones.The one thing I really like about this place is that there is something for everyone...the menu is so diverse and has a lil bit of everything to satisfy everyone's taste...even the picky eaters.My cousin n her spouse was here was UK and they eat only halal meat...so creek stone beef is halal and Stanton social has it on their menu (beef with broc and the Korean short rib taco). I called to get details about it...the girl called the chef and then got back to me within half n hour at 9.30pm...it was awesome :)We had a bunch of food...we did the perogis, the soup dumpling, the sexy burger, the snapper taco, scallop, wasabi salmon, beef n broc, Korean taco, fries (we had 3 orders of them), donuts and Oreo Twinkie...4 of us and a lot of nibbles it was all awesome :)

Amazing! This restaurant is specifically focused on small dishes, or tapas, which are done exceptionally well. For starters my boyfriend and I received a complimentary shot of carrot ginger soup. My first sip was heaven. The best part about this soup was its layers, varying textures and complex flavors. The foam on top was airy yet creamy and rich and the soup found below was sweet and fragrant with a hint of spice. This was the perfect appetizer while we waited for our main dishes. We ordered several dishes but the most memorable were the Beef Wellington, which was wrapped in a delicate layer of puff pastry and foie gras mousse; the Pirogies, which were filled with potatoes and Goat Cheese and came with an exquisite side of truffle crème fraîche;  and the Chicken and Waffles, which were breaded and seasoned to perfection on top of a moist waffle bottom with a side of maple syrup. We also both ordered the Blood Orange Jalapeño Margarita, which may not have been the right compliment with this meal, yet we still ended up ordering two drinks each.

Came here for brunch with a friend that has been here before, so she (semi) joked she's ordering for the table and to "trust her". Worked out great because I LOVED it all! We were a group of 3 so we ordered 6 plates which are tapas-style (so perfect for sharing).For "breakfast" part of brunch we got- banana pancakes (I could have done without them- they were eh) and nutella French toast sticks (yum)For "lunch" part of brunch we got- potato goat cheese pierogies, and French onion soup dumplings (BOTH HIGHLY RECOMMENDED- my favorites- never had anything like either of those!). Also got the Mac n cheese and ricotta meatballs- very good as well. I also liked how the plate came out as they were made or in little shifts... Makes the meal not feel so rushed and spreads out the food a bit so you gradually feel full (rather than all at once!). Can't wait to return and try more- but will definitely be getting the pierogies+ soup dumplings again without a doubt!

Celebrity chef Chris Santos has definitely hit it out of the park with this wonderful, quaint and tastefully decorated restaurant. Everything is served bite-sized and made for sharing, with 2-3 dishes recommended per person in your party. The cocktails were great and so was everything we tasted. When I'm not in New York City, I dream about the wonderful French Onion Soup bites. This is a must visit when in the City and a great place for a romantic, fun date.

Came here with a group of 8 for dinner on Tuesday night and we had an awesome experience. My boyfriend was in town, and since this place serves their dishes tapas style, I figured it would be a good idea to do for a big group - and it was! A few of us arrived early so we grabbed a round upstairs. I tried the Notorious F.I.G. ($14) while the bf had the Blood Orange Jalapeno Margarita ($14). I'm a sucker for spicy drinks, and the margarita was perfectly spiced, but not overpowering and not too sweet. However I'm a whiskey lady so I preferred my drink over the bf's. We were originally going to do the Restaurant Week menu but since there were 8 of us... copious amounts of the same desserts/entrees just didn't sound appealing to us. So we made a game-time decision and decided to order everything a la carte, especially since the tuna poke wontons and the infamous French onion soup dumplings weren't even on the RW menu. Food:Cobb Salad Bites ($10) - these one-biters were tasty! They did a great job of encompassing all the flavors you know of a classic cobb salad into one little bite. Would recommend.French Onion Soup Dumplings ($14) - SO this restaurant is known for these bad boys... but I was sadly underwhelmed. We placed 2 orders of this and to start, I'm not sure why they've named these 'soup dumplings' if there technically isn't soup inside of them. The filling inside was just the caramelized onions. Presentation was good as it's served in the escargot dishes with melted swiss cheese on top, but they weren't anything to write home about. I LOVE French onion soup, but there wasn't much of the soup part that I love so much in this dish. I think just recently coming back from Paris and crushing French onion soups there might have pushed my standards a lot higher, but either way, it was just OK.Potato and Goat Cheese Pierogies ($10) - THESE WERE AMAZING. I mean, who doesn't like all three of the words all into one dish?!  These pierogies are served with a side of truffle crème fraiche that paired perfectly well. The filling was creamy, but the shell was still crunchy, and the crème fraiche sauce just tied everything together.Nori Spiced Tuna Poke Wonton ($15) - if these are the closest things I can get to having poke of any sort without having to go to Hawaii, then I'll take it! It's literally tuna poke inside a fried wonton shaped like a taco, and they're damn addicting - HIGHLY recommendRed Snapper Tacos ($11) - these were GOOD, but not amazing. The table had mixed reviews about this one - some liked  it, some thought it was a tad bit on the fishy side. I'd say this is almost similar to the tuna poke wontons, and between the two... I'd definitely go with the tuna poke wontons over these.Social Mac and Cheese ($14) - Okay so our group went a little crazy on this one as we asked for 3 orders of these things. MAC AND CHEESE OVERLOAD. I wasn't a huge fan of this... perhaps it's because this was the last order that was brought out and we were all already stuffed to the brim? I'm not sure, but I thought it was okay.Warm Doughnuts ($10) - this was a good dessert and the sauces were good. Donuts were still nice and warm and the sauces weren't too sweet. Really enjoyed this.We had about 3 bottles of wine throughout the dinner...so the total came out to be ~$70pp +tip.Service was attentive, friendly and not pushy. I loved that they seated us in a large round table as it's always difficult to have one main conversation going with a group of 8 people, so that made our experience so much better. This place is a lot of fun if you're with a big group, but make sure to book reservations ahead of time. I'll definitely be back!

The Stanton Social was recommended to me by quite a few people so we decided to give it a try. The atmosphere is nice and intimate, decor is on point and trendy and the food (for the most part) is really good. Here's what we got:Red Snapper tacos - 3 mini tacos on basically a wonton, with red snapper ceviche and masa. Tuna Tacos - same story as above, 3 mini 'tacos' of tuna sashimi served simply with green onion and a light dressing. French Onion Soup Dumpling - an interesting take on FOS. Essentially 6 little soup dumpling stuffed with onion and baked. They were alright. Not sure why they're so popular.  I would have rather had a bowl of soup frankly. Cast Iron Shrimp - it was so so. Slightly spicy, though not hot. Shrimp was well cooked and good quality. Chicken & Waffles - I didn't indulge but my group did and they liked them. Waffle was soft, but crispy and fried chicken was nicely proportioned. Not sure what all the fuss is about but it's a cool place that's nice for a casual dinner. If you're in soho check it out, but honestly for the price, Lure Fishbar is a million times better

I'm obviously a huge fan of Chris Santos and watch Chopped pretty religiously... so I was super excited to try this out!I even gave up being vegan for this meal because I needed to try everything.Ambiance - Trendy, Great service, high quality wait staff and super professional demeanor all around, great music (They played kygo remixes for most of our meal), and amazing decor.French Onion Soup Dumplings - 6 little balls come in a pot and you pull the sticks out and eat them! Fun and delicious.Cous Cous - a bit on the spicy side. A generous portion and I ended up taking half of it home.Pizzetta - Hard to screw this up, really fresh and tasty!Butternut Squash Ravioli - Sooo good. They only give you 3 raviolis, so if you have multiple people who want to try this (as they should), then you should order a few of these!Veggie Burger - OMG. so good. Again, order multiple of these because a "burger" is like half the size of your fist. Each order of a burger is for one individual person.I have also been here for the bar/nightlife scene, and I recommend it for latenight as well! Can't wait to come back and try the $3 birthday cake shots... yumm.

Went to stanton social for dinner last night, wow was it crowded!!  After 15 mins past our reservation  time, our table was ready.  Omg the food was out of control--we ordered: french onion soup dumplings, broccoli and beef, potato and goat cheese peirogies, mac and cheese,  scallops--all were amazing.   Check out onebiteonesip on ig for pictures.  I would highly recommend the dumplings!!  Everything  else was great as well but those really were the best!

The Stanton Social is a great place for brunch, especially when you're going with a group of friends. They family style all of their small plates, and comes out in the order they're made. I highly recommend the French toast sticks, Oreo pancakes, and fish tacos. However, we thoroughly enjoyed all the dishes and would definitely come here again.

Came here on a Tuesday night and the place was popping! I really loved the vibe of the restaurant, especially the music. It felt like a lounge, almost club like with the dim lighting. Some people were pretty dressed up to go out. Seemed like a popular place to grab some food and get a few drinks before heading out.We sat in a circular booth (3 of us) and ordered a bunch of plates and shared tapas style. I really wanted to like this place considering it got great reviews and was a super trendy restaurant. Everything was tasty, but nothing really stood out to me. I had higher expectations of the food. The food was pretty typical of any other trendy New American restaurant. Portions were pretty small considering we ordered about 10-12 dishes off the menu.Service was okay, not the greatest. Our waiter was not the most attentive to our table...maybe because we didn't order any drinks? It also took us a while to get our check (which was pretty hefty)..Long story short: great ambiance, good food but nothing special, small portions, mediocre service, expensive
Hate to sound like a broken record but....French onion soup dumplings. Really.

This was my first time at Stanton and I could say yelp reviews were pretty accurate. The place itself is very trendy but small so reservations are a must. The staff was overall very friendly, as was my waiter. I guess my only issue was the price of the food that was served tapas style. The arepas were about the size of a quarter I'm not used to tapas style dining, but for the price I was a bit irked, the Mac and cheese is a steal hands down my favorite meal we had all night.  Overall great place but definitely yelp the menu if you don't intend on spending much

Sunday night visit to the Stanton Social, was met by a nearly empty bar upstairs which left plenty of room for quiet conversation. The cocktails were very inspired, with flavors ranging from citrus sweets to bitter greens - the bar tender took care to pound everything into smooth perfection before pouring - which made it all the more delicious. Was less overwhelmed by the food on the dimly lit but open first floor, had the dumplings everyone recommended (yes they were very hot!) and the lamb and the chicken and waffles. Everything tasted as it should, without too much more. Overall a pleasant eating experience.
My favorite restaurant in NYC! Always the first place I recommend to friends! Perfect for a night out with delicious drinks.

The atmosphere was all a buzz with dim lights. It was a little difficult to see the food that we ate very well but perhaps this is a tactic used to hieghten the oral senses. The seats were soft and comfy but the area was very "cozy" you had to be aware of passing patrons and wait staff. The service was efficient but since they were so busy we had more than one wait staff member. Made it a little confusing when looking for someone to serve/cater to our needs.As far as the food goes they encourage you to order 6-8 dishes to share (tapas style). As a palette prep treat they served a coconut ginger carrot soup in a ceramic tea/shot cup. Delish! My fav dishes ordered were the red snapper tacos,  veggie burger slider,  and mac and cheese. Also the waffles in the chicken and waffles dish were great. The chicken left much to be desired. We Also Enjoyed BIRTHDAY Cake Flavored Mini Milk Shakes shots With Whiskey And sprinkles and I had the hot chocolate shot with mescal and a sliver of marshmallow. They were good in flavor but could have been a little bit stronger as far as the alcohol content. They regular bar drinks were pretty good.The restaurant also has a bar/lounge section that you could sort of just cross over to when you complete your meal.  I didn't investigate this part but it seemed crowded with s calm crowd of people enjoying drinks food and mudic. I will definitely try this place again during brunch hours. Their Pancake And Desserts Looked Tasty.

We had a great birthday celebration here. Vibrant place with lots of folks and celebration going on. Great food tapas style. We had spanakopita, gyro, Short rib tacos, raviolis with butternut squash and, waffles and fried chicken, kale Caesar salad, grilled octopus, and rigatoni Bolognese. The vodka gimlet was exceptional as was a really cool bourbon drink that had fresh fig in it.
Awesome food. It's a great experience. Would recommend the ravioli, but it all was excellent. Gave it 4 stars, could expand the wine list. Service was good.

Note: This is a review of the lounge upstairs.  Doing a little bar hopping on a weekday and this spot is going down as a fav in LES.  Pretty dim lighting but the ambiance was great.  It was very laid back and had a diverse crowd.  The music was great and a perfect mix of music.  My friend I went with mentioned that they have doughnuts  I HAVE TO TRY.  The doughnuts are served warm and covered in cinnamon sugar. It is accompanied by three  dipping sauces. Best way to put it is SEX IN MY MOUTH. Was that too much? Well its so amazing I been dreaming about it since I left the establishment. Overall it was an awesome time.Lastly, I will update this review once I dine here for dinner.

Food was amazing! Service was great! Definitely sit upstairs for Sunday brunch; much quieter, brighter, and more comfortable with the skylights. Same owner as Beauty And Essex down the street and both are amazing! Had the Oreo pancakes, Mac and cheese, and potatoe and goat cheese perogies. All excellent and good value. I have to go back and try the donuts and lobster roll. Hard to park though, leave plenty of time for that.. Great birthday brunch spot #applause

Super packed on a Friday night. DJ was excellent - played a great mix. Noise level was loud, but not too loud that we couldn't have a conversation. Drinks - we had the Swashbuckler and Strawberry Fields. $14 each.Food - Small tapas-style dishes meant to be shared. Favorites were the poke wonton - which was more like a mini crispy taco, and the goat cheese pierogies. Toffee cake for dessert was delicious. The one miss was the Oreo Twinkie - it was terrible! Tasted dry and stale. *gag* Otherwise, everything was tasty.Service - very efficient and attentive. The waiter's recommendations were on point.Will definitely return again.

Good service and atmosphere. But I give this place 3 stars because I think their food is overrated. The food is good but I think it's only because of it being heavy and hearty. I think the food lacks real flavoring from the natural flavors of ingredients. Instead, there is flavor but it is only enhanced by the addition of too much salt. In addition we drank German Riesling but it was too grapey and did not compliment our heavy tapas. Id say at the price we paid it was only worth half the cost. Also we had a friends birthday here and they did give is a complimentary cupcake and candle. But the cupcake was stale and flavorless. I could tell other birthday tables thought the same way by the looks of untouched cupcakes.

I know it's corny, touristy and commercial but I am a real New Yorker who can admit that I enjoy this place, albeit NEVER EVER on a weekend.   if i'm in the area and want a romantic setting for shared small plates and wine with my husband, this is it.  We've had lovely evenings here.  French Onion soup dumplings are as popular as they are for a reason, never eat here without ordering them.   If it's just a party of two, the bar upstairs is a great option for seating, less tourists staring and waiting for someone to create a vibe.   Fish tacos and short rib tacos really tasty as well.   I don't recommend a special trip but if you're in the area and it's a Tues or a Wed, and you can easily ignore the people around you, go!

I absolutely loved this place! We ordered 10 tapas and couldn't decide which one was the best.  I liked how the upstairs bar was separate from downstairs but you could still go up for a drink while you waited for your table.  The drinks are amazing, the wine selection is large and very good.  The staff was very accommodating. This place is great!!

the cheese on the french onion soup dumplings was SO GOOD. my favorite was definitely the potato & goat cheese pierogies with truffle creme ! awesome service :)the caramel banana pancakes were presented nicely and tasted good, but wasn't super unique. the oreo pancakes i thought were a bigger hit. overall yummy place :)

First I'm not a fan of Tapas because usually I'm the only person in the group who is gluten free. So it ends up to be a very pricey meal. The food is okay. My friend ordered something from the gluten free menu for us to share, and out came...the gluten version. Annoying. I had to order the GF version.  The food itself was okay. There are a few good items, but  in general it's just okay.

My friend and I dined at The Stanton Social and ordered 6 dishes for the two of us. We probably could have ordered 1 less because we were too full at the end for dessert. We ordered:Red Snapper Tacos (really delicious) French Onion Soup Dumplings (the filling wasn't very soup-like; more just onions in a sauce)Korean Short Rib Tacos (kimchi was wonderful but there was a lot of cilantro)Perogies (favorite dish of the night)Chicken and Waffles (waffles and syrup were delicious but the chicken had no seasoning)Scallops (scallops were perfectly cooked)Overall the food was good but it was the service and the atmosphere that took off a star. The music was far too loud (I had to shout across the table) and the servers were almost impossible to find during the meal. We switched servers halfway through the meal and our second waiter never returned to check on us until we asked for the bill.

Had expected to have a much more unique food experience but was quite let down from the moment I arrived with my party. We were a bit early and the place was empty but hostess wouldn't seat us until everyone in our party had arrived. Ok fair enough. Had a drink at the bar and tried to get seated again but was refused. At our third try she seated us as we were about to go elsewhere. Really? The place was still empty at 7pmon a Monday nite.  Anyway our waitress greeted us but was real cold and snooty so that set the tone of the nite. The servers and bus boys were real friendly though. The food was nothing special or unique. Chicken and waffles was just glorified chicken fingers. Their signature dish of French onion soup w dumplings was not really soup but rather a small square of bread w some sautéed onion housed in an escargot dish.  So you can figure how much  "soup" you really got. Ribs were tasteless and dry. Mac n cheese was heavy and ordinary. Definitely not restaurant worthy. Only good thing we had were the cider steamed mussels and pulled chicken arrepas. Also the brownie Sunday dessert was good. The so called Twinkie was a waste of calories being dry and hard  Overall experience was not worth it at all. Wouldnt recommend to anyone for food. Maybe just drinks

My wife and I stumbled into The Stanton Social while in town and really glad we did.  We were just looking for a few cocktails and some small bits.  Both really turned out great.  The cocktails were spot on!  We had one that was just recently put on the menu called the Notorious F.I.G. and really liked it.   Wish I could get my own pear-cinnamon syrup so I could make it at home.  Opted for the french onion soup dumplings and the kale ceaser salad.  Salad was nothing special but the dumplings were awesome.  Great service from the bar tenders who made a great suggestion for our next stop of the evening.  Would definitely come back whenever I get to the city.
The food here in phenomenal. Everything is served fresh . The drinks are good with twist to each selection . The only thing I didn't like was the French onion soup . Great lounge upstairs .

While everyone raves about the french onion soup dumplings, the goat cheese truffle perogies were my favorite.  Super full on a Wednesday.  Some other favorites:mac and cheese, miso mushrooms, chicken arepas

Nice small bites place where the attire runs from casual to clubby attire, i guess just go how you feel!the waiter recommended 2-3 dishes per person but the dishes we ordered were SO HEAVY that the two of us were stuffed after 3 dishes (maybe it's just what we ordered)--amiguita's blue old fashioned cocktail: MMm enjoyed this one--blood orange jalapeno margarita: a bit too spicy for me--amuse bouche: mango soup.. nothing special--french onion soup dumplings: yummy! couldve done w/o the crouton on top though--social mac & cheese: pretty standard for mac n cheese--potato & goat cheese pierogies: my FAV dish of the night... they were crispy & had a delicious goat cheese to dipone gripe: we almost felt rushed through our dinner because of how quickly the food was coming out and how quickly the dishes were cleared

Was there for brunch and as most know, everything is in small portions here. So three of us ordered 9 entrees. Loved almost everything there. French onion soup dumplings, potato and goat cheese pierogies, Oreo pancakes, Armando's Chilaquiles deserve a special mention

The portions are small so make sure you order a lot of food. We ordered 9 plates for 3 people. The Oreo cupcakes are HEAVENLY! You should also try French toast and the soup dumplings.The chicken and waffles are over priced.

If there was a higher rating I would of given it. I knew if this place from a friend who has been here a few times and from being a big Chopped the tv show fan. I like to go to the restaurants that the Chopped judges work at or own. My friend said you have to try the Stanton Social you would love if and he was 100% right. He recommended the french onion soup dumplings and the scallops with risotto and both were cooked perfectly. We got a few other items like the short rib tacos, the chicken taquito the shrimp with paella and everything was simply amazing. I went with 3 other people, my wife and cousins. We had a great night with great food and we met Chris the owner who was awesome and treated us for a drink. I can't wait to go back. Beauty and Essex I went to a few months ago which is owner by the same owner and I would go to either one they both are AMAZING. Thank you everyone for making an evening with great expectations an even better night then any of us imagined.

Came here on a Friday night, and it was packed. I had been here for drinks a couple times, but not for the food. I had a reservation for 2 on OpenTable for 7:30pm, but the hostess said our table wasn't ready. About half an hour later, we were still waiting and then I asked the hostess how much longer it would be, and she said she didn't know, and that she was "sorry" in the most feeble way possible. Not great. It was a cold night outside, so they were blasting the heat by the door, which made it a bit uncomfortable to wait inside.Finally, a few minutes later, we were seated upstairs, wedged between two people on an uncomfortable date, and a group of women having girl's night. Hoookay. The decor is pretty modern and trendy, as well as the music. The music was actually almost deafening when we sat down, and even one of the Mexican waiters was like, "can we turn the f%$#ing music down, por favor?" Sí, podemos y debemos, my good man. After glancing at the menu, the dishes looked fairly creative and sounded good, albeit way overpriced. $9 for a side of fries and $19 for 4 small chicken fingers and a waffle seemed just a bit exorbitant, wouldn't you think? But that's New York, I guess. Nonetheless, we opted for the mac & cheese, octopus, chicken and waffles, french onion soup dumplings, and an order of fries. The meal started off with a complimentary shot of carrot and ginger soup with crème fraîche. Pretty tasty. The waiters actually came out with the dishes at a pretty meticulous pace, and we kept getting new dishes just as we were finishing up our previous ones. The mac & cheese was standard but delicious, the octopus tender and well-seasoned, the soup dumplings were very creative and juicy, and the chicken and waffles were actually done well, despite my previous decrying of the price tag.All the dishes were well-executed and the waiters were actually pretty attentive and friendly. The only things are that the value isn't good and this type of establishment isn't for everyone. Stanton Social was not bad, but I like Macondo on Houston better for tapas in a trendy, intimate atmosphere.

The Stanton Social basically affirms my belief that tapas-type places under restaurant direction lacking an all-encompassing, specific cuisine are generally not that great. Sure, the place has a few noteworthy items, but they aren't good enough to fill out the rest of the fluff on the menu.In the least creepy way possible, I often look around restaurants seeing if I could be friends with my fellow diners. I've never considered, nor (now after brief consideration) desired going around introducing myself to strangers sitting around me eating, but, I will say, a restaurant's crowd is usually a good measure of a place's overall worth.Along with food quality, ambience, etc., I try to analyze enough of a crowd so that I can properly crunch numbers in order to delivery an accurate rating to Yelp and its varied constituents. There's a method to the madness and a lot of behind the scenes advanced metrics that go into these reviews. To add some depth... sometimes, I'll be super excited to try out a new place, but, upon walking in, I'll make uncomfortable eye contact with the wrong person and subsequently decide that I wouldn't be composed and impartial enough to sit through a meal in his/her presence.Now that everyone's caught up, I wanted nothing to do with the groups situated around my table at The Stanton Social.  Between the painfully lonely, single women brunching and the double dates of couples cheers-ing overpriced mimosas, I could only wish that #BlackBrunchNYC would storm in and protest.  Not that I agree with anything remotely related to their misguided demonstrations, but I merely wished that everyone sitting around me was made to feel as uncomfortable and dispirited as I was throughout my entire meal.

This review is only for the bar upstairs. My friend and I were here on our last night before we left NYC, since it is Sunday night, the place as empty. We sat at the bar and tried out the following drinks:The Social Tea - Great summer drinkBasil-Lime Gimlet - My friend's favorite drinkThe Ruby Jack - Another great summer drinkNotorious F.I.G - I'm a big bourbon drinker and not really into mix drinks, however, this is my favorite drink of the night. Service is SUPER. Great place to have a date here.

I rarely give a restaurant 5 stars, but Stanton Social is way more than deserving! I am a very big ambiance person and although it may be bit tight in there, it is perfectly (dimly) lit and cozy, providing the perfect tone for a romantic date or a night with your girls! Very chic! I thought the menu was very impressive. Small tapas style and great for sharing. Portions are generous for this type of dining! My absolute favorite was the french onion soup dumplings. Ugh. SOOO GOOD. I loved every single thing I ate! DO NOT SLEEP ON THIS RESTAURANT!

I went here for my birthday and had a great time.  My friends from Charlotte had called ahead of time to surprise me with 2 bottles of wine.  They put cards in the wine saying happy birthday from my friends.  The food and atmosphere are fantastic.  It was pretty crowded and we had to make reservations about 3 weeks in advance.  We had a great time and great food.

Arrived eight minutes early on 30 degree winter evening for a 5 pm reservation and was "greeted" at the door by a rude staff member who acted like we arrived hours early, informed us that the restaurant didn't open until 5, and then slammed the door in our face.  He should have invited us in to sit at the bar or a table for a drink until our table was ready, especially because it was so cold.  Additionally, the restaurant could have made more money off of us for our pre-dinner drinks.   It was such a turnoff that we cancelled the Opentable reservation and walked around the corner to go somewhere else.  Rudeness is never excusable.  We have eaten here before and the food is decent.  It is convenient to the Landmark Sunshine, which is why we chose it, but with all the choices in the neighborhood there is no need to put up with such nonsense.

There were three of us and we were all excited to try it out, being big fans of Chris Santos.  I didn't think it was that great.  After seeing almost 2,000 reviews and 4 stars I'm starting to wonder if something is wrong with me!!  Maybe there is.....I asked them what they'd rate this place on Yelp and both said 4.  Oh well.Our waitress recommended getting 7 things and she was right-on with that.  They brought out a complimentary little cup of this carrot/coriander soup thing and I liked that a lot.  We ordered the snapper tacos, mac and cheese, pierogies, beef and broccoli, ribs, chicken and waffles and the meatballs.  I had to send the meatballs back b/c they were not cooked enough.  Everything was just "eh".  It wasn't blow-your-socks-off delicious like I was thought it would be.  I will say that it was better than Chili's or something, but if you're Chris Santos that's to be expected anyway, right? Surprisingly, we were all stuffed, but I really wanted to try the donuts because the pics on Yelp looked legit.  They were DELISH. That was the only really memorable thing about our meal.  Now on to the cocktails:  I started with Strawberry Fields and I was extremely disappointed.  It had no real flavor.  It just wasn't yummy and I was looking forward to a really yummy cocktail.  I tried the basil-lime gimlet after that and I was not impressed, either!  I was expecting to have as delicious a basily-limey drink as I did earlier that day at ABC Kitchen (yeah, for someone who doesn't drink, I sure did that day).  My friends ordered wines, so I can't comment. All in all, it was a let-down.  I crossed it off my list and I don't need to come again.

Came here on our first night visiting the city on a recommendation of a friend. After the first course we wondered how we'd even be full with a meal like this. Stanton Social showed us how! Food was incredible and service highly attentive. Would definitely return!
Sucks!!!! Worst service. Stay away!!!Rude bar, long wait with reservation and expensive. They want you in/out like Cattle.

Went here randomly for a dinner date with my bf. The place is really cute.. The menu is similar to beauty&essex format wise. I forgot what I ordered but I love the whole idea of getting a bunch of plates and sharing, so I enjoyed it. The place isn't as fancy as beauty&essex, but it's still nice. Seems like a good place for a date or groups.

Friday night reviewThree floor restaurant. We were on the third level, pretty place, tight seating, nice waiters and staff.We had...French onion dumplings....good but they brought us three dishes at once...and we had two of these when they were hot, which were great. But if you take your attention from this thing to eat something else the cheese gets hard and it's less appealing. Korean tacos...meat tasted burnt. Didn't taste kimchi.Greek octopus....meh. skip it. Tasted like beans and fish water. Pierogies...very good, slightly crunchy and gooey on the inside. The goat cheese creme was meh.Chicken arepas...tasted like smoke. Would never have known these were arepas if you didn't tell me. The chicken looked like cat food. Was meh. Drinks...cranberry flower...I swear it tasted like iced oceanspray. Didnt taste any alcohol. Wife had the gin cocktail which tasted like medicated soap.Dessert...donuts....very tasty....and theatre sundae...ice cream popcorn was a little weird but good.Overall was good, some things were tasty while other things failures. Well try it again.

Don't let the fact that it's a hip hot spot fool you into thinking it's only for the famous folks...the food here delivers!  Food is small plates meant to be shared and a great chance to get adventurous. You can also let the kitchen know that you'd like to have them portion out things so everyone gets to try it! Menu changes up somewhat depending on the season and it's large so you can go back again and again and never get bored. I especially love the Creole Shrimp and Grits and the Beef and Broccoil o rice cakes, but you can't go wrong here!

After hearing so much about this place I decided to take my girlfriend for brunch a few Sunday's ago. The food was food was good but I didn't get what all the hype was about. It was way too crowded, and it felt like everyone was on top of each other. the group eating to the left of us spent their time looking our way and pointing and referring to the food we were eating...needless to say I was a little annoyed. The young lady that sat us at our table seemed as if she was angry at the world that day, and it showed in her tone and movements. But the young lady that came afterwards to take our order was much more pleasant and attentive. Over all it was a fun experience but not my type of scene.

Summary:A great little hidden spot for some quality drinks in the LES.  Cool place to impress out-of-town friends.The Atmosphere:Very cool-chic in a small space above the restaurant part of the building.  They always have some event with one or two roped off areas, so it is a good spot for birthday parties with friends.The Drinks:The bartenders here get almost everything right.  The drinks are always on point.  However, something I can't quite put my finger on, the drinks lack a little something, that extra oompf.  I'm not talking about the booze content, but just that extra wow factor you see at other bars of this caliber.The Service:Very friendly, but somewhat inattentive.  I always got a good recommendation on drinks though.  Again, lacking that extra wow-factor.Overall, a great little bar with some quality drinks and a nice atmosphere.  Definitely recommend checking it out a few times.

The kind of gentrification in brunch that transforms your classic homemade breakfast specials and Mexican favorites. It is a trendy restaurant in the area if you are planning a day for NYC visitors or want to enjoy a nice dining experience.  If sharing tapas at the table, one must exhibit the art of savoring their one to two bite of delicious taquito, taco, French toast, etc (notice there're no -s). Enjoy it while it lasts... Service was decent for the most part. Most of the times, you would have to ask to have your coffee/ tea refilled. Also, try not to be greedy and accept a plate that you didn't order. That will show up on your bill. It happened to us, but as good-samaritans, we did not take the "extra" spicy lobster benedict; however, it showed up on the bill anyways. The charge was refuted and reversed by the waiter. Recommendations (in order of my taste): #1 Chicken n' Waffles#2 Spicy Lobster Benedict#3 French Onion Soup Dumplings #4 Red Snapper Tacos #5 French Toast Sticks with Nutella For a party of 4 foodies: 8 tapas is recommended Will I come back? Yes- in a year.

Stanton Social is a great late night eatery.  I remember really having a blast, but not much more than that (as their basil gimlet cocktails must have gotten to me).    With that said, I would definitely go back - as it was the perfect for dinner before a night out in the LES and the service was great.
The service and food were very good.  Get there early because it gets crowded and noisy after 7pm.  The Greek samplers were excellent.

This is a hip place. I was here in October for a friend's b-day dinner. It's tapas style. For a filling meal, order the sliders (those come w/ great fries) and the mac n cheese. The butternut squash ravioli was good but only 3 pieces were in one order.The drinks are good. Service was fine.

Can't say enough good things about this place.  Our table for six wasn't ready on time so we were brought upstairs to the bar and they comped us 6 martini's ($15 a pop).  It was only about a 10-15min delay until our table was ready.  On the way we ran into Chris Santos (owner and judge on Chopped) and he was the man.  Introduced himself to our whole party and then asked what name our reservation was under and said he'd make sure we got taken care of.  He sent over a bottle of champagne at the beginning of the meal and a great dessert at the end both on the house.  Made us feel special and was a great experience. The food was excellent as well.  I highly recommend.

Yum. Chris Santos has knocked this one pretty far out of the park. I'm sad to only give 4 stars, but if you know what to order, it's 5 stars. Go in groups, order a bunch of things, and expect to pay more than for your typical brunch (and get more too). Went w/ a big group and tried a bunch of things.Must order:-French onion soup dumplings-pierogies-bacon polenta (totally delicious and not too bacon-y)-Oreo pancakes-French toast sticksWould order again:-bagels and lox platter-chicken and waffles-philly cheesesteak sliderWouldn't order again:-ricotta fritters (although most of my table liked these)-breakfast bruschetta (idk, I didn't love the soft eggs and didn't find these overall that flavorful despite them having chorizo in them)-fish tacos: nothing special-banana pancakes: not banana-y enough!-spicy lobster Benedict: I'm not a huge lobster person, so maybe that's it. But didn't find it spicy or particularly flavorful. Overall, service was good. Drinks (mimosas and bellinis) were good - although my friend didn't like her Bloody Mary, wasn't spicy enough. Atmosphere is fun and casual despite it being on the upscale side. Would definitely go back (especially if it's a corporate card affair).

Are you from New Jersey? Want to go somewhere in Manhattan and feel right at home?  Welcome to Stanton Social!  (Oh, and feel free to replace New Jersey with Long Island, Staten Island or Connecticut.) This place used to be cool. I miss those days. Now it's where you bring your parents when they're in town from Great Neck. I will say the menu is worth suffering all of those suburbanite tools. It's comfort food served with an haute cuisine flair. Nothing better on a rainy/snowy New York night. Those French onion soup dumplings live up to the hype. Too bad this place has become such a tourist trap.

Was the best meal we had in New York. The chicken and waffles and French onion dumplings were amazing! The Korean tacos were our least favorite and I wouldn't order them again, wish we would have tried the Peregois they sounded great! The service was very friendly and atmosphere was very nice!

I was in town for work, and my colleague and I stopped here on our last night in town. We made a reservation, but we were running late and were still seated very quickly even though the place was quite packed. The menu was explained to us, our drinks were never left empty, and the food came out with great timing and very hot.The food was unbelievably good as I always expect in NYC. We ordered the red snapper tacos and the Mac n cheese to start both of which were awesome. Followed by the chicken n waffles and the Philly cheesesteak sliders , and the warm donuts for dessert. Everything was very, very good! The mood of the restaurant was very cool as well and they play great music! I would definitely recommend to anyone!

Came here bc we love Beauty and Essex. It shouldn't be compared! Sat down, the leather booth was ripped in two places. Asked for a new seat, got ignored. Awesome, got a snag in my tights. Food was so mediocre and overrated. Reuben was so saucy, no taste of the meat. Chechen and waffles tasted like frozen food. Ribs were served cold twice. Told the waitress and she wasn't too concerned. Honestly such a disappointment. Bussers do all the work there, hope they are compensated!

Wow! Everything ordered was amazing!!! We ordered the Mac n Cheese, chicken and waffles, short rib tacos, goat cheese pierogi, tuna poke tacos, eggplant puttanesca, basically everything on the menu and not one item disappointed. Had a hard time not dancing to the music - even that was awesome! Must check it out - will not disappoint!

Loved this place! A friend recommended it as a happening place in the city and she was so right. The music was amazing (actually, we all wanted to get up from the table and dance!) and the food was phenomenal! Definitely coming back!

Stanton Social is a great scene, with pretty good food.  Loud and crowded almost every night of the week, this is a great place to take people visiting from out of town (visitors I take always love it).  Cool place for a date too but just don't expect being seated in a quiet corner.  Worth noting that they pack people in here so lots of the tables are pretty close together and it can feel like you're on top of the people next to you.  Honestly it has never negatively affected my experience there but just something to be aware of going in.The food is slightly overpriced for what it is- don't get me wrong I think most of the tapas are good but they aren't exactly life changing.  You pay for the happening scene and nice decor more than anything.  Last time I went we got dessert shots - hot chocolate with tequila and birthday cake milkshake with vodka...little shots but seriously delicious.Definitely make a reservation and be prepared to wait at least a little while even if you come on time for your reservation.   Love the music the play here.  Lastly- dress to impress!

Believe all the hype. This place is quintessential New York. Trendy, loud, tasty. It was the perfect venue to bring out of town visitors on a Saturday night. I made a reservation weeks in advance knowing that my cousin and friend were going to be visiting and I'm so glad I did. The place was packed to the max (can people even walk in and get seated? doesn't look like it!)Obviously the tapas are what everyone raves about because that's what Stanton is built on. So many different varieties, and it's not your typical Spanish-style small plates. It's pretty much unabashedly New American-style tapas. The potato and cheese perogies were to die for, obviously so were the famous French onion soup dumplings (it's a spoonful of soup inside of a dumpling- genius!). We also all shared the red snapper tacos (fresh, a bit spicy in the best way), lamb gyros, cobb salad bites, the DELICIOUS mac n cheese, and the scallops. I absolutely loved every bite of food I took here.This joint also has some pretty stellar cocktails, all of which really packed a punch. I feel like I was really getting my bang for my buck here. Great music, friendly wait staff. If you're ready to start your New York night out in style, look no further.

I haven't been to Stanton Social in years but when I returned for a friends birthday dinner I was pleased to have another lovely experience.  The coat check is readily available and all the staff were very professional.  A patron at the table next to me was b****ing about being too cold and the staff was very accommodating for her.  I'm in love with a cocktail on the menu, the strawberry fields, it's a little on the girly side but I could drink about 20 of those puppies.  As mentioned the menu is small plates but it makes for a great group experience if you like to share.  The bar upstairs is a cute spot for a drink too!

Overall a good experience but there is a lot of hype for this place. Not a good place if you want an intimate dinner but definitely one for a girls night out. The noise level is loud so I recommend going around brunch time? I can't imagine it being the same. Favorite dishes were the french onion soup dumplings, red snapper tacos, and the kobe beef burgers.

The decor is nice, and that's about where the value of this place ends. The food is overpriced and bland. My table ordered 6 different dishes to share and all of them were horrible. There are so many options in the area, and this one is forever crossed off the list.

Stanton Social was a pleasant surprise. I came here for a double date on a cold Saturday night and all I really knew going in was that the food was tapas style. I was happy to learn that they were American tapas instead of the normal Latin food you would see on such a menu. This was especially a fun experience for a double date because we got to sample different foods and discuss what we each liked.Between the 4 of us I think we ordered about 10 things? I was stuffed by the end and I think we could have been comfortable with a little less food, but no regrets. My favorite items were the french onion soup dumplings and tuna tacos. The kale caesar salad was excellent as well. Also I LOVED the birthday cake shot at the end - it was one of the best tasting "desserts" I've had in ages and I wish every meal ended with one. Only two minor complaints. First, we had asked for the chorizo on the side for our mac and cheese (had a veggie in our group) but our dish came without it, and we had to wait a bit to get the side of meat. Not a big deal. Second, the girl who was sitting behind me at another table had no concept of personal space and kept banging into my seat when I had no room. Obnoxious but not the restaurant's fault really (unless they could have rearranged the seating a bit).Definitely a fun place to come with a small group or a date. It is a little bit dressier than I expected (i.e. maybe wearing Uggs wasn't a great choice) but not overly so.

I don't usually like tapas, but the food was great. Very creative plate ideas. The seating was a little crammed and we were hitting elbows with people at the other tables, but overall it was a great experience.

What a wonderful place! Went here for a date night with my boyfriend tonight to expand his horizons. We had an 8:30 reservation, but based on previous reviews with waiting times, we decided to go early. We were seated immediately upstairs in such a fancy dining area full of dim lights and candles...perfect for a date night!This place serves tapas style, sharable food. Heres what we had:-Red snapper tacos (soooo good...a little goes a long way-french onion soup dumplings (least favorite...but still good in my opinion)-chicken and waffles (lawwwd jesus YOU MUST ORDER THIS!)-birthday cake shots (a must try)-warm dougnuts (amazing without sauce, but only liked the rasberry sauce..made it taste like buttered  toast with jelly)All in all it was a great evening. Helpful staff. Great ambiance. I would definitely come back!

I love it here! I came here twice so far. It's not cheap & cheerful & there is no bottomless brunch special but the food and service is great! The French onion soup dumplings are so good. Sliders also very good!Great crowd, fun environment

Excellent food, excellent location and excellent service. Visited Stanton twice in a month before writing this review and im glad i waited since the first time was for a industry event and you know how that goes, cant write a review for free food.Arrived at 12:30 with no reservation and were promptly seated. The waiter came by and explained how the menu works for brunch and suggested 4-6 plates to get the full experience. We decided on 4 since prices seem decent but they will not fill you up.Ordered the oreo cookie pancakes and as a good waiter, asked us if we wanted that at first or at the end of our meal. we said at the end since you want to keep the sweets at the end so they don't cloud the palate for the rest of the food.Also ordered the eggs benedict and the egg tacos. The benedict was great, it came with a salda in between the eggs and it contrasted well with the bechamel sauce that came with the eggs. The tacos, were a bit small and just plain.Drinks here tend to be fancy and for around $13 each you must at least get one.The decoration is trendy, flashy and so nice for a nice date or two.

Yum!Attended a company event here and had a wonderful time! We got to try a series of appetizers and entrees including the following:- Ahi Tuna Tacos: delicious! A little small, but wonderful nonetheless.- French Onion Soup Dumplings: EPIC. How do they get the delicious soup into that dumpling and smother it with cheese? I will never know the magic behind this amazing dish. Be sure to use a fork when plucking it out of the serving dish, as these are very delicate!- Butternut Squash Ravioli - awesome, awesome, awesome- Salmon with Pesto and Carrots - delicious!- BBQ Ribs - didn't try this but heard it was very good- Cinnamon Donuts with dipping sauces - was so full by the time this came around, but I couldn't resist. Absolutely wonderful!The restaurant also served a blood orange jalapeno margarita that was absolutely amazing. Loved that they handed us freshly baked chocolate chip cookies on the way out as well!

Went here for brunch. They serve small plates. 4-6 plates recommend for two ppl to share. The food was good. We had social Mac & Cheese, Spicy Lobster Benedict, Fried Chicken and Waffles, Red Snapper Tacos, and Oreo cookie pancakes. So the pancakes, chicken and waffles, and Mac & cheese were the shining stars in my opinion. I like the small plates concept so that I can try a little of everything lol. Nice atmosphere. Would definitely return.
Came here for jazzy brunch. While everything is good (both brunch and dinner) the pastrami quesadillas were unforgetable

food is delicious. went couple of times in a large group, and almost every dish was awesome.  however its pricey- the dishes have "tapas" sizing but you may not guess it from the prices.  atmosphere is cool but service was super slow on both occasions.

The blood orange-jalapeño margarita (jalapeño-infused Milagro Reposado, blood orange juice, fresh lime, Cointreau). I really enjoyed my drink here, the ambiance is more on the intimate side with the lights dimmed. I actually like that when I am drinking, it's a nice spot to catch up with a friend and share secrets, haha. Anyway, the first drink was not spicy enough so I asked the bartender if he can make it spicier which he had no problem doing. Sometimes when I ask other bars to take it up a notch, they don't want to do it for some reason, so extra points for Stanton Social for not having a problem with it!

I use to be a fan of Stanton Social - took all my friends, family, and hit up the place during special occasions., but boy was I disappointed on my last visit. The once beloved Pierogies in that luscious truffle sauce was served cold, and I had to ask my waitress to change my silverware twice because there was gunk on it. Our french onion soup dumplings had cheese that was congealed and the inside was luke warm at best.  I was not happy, and to make it even worse it was my dad's birthday. So sad to see this place go downhill. I had really high hopes for it.
Went here for brunch. Had the perfect Bloody Mary and the food was excellent. The atmosphere on Sunday was casual yet sophisticated.
One of my favorite spots in NYC. Always feels like a special, celebratory time when I'm here. Must get the french onion soup dumplings!

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants. I'm from out of town but I always make sure to go to Stanton Social when I am in Manhattan. The pierogies and the French onion soup dumplings are their signature dishes, but they are not over hyped. I mean french onion soup in dumpling form? Who wouldn't want to eat that. This is a tapas place but any of the dishes I would eat for a full meal!

This place puts you in an instant good mood when you walk in because the music is always great (and loud). Keeping in mind that the portions are tiny because it's a tapas place so I would suggest 5 items per 2 people. Call me crazy but they may have the best roasted carrots I have ever tried. The red velvet twinkles are an absolute must. It's a hip, loud, young and underground spot that's suitable for young professionals.
absolutely amazing food. great service. good atmosphere. reccomend it to everyone i know!!

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! I came here with my Dad when he was visiting from out of town and we were both astounded by how delicious everything we ordered was. The presentation of the food was amazing- I'm not a big food photographer but I had to take pictures here! The french onion soup dumplings are to die for, and unlike anything I've ever tasted. The beef wellington was super rich, cooked perfectly and definitely worth ordering if you like steak and/or foie gras. I still have dreams about it. Chicken and waffles were buttery, perfectly sweet and delicious. This was my first time trying chicken and waffles and I doubt I will find anywhere else that compares. We also ordered the Nori Spiced Tuna Poke Wonton which I was worried would be too spicy, but they ended up being perfect. I'm obsessed with this place and can't wait to go back and try more of their unique dishes!

3.5 stars for brunch. Great setting in an awesome area with fantastic service and live jazz when I was here. Food however, although original in conception is very average in execution/flavor and establishment is crowded. Price was not justified by value in my opinion.Food: french onion soup dumplings are a cool concept, but the dumplings themselves are overrated. I'm actually not sure how people can possibly like them so much, unless our order was a one time preparation miss. Our serving was too dry, had small portioned fillings, and just weren't that tasty. The perogies were the best dish, but still very average. French toast sticks were good but not satisfying due to small plate portions (again, not the restaurant's fault, but not good value for the price)Service: wonderful. attentive and knowledgeable servers. what you'd expect and more from a restaurant like thisAmbiance: A+ minus the crowdedness

Ok, let's see...what have I had here that wasn't good. Oh, that's right, nothing. I've been here a bunch of times and without fail it's always on point. The food is just great. Notable dishes: The ever famous French onion soup dumplings. Believe the hype, they're that good. Red snapper tacos were delicious. The snapper was fresh and the avocado and spicy mango complimented not overpowered the fish. Spicy lamb souvlaki. Just order it, you'll thank me. Braised short rib tacos...what could be bad about braised short rib? It was tender, juicy and a taco. They took a pedestrian dish like tacos and stepped it up to gourmet. Spanakopita is one of my absolute favorite greek dishes. I love the combo of feta with spinach. I liked the lemon aioli but still prefer my spanakopita with tzatziki. Kobe beef sliders - for once a slider that wasn't dry and disappointing. They're great but if I can make it at home I'm not inclined to eat it at a place like this. This dish, along with the herb dusted frites is a solid choice for the picky eater friend. You can't go wrong. The beef Wellington. Awesome. Who is turning down filet mignon with foie gras and mushrooms all wrapped in puff pastry? Who? Only a fool, that's who. The filet is cooked to perfection as is the puff pastry. If you're not too full and can swing dessert get the donuts. Actually order two orders because you won't want to share them. Light and sweet these babies are delicious. My favorite sauce was the raspberry. It's not too heavy like the chocolate and caramel. The red velvet twinkles...well it's a Twinkie and it's red velvet. If I have to elaborate you don't deserve one.

There is not much I can say about The Stanton Social that hasn't already been said. But based on my experience MUST trys include: PierogiesKale SaladFrench Onion Soup DumplingsChicken and WafflesWarm DoughnutsItems that were just OK:MeatballsChicken ArepasRed Snapper TacosHappy eating :)

Came here on a tuesday night and it was super packed. Even with reservations, i waited about 15-20mins. Most of the food was phenomenal! My guest & I got:French onion soup dumplings - they looked so good when i watched another table eat it but personally i think its over-rated. Maybe the one we got wasnt as hot as it was suppose to because it wasnt "string cheesy" when i was trying to take a dumpling out.Red snapper tacos - great. Crunchy & flavorfulMini lamb gyros - my favorite thing that night. The bread was so soft and warm. Lamb wasnt gamey, so so delicious !Short rib kimchee tacos - too salty. Short rib was chewy. Greek style octopus -horrible. Dont. Bother. To. Order.  I was extremely disappointed when this dish got to my table. It was last dish and i was craving octopus. Side of mushrooms - great. Flavorful, sweet, savory.  YumChicken & waffles - its my first time and i must say its interesting.I would definitely come back and try the rest of the menu.
Fantastic restaurant and you MUST try the French onion soup dumplings, they're out of this world good!

At review 1902, I don't need to tell you much about this place except this...If you like a loungy environment where the food is better than average (4 Star), the drinks are on point, the buzz is loud and the service is friendly and fun then you have found your home here.Some nights I like the music to be loud enough that I can hold a raised voice conversation with my company or nod my head and zone out...Stanton Social provides this.They played Kanye and Jay Z's "No Church in the Wild" during dinner....I was sold!
This place is beautiful. The portions are quite small but delicious. The red snapper taco was my favorite. A great place for a date.
Food is amazing. Pierogies were my favorite along with the movie theater sundae. Nothing short of amazing. Can't wait to go back!
The jalapeño margarita is the best! Have never had anything and it's delicious :) the French onion soup dumplings are a must, as  well as the tuna tacos. But really, everything is great.

All the plates were totally delicious. Make sure to get the French onion dumplings and perogies. The donuts at the end were fantastic. As far as pricing goes, if you have a few drinks, you are looking at a few hundred bucks for 2 people.

My girlfriend and I came here late one night for dinner. The food was amazing and the ambience is very dark and loud. If you are looking for a first/second date this is not the place, as it is very loud. If you are however looking for good food, trendy night spot than this is the place. The tapas plates are amazing, 3-4 plates for two people is more than enough. After that you can hit one of the many bars in the area.

Only thing that made me change this to 4 stars is that the "grade" for the food safety thing is pending and we saw this as we were leaving!  Kind of unsettling. With that said, the food was great.  The service was great. The drinks are good. There was nothing to complain about other than it's slightly cramped. I hit at least two waiters and another one from our party hit two waiters as well.  On accident of course :)We had a party of 8 but the food came out quickly and consistently....and of all the plates we ordered (there were A LOT) maybe two of them were so so. I recommend the French onion soup things, their quesadilla, fried chicken and waffles, edamame, hot donuts....I can't even finish because I don't remember all the names.  Bottom line, GO!!

Two main points:1.)  Food is meh.  Small, relatively flavorless bites of overpriced ingredients.  Had a group of 6 so we had a chance to try a few of the menu items.  Dumplings were better than average but is the only thing worth highlighting.  Left hungry and disappointed.2.)  Service is sub-par.  Rude from the second we walked in as though they were doing us a favor by allowing us to dine.  Food was very slow to arrive so don't show up too hungry.  One of those restaurants whose rating is a mystery to me.  On a good night I'd imagine 3 stars at most.

Max 2.5 stars. This place is over rated and over priced and the quality is not up to par. It's akin to a tourist trap.Reservations need to be made a few weeks in advance for Friday and Saturday nights if you want to eat at any decent time. Sure, many restaurants work that way, but this one is not worth it at all.Nothing we ordered was every worth ordering again. Red Snapper Tacos - too salty, everything is chopped up so finely I don't taste fish or mango or avocado. The flavors are akin to red snapper tacos you could order at an Appleby's.Fresh Onion Soup Dumplings - great concept, but not great execution. 6 deflated dumplings made with caramalized onions inside, topped with a vat of melted crispy cheese and a crouton in each one. Way too sweet and I don't even know why. Flavor is ok and that's about that. Greasy.Spanakopita - this was probably the best thing we ate. Not everyone liked it, but I did. Does not take the shape of traditional spanakopita, but is essentially 2 egg roll shapes cut into four pieces total. These egg rolls are fried and stuffed with feta and spinach cheese. Didn't like the egg roll wrapper, just ate the inside.Meatballs with manicotti - no one liked this one. Why are all of these dishes sweet I don't get it? The manicotti stuffed with ricotta in particular was just so blah. It seemed like store bought pasta with store bought ricotta and store bought sauce.Oreo Twinkie - small, not enough for one person, not really oreo at all, barely any chocolate, and super sweet.The best part was the complimentary teeny tiny parsnip soup they served in the beginning.Ambiance isn't great, way too loud, way too crowded, way too expensive. Poor quality. So not worth it.
The service I received was great and the food was amazing with the exception of the short rib taco. It was incredibly salty. I wouldn't order that. But everything else we tried was very good.

Amazing food and great atmosphere. Make sure you make reservations or you'll have to wait forever. Went here for our anniversary and have gone back several times after that. Will defiantly be a regular spot for us. Everything we ate was amazing.

Awesome spot in a great location near many great restaurants and bars. I've been here twice - once for brunch and once for dinner. I recommend both especially the brunch.  Its probably once of the best brunch joints I've been to.  For brunch we ordered the buttermilk waffles, huevos ranchero tacos (i love a good ranchero), french onion dumpling soup, stanton social kobe beef sliders, mac n cheese with chorizo, spicy lobster eggs benedict - side note.. this was divided for 4 people lol. To wash it all down we had their house mimosas and the bloody marts and some coffee. For dinner I started with a cocktail that had jack daniels called Ruby jack, pretty good and strong while waiting to be seated. For dinner we started with the tuna wontons followed by a platter of sweet oysters. For entrees we shared the Korean short ribbed tacos which were delicious, the chicken taquitos and split their famous "sexy" burger cooked medium rare.  The tacos were delicious and very very tender.  The chicken taquitos were ok, the ends were a little too crispy and the burger was great.. and i wish i didn't split it. For sides we just had the seasoned fries.. which were great. I def would recommend this spot and will be returning back for brunch of course :)

Great restaurant overall. Few things that I can see be a turn off to some:-music is too loud so very hard to hear the person next to you-music selection seems like my playlist back in the early/late 90's-very strict about seating your party if everyone is not there-some dishes were overly saltyThings I loved:-chicken and waffles were amazing-french onion soup dumplings are as good as everyone raves about-donuts were a nice ending that I recommend-drinks were delicious albeit a bit on the pricier end of the spectrum-decor was cute/cozy (with that being said it was slightly too dim especially when in the restroom)-dishes were a good size to share

I went here for some tapas and cocktails with 3 other people! Everything we ordered was amazing and well times. I was blown away by the French onion soup dumplings , potato-goat cheese kanishes, red snapper tacos, and the butternut squash ravioli (best ravioli I've ever had!). The dessert was even more amazing: s'mores cup. You have to try it!

Bought 2 brunch vouchers from Amazon local at a prize of 75$ each . Before we visited the place yesterday, Stanton Social changed its terms and conditions so that the whole group had to eat the same things and couldn't choose different dishes.Best example how customers are being ripped off. Also there is nowhere the info that you have to order from a reduced menu and not the normal one. Portions were a joke and again completely unclear how they count. 5 mini pancakes for 4 people based on 2 vouchers? How many pancakes would you get based on 1 voucher, 2.5???? Same applies for cinnemon buns and other dishes.We were very upset and would never go there again, nor could I recommend the place to anyone else.Waiter said the conditions are set by Amazon and could not deal with our comments around the situation we were facing.NB place is also very noisy. Nothing for a someone who is looking for a relaxed atmosphere.

The food is good; however, service is bad. We didn't allow to sit until all of us arrive. The hostess told us to wait upstair at the bar and no one greeting us or say anything to us. A busboy took our plates away and started cleaning the table when we not even finish eating. The place is really small. People keep walking around and pushing our chairs. the music is way too loud. Me and my friend will never return to this place again.

They have an upstairs bar where you wait for your table. I had a well made Grey Goose martini. We were celebrating my daughter's 23 birthday, 5 of us.  There all small dishes to share and it adds up pretty good. We did have quite a few cocktails as well. We had the followingKale Caesar salad. Very goodPizza was. Not greatOnion soup dumpling. Imaginative and very goodPierogi. Very goodKobe sliders. Over priced and not tastyRigatoni bolonese. Not greatMeatballs. Touch bread not greatMac and cheese. Pretty good not greatDeserts were ok not greatDonuts were a must have. Surgary donut with dipping sauces chocolate raspberry or caramelCreme bulle. EhOverall a fun place but could be notched up a bit on the food5 people about 100 per person with  tipPS when you come for a birthday. They could make it feel more special
Amazing food, great cool vibe and awesome service!   I'm so glad we found this place.

I love picnic style eating and I love Stanton Social!  We came with a group of 7 for a birthday and although we played some musical chairs in the beginning, we ended up getting situated in the balcony section which was pretty perfect and removed from the hub bub of the main dining section.  I wasn't too sure how we were going to order tapas style for our party of 7, but turns out, everyone ordered 1-2 dishes, and they just bring out 7 of each item so everyone can taste!  We ended up ordering around 10 dishes so we tasted a LOT!  Everything we had was really good, but the standout items were the french onion soup dumplings, the fried chicken and waffles, and the barbacoa tacos!  For dessert, we had the warm doughnuts (mmmmmmmmmmm) and the birthday cake milkshake shot.  Perfect way to end dinner!  Definitely want to come back for the brunch or just because!
Delish and a great atmosphere, but plates can be pricey, go with people who don't mind light meals or get ready to pay a major tab.

Mac & cheese was amazing.  Philly slider was great as well.  Just don't come alone like me (traveling), b/c there are many interesting small plates to try.  A 4.5 for me.  The jalapeño margarita was stiff but really tasty.

Great fun bar food, and good vibe but POOR DRY AND BITTER DRINKS ? Everybody ordered French onion soup dumpling :)) Yumm Yumm ! Chicken waffle with maple cheddar sauce is one of the best chicken waffle I have ever had so far. Surprisingly satuee kale is not bad at all :) The drink....hmmm it's really bad ? Watermelon ginger Magarita is way too bitter and dry to even have 2nd sip...my sister ordered some tea cocktails was even more bitter than fried kale ... I just want to say WHAT HAPPENED? The complimentary chilled soup ... The couple sit  next to us were observing me when I drank it. The moment my eye brows congested, they laughed and said " hahaha!!! I had the exactly same look as you when I drank it' no wonder it's free!!! "L O L

One of my favorite NYC restaurants.  Small plates, everything tastes great.  Don't miss the Pastrami Quesadilla - sounds weird, it was spectacular.  The Ahi Tuna tacos were so good, had to order a second batch.  Warm Nutella donuts at the end - WOW!  Great atmosphere.  Also, tried it for brunch on a Sunday.  It gets packed so make your reservations.  You won't be disappointed.  AWESOME!!!

I would have loved to have tried a house cocktail at the upstairs bar, but the bartender never approached me. I stood at the bar for about 20 minutes waiting to be acknowledged while watching other customers approach and be served. Even the bar back went out of his way to avoid eye contact so I wouldn't ask him for anything. I would expect to wait a while on a weekend but this was a MONDAY night.
