I understand that it was busy at the time and maybe, just maybe, the bartender didn't see me. If this was the case in a bar this size, perhaps there should have been a second bartender on duty (Or at least a bar back who knows how to greet customers). Despite the great atmosphere and music I decided to leave. I would return to try dinner in the downstairs dining room, but I will not return to the upstairs bar. There are so many other places in town to get a good drink AND good service.I'm sure a restaurant/bar with such a great reputation can do better than this.Side note: There were at least 15 people standing in line for the bathroom, and people are going in 2 (or more) at a time for about 10-20 minutes each. C'mon now, SS. You had several security guys working that night...

This is hands down my favorite restaurant in all of NYC. I love the ambiance. Whether you're looking for a date spot or a place to meet the girls, this place is it. It's super trendy, so be prepared for the snootiness you usually find in the Meatpacking District. You must have a reservation or expect to wait forever. Also, friendly note, if you do have a reservation and you're running late, they will only hold your table for 15 minutes, and then you'll be debased like Lindsay Lohan trying to get into the newest club. Seriously though, they don't care who you are, if you're late, you lose. This happened to me ON MY BIRTHDAY and I'm still giving this place 4 stars, which is saying something. The food is spectacular. They can't do anything wrong. The french onion soup dumplings are their signature dish and cannot be missed. Their beef wellington is also uh-mazing. Really, you can't go wrong with anything on this menu. My favorite part is that every item is a small plate, so you can order a bunch and try a little of everything. And trust me, you'll want to.

Food is definitely the winner here.  Ambiance is definitely for the trendy, a little small and can be noisy on some days I've heard, but we went on a Sunday and it was fine.  We were a party of 3 and sat in one of the side booths, it was perfect.  Portions are little smaller, so be prepared to order lots, but most everything was very good, maybe not spectacular.

Food was very very good and creative. French onion dumplings A+, scallops and tuna tacos great, several of the other tacos were very nice too. Lamb gyros and sliders average. Ambiance was chick and modern w a lounge feel to it... I really liked it.  Drinks were average although I didn't order anything from their special drink menu. Service was a bit substandard and the reason why I'm giving it 1 less star... Probably a 3.5 would be warranted but bc the food and ambiance was so good I'll give them a pass. I just think they should pay more attention to detail. I mean it's not like the place is cheap and we aren't paying premium price for the food. Our waiter was kinda slow and lacked charisma nor ability to keep us attended without us having to waive at him for more water or drinks. Also, some of the other workers that pass along the table to grab dishes and bring others should be better trained in this type of establishment. They literally handed us some of the plates instead of putting them on the table... And we had to pass them the used dishes too. I mean who does that on a high end restaurant. I know the place was full but still attention to detail is imperative in this sort of place so for now 4 stars... I'll give them another chance and update my review hopefully to bring them up to 5 instead if bringing them down to 3 or worse

Great restaurant with a lively atmosphere. Some might think it a little loud, but we had a great time despite being the oldest people there; and we're in our mid 40s. The drinks were all well made. But the star of this place is the food. It is a place that serves small plates so our group of 4 ordered about 9 different items. One of those items was Beef Tenderloin, nobody makes beef tenderloin anymore, but they do and it's wonderful!!!Guess what, they were all excellent. We had a great time at this wonderful restaurant.

Omg omg this place was amazing and you MUST GO!!!! I had heard the restaurant was good but not expecting it to be this great.. My favorite dishes 1. Tuna wontons 2. Goat cheese perogies 3. Lamb gyros 4. French onion dumplings 5. Shrimp and grits for dessert the smores creme brûlée was out of this world.. I would seriously go back just for that and of course the donuts were great too per yelpers suggestions!! I am going again ASAP bc I need to try everything on the menu!!!!!

I was very impressed by this restaurant.  There's some very interesting architectural details, which makes for an even better atmosphere here.I came here on a Friday night with a group of 6 with a reservation and although the place was packed, we didn't wait longer than 15 mins. They sat us at a lovely booth. The food was fantastic and the service was great.  The portions are small b/c the restaurant's menu is all appetizers meant for sharing but I guarantee that you will enjoy everything that you order.  We chose several dishes and shared and we loved everything. My favorites were the mac & cheese, tacos and dumplings. Our bottle of champagne was pricey so our dinner cost was higher than your average dinner but it was well worth it. I will be back here again.

Great for larger groups that are going to be having lots to drink.  A very upbeat vibe both upstairs and downstairs.  Charming wait staff.  The food however, much too greasy and carb-laden for this palate particularly as I was not having too many drinks.  Grease and carbs are the perfect pairing for heavier drinking.  Perhaps it was our misfortune to have been using a Gilt City coupon, but one would think that the fare served would be attempting to woo prospective patrons.  Nothing was particularly impressive/memorable...that taster's menu was simply too bland and as stated before, greasy and carb-laden.
Salty, bland, greasy food.  Probably goes well with lots of drinks.

More of a 3.5.Came here with the Amazon local deal.  It was a lot of food for $75, and two drinks per person.  Our server was very friendly and prompt, and the ambiance was nice.  Our food was overall OK:-Cinnamon buns were really tasty, and we have 6 mini ones.-Banana pancakes were really good, especially the banana and walnuts.-Chilquiles were OK.  I guess I've never had amazing chilaquiles, they're always soggy and underwhelming.-Kobe sliders.  Also OK - a little too salty for my taste, and by this point we were feeling full.-Taquitos.  Pretty good, good portion size too.  The sauce was nice.-Mac and cheese.  Pretty good too.The drinks were not great.  The bloody marisol and mojito were really underwhelming.  It's probably better to go with the champagne, which seemed of good quality.Again, a lot of food, and somewhat mediocre drinks.
Perfect choice for group of friends or couples! Make sure to order the French soup and the potato gout cheese! All the dishes are to share. A place worth coming to!

What's the rave about??? Sorely disappointed with this place.  First, the hostess and manager.  We arrived promptly at 6 for our reso. We were a group of 6 but one person in our party was running a few minutes behind. They refused to seat us and wanted us to go upstairs to the bar. Had to throw a little fit - place was empty when we arrived. The manager explained that it throws off the kitchen because they would have to "start a meal" when he arrived.  Does he know this is a tapas restaurant? He then went on to explain that they had a reso behind us at 8:30?? Serious??  I said all the more reason to seat us now.  With a nasty attitude the hostess said "well alright then, let's go."  Not a good first impression.  Second, the food.  It wasn't that it tasted bad. It was just teeny tiny and not inexpensive.  So you need a lot to feel like you had a meal = $$$.  Several of us ordered the big sexy burger hoping that would be enough to fill us. We expected big and sexy (as it was named) and got small and tasteless - nothing sexy about it.  $18. Tacos were basically bite at ~$3 a piece.  You get about 5 ribs for nearly $20.  Insane to me. The only really yummy item was the soup dumpling.  Everything else was fairly generic.  Nothing special and definitely not worth what we paid - just over $500 and we went a few blocks and had to get more food at San Gennaro.   The highlight was our waitress - she was patient and helpful with the menu.  I know it's NY and I don't mind paying up but really? Plenty of good vibe places in NYC with real people size food.

The Stanton Social is one of the best restaurants in New York by far. After ambling around SoHo all day, I was eager to sit down and eat at Chris Santos' esteemed restaurant. To my family and I's dismay, there was an hour wait. So, we went up to the lounge where we enjoyed a few cocktails and the DELICIOUS French onion soup dumplings. The dumplings were French onions stuffed with bread, with a thick French onion soup gravy poured on top. They were absolutely amazing. Chris Santos then came up to our table and talked to us for fifteen minutes. I was ecstatic since I'm an avid Chopped fan. Chris Santos was the most genuine guy and he had us seated right away. He then brought us complimentary gazpacho which was amazing. We then ordered an assortment of food. I liked how the restaurant's menu was all appetizers meant for sharing. It really brought a family aspect to the very chic restaurant. We ordered tuna tacos, a Philly cheesesteak, a dozen oysters, the summer squash ravioli, the red snapper tacos, and miso glazes mushrooms. First, the tuna tacos were delicious. Individually wrapped in a crispy wonton, stuffed with fresh ahi tuna, and topped off with avocado, cilantro, and wasabi peas. They were amazing. Next we had a dozen oysters and topped with the mango chutney, they were the best oysters I've ever had. The Philly Cheesesteak wasn't my favorite thing on the menu but it was still pretty tasty with a twist of truffle and goat cheese fondue. Some things are just meant to be kept classic. The Summer Squash Ravioli was amazing. It had the perfect balance of flavors between the doughy ravioli, crunchy squash blossoms, creamy ricotta, rich buerre blanc, and bitter basil. The red snapper tacos were recommended to us by the waiter and they were amazing. The creamy avocado complimented the spicy mango perfectly on top of the red snapper. Lastly, for a side we had the Miso glazed mushrooms. As an avid mushroom fan, I was very excited. The mushrooms were delicious and very rich complimented with the miso and mint. Overall the Stanton Social was a success. Their amazing appetizer style menu really brought a family element to the chic ambiance. Everything we had was absolutely delicious and next time I'm in New York, I'll definitely be stopping by.

I hadn't been to Stanton Social for years, so I assumed that I had reviewed it once before since this is the place where I met one of the greatest loves of my life back in 2009. Anyway, it felt a little different than before. Granted this time I was here for brunch instead of dinner, but still, the crowd was very different than what I was used to seeing here. I can also say that the food felt different. While the drinks still remained VERY good at $14 a pop, the food all left something more to be desired. The lobster roll slider was ok. The Red Snapper Tacos were actually very delicious and very light, but their so called "signature French Onion Soup Dumplings were a messy miss. Anyone that has ever had a real soup dumpling would be appalled by anyone calling what they serve here a soup dumpling because it really isn't at all. Anyway, unless you want to smell funky cheese steer clear of these. The best things we had for brunch were the oreo pancakes, the drinks, and the red snapper tacos, mixed with some smooth Jazz and we still had a very nice brunch. Enjoy.

Such a fun vibe! This place is what I'd consider to be 'lazy clubbing' because the music is good and very loud, basically what you would hear in a night club, but you're sitting at tables eating delicious tapas.  That being said, it is very loud making conversations a bit difficult and the drinks aren't great (think watered down and uninspired). The food is very creative and given the portions,  its great for sharing.  We tried the following:- French onion soup dumplings which were a fav all around and not overly salty,- pierogies - decent but my Oma's are better- French fries - solid, comparable to the Meat Ball Shop- meat balls - nice presentation and a good sauce- s'more creamer brûlée - not good, it lacked any resemblance to either of its namesakes- donuts - the dipping sauces were great and the donuts are made to order, a huge plus!I would go back for a special occasion and with a large group, but for a quiet night out, this is not the place to be.  Definitely make a reservation!

Initially went in Aug 23rd. Came here for a birthday celebration on a Sat night. It's was too crowded for my taste. When you walk in to get to the hostess stand, you can barely get there because there isn't enough room for people to stand who are waiting for their table, same issue I had at Beauty and Essex.  The bar is upstairs where they ask you to wait, INCONVENIENT to say the least. The place is very chic but a bit noisy. As for the food, it's set up to share plates. We were three hungry women so our server suggested 5-6 plates: Old School Meatballs: pretty good but not greatFrench Onion Dumpling: interesting and the most popular dish there. We didn't love it. I wouldn't order it again. If you love French onion soup then you need to order this Philly Cheesesteak Slider: probably the most poorly executed item we had. I had two bites and stopped. It was pretty badMacaroni and cheese: w/o the bread crumbs I would have loved it, just too manySweet Tea Ribs: Hands down the best item we ate! BRAVOShrimp and Grits: the second best item. Grits were super creamy, shrimp were seasoned well and cooked to perfectionBarcocoa tacos: Holy moly!!!! Okay so the last three dishes might be a tie for the best.....Every single dessert was OFF THE F$&(;@? CHART!!!!!!! S'mores Creme Brûlée: OH GEEZ... I dream of this thingBirthday Cake milkshake Shot: AN ABSOLUTE MUSTStrawberry Lemondae sundae: nice, light and just darn good

Perfect date night! If you go on a Friday be prepared for a very well dress good looking crowd. This place is very nice good music live atmosphere great drinks!! The waitress was very friendly. She suggested we do about 6-8 plates since it was two of us. Depending on how hungry you are I guess that would work But honestly that's just way to much food even though the plates are meant for sharing. We did about 4. Plus a desert. If you must try anything it would have to be the Mac and Cheese!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE the ambiance and live music in this place. I went here for Sunday brunch. It wasn't too packed which was great. You won't regret the French Onion Dumplings and the Caramelized Banana Pancakes are amaaazing!I must say $7 for ONE slider is kind of a rip off though.Will be coming back here soon - hopefully dinner.

It was one of my favorite restaurants circa 2008-2009. It has been a while since I have been back, and it didn't disappoint! I went to brunch this past weekend, and had a great time. The neighborhood was a lot more lively than I remembered. We got there around noon and got seated promptly for our noon reservation. A lot of the popular restaurants don't take reservations, so it is definitely a plus! Four of us ordered 7 things to share: french onion soup, pierogi, chicken and waffle, huevo ranchero taco, pizzetta, banana pancake and spicy lobster benedict. All very good and fun to share. We didn't drink and were totally stuffed. The total damage was very reasonable (like $27 per head before tips). Definitely recommend it for both brunch and dinner now!

I'm a HUGE fan of pierogi, as I'm Polish, and these are a MAJOR disappointment. Nasty bar fried bs unfortunately. And cold when they came out less than 5 minutes after ordering. Must have gotten leftover. I would look over it, but the atmosphere is all douchebag when I came for a late bite near 12am. Only plus is they serve this late. Pickled veggies are at least a decent portion, but all salt. So gross! Spicy margarita is good. Totally sad that a decent chef attached his name to this place. 2 stars is for late food and a decent drink and lots of pickled veggies, though all salt.

Overrated. Pros: Food is tasty (at least, some of it). Waitstaff is friendly. Cons:Host/Hostess: Clueless about how to host in a restaurant. Totally rude and unaccomodating. Reservations are hit or miss at best - you could be waiting in the bar for an hour, as I have before. Food: What came out tasted reasonably good, except it was all cold. The hottest thing that was delivered to the table was dessert. Not a joke. Noise: The place is energetic, which can be fun, but its impossible to speak to anyone at a table in the middle of the restaurant with 6+ people. Skip Stantion Social and try Beauty and Essex. Similar experience, but better all around. Oh, and hot food for a change.

went on Saturday Sept. 6th with a 7:00 reservation for 4 - we were seated right away. I didn't think the music was too loud and I loved the setting.  The server explained the menu and said the plates were for sharing, he recommended 8 plates for the 4 of us.  We ordered the the goat cheese pierogies, the  onion soup dumplings, the chicken arepas, the chicken taquitos, the mac & chesse, the kobe slider, the steak & cheese slider and the chicken & waffles.for dessert we split the warm doughnuts.  We all really like the food and felt there was enough for everyone - we weren't stuffed but we didn't leave hungry either. I would recommend this place for a fun night out

This place is seriously overrated.  I really don't understand the reviews.  My boyfriend decided to surprise me with a fancy dinner here so I'm actually a bit sad to give this place such a low rating but the truth must come out!+ service was good+ seated immediately with a 9pm dinner reservation+ decor was impressive as well+ drinks were tasty+/- everyone is dressed up (thank goodness I wore a dress!)- portion size is tiny, even for tapas, 3-4 bites per plate- price per tapa is $10-20 each- mediocre food- LOUD - mostly huge groups screaming and music pumping- crowded, especially with birthday and bachelorette parties- left with big check and half-empty stomachs (we ordered 5 plates for 2 people)Tapas ordered: red snapper tacos, quesadillas, meatballs, french onion dumplings, slider.Unfortunately, the french onion dumplings (6 small dumplings) that everyone is raving was a disappointment... the couple on our left AND right ordered them as well but I personally prefer the actual soup over these dumplings.  The ONLY plate I thought was amazing was the red snapper tacos but 3 bites for $11, nooo thank you!So if you're out to party with some friends in a gorgeous venue with relatively quick service, this may be your place.   But if you are here for the food or on a date, I highly recommend looking elsewhere.

It's safe to say this is one of my favorite places to eat. The food is out of this world. I highly recommend making early reservations if you like to have a conversation & eat, as the night goes on it gets extremely loud with the dj pumping awesome tracks. The Social Mac & Cheese, Goat Cheese Pierogies, & the mini Philly Cheese sliders are our all time fav (notice the cheese trend) oh yeah and be sure to order the fresh donuts for dessert, they are to die for.

I made a reservation for around 15 ppl for my wife's 30th Bday. When you reserve with large parties you choose from a pre fixed menu. The vibe was nice and the music was good. I really enjoyed the baked Spanakopita and the chicken arepas. The grilled caprese style pizzetta was tasty! We all enjoyed all the food and will def going again. Even if you have a small party MAKE A RESERVATION!

Came here for a bachelorette dinner this past Saturday night. It was loud and crowded, and everyone dining was incredibly good looking. Is that a requirement to eat here? I think everyone was dressed to go out afterwards, because most of the girls were wearing dresses. The music is loud but fun, makes you want to dance at dinner. The service is great as well. Our server explained everything is small plates, but if everyone in particular wanted something, than we could order more of that particular dish. There were 6 of us, so our server recommended to order at least 8 dishes. We got the:-pierogies (must get)-red snapper tacos (must get)-wontons (must get)-french onion dumplings (good)-mac and cheese (good)-kobe beef slider (only 1 per serving, so order your own if you want one; good)-taquitos (OK)-lamb gyros (mehh)-meat balls (didn't eat)-beef and broccoli (didn't eat)dessert: doughnuts (good)I would definitely recommend for a fun dinner!

Went here after checking out the yelp page since the menu looked pretty good. The atmosphere is very nice, perfect for a date. At the waitress' suggestion we ordered 5 different plates (tapas style). The plates that were especially good were the French onion soup dumplings and the Mac and cheese with chorizo. The only reason I won't give it five stars is because the food wasn't incredibly memorable. All in all it was a nice experience but there are definitely better places to have dinner for the money.

Went in for a drink an appetizer. There is a large restaurant area downstairs and up the stairs a bar lounge. We sat at the bar and ordered 2 rounds of cocktails and edamame. All were delicious and the bartenders were friendly fast and informative. The patrons and employees were all upbeat and dancing to the music. The place looks fancy but there was a great mix of people In there and a good vibe. Def will come back again

I had my birthday dinner here last weekend w my best chicas, and it was fabulous from the cocktails all the way to dessert.  You must try the bourbon braised ribs, shrimp and grits and lamb tacos, as those were my favs!  I'm am not a dessert person, but oh my..... the birthday cake "shots" were absolutely phenomenal.  The music was a great touch of 80s and 90s dance tunes!  Let's just say we have already set our return date to this hip establishment....enjoy!

I loveeeee this place. love love love. My mom was coming into town for my birthday so I made a reservation for the two of us at 6:30 pm (since she doesn't live here and only new yorkers eat dinner at 9 pm). My bf was supposed to be out of town but ended up being around so we had to change the reservation but surprisingly, could only get a 6 pm res. I mean, I get it, it was only a few hours prior. Little did I know how PACKED the place was already going to be that early. I was really surprised. I had looked that menu online prior to coming but wasn't really sure what to expect. Seemed pricey for small plates/tapas. I half expected it to be kind of lackluster food but it had such good reviews that I kept some hope. We were sat right away in one of their cushy round booths and all ordered a glass of wine. We asked our server how many tapas she suggested for 3 people and she said 7-9.... seems a bit much but we ordered around that amount just in case, plus dessert. Here's what I thought about the food:French onion soup dumplings: DELICIOUS. Do not skip these when you come here. An absolute must.Pierogies: Yes. They are fried to perfection and the goat cheese inside melts in your mouth.Baked spanakopita: also yummy. Loved the aioli sauce that came with it. Grilled caprese style pizzette: Also good, but my least favorite out of everything.Skate wing fish & chips: Fried to perfection. The "chips" are actually like a hash brown under the fish. Unusual but really tasty.Summer Squash ravioli: Also not my favorite, but still very good. For dessert we got the s'mores creme brûlée. VERY sweet but so so good. There were luckily 3 little individual ones..just enough sweetness for each of us.On top of the good food, the service was great. Very attentive and fast. The food came out pretty quick, too. No complaints here.The atmosphere was dark and trendy, and as the night went on it got a littleeee darker and the music was getting a littleeee louder. I would most definitely come back here again. Fo sho.

Went there while on business Trip in 11-2013. Very "nicely furnished" place with bar upstairs. Frequentes by mostly good looking People and ...models. The friendly staff is not only pretty but professional and quick. Our waitress knew "everything" about every course. The food was "petite" but tasty! The music (as seemingly all over NYC) was on club level volume, which made conversation a bit exhausting. There's only ONE bathroom, wich is situated in clear sight of everybody, wich makes waiting in front of it a bit awkward for the ladies. But I loved it and will go again!

I came here with a group, and it was the perfect atmosphere for that kind of outing. Everyone loved the food, and we got to try a lot of different things. However, I'm a bit fussy so I didn't eat everything - shared plates are obviously not the best choice for a picky eater. My favorite was the pierogies in a truffle sour cream. Mmmmm...

Great restaurant for groups, each dish can be shared and the menu has a variety of options. My personal favorites were the snapper tacos, arepas, chicken and waffles and the goat cheese appetizers. Highly recommend this place, food is terrific.
Great food and solid service. Bar upstairs makes better cocktails. Philly Cheesesteak Slider was a big hit. Mac and Cheese was too salty. All in a great experience. Will recommend and return.

While in town on business, I met up with an eternally hip friend who moved to the city a couple years back. She suggested Stanton Social, and even just by its general profile -- small plates, intended for sharing -- I had what were likely overly lofty expectations. Arrival was simple, though the hostess did give us a brusque "Give me a minute" when we tried to check in on our reservation. Tucked away in LES, the inside was effortlessly cool in contrast to its cramped entryway. We sat at our table about 4-5 minutes after we initially checked in with the hostess. While the table was small, it was comfortable. And lord, those menus... Here's what you need to know:FRENCH ONION SOUP DUMPLINGS: if you just go for one item, this must be your choice. Crispy dough balls filled with the soup (what?) smothered in Gruyere and topped with crunchy croutons. The first bite was hot hot hot, but at any temperature these are phenomenal and are the sole contributing factor to my overlooking any element of anything less than stellar. BAKED SPANIKOPITA: ya know, I'm not the biggest fan normally, but damn. They weren't very greek/Mediterranean, but they were delicious and satisfying. Buttery, flaky, cheesy AND flavorful (the last descriptor generally being the missing element). Well done. POTATO & GOAT CHEESE PIEROGIS: also not normally something I seek out, but I liked these more than the spanikopita. The creamy goat cheese is always a recipe for success, especially in this plate. AHI POKE WONTON TACOS: the least impressive. This was the item I wanted the most, being an Angeleno who loves fish. Generally I've found that raw fish in New York is not as good as on the west coast (don't smite me, east coasters!)OLD SCHOOL MEATBALLS: the surprise hit of the evening. Second to the French onion soup dumplings, these were the favorite. Tender, juicy, savory and creamy. I expected dried out IKEA meatballs, but damn. There were only two sadly -- my only complaint. Trust me on these, they are a delight. Get them. WARM DOUGHNUTS: as an avid donut seeker who has tried everything (including the newest Wow-Nut, aka waffle donut), these were more churro balls than donuts. That being said, they are so worth it. They come with three sauces: raspberry, caramel, chocolate. The caramel was best and most churro-complimentary; raspberry was a fun tart coating; chocolate was not made for these donuts. Skip the chocolate. BLOOD ORANGE JALAPEÑO MARGARITA: done. Spicy, unique, fruity without sweetness overload. Recommended... And I've tried every spicy drink there is. I can't wait for my next trip to New York so I can try more at Stanton... And also so I can get two plates of French Onion Soup Dumplings for myself. BACK OFF MY DUMPLINGS!

Tried to go back. This time Kevin was the manager. Stressed-out-Hostess made us wait until the whole party arrived and we lost the reservation. Previously they changed the reservation as needed and pulled chairs up for latecomers....Me: Kevin, we had a great celebration here earlier this summer and would like for this birthday to be just as fantastic. 2 hours for a table of four is not a great start.Kevin: We have a lot of birthdays here. I have a hard job making everyone happy.Me: #ByeKevin #thatswhyitscalledajob
This is a really funky, fun place to visit on a Friday or Saturday night. It's a young persons hangout. Food is good not great but you go for the experience

I will repeat my review I wrote on Trip Advisor. If you are coming from out of town this place is acceptable. You are able to make a reservation at a cool location in the LES almost the same day. However, given the neighborhood you are in,when you actually venture to the LES, there are so many other places you can go that are better. The food here  tastes like it was thawed out from a sysco truck.In summary, this place is so passé and they know it. Go someplace where the people are down to earth and treat you well. That is the real NYC experience.

Unbelievable. We had 7 people for dinner at 845 on a wednesday. The place was packed. My friends ordered cocktails: cucumber/vodka, basil/vodka and jalapano while my friend and i split a bottle of Malbec. We ordered the following dishes: kale salad, red snapper tacos, beef and broccoli, mac and cheese, perogies, mini gyros, scallops and risoto, mini lobster rolls. Everything was fanatic and full of flavor. Each of the plates came in 7 small pieces so it was perfect for everyone to try everything. I would 100% go back. Order the beef and broccoli- you will not be disappointed.

I am not understanding how this place has such a high rating. I highly regret going here for dinner. First of all, it's very hard to find. There's no sign outside and it doesn't stand out. The decor is very nice, I'll give them that. Once seated, they told us that they recommend a table of 2 to get 5-6 small plates to share. We weren't that hungry so we got 3: The hand-pulled chicken arepas, chicken taquitos, and the braised short rib soft tacos. Each dish had 3 bites on it (literally each piece was one bite. Not 2 or 3 bites. ONE bite). Along with 2 cocktails, the bill came out to 90 dollars. WHAT? For 9 pieces of hors d'oeuvres? One of the dishes, the arepas, was just garnishes on a ritz cracker. I am not exaggerating here. They also took 30 minutes with my credit card. I saw it just hanging out on the counter. We had to go ask for it so I could sign and leave. Awful dining experience.

Upscale Hooters:The first thing I noticed about this place is that it had an all female wait staff dressed in low cut short dresses. While the overpriced small portion tapas food were OK, the wait staff was arrogant and rude. Our server abruptly took my wife's wine ($70+/bottle) before she was finished while swishing the remaining wine in the glass. When she returned we pointed out what she had done, she went to the bar and returned an empty wine glass to "prove" that it was empty. It was apparent that she was just trying to rush us thru the meal.

#TrendyThat's the perfect description of the Stanton Social and all that is has to offer.  We walked in and the place was jam packed.  Women in dresses, men dressed to the nines.  I, of course, was rocking sleeveless and comfy jeans, but really didn't feel underdressed at all.  The Stanton Social has a very warm and inviting atmosphere.We sat down, and per usual, it was a tight squeeze.  Not a complaint, but just a little side note.Let's get right to the food shall we?Kale Caesar Salad: I'm completely on the fence with this one; between like and love.  There was a smokey flavor on the salad that I loved, BUT the salad was blatantly underdressed.  Chicken Arepas:  Beautiful presentation and nice flavor.  The dish was spicy, but not overwhelmingly to the point that I didn't enjoy each bite.Fish and Chips: This was my favorite dish...1) because it's fried and 2) Because all of the flavors worked very well together.  The dish consisted of fried chunks of skate and sat upon perfectly fried "adult tater tots".  Adult simply meaning they were much larger than average tater tot.  They were topped with a homemade tartar sauce, and it all just worked.Beef Wellington: My only complaint; I wish this dish had been served on it's own.  By the time we had a chance to get to it, it was already a little cold.  BUT this dish is shining star.  Perfectly, and I mean perfectly cooked and exceptional flavor.  I would highly recommend.Dessert: This fried little donut bites. Clearly it was my cheat day from my normally impeccable eating habits....totally worth it on every level.  The donuts came with a raspberry, caramel, and chocolate dipping sauce selection.  All were packed with flavor and the perfect complement.I would happily come back here, but be forewarned, a speciality cocktail will run you $20 a pop.

Social yes happening yes, great food yes, excellent drinks and service yes. This place is has great food great drinks and great service, what more can you ask from a local spot. went last Thurs to hang with a few friends for the birth of a baby boy, love the spinach roll appetizer. If you are looking for a great night out check out the social.

This place was awesome! I mean really good. Went Friday night with my date and another couple. Had the recommended French onion soup dumplings, pierogies and a few other dishes.  s'mores creme brulee for desert. Service was spotty although our waiter was really busting his ass to accomodate. The food made up for it. I only hope that by the next time the quality will remain!

So, I've been to the Stanton Social a few times in the past but all before 2009. While I've always loved the actual venue and ambience, I found the food to be kind of overrated. I dined here last night with some girlfriends, and I was pleasantly surprised. This time around (and based off of Yelp reviews), I ordered differently, and have to say I really enjoyed the food as compared to the past.You can't be seated until your entire party arrives just FYI. But they have a nice bar upstairs where you can wait in the mean time. Our reservation was for 8:30pm but the rest of my party didn't show until well after 9pm. The place was super busy but they accommodated us without hesitation. We were seated at around 9:30pm at a cute table right by the window. The place gets pretty loud but our spot was nice + cozy. There were 4 of us and we ordered French onion soup dumplings (kind of amazing), red snapper tacos (tiny, cute, and delicious -- although a tad fishy), beef & broccoli (couldn't spot the broccoli but interesting + pretty good), California style veggie burger (I loved these but some of my non-veggie loving friends weren't the biggest fans), Philly cheesesteak (so good), the Social mac n' cheese with the chorizo on the side (I'm a huge mac n' cheese lover so while this was good, I didn't think it was amazing; it's also really heavy), and the grilled summer squash ravioli (yummy). I wanted to try the fried chicken + waffles...but I think I was the only one ha. I'll try them next time. I would def order the French onion soup dumplings, the veggie burger, and the Philly cheesesteak again. Also, we were stuffed by the end of our meal but my friend ordered the S'mores Creme Brulee -- 3 come in one order, which we ended up sharing anyway. I wouldn't have ordered it on my own but they were SO good. Def recommend.Our server, Danny, was great -- he was attentive and friendly. He offered to adjust our plates to include 4 of everything bec most plates came in quantities of 3. Food came out pretty quickly -- usually 2-3 plates at a time. And given that we were all medium hungry, we def ordered just the right amount. Good food, good music, great ambience. I'll be back!

Went here for my gf's bachelorette party dinner.  There were about 15 of us or so.  Service was great - very accommodating for such a big party (and I think we were running late too) and food came out fast.  Ordered a lot of different tapas and I thought all of them were tasty, I forgot what we ordered but i remember everything was good.

We had a reservation for a Friday night and good thing, it got pretty busy after a while. Tables are cozy, though I felt they were a bit too close to neighboring tables -- maybe that's to encourage the socialization among people. Still felt too close for my comfort. Food was great! We had 5 dishes as suggested by our waiter, including the famous French onion soup dumplings. Those were very good, along with the ravioli. I also really enjoyed the s'mores creme brûlée, cute shots of chocolate and a toasted marshmallow topping. Nothing to complain about service, though the other parties at the time created such a din I could hardly hear myself think, let alone hear what my partner was saying. I would go here again but maybe during a quieter hour.
Have the pierogi, arepas, and French onion soup dumplings!!! And bring lots of friends to enjoy the most variety of dishes!!

My husband and I got married at Stanton Social less than two weeks ago. We were supposed to get married at reBar but it closed abruptly in May, 2014, leaving us little time and money to plan another wedding. I was devastated that we lost our money and wedding venue and the thought that we may not have a wedding at all. After a week of feeling utterly miserable and sick, my husband and I began to look for another wedding venue.Upon hearing of the closure of reBar, Stanton Social immediately attempted to help the effected couples by offering to host weddings at a greatly discounted rate. I had been to Stanton Social on several prior occasions and loved it. I was overjoyed when I learned they were offering to host weddings at discounted rates. My husband had never been so we decided to check it out together.We met with Stanton Social to discuss possibilities for our upcoming wedding. From the start, they were incredible--so incredible that we literally did not believe it was even possible that people could be so helpful and generous, particularly after what we had been through with reBar.  I kept saying it was too good to be true and that something was bound to go wrong.  Stanton Social kept reassuring me that, while it may seem to good to be true, it really was true.  After our first meeting, my husband and I decided to book our wedding at Stanton Social--the venue were great, the food and drinks were delicious, the staff was full of energy, and they were more than willing to work within our limited budget. They were so responsive to all my questions and their organization was such a relief that I, a control freak, felt totally comfortable letting them coordinate the details.The event coordinator, Natalie, and the manager were so eager to ensure that our wedding would be special and fabulous. It was so apparent that they genuinely cared and wanted to make things right for us.  As we planned the details of the wedding and worked with Stanton Social, they continued to go above and beyond what we expected. They not only gave us an extremely discounted rate but also added complementary food and drinks options. Again, it just seemed too good to be true.The wedding day was completely flawless! The ceremony was beautiful and the reception was so, so perfect. The staff was absolutely amazing.  They worked so hard and many of our guests told us how impeccable the service was throughout the night. The food and drinks were excellent and the staff made sure that my husband and I had food and drinks throughout the evening. We literally could not have asked for a better or more perfect wedding.Since our wedding, my husband and I have already returned to Stanton Social for dinner and we will surely be back again soon. It's a fabulous place with wonderful service and food and people who truly care.  It's also been rated one of the top restaurants in New York.   You should totally visit this place--you are sure to have a wonderful experience!

Love, love, love this place. Came here initially on someone's recommendation of the French Onion Soup Dumplings on a cold Sunday night. The dumplings lived up to the hype, as did every other tapas style dish we tried. Each dumpling is an explosion of deliciousness in your mouth! After my first experience here, I've come back to this restaurant using a GiltCity voucher and on several other occasions simply for drinks and a few small dishes at the bar. The first time I came here, the waiter recommended we have about 6 plates among the two of us (two girls), so the bill definitely adds up, but every dish I've tried here is incredible and worth the money. The Kobe Beef Burger may have been one of the best I've had. The old school meatballs are very good as well. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese, but the Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies are still one of my favorite dishes on the menu. The presentation of the food is fantastic, the atmosphere is very chic -- dim lights and loud music. Perfect date spot, or to simply go and hang with friends. It gets very crowded at night, so I recommend a reservation. Even when I came here on a Sunday evening around 7pm, there wasn't an empty table in the place. The restaurant is two floors, with the bathrooms and bar on the top floor. Definitely one of my go-to spots in Manhattan!
Went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Food was incredible, and just the right amount before the group of us went out that night.

Drinks in the bar are good.  Food is delicious and fresh.  Had the spinach filo dough wrap thing.  Beef taco in corn tortilla, shredded pork on a cracker, kale salad, flat bread with tomatoes and arugla, prorogues' and French fries... And they were all outstanding.  The food was hot upon delivery and very tasty. They do not serve individual  plates...its group serving so if your party arrives after the dishes have been selected /ordered...you are so screwed. Haha!let me explain clearly. if you come with a party of 4 and 5 more ppl arrive...after the meal/tapas have been ordered,they only serve amounts for the party of 4 not the party of nine.  and if they have changed their ways...just be sure to check your tab before you pay...okay?

Holy Moly!Perogies and the french onion soup dumplings were amazing!! The bill? not so much. Definitely a place to treat yourself and your girlfriends. Its pricey but its the city so what can you expect. I will be coming back again ;)

Highly recommend this place for brunch.  Food and service was incredible!Small portions (tapas style kinda) were tasty and delicious.  Service was great.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Definitely coming back next time in NYC.  We were incredibly pleased with everything.  Music was a bit loud for brunch time but not unpleasant.

Last night was my third time back and it was as delicious as ever. If you're there early for your reservation then go upstairs and grab a few cocktails while you wait.  Their drink menu is really creative. I wanted to try all of them but only made it to four of them. (Some are pretty strong!). Dinner: everything is small shared plates which is something I love to do. We always start with a seafood platter is there one. They don't let you switch anything out though. (We aren't huge fans of raw clam but if you add enough mignonette it's not too bad.) Definitely get the Kobe beef sliders, French onion soup dumplings and their herbed French fries. So flavorful!  Oh and don't forget about the Mac & Cheese, red snapper tacos and if you still have room, chicken and waffles!!  Enjoy the culinary adventure and make sure you go with people who don't mind sharing.

Fun place! Went there for brunch, it's your typical american/nouveau eclectic restaurant.  The food was SO good. Got the lobster benedict, the french onion soup dumplings, the french toast with nutella and the best of all... the OREO pancakes.  Beyond good.  Great place for a group of people looking to share a bunch of little plates with chic music and nice decor.

3 1/2 stars. First dinner spot in NY after my arrival from LA. Originally had reservations to ABC kitchen but did not work out so made reservations last min at Stanton. The inside is real nice, dim and glamorous but casual. There is also a small upper area for more lounging and grabbing a few drinks at the bar upstairs. Since we did not have reservations we did not get to sit in the main dining room but was fortunate enough to be seated more in a quaint corner near the door. The girl hostess were not that friendly and the service was pretty bad. Especially since we were tucked in the corner it was hard to get some service. The pictures and reviews looked great, but sadly our experience for the first night was disappointing and unpleasant. The food is tapas style, and let me say tapas in NY is way smaller than tapas in LA!_Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies ($10). Caramelized onions, truffle creme fraiche. A popular dish and I can say it was well deserved. Comes in 4 small sizes of lightly fried potato balls with gooey and warm goat cheese inside. A bit on the heavy side but great to share with a person or 2. The truffle creme fraiche though!! was the highlight. You can taste the truffle creme, light and airy and the caramelized onions add a nice sweetness to it. _Red Snapper Tacos ($10). Creamy avocado, spicy mango. Comes in 3 small crunchy shell tacos. Generous amount of red snapper. The flavors were well balanced and refreshing. The spicy mango added a nice kick to it and did not take away from the red snapper. We ordered 2 of these since they were the best dish that night. _Kobe Beef Burger ($8). One small slider of a burger. Came with a few chips that were not even necessary. The meat itself was juicy and tasty but it was real salty! the bun was warm and the good amount of cheese. That's about all I can say for this small $8.00 slider._Old School Meatballs ($14). Basil & ricotta 'manicotti'. This was the most disappointing. 2 meatballs that were good but texture was mushy and overall dish reminded me of Chef Boyardee instant food. Very plain the small pasta underneath was overly cooked and tasted mushy as well. $14 for this dish made me want to cry. What a waste!I did not even want to stay for dessert. Stanton you let us down! :(

Well-liked neighborhood date/drinks spot doesn't disappoint in my mind. The food was creative without being too 'out there'; the bar scene on the second floor upstairs was pretty relaxed and a solid place to start out; and the service in general was attentive. One complaint: too many tables jammed next to each other downstairs (I felt I was interacting with both couples either side of me, having three simultaneous conversations). Still, overall had fun and will likely go again.

Recently took some out-of-town guests to the Stanton Social for some great food.  Have loved this place in the past but was incredibly disappointed this trip.  I think it has better food than it's sister property, Beauty and Essex, though I prefer the ambience at Beauty.  Stanton was MUCH louder and more crowded than I recall. We were seated promptly and at a good table.  When the waitress arrived I wanted to order only two items to start so as to pace the meal.  She specifically stated that we should order everything at once because their chefs would absolutely parse it out.  No sooner did we order than two plates arrived, followed immediately by two more.  We had four plates taking up the whole table after I especially asked not to be rushed.  Then the last two entrees arrived.  We ordered wine and drinks, as well as dessert.  While I was eating desert, literally a spoon in my mouth, a manager came by and dropped the check  on the table. Hadn't asked for it and hadn't even been asked by the waitress if we wanted anything further. Check was practically flung on the table. Upon paying the bill i wrote a comment on the card about the service/experience.  To their credit, a manager came over to discuss.  While he apologized, it didn't particularly seem sincere - especially given that when he offered to buy us a drink to end the evening on a positive note, he did not want us taking the table any longer and asked to buy us a drink in the ridiculously crowded (read fire marshall capacity), standing room only, bar upstairs.  I've been to a lot of restaurants in NYC and on a friday night no less.  I have never been as rushed as I was at Stanton.  It obvious how badly they were trying to turn over guests.  The table of two sitting next to us had paid their bill and were having a quiet chat whilel finishing their wine.  The manager came up to them and "encouraged" them to leave as well by inquiring what further he could do for them. It was just such a blatant push the whole evening.  Incredibly disappointed if this is the new standard for the Stanton.  Not sure I'll be back.
Highly inventive food in the LES.  This is the best place to come as a group and try many small plates.   The best are the French Onion Soup Dumplings and the Red Snapper tacos.  Make reservations.

Everything was absolutely delicious! Went with two of my friends and we ordered the Brussels sprouts, baked spanakopita, french onion soup dumplings, the mac & cheese, and the sliders (Veggie slider, Pastrami slider, and Spicy Italian Sausage & Peppers). For desert we each tried a milkshake shot and the red velvet twinkie, both were delicious. Make sure to call or go online well in advance to make your reservations. Will def be back!

Went on a double date with my best friend and we were looking for a "gastro tapas" place that did not look cheap and was different than the usual fake Spanish wine bar and if you're looking or the same, this place is definitely the right spot. Although I would recommend to make a reservation (especially for dinner during the weekend), you will be amazed by the food you'll get. The prices are a bit high for tapas but it is worth the money. We ordered a selection of 6 tapas and I definitely recommend to get the French onion Soup Dumplings and the Potato and Goat cheese Pierogies that were just amazing. The menu is so long that you want to order anything but also make you want to come back to try them all. The portions were large enough to share with 4 people and the service was good. On top of it, the music was not as loud as I was expecting after reading some reviews and we could actually talk to each other without screaming. So just go and enjoy upper-class tapas with your GF or BF!

First time I came here I loved this place with the good and music and environment. But this time I had a reservation and they close at 100 am. Reservation was 1130 and I showed up at 1140. The host said he sees my reservation but they closed the kitchen since we are late. He had a terrible attitude. On top of that the service is pretty bad and the waiters are very snobby. Amazing food though if you're willing to deal with assholes

I had dinner Stanton social for very first time the dishes excellent did not disappoint me I loved all the food and the atmosphere and my date was pleased with the food looking forward to returning only thing be prepared the place is very noisy and loud

We went on the recommendation of friends.  I liked the atmosphere, ambiance and service was fine, but food was just meh.  We had their "famous" french onion soup dumplings which were overcooked and chewy.  Scallops were ok, pierogies were good, and brussel sprouts were undercooked.  I can't speak to their cocktails, I only had a glass of Malbec which was fine.

Overpriced and crowded.  Our table was 5 inches from two couples on either side of us.  Not an enjoyable or relaxable atmosphere.  The food was decent, not spectacular.  The sliders we ordered were cold upon receiving them.  I just think this is one of those trendy places that's good for sorority girls or yuppies who go because the chef is mildly known for some reason I don't care.

I went with my mom, her friend, and my boyfriend for dinner one evening. I had been warned by other Yelp reviewers that the place would be rather loud, and they were right. We weren't seated for a good 25 minutes, and then got put upstairs where I swear the music was even louder (no one likes Party in the USA with their meal).Cocktails: I have to say I loved mine, but I cannot remember which one I ordered unfortunately.Food: I let the Yelp reviewers help me out with my selection, as I ordered for the entire table.Chicken & Waffles: YUM. Very good, wish I had had more!Edamame: Nothing special. I've had funky edamame before, but the group seemed to like them.Pierogies: A MUST HAVE!!!!!!!!! Cannot stress this enough. Thank god for the yelp reviewers because I never would have ordered them. Red Snapper Tacos: really delicious and fresh. Chicken Arepas: I didn't manage to snag one unfortunately, but I think it was the least-liked dish during the meal. Celery Root Ravioli: this was actually surprisingly really tasty, I loved it!Scallops: hard to go wrong with scallopsBrussels Sprouts: I've had better.
Food was delicious. Setting was perfect. Gets really noisy and then it becomes hard to hear the people you're with. Other than that cool place.

We had a large group and decided to try out this location.  We were a little late for our reservation so did have to wait an extra hour for a table, but the manager on duty was incredibly diplomatic about it. I would suggest arriving on time for this place (especially on a Saturday night). From what I can tell you would still have to wait, just not quite as long. Also, your entire party has to be there to be seated. Once seated, both the service and the food were amazing!  The food is all served family style, and if you have more people than each order comes with, you can add extra serving a la carte on many of the dishes. The french onion dumplings were so good! They are served in little trays usually reserved for escargot, and I could eat more right this second! Also something that stood out was the shrimp and grits. They are individual with two shrimp and a grit patty underneath. Definitely a treat. while the atmosphere of this place is charming it is also fairly loud. We sat upstairs so had a DJ blasting music the entire time and downstairs seemed just as boisterous.  Regardless of the wait and the loudness, I had a great time and look forward to returning to this place for round two. Thanks for reading and enjoy!

I don't know if we loved Stanton Social because we had no expectations of the place before we went but it was really great.  I didn't know what to expect food wise or atmosphere wise but I would highly recommend this place. We went at 8 pm on a summer Friday and were really pleased with the atmosphere.  The restaurant was loud but not so loud you couldn't hear your table talking, it was almost loud above us.  There are a ton of large tables for groups and I see why so many bachelorette parties go here.   We didn't know what the food would be like but it was American tapas, so it was nice to try tapas that weren't Spanish for a change.  While all the food that came out was in mini form (each item was so cute and teeny tiny), it was definitely enough to fill us - they pack each item. We ordered: Tuna Tartare Wontons (3 per dish)Red Snapper Tacos (3 per dish)2 Lobster Roll SlidersThe Salad on the menu, forget the nameMiso MushroomsGoat Cheese and Onion Perogies   (4 per dish)We loved everything.  The highlights for me were the mushrooms, snapper tacos and perogies and I was more than full when we were done.  Our service was fine and I would go back here or recommend it.
Excellent food and drinks ! Bartender upstairs was excellent. Hostess downstairs very rude

I have been to this restaurant multiple times and I had a great experience every single time. Both my wife and I enjoy the food and service there. There is a bar upstairs which is fantastic to start your night out and then just stroll down to the restaurant for the best food. Great romantic spot and small plates are perfect to try all different types of dishes

The wait was ridiculous, but well worth it. My friends and I made the mistake not making a reservation on a Tuesday night. They told us the wait would be an hour, and we decided to wait it out by having a few drinks upstairs. The food was amazing. Every time I took a bite of the food, it was like a huge explosion of flavor in my mouth. SO. DELICIOUS. Everything here is a bit on the pricey side, but it's worth the hole in your wallet. I will definitely come back again!

I haven't been here in a very long time, so when I went for brunch I was curious if the reputation still held up.  It did!  One of the best meals I've had!What We Ate --Oreo Pancakes - Beyond!Chicken N' Waffles - Amazing!Nutella French Toast Sticks Lobster RollFrench Onion Soup Dumplings The service was also good.  They altered the portion size to fit our group of 6 and that was super helpful.Everything was perfection.

Bad food, good everything else.We went to station social for my friends birthday . Since we were 11 people we requested a pre fixed menu . They seated us on time for our reservation which is pretty rare in the city.The restaurant was filled and the music was loud, exactly the type of atmosphere we wanted.The food sounded amazing on the menu,  looked beautiful on the plate, but was inedible.Although we hated the food, we loved the atmosphere. Really fun for birthdays if you focus on the drinking and less on food. Plus, the service was awesome.

I went to stanton social with two of my friends last week on a Tuesday. I am still dreaming about the food. I mean, honestly, EVERYTHING we ate was amazing! And our waiter was probably one of the sweetest waiters I've had to date. She was attentive, gave us great suggestions on drinks, and was very accommodating. The food:1. Potato & Goat Cheese Pierogies: If you come to stanton and you don't order these, you are seriously missing out. We could've eaten these for the rest of the night and been just as content with our meal. 2. French Onion Soup dumplings: while i understand this is what stanton is famous for, I thought these were good but they have better options on their menu. they definitely didn't live up to the expectation after reading all the yelp reviews. 3. Chicken Taquitos: also good but not great. 4. Sliders: We got the veggie, lobster roll, and kobe beef. the veggie and lobster roll were okay but the kobe beef was out of this world amazing.5. Chicken n Waffles: amazing!! i loved that they came in 4 small portions and i loved the taste of the syrup along with the louisiana hot sauce butter, great sweet and savory combo!The drinks we got were the strawberry fields, blood orange jalapeno margarita, and basil-lime gimlet. All the drinks were pretty strong and they were pretty good. We liked the strawberry fields the best. I can't wait to come back to this place!

I can't wait to be back in NYC in a couple months. I mean not only will I get the closest thing possible to real Italian gelato, but I also get to go here. So there are some things, it's not super expensive, but it also might be the kinda place that you should have a little extra cash for.Savor your meal, cause the atmosphere is fantastic. I wish I could be a wine drinker, because I see the wall of wine and I feel like saying speaking in a faux European accent and ordering something that was from 1947 and probably was personally in Cary Grant's wine cellar. The french onion soup poppers were fantastic, and I loved the little baby lobster rolls. They were adorable and good.

Don't know what the fuss is about. People write essays about the place. Been there last night. Red snapper taco that people raved about was ok. We didn't really know what we were eating. Salmon was good. Burger was better than average but the fries was delicious. The place looks rather dull perhaps we were there too early.
Outstanding atmosphere, service, and food. Try the french onion soup dumplings and the chipotle maple fried chicken & waffles! A 'must visit' for anyone visiting Manhattan.
So much fun, loud and boisterous was very very fun night enhanced by delicious small plates- French onion dumplings were awesome

Normally, I write entire essays about disappointing dining experiences- but for this I'll keep it short and sweet because there isn't much to say. Overpriced, tiny portions, uppity host staff. I've heard so many great things about Stanton Social but maybe it's mostly coming from people who only care about the trendy vibe and atmosphere more than the food quality. All I know is that I paid way more than I should've for how hungry I left Stanton Social.

Had my 21st birthday here on the mezzanine floor (overlooking the restaurant with the dimly lit, rustic, elegant atmosphere).Everything from the service  drinks, food, music was A+. Food is upscale, elegant American fusion. Your gonna order tuna tartare spring rolls, duck Ragu peroggies, French onion soup dumplings, etc etc etc.Worth a visit, even if it's for an appetizer and a drink!

Came for dinner with my hubby who is trying to do low carb thing at the moment (buzz kill).... Started with mix of east and west coast oysters- both were great.  We shared the edamame (tasty) as well.  I ordered the pierogies which were the highlight of the evening for me and hubby ordered the spinach salad which he enjoyed (can't recall if I snuck a bite).  We shared the lamb gyros and chicken arepas (he left the bread for me).  Both were very good but would probably pick the lamb as the winner between the two.  Hubby also ordered the sausage and peppers- I did manage to steal a bite despite the small portion size.  Overall, great meal and would definitely go back to try other menu items (like the soup dumplings and mac and cheese) when the hubby isn't trying to go light on carbs.Nice decor and vibe- we went upstairs for drinks before we were seated and could sense the bar scene gets better the later the night (think we had 9:30 PM reservation).  The stairs up/down are quite steep so be careful with the hooker heels ladies!  Also, only 1 single sex bathroom on each floor so be prepared for a line.

THE PIEROGIES.THE DAMN PIEROGIES.If you come here and don't order the pierogies, you have no idea what you're doing with your life. As if the goat cheese and caramelized onion combo wasn't enough, the truffle creme fraiche was out of this world. It brought the whole dish together and I cannot stop thinking about it. My table also ordered the French Onion Soup Dumplings, which were of course amazing. We ordered several more dishes but after a while I was just stuffing my face with whatever was on the table without caring to hear what it was. And it was all delicious. This review is based only on the food, but the service was perfectly fine to me. I personally do not go to restaurants for the service and, unless it's atrocious, don't care to comment on it. The Stanton Social is very loud, but my friends and I are in our early twenties and are accustomed to that kind of environment, so we enjoyed it. Honestly, I can't wait to go back!

This restaurant was extremely dark, was barely able to see the menu! I was really looking forward to the Mac & cheese, but when I tried it I was very disappointed. I had a salmon entree and it was amazing! If you like salmon, you must try it! The popcorn shrimp was also very tasty! Stanton is good for groups, good portions to feed about 3 people per. Pricing is fair, but check your bank statement because my server billed me wrong! Nice atmosphere overall.

Good food but way too rich and heavy that leaves you breathless for few hours, the service is too aggressive. Overall, not the most pleasant experience. One of our starters were snapper tacos that had a drop of a sauce on the side. I wanted to deep my taco into this sauce to have a full experience of the dish the way it was served, but as soon as we picked up tacos from the main serving plate, the stuff just grabbed this plate because I assume they thought we were finished with it. There was another little dish on our table I wasn't finished with and the stuff came to us 4 times asking, "Are finished?" I was still chewing my food when they came up and it bothered me because I was thinking to myself why would they ask me that if I was still chewing my food and my mouth was full to even respond? I couldn't relax and enjoy because I had to constantly protect the plates from being cleaned off the table too fast. When you spend roughly $80-$100 per person, the last thing you want is to be rushed. The food was good, but not amazing. I would give 5 stars on the presentation and 4 stars on the flavors and quality. We shared 5 dishes among 2 people + a desert and everything was so rich and heavy that we had a hard time digesting it after. My husband asked me to give him some kombucha to help with digestion, haha!The ambiance was nice and the vibe was great. Maybe because we had an early dinner, the music wasn't as loud as later. If only we were allowed to enjoy our dishes, I would've been much more happier and probably would've given 5 stars to this place. But aggressive service was just a HUGE MINUS to the overall experience that didn't allow us to truly appreciate the art of their food. I felt like I had to shovel the food down my throat and it shouldn't be like that in a restaurant of this caliber.

Probably should avoid if you are 35 or older, or not a personal friend of the chef, whose table seemed to be enjoying a lot of attention.  You would think that after twenty years I would be use to it, but I guess I just wasn't in the mood for the dismissive, bordering on rude, 20-year old staff.  I should not have had to insist on speaking to the manager, who the hostess refused to find notwithstanding the fact that he had been standing immediately to her left, to be seated.  On the other hand, the atmosphere there is upbeat and fun, especially upstairs where it is a little more relaxed.  The food is good, especially the French Onion Soup Dumplings.  Next time I'll stay upstairs rather than take up a table downstairs where my party of six was obviously not welcome.  All in all, plenty of fun restaurants in New York with good food that don't treat you like you're doing them a favor, but if you're thick-skinned it's well worth a visit.

To go or not to go? Go, your ears will bleed, but your mouth will water. Pro tip: Trust your server. Just because tapas are "small plates," if you server says that you probably don't need that much food, listen! Don't miss the French Onion soup dumplings. If you are going for brunch, the warm donuts are a must. Any donuts are usually a must, but so good with the fudge sauce. Mmmm...donuuuts.
Don't go here if you're on a diet....DELISHHHH!!! Need to try the peorgies, warm donuts, and creme brûlée

Overall, the food was just ok but not great. This place is very very loud. You should only bring people here for dinner to avoid the awkward silence when there is nothing to talk about. I thought the tuna wonton was better than the snapper tacos that everyone is raving about on yelp. Nothing special about the oysters, Kobe sliders or warm donuts. Bottom line is, I was not impressed and I'm not eager to bring someone here for their bday.

Went in with great expectations. All of my foodie friends were drooling with jealousy. I did 8 courses with 10 friends and not one was memorable. The champagne was great' I,d go back for drinks upstairs but find somewhere else to eat. The table next to us had a dessert selection that looked and tasted yummy (so sweet to share). Go after dinner for sweets and drinks but skip the main course.

I had read the reviews that the Stanton Social was a loud restaurant, and boy were they right. The minute we stepped inside, the place was bumpin'. It was a flurry of activity with people gabbing away at their tables and music pumpin' through the three floor space. Luckily for me, we were seated on the third floor which is a lot quieter, which suited me much better. The space definitely has a vibe and a life to it that you are not gonna get at home.To start, we ordered some Red Snapper Tacos and the Hand Pulled Chicken Arepas. They are known for the Red Snapper Tacos, and while they were good, I prefered the chicken arepas myself, which is why we ordered another round of those later. The dice on the vegetable and fruit on the red snapper tacos was so tiny and a real treat. I thought it brought a nice textural element, but the texture of the hand pulled chicken was out of control good. That little pile of chicken just melted in my mouth.We also tried another dish they are known for, the French Onion Soup Dumplings. I must agree with a previous reviewers when they said that they taste better than they smell. The smell is definitely a little off putting... must be the cheese. Though they are tasty. They weren't my favourite thing there, but they were definitely the most unique and creative.For our main we had the Fried Chicken and Maple Cheddar Waffles with louisana hot sauce butter. Because this was a main and a little more money it was a bigger bite, and you got four servings instead of three like some of the others. So don't be oftput by the price differences as you will get more bang for your buck. I thought putting the maple inside the waffle instead of syrup was a smart idea. And they were so delicious when you wiped some of that hot sauce butter on it.My favourite part of the meal though, and the best dessert I had in New York, and one of my favourites ever was the S'mores Creme Brulee. I haven't been so surprised by a plate of food in a long time. The creme brulee was cold which was surprise #1. Surprise #2 was the liquid bitter espresso like chocolate underneath. The sweetness came from the marshmellow, but the bitter came from this, and they mixed perfectly. And the textures were quite different with the marshmellow, and the liquid chocolate and the creme brulee. This is a dessert not to be missed!

LOVED this spot. I've been trying to get a reservation here for a while (one that's not at 5pm or 10pm). Luckily, it was a holiday weekend in NYC so we got an 8pm reservation on a Saturday night. Came with a friend for dinner. First off, the vibe here is awesome. Very trendy...I felt like I was back in LA. Lots of pretty people. I will also say that the music was really good. I was almost dancing in my seat. Anyway, on top of that, great service and delicious food!Chicken Arepas - deliciousDumplings - kind of cheesy but still really tastyRibs - sooooo very flavorful and ridiculously goodScallops - super tasty and the risotto that comes with it is really good tooDrinks were expensive but also good! It kind of turned into a bar scene towards the end of our meal. I would probably come back to check that out sometime!

This place is super chic and very hip.  Plus, there's plenty of cocktail options and shared plates to make everyone happy. However, if there's a wait for a table, I'd suggest waiting no more than 10 minutes because you're in the LES and there's plenty of places in this hood. I especially loved their crab cakes there.  Also, what's quite dangerous is when you arrive with a party of 5 (or more), the waiter can adjust each dish so that everyone gets their own portion. This then leads to a price markup on dishes you thought were cheap. Be warned and keep that in mind when dining here with a party larger than 3.

Why are their hostesses so rude? Our server was  was great, but the girl at the stand needs to get her attitude in check.  We were are large group and spent over 1k and multiple people in the party commented how rude she was when they arrived. That said....This was for a birthday celebration and we were sitting in the the lounge area upstairs.   I would get a regular table next time as the lounge can be a bit trick with the limited table space for places and glasses. When you are a party of 10 or more they make you pre-fix the menu.  The amount of food was plenty, no one left hungry.  The timing of the courses and the service were great,  they perfectly spaced out all the courses so we took the entire 3 hours at the table and the staff was very attentive in keep the table cleared at all times.  This is always a safe bet for a fun dinner night out.

The service was good. The food was tasty. The drinks weren't bad at all. I really just feel like the price stole 2 or 3 stars.  Maybe this isn't supposed to be a dinner spot?Well...My tab for 2  with tax and tip for 5 cocktails and 5 plates in total somehow came out to be around $180 for finger food and simply OK cocktails. I was still hungry and not buzzed after unfortunately.If this was $100 total, I wouldn't really mind, but food the size of small appetizers shouldn't be $15-20 a plate. Cocktails in the LES shouldn't be $14 either. This is my opinion, but then again, Stanton Social is charging a bit much. The place had too much hype and just let me down when I finally got around to coming.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The prices are a bit steep, but that comes with the territory of a popular, trendy, downtown restaurant. My favorite things on the menu are the grilled pesto-crusted salmon and soba noodles (AMAZING!) and veggie burger sliders. Creative drink menu and delicious deserts as well.The place is very trendy and hip. Feels like a club late night but just a nice restaurant any other time of day.

Me and my boyfriend came here on a Thursday and the environment and ambience right when you walk in seems intimate, but once it gets filled is hustling and bustling. I enjoyed the chatter and movement, although it got difficult to hear at times. We started off with a kale salad, goat cheese and caramelized onion pierogis with truffle creme fraiche and mac and cheese. I was pretty full after that, but those were just starters! We ordered sliders as our main course, a Kobe beef burger for him and a veggie slider with avocado, cheddar, roasted green chile mayo for me. Although they are small plates, they are very filling and filled with a lot of flavor! If that wasn't enough we had paired dinner with a bottle of wine and finished off with mint chip pudding bons bons covered in dark chocolate. Being full was an understatement. I definitely would come back for a special occasion or girls night out, although it can get a little pricey.

Drum roll.  I have eaten at non-chain restaurants in over 35 states and The Stanton Social in NYC is the best food I have ever eaten.  As a result, I want Chef Chris Santos to cater my wedding to Joe Manganiello.  I doubt I would ever make it to death row; but the Stanton Social's entire menu would be my last supper before walking the green mile.I have been to the foam and foie gras restaurants that sacrifice deliciousness for presentation, but the Stanton Social has both of these elements on steroids.  The restaurant treats basic dishes like the new kid at school and gives them the sophistication of the Heathers but the food still has the hipster kick of Solange Knowles.  (tee he he)At the Stanton Social shrimp and grits and chicken and waffles become tapas; while French onion soup rides with Marty McFly into the future evolves into a dumpling.  The kobe burgers, herb dusted frites and mac * cheese with chorizo and roasted poblanos were all on point. No this isn't basic bar food, pot-head food or the I need to eat something to sober up before I go home food.   This is the food that you want  on a well-deserved cheat day...or when you have a ravenous appetite after an amazing workout, good sex...or want to have before amazing sex.  My only disappointment is that my first visit Stanton Social visit wasn't on an empty stomach.Shout-out to Karen our amazing waitress that never left my wine glass half full and for asking about food allergies prior to service.Lastly shout-out to the deejay that randomly played the Wobble for about 70 seconds;-)

Really noisy and packed. Food was just fine, and, of course small portions which is the trend in the city now. We had reservation for 6:15 but did not get in until 6:40. And you just can't move around that much due to the very limited space.

Love tapas style cause it allows you to try a bit of everything! French Onion Soup Dumpling live up to the hype, and the mini gyros were also very tasty. The atmosphere was trendy and our service was very quick. Only downfall was that we were rushed to leave right after our meal was over, even though we just got drinks that we were trying to finish up. Oh and how can I forget, the donuts are a must order! Delicious!

On food alone, this place gets 5 stars. But overall review, I take off a few for icy hostess and ridiculously loud obnoxious music. We were a party of 8 on Saturday evening. Half our party was late for the reservation and half sent up to the bar. When the late party arrived we weren't seated until our friends came down from the bar, the hostess was adamant we all had to be present to be seated. Okay, I get it, I do. But they were squaring a check and on their way down. And we were staring at our set table that obviously was for us (the place is pretty small) and we couldn't sit down why? It just seemed weird. So when our friends finally came down the hostess then asked us if we would be finished dinner by 7:45, presumably because that's when that table was next reserved. Ummmm, I guess it depends how fast your kitchen cooks the food--wth kind of question is that? Like you're not sending that party up to the bar first?? I mean, just weird. Thankfully when we were seated we had a very friendly waitress. She also recommended a number of dishes based on the number of people at our table and at first this sounded like a lot but once you get rolling (and eating) everything is delicious and you'll gladly order more. Everything we had was delicious--everything. No low notes here. Even the boring sounding spinach salad was to die for. Drinks were STRONG! Very nice, especially for what they cost. Most of us were too full for dessert but we had the donuts and they were good but the red velvet "twinkie" was a bit of a disappointment. Otherwise the food was good and we would go back based on food (and drinks!) alone. The music is crazy loud. Why do trendy places insist on loud music? If I want to go to the club I'll go after dinner. I mean, seriously? You can barely hear the person next to you. One woman in our group barely talked, she didn't even bother, till we hit a bar later. A bar. We could hear better in a BAR! Yeah, it's that loud there.

So, let me preface with: I should have known better.I should have known better than to:A.) Make a reservation a this place for a Friday nightB.) Be surprised that my table wasn't ready at said reservation time (that it would be at least 30 minutes before we'd be seated) C.) That there would be a place for my party and I to stand while we waited for our table to be ready (besides out in the rain)And D.) Expect that the service would be professional and friendlySo here's how it actually went down.
